title: Character Rigger/Breaker
description:
Elliott Animation is hiring in Toronto!

Character Rigger/Breaker in Flash

Fresh TV and Elliott Animation, a Toronto-based artist-driven entertainment company, is looking for a 2D Breaking/Symbolizer artist to join the team of a world-class animated television series.

As a 2D Character Rigger/Breaker artist you will be responsible to manipulate and understand the different properties of vector art (working with lines, shapes, groups, and symbols, and how to embed symbols.

Start Date:

ASAP 2022 - through to Spring 2023

Responsibilities:

  • Able to learn custom in-house processes to break/symbolize characters, poses, and props
  • Working closely with the team to follow the established workflow
  • Ensuring all necessary elements are contained and functioning properly in the file
  • Completing assignments and revisions in a timely manner
  • how to create keyframe animation in flash

Qualifications:

  • Has 2D animation background in character design
  • Has production experience in flash character animation
  • Understands keyframe and timeline animation
  • How to create symbols and understand their properties
  • How to manipulate vector art
  • Knows how to embed symbols
  • Understands flash libraries
  • Appreciation for accuracy and attention to detail
  • Ability to deliver work on a set schedule
  • Excellent communication, organizational and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to take direction, and work both independently and as part of a team
  • Flash experience is an asset

Please email your resume to Suzy and Sharon at the email below with the position in the subject heading and include your availability.

You must be an Ontario Resident and Canadian Citizen.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract

Salary: $19.00-$37.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: Tower Rigger
description:
We are currently seeking a Tower Technician I or II. We prefer candidates with existing experience in Tower Construction, Antenna and Line Installations, Microwave Installations, and Tower Modifications

Who We Are:

CommTech Solutions is a Turnkey Supplier of Telecommunication Infrastructure Design and Implementation throughout the Wireless and Wireline Industry. We are actively engaged in all aspects of Telecommunications Design and Construction including; Greenfield Site Builds, Antenna and Line Installation/Upgrades, Microwave Installation/Commissioning, and Civil and Electrical Installations. CommTech has offices across Ontario, Quebec and the with projects covering those areas. We are comprised of a strong family of men and women who operate as teammates. We are proud of the collective, team-oriented atmosphere that drives this company to excellence. Our desire is for every member of our team to advance in knowledge and skill and to pursue exceptional performance and safety.

Benefits Include:

  • Extended Health
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • Life Insurance
  • Boot & Uniform Allowance per year
  • Per Diem for Personal Use
  • Transportation Provided
  • Personal and Vacation Days

Essential Functions / Responsibilities:

  • Climb various heights on multiple type structures
  • Perform installation of antennas, mounts, cable ladders, cable, etc.
  • Assist in testing of sites
  • Participate in new tower construction
  • Perform routine and special circumstance tower maintenance
  • Assist in trouble shooting a variety of electronic components from cell/microwave sites to lighting systems
  • Recognize safety hazards and perform all duties in a safe manner
  • Maintain a professional working attitude with co-workers and clients
  • Continue industry education and knowledge on an ongoing basis
  • Uphold quality workmanship surpassing industry standards

Personal Attributes:

  • Must be willing to travel and be able to work within a non-structured schedule, i.e., long hours, weekends, etc.
  • Self-Motivated and able to learn efficiently
  • Team oriented

Supervisory Responsibility

Level 1 tower techs do not have any supervisory responsibility. Level 2 tower techs are expected to mentor and train level 1 techs.

Work Environment & Physical Demands

The physical demands and work environment described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job.

  • Frequent work in adverse weather conditions
  • Frequently required to stand, walk, stoop, sit, and climb ladders and communication towers and work in an elevated position that is +/- 500 feet.
  • On a constant basis, employee must lift, carry, and maneuver heavy or awkward objects weighing 50lbs or more.
  • Daily travel within the Company’s geographical footprint and possible extended stays at external destinations. Travel time can be anywhere from three to six weeks at a time, with appropriate breaks.
  • Frequently required to use hand and power tools

Required Knowledge:

  • General tower and fall protection knowledge and ability to utilize 100% tie off techniques at all times (willing to train candidates)
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Electrical/electronics education a plus
  • Basic Rigging

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $23.00-$45.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • On call
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
We conform to all current provincial and federal COVID-19 mandates

Experience:

  • telecommunication: 1 year (preferred)
  • Telecommunications Tower Rigging: 1 year (preferred)

Shift availability:

  • Day Shift (preferred)

title: newTelecommunications Tower Technician (Climber / Rigger)
description:
***Shop Located in Acheson, AB - West of Edmonton***

Do you have substantial experience working at heights, hanging in a harness, and specifically in telecommunications tower rigging? We are a small contracting company looking to expand and create a crew of 2-3 reliable tower technicians ( riggers ) for Telus and Rogers work. At this time we are looking for people with climbing and rigging experience.

Advantages of working for us:

  • Weekly pay + 6% vacation pay
  • Interesting and difference projects every day
  • Opportunity to make great money!

The majority of the work will consist of vendor swaps. We are aiming for M-F work with the possibility of some weekends (if desired) with properly paid overtime.

Our ideal candidate has 1 or more years of rigging experience on telecommunication towers, specifically with Rogers and Telus. They are comfortable working out on booms and lowering down to an antenna with 330ft between them and the ground. They can working with both hands while suspended in a harness and comfortably move around all types of communication towers. They show up to work in a clear state of mind and ready for all types of weather.

Please respond to this job ad if you meet the following criteria and are ready to begin work in early May:

  • Completely comfortable working at heights of over 330ft - including hanging in a harness under an antenna and working with both hands!
  • Experienced with Rogers and Telus standards on telecommunication towers
  • Have, at a minimum, a Class 5 drivers license with clean (or mostly clean) abstract (reliable transportation to shop West of Edmonton required as well)
  • Experienced with safely rigging antennas, radios, and steel on communication towers
  • Basic tower climber safety tickets (climbing, RF safety, first aid, ect)

Nice to have's

  • Your own harness with seat, lanyards, and positioning device
  • Experience in communication shelters (Fiber and DC power)
  • Rope access tickets

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $23.00-$40.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime

COVID-19 considerations:
Any customer Covid-19 precautions must be followed.

Application question(s):

  • What three colours does Telus use to identify Sectors 1, 2, & 3 on communication towers?
  • Are you comfortable working while suspended by a harness?
  • Do you have reliable transportation to Acheson, AB?
  • What is your wage expectation? (per hour)

Experience:

  • telecommunication: 1 year (preferred)
  • Telus: 1 year (preferred)
  • Rogers: 1 year (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-11
Expected start date: 2022-05-11

title: Rigger Helper
description:
Department: Warehouse Operations
Location: Saint Laurent
Reporting to: Terminal manager
Core shift: Days (M-F) ; flexible schedule, weekends on demand/occasional

At SCI our people make us even better, which is why we want you to be a part of our fast growing organization. SCI recognizes that having a great team is the key to success, which is why we attract and retain the right people with an employee experience that focuses on building trust, embracing change, and achieving our goals together. Any one of our 3000 industry experts will tell you that we take on some of Canada’s toughest service and logistic challenges in specialized transportation, technical services, and supply chain management. For 30 years, our proficient planning and flexible solutions have brought us top tier clients. With clear focus, operational excellence, and future growth at the core of our operation, we apply out-of-the-box thinking to deliver exceptional experiences that take our clients to the next level. Are you ready for your next challenge?

Key Responsibilities include:

  • Assist in delivery and installation
  • Assist driver and dispatch with other duties as required including but not limited to communications with both the customer and dispatch, completing paperwork, and assist with navigation
  • Complete required paperwork accurately and legibly
  • Perform daily pre-trip and post-trip vehicle inspections
  • Ability to solve problems as they arise while on road
  • Provide consistent on-time pickup and delivery service performance
  • Communicates priorities in a professional manner with shipping, receiving and dispatcher
  • Ability to operate a mobile computing device
  • Portray a professional image as a representative of SCI White Glove Inc. including the maintenance and presentation of vehicle, uniform, etc.
  • Ability to work under pressure with minimal supervision
  • Team player
  • Flexible work schedule required.
  • Highly customer focused with the ability to exceed expectations
  • Perform other general warehousing duties as assigned by Management.
  • Other duties as assigned

General Requirements:

  • Lift up to 75 lbs. repeatedly up and down stairs/ramps, and into office spaces with or without mechanical assistance.
  • Ability to operate Material Handling Equipment (pallet jacks, stair climbers, dollies etc.)
  • Previous experience with handling high end commercial electronics i.e. printers, photo copiers, bank machines, preferred.
  • Previous experience with Load Securement practices
  • Complete daily trip reports and record delivery activities
  • Flexible work schedule required.
  • Demonstrate exceptional customer service through interactions with customers
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Ability to follow process and be detail oriented
  • Must have clean Criminal back ground check

Working Conditions:

  • General Warehouse and outside weather conditions

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Saint-Laurent, QC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Heavy lifting (up to 75 lbs): 1 year (required)
  • Load securement: 1 year (required)

Language:

  • English (required)
  • French (required)

title: newKLTP - Crane Operator - 100 Ton RT
description:
Kiewit is looking for Journeyman Crane Operatorfor the Trans Mountain Expansion Project located in the Lower Mainland, BC.

Requirements

  • Must be a ticketed JM Crane Operator
  • Minimum 5 years of experience operating crane
  • Significant experience operating a 100-ton Rough Terrain Crane

Shift information

  • 10 hours, overtime after 8 hours everyday
  • Depending on work, there may be additional overtime required
  • Must be willing to work weekends when required

Additional Information

  • Please list all valid safety tickets on resume
  • Upon an offer, all candidates must be able to pass a Drug and Alcohol and Fit for Work test
  • Minimum 2 hours of overtime pay every day
  • Accrue a retention bonus after 3 months
  • Long term 3 year construction project

Project Information

The Trans Mountain Expansion Project is a Kiewit and Ledcor Partnership, which includes 35km of pipeline from Langley to Burnaby and includes four terminals. This is a multi-billion dollar project that is estimated to take 3+ years to complete.

About Kiewit

As one of North America's largest, most respected construction and engineering organizations, with 2019 revenues of $10.3 billion and 2020 revenues of $12.5 billion, Kiewit exists to make a difference. We improve and connect communities across the United States, Canada, and Mexico through complex projects in transportation, water/wastewater, power, oil, gas and chemical, building, industrial, and mining. Our services are as diverse as the skills of our 27,000-strong workforce to whom we provide challenging, honest work in a caring and collaborative culture. A sense of adventure, pride, and fulfillment is built into every career at Kiewit.

For more information on our current projects/job openings, or to apply online visit our website at: allcraftjobs.com

Due to the volume of applicants, only candidates who meet the minimum requirements will be contacted

Job Type: Full-time

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • Overtime

Experience:

  • Crane Operators & Riggers: 5 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Journeyperson Ticket (preferred)

title: newTechnicien de production-d’associé de rigger
description:
Nous recherchons un Candidat autonome fort qui se joindra à nous en tant que Technicien de production d’associé de rigger à notre succursale en Quebec City, QC. Le préposé à l’entrepôt participe aux différentes fonctions de l’entrepôt. Il veille à la bonne organisation de l’entrepôt et de l’inventaire/équipement ainsi qu’à l’emballage, l’envoi, la réception et la distribution des marchandises et fournitures.

Nous offrons un ensemble complet de compensations et d'avantages sociaux qui comprennent :

  • Incitation à la santé et au bien-être
  • Prestations complètes en matière de santé et de soins dentaires (coûts partagés)
  • Programme d'appariement des REER 5% (après un an)
  • Possibilités de développement personnel et professionnel
  • Un environnement de travail agréable et stimulant
  • Stationnement gratuit


Responsabilités principales

  • Fabrication d’élingues et de câbles
  • Couper le câble métallique et plier les torons conformément aux spécifications
  • Suivre les procédures de contrôle de la qualité, conformément à la norme ISO 9001: 2000.
  • S'assurer qu'un produit de qualité est fabriqué, conformément aux normes de qualité de l'entreprise
  • Organiser, nettoyer et assurer la maintenance générale de l'espace de travail sur le gréement
  • Maintenir une vitesse de production efficace avec un minimum de problèmes de qualité
  • Responsable de la précision des stocks en enregistrant les articles utilisés en production
  • Processus et réquisition de matériel et de fournitures pour le département de gréage
  • Veiller à ce que les stocks soient stockés de manière appropriée pour en faciliter l’accès et l’identification, ainsi que pour éviter les dommages éventuels aux produits.


Qualifications

  • Diplôme d'études secondaire ou équivalent
  • Cours de gréement ou expérience pertinente équivalente, un atout
  • Une expérience de travail avec des câbles est considérée comme un atout
  • Capacité à soulever en toute sécurité 50 livres du sol au niveau de la taille, ainsi qu'à effectuer des mouvements répétitifs des mains et des poignets, notamment saisir, tordre, tirer et pousser.
  • Formation préalable à la conduite d'un chariot élévateur à fourche
  • Être légalement autorisé à travailler au Canada


Veuillez noter: Une des conditions de l’emploi exige que les candidats choisis se soumettent et réussissent une évaluation du casier judiciaire.

Le Groupe de Compagnies Hercules est composé de cinq compagnies distinctes - Hercules SLR, Spartan Industrial Marine, Stellar Industrial Sales, Atlantic Crane and Material Handling et Wire Rope Industries Atlantic - avec Hercules Machining & Millwright Services comme division de Hercules SLR. Alors que Hercules s'est développé dans une multitude de secteurs industriels, nous sommes spécialisés dans les équipements, les produits et les services pour les applications de fixation, de levage et de gréement

En tant que membre du groupe de sociétés Hercules, nous nous employons à être le chef de file des secteurs que nous desservons. Nous mettons l'accent sur l'amélioration continue des compétences et des capacités de nos employés et nous sommes fiers d'avoir construit et amélioré nos cultures de sécurité et de service à la clientèle dévoué.

title: Telecom Wireless Rigger
description:
Have a stimulating job and enjoy a competitive salary!

Pearson Pelletier Telecom, is a young and dynamic company, with heart and soul, working in the field of telecommunications. Its continued expansion led it to seek a telecommunications rigger with or without experience.

The position of telecommunications rigger consists of the installation of telecommunications structure equipment. The work can be done in towers, on the rooftop of buildings or inside industrial and commercial buildings. The telecommunications rigger works constantly as part of a team and may be required to travel anywhere in Canada.

Responsabilities :

Our telecommunications riggers perform some or all of the following duties:

  • Line and antenna installation;
  • Microwave link installation, microwave canvas replacement;
  • Installation and maintenance of indoor wireless networks;
  • Installation of fiber optic cabling;
  • Addition of equipment to existing structure or dismantling of equipment or structure;
  • Structural verification, equipment support, anchoring and guy wire;
  • Assembly, erection and maintenance of telecommunications towers;
  • Optical fiber (replacement and/or installation, verification);
  • Installation, maintenance and repair of telecommunications equipment;
  • Other work related to business operations.

Job profile:

  • No experience required;
  • Excellent physical shape and good skills for manual work;
  • Ability to work at height (from 0 to 200 meters);
  • Ability to work in difficult climatic conditions both in summer and winter;
  • Autonomous, methodical and proactive;
  • Great ease of adaptation and teamwork;
  • Great mobility to carry out projects throughout Quebec and occasionally in other provinces;

Who we are...

Pearson Pelletier Telecom offers cutting-edge expertise in the construction, installation and repair of telecommunications infrastructure, as well as in carrying out special projects associated with civil engineering.

Since 2015, we have been actively responding to telecommunications infrastructure and special projects associated with civil engineering. The enviable reputation and skills we have acquired over the years ensure us a leading position in telecom field, nationally.

Pearson Pelletier Telecom places innovation and performance at the center of all its processes. We are constantly looking for new technologies and procedures to meet and even exceed the demands of our customers. We are proud to offer avant-garde work ideas and techniques that allow for efficiency adapted to different environmental conditions. Our team of experts stays abreast of industry standards and changes and ensures work that meets safety and compliance standards.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • Are you comfortable climbing towers of 200 meters high?
  • Are you available to work a shift more than 8 hours a day
  • Are you available to travel throughout the province (several days at a time)?
  • Are you comfortable working outside in all types of weather?

Experience:

  • Wireless: 1 year (required)

title: High Angle Rigger
description:
Job Overview:

CJE is a telecom construction company looking for experienced riggers and lead hands to join our professional telecommunications install team! We perform work on towers all across Canada, so the ability to travel out of town and work comfortably at heights is a must.

This posting is for sites in Ontario and Manitoba, but the potential to work elsewhere is also available if desired.

Applicants Must:

  • Be comfortable working at heights.
  • Be able to read, comprehend, and execute expectations of work orders and design.
  • Have a positive and professional attitude and work well within a team.
  • Have and maintain a valid driver's license, as well as the ability to arrive at sites independently and on time.
  • Have and maintain a cellphone for communication and scheduling purposes.
  • Be able to work on weekends and nights if required.
  • Provide a 5-year certified driver's abstract upon hiring.
  • Disclose any present or past drug or alcohol dependency or abuse.

Responsibilities Include:

  • Climbing communications tower to install cables, antennas, radios, MW, steel, or any other equipment outlined in work orders and designs.
  • Assembly of steel structures, antennas, radio mounts, and any other ground assembly required to achieve requirements of work orders and designs.
  • Properly align and test installed equipment.
  • Ensure compliance with all safety rules and regulations.
  • Report all safety concerns/issues immediately.
  • Work cooperatively with a team to meet requirements.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Pay rate will be determined based on merit, experience, and scope of work, and can be increased based on skill following probationary period.

We are grateful for all applications but please note that only selected applicants will be contacted for interviews.

Interviews will be conducted remotely over Microsoft Teams. Meeting invitations will be sent by email for an agreed upon time.

Expected start date: 2022-03-28

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $60,000.00 per year

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $60,000.00-$200,000.00 per year

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $60,000.00-$200,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

  • Telecommunications Infrastructure Technicians: 1 year (preferred)

title: RIGGER - Jack and Roll Crew
description:
Rigger/Laborer

Location: Edmonton, AB

Since 1964, Premay Equipment L.P. has been keeping industry moving. Serving the oilfield industry, mining and construction sectors, Premay moves loads from light to heavy, small to large. Whatever the moving challenge, Premay is up to it.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provide physically demanding labor support to operators
  • Help offload, setup and place Jack and Roll rigging equipment
  • Help load and secure cargo, equipment, tools and material
  • Perform preventative and daily maintenance on equipment

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Class 5 driver’s license, Class 1 or 3 considered a strong asset
  • Must have First Aid, H2S Alive, CSTS, & OSSA; the right candidate may be provided with these courses
  • Motivation to work hard to get tasks done on time, as well as a competitive spirit
  • Pride and ownership of work
  • Problem solving skills
  • Able to work independently and as part of a small team
  • Ability to work extended periods away from home
  • No issues working outside in all weather conditions

We offer very competitive pay rates, lots of overtime available with variable shifts. A great team environment working for a well-established company in Western Canada. Come join the Premay Family.

Premay Equipment LP is an Employment Equity Company

www.Premay.com

title: Rigger
description:
LOOKING FOR DEDICATED & SAFETY FOCUSED CREW FOR UPCOMING DSV WORK !

Reliance Offshore, a subsidiary of I. H. Mathers – 79 Mews Place, St. John’s, NL A1B 4N2, is currently recruiting personnel on behalf of our client Subsea 7 Canada Inc., St. John’s, NL.

Employment opportunities will be aboard the Dive Support Vessel (DSV) Seven Falcon operating offshore Newfoundland & Labrador.

May to July 2022 (4-6 week rotations).

JOB/POSITION:

  • Rigger, 2 vacancies – Job Reference #SS7-2022-RGR001

The Rigger is responsible for assisting in all operations as directed by the Deck Foreman or Rigger Supervisor, and for carrying out such operations in accordance with standard vessel procedures and in a safe manner.

  • $425 per day (terms, as per contract)

EXPERIENCE:

· 6+ Months working onboard construction vessel with 50+ POB

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

All personnel are also expected to contribute to creating a culture of ethics and integrity within Subsea 7 and ensure familiarity with and adherence to our Code of Conduct

· General rigging & slinging duties/maintenance duties on deck & with equipment

· Winch operations

· Pipe and equipment handling / loading / offloading

· HIAB Crane Operations

· Carousel operations/loadouts

· FLS & Moonpool operations

MANDATORY REQUIREMENTS:

  • API RP 2DC Rigging Certificate
  • Valid STCW'95 Safety Training (Section A-VI/1 – Tables A-VI/1-1, A-VI/1-2, A-VI/1-3, A-VI/1-4) OR Basic Survival Training (BST) OR BOSIET Certificate
  • Ship Security with Designated Security Duties (VPWSR) (Reg. VI/6 – Section A-VI/6)
  • Valid First Aid Certificate (< 3 Yrs)
  • Fall Protection
  • WHMIS 2015
  • Valid Passport
  • MLC Compliant Seaman’s Medical
  • Must be willing to undergo industry required medical & drug assessments
  • Must be fully vaccinated w/ 2 doses of a Health Canada approved COVID-19 Vaccine

Please reply to this ad with your current resume & valid certificates. Please include Job Reference #SS7-2022-RGR001 in the “Subject Line” of your email.

NO PHONE CALLS – PLEASE

Location: Offshore NL,

Language: English

Contract length: 4-6 week on / off rotation

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract

Salary: $425.00 per day

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift

title: Offshore Ironworker - Rigger
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:
Wood is actively recruiting Riggers to support upcoming Q3 2022 Maintenance Turnaround activities.

This position will require you to travel to offshore Newfoundland and Labrador via helicopter or supply vessel. Individuals must be comfortable working in remote locations, confined spaces, and heights.

Responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to:
  • Safe execution of work in accordance to agreed guidance documents (i.e. work packs, work instructions, procedures) and governing specifications.
  • Ensure that safe rigging practices are used during the movement of loads including risk assessment, proper lift planning and equipment selection.
  • Monitor rigging materials and highlight any overages/shortages to Offshore Maintenance Supervisor.
  • Ensure all rigging equipment is in fit-for-purpose condition (i.e. pre and post use) and quarantine any defective materials.
  • Must be conversant with relevant rigging standards, specifications, rules, regulations etc. including Permit to Work (PTW).

Skills / Qualifications (Text Only): Candidates should possess the following qualifications: - Interprovincial Boilermaker / Iron Worker or Journeyperson’s certificate. Any equivalent combination of experience and / or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved may also be considered. - Must have successfully completed Rigging Training as outlined in CAPP from a recognized training institution. - Must have a basic understanding of the construction (i.e. wire rope, nylon, chain), inspection, maintenance and selection of lifting equipment, including limitations and safety issues associated with the material. - Must be familiar with the safe use of mechanical handling equipment (i.e. chain hoists, tirfors, hydraulic jacks, etc.) used in an offshore construction environment. - Strong working knowledge of industrial rigging practices and equipment. For this position, the following training/certifications would be considered an asset: - Basic Survival Training (BST) including HUET and HUEBA. - Advanced Offshore Rigging: Stage 1 or 2 - Hydrogen Sulphide (H2S) Alive. - Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS 2015). - Offshore Safety Regulatory Awareness - Fall Protection - Confined Space Entry - Emergency First Aid Successful Candidates must meet the following requirements - Pass a site-specific drug and alcohol test and meet COVID-19 vacination requirements - Be able to safely lift and carry up to 50lbs - Possess enough strength and stamina to perform the technical duties and essential functions as identified above - Able to move and work in confined spaces, following proper protocol - May be required consistently to work 10-12 hour shifts performing physical labour in varying temperatures and weather conditions. - Be able to climb and maintain balance on stairs, ladders, scaffolds and steel framework, utilizing proper fall arrest procedures when required. - Able to safely and comfortably work at heights without posing a danger to oneself or others - Able to meet physical requirements of frequent walking, climbing, standing, bending, twisting and crawling for the duration of the shift Company Overview:
Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com
Diversity Statement (EEO):
We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: newRigger Technician
description:
We are looking for a Rigger Technician to join our team in Hamilton, ON. Reporting to the Manager, the Wire Rope Technician fabricates, set ups, and repairs rigging, supporting structures, hoists, and pulling gear, using hand and power tools according to customer requirements.

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package that includes:

  • Full health and dental benefits
  • Health & Wellness Incentive
  • RRSP matching program
  • Personal & Professional Development Opportunities
  • Fun & engaging working environment
  • Free parking

Principle Responsibilities

  • Cut wire rope and bend strands to meet specifications
  • Ensure a quality product is produced, as per the company quality standards
  • Organize, clean, and ensure overall maintenance of the rigging workspace
  • Maintain an efficient production speed with minimal quality issues
  • Responsible for inventory accuracy by recording items used in production
  • Process and requisition of materials and supplies for the rigging department
  • Ensure inventory is stored in an appropriate manner to ease accessibility and identification, and reduce the potential for damage to products
  • Inventory maintenance
  • Warehouse maintenance
  • Other duties as necessary

Required knowledge and training

  • High school diploma, or equivalent
  • Rigging course or equivalent relevant experience is an asset
  • Previous experience working with wire rope is considered a strong asset
  • Able to safely lift 50 lbs. from floor level to waist level
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada

The Hercules Group of Companies is a privately owned Canadian company, headquartered in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia; it is comprised of four distinct companies—Hercules SLR, Spartan Industrial Marine, Stellar Industrial Sales, and Wire Rope Industries Atlantic—with Hercules Machining & Millwright Services as a division of Hercules SLR. While Hercules has grown into a multitude of industrial sectors, we specialize in equipment, products and services for securing, lifting and rigging applications.

As an employer, we focus on continually enhancing the skills and capabilities of our employees and pride ourselves for building and improving upon our cultures of safety and dedicated customer service.

Please note: Successful candidates will be required to pass a criminal background check; drivers abstract and reference checks as a condition of employment.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

title: Telecommunication Foremen & Riggers
description:
Highland Telecom is looking for experienced Telecommunication Foremen & Riggers with experience in antenna system installation and the erection of guyed towers, self-support towers, and monopoles.

We offer competitive wages and a safe comfortable work environment. Highland Telecom offers a Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision Care Benefits plan. Applicants must have a valid Drivers licence and must be able to travel periodically for out of town work (out of town living expenses paid by Highland).

If you are a career minded individual with a commitement to service excellence, please Submit your Resume to:

E-mail: kevinmacleod@highlandtel.ca

Highland Telecom is committed to establishing and maintaining a comprehensive health and safety system aimed at protecting its employees from injury or occupational illness and property from damage or loss.

We are a member of the Alberta Construction Safety Association and we are Secor Certified.

title: newTower Rigger
description:
Vincent Communications and Controls Ltd. has been in business since 2005 with offices in Grande Prairie, AB and Fort St. John, B.C. We specialize in the design and implementation of communication systems for industrial applications. Our company is expanding its tower, internet, radio voice services and infrastructure throughout Alberta and Northern B.C.

In support of this expansion, we are currently accepting applications for an experienced and dedicated TOWER RIGGER to join the Vincent Communications Team. Reporting directly to the Field Operations Manager, this position is based out of our Fort St. John, BC office.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Install, inspect, and maintain Trylon towers, DMX towers, All Weld Self Support towers, All Weld Guyed towers, break pole towers, and masts.
  • Tower climbing and rigging such as installing antennas, dishes, coax, and mounting hardware by selecting and using proper cables, ropes, blocks, pullies, and capstans on various structures.
  • Install various ancillary items on various communication towers including ice guards, antenna mounts and transmission line support systems, anti-climbs, lighting systems, fall protection systems, and tower grounding systems.
  • Identify, select, and use proper communications testing equipment based on job requirements.
  • Identify, select, and use proper rigging equipment based on job requirements.
  • Working at heights using various equipment such as ladders, aerial lifts, scaffolding, and man baskets.
  • Travel long distances to and from different locations which may require overnight stays.
  • Operating hand, air, and power tools.
  • Adaptable and flexible for changing priorities.
  • Working in extreme heat, cold or other often adverse weather conditions.
  • Working at job sites that may be rugged in nature including but not limited to un-level, muddy, snow-covered, and slippery or wet ground conditions.
  • Working in remote areas that may expose you to wildlife and other risks associated with working in a wilderness area.
  • Work with and around heavy equipment, picker trucks, ATV, and helicopters.

Required Experience and Education:

  • Technical field experience in Communications / Telecom industry
  • Tower rigging and climbing experience.
  • Experience in the Oil & Gas industry is considered an asset.
  • Technology degree or diploma an asset.
  • Valid Class 5 Driver’s License with an acceptable Driver’s Abstract.

Required Skills:

  • Able to confidently work at heights.
  • Class 5 driver’s license with acceptable drivers abstract.
  • Basic understanding of computer fundamentals.
  • Must be physically fit and be able to safely lift 55 lbs.
  • Basic understanding and safe use of hand, air, and power tools.
  • Strong English communication skills with the proven ability to communicate with respect and professionalism.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and use of good judgement in response to unexpected problems.
  • Reliable and dependable.

What do we have to offer?

  • Compensation will be based on a combination of experience and education. Hourly rate ranges between $20.00/hour – $40.00/hour
  • Overtime paid after 8 hours/day and on weekends.
  • Potential for yearly bonus that is calculated on key company financial metrics.
  • Annual safety and tool allowance
  • Participation in the Family Extended Health Benefits program after completion of 90-day probationary period.
  • Guaranteed two weeks’ holiday
  • Upon Management approval - Vincent Communications may pay for approved additional training and courses as well as compensation for the time required to complete them.
  • Company vehicle may be provided depending on the applicant.

All applicants will be reviewed and will be kept in the strictest of confidence. We thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those most suited will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00-$45.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift

Experience:

  • Telecommunications or Oil and Gas: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Class 5 Drivers License with no GDL (minimum requirement) (preferred)
  • drivers abstract with less than 6 demerits (preferred)

title: newFIELD TECHNICIAN / RIGGER
description:
Kanata, ON

This is an exciting time to join our growing Field Operations department! When in the office, share your ideas with the team – we value input, fresh perspectives, and participation. When in the field, put your tower climbing and rigging expertise to the test by building, installing, upgrading, testing, and maintaining our sites and infrastructure.
We are looking for someone who enjoys adventure, is fueled by new technology, learns quickly, embraces challenges, and always strives to find the right solution for SSi. Does this sound like you? If so, this could be the opportunity you have been waiting for!

Key Responsibilities:

Carrying out work in accordance with strict company Health & Safety procedures
Climbing and working on communications towers for the purpose of installing, replacing, and repairing equipment
Traveling for the routine maintenance and repair of our infrastructure
Providing operational feedback to the manager on an ongoing basis
Working alongside contractors, tradespeople, and our representatives at our sites
Working in the office to document changes, tests and audits and for field preparation

You’re a Natural Fit, Because You:

Make safety a priority;
Have intermediate rigging experience;
Have intermediate experience working on communication towers;
Are physically capable of performing required tower climbing and rigger duties;
Can work outdoors in all seasons of the year and aren’t bothered by adverse weather conditions;
Are able and willing to travel off the beaten path as part of your work;
Hold a valid driver’s license and have dependable transportation;
Are proficient with hand tools, power tools, and safety equipment;
Possess strong verbal and written communication and organizational skills;
Are a positive, genuine team player – friendly, personable and helpful;
Are able to work with minimal supervision – trustworthy, methodical and detailed;
Demonstrate great initiative and excel in problem solving;
Are able to understand and follow complex instructions;
Can manage unexpected tasks and situations with ease;
Are conscientious about deadlines and responsibilities;
Always strive to get the job done.

Icing on the Cake

Have excellent verbal French language skills (considered a big asset, though not required!)

If you can’t check off all the boxes but you’re hardworking, bright, (quirky is great too), and passionate about what you do, we want to hear from you! Convince us with your cover letter!

Attach your cover letter

Attach your resume

Best way to contact you

title: newRigger / Monteur
description:
Are you ready to take your career to new heights? Join our growing team at WesTower Communications Ltd. as an Aerial Field Technician! We are Canada’s largest network service contractor offering Engineering, Design, Fabrication, Construction, Project Management, and Maintenance Services for telecommunication carriers, independent tower operators, broadcast, and utility.

We offer competitive wages with paid out living allowances, paid holidays, comprehensive benefits, RSP matching, stock options, a generous referral bonus program and opportunities to further develop your skillset and grow your career. Job Description: • Tower and cell-site installation and routine maintenance • Antenna modifications / adds • Repair or replace defective equipment on tower • Perform tests equipment to locate transmission faults • Extensive travel throughout the province and or country Qualifications: • 2 years of basic knowledge of construction and tool manipulation • Telecom troubleshooting experience preferred but not required • Ability to interpret engineered drawings and knowledge of fibre and DC drawings • Knowledge of OTDR test equipment and fibre fusion • Demonstrate strong adherence to safety procedures • Good physical condition and comfortable working at heights • Willing to work outdoors and be exposed to all types of weather • Valid Canadian driver’s license is required • Must be authorized to work in Canada • Must be mechanically inclined • Strong written and verbal skills • Clean Criminal record • Maintain a professional working relationship with co-workers and clients • Must be reliable, trustworthy and have a positive attitude! At WesTower Communications Ltd. you can expect to be treated fairly.

We recognize that it is our people who drive the success of our business, so we make it our priority to foster inclusive work environments welcomed to diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to accommodating prospective employees. We proudly offer a drug-free workplace with a zero-tolerance safety program.

title: newStagehand
description:
We are seeking experienced Stagehands located in Toronto for on-call installation / strike calls. We are hiring Stagehands, Riggers, Lift Ops, Painters, Carpenters, General Labours.

What we do:

Crew and Logistics- serves primarily the in marketing, public art installations, film/ television sets, window dressing for high end retailers, pop-up shops, fashion events, corporate events and live stage productions. These projects include interactive displays, games and mechanically operated parts which require a skilled team of designers to create, test and prove sustainability and longevity in the market place. We are currently seeking motivated and hardworking team players for our onsite crew. Stagehands are our onsite crew for installing and dismantling projects based on given deadlines. Stagehand hands are booked based on availability provided all details of job type, location, as well as what tools or gear will be needed.

"If you do not have the exact qualifications we specify below, but believe that you have strengths to add to our team, feel free to send in a resume specifying what contribution you think you can make."

Stagehand Job Responsibilities Depending on Project Needs:

  • Install and dismantle stages, set pieces, temporary structures and displays for live events, corporate events, film and television.
  • Assist carpenters on site and in shop.
  • Basic painting
  • Load and unload trucks

This Position Requires:

  • A Motivated person with a positive attitude
  • Very good communication skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and goal-oriented environment and adapt quickly to new procedures.
  • Available to work flexible hours including nights and weekends.
  • Must be in a good physical condition
  • Willing to work in various weather conditions
  • Respond well to and follow the direction
  • Enjoy working with others in a team setting
  • Must own/have all Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) needed at all times, including steel toes, hard hat and vest
  • Ability to travel is an asset (Most job are within the GTA)
  • Preferred Qualifications: 1 year of general Labor experience
  • Must be able to lift at least 50lbs
  • Drivers license is an asset
  • Forklift or other machine licenses are an asset

title: Rigger
description:
There is an exciting opportunity for a talented professional to join the Construction team in Vancouver as a Rigger. This role will be responsible for maintaining all rigging equipment and will require a high standard of safety.

Job Description:

  • Attach rigging to material and equipment to prepare for moving with chains, shackles, web slings, chokers and or straps
  • Dismantle and store rigging equipment after use.
  • Must be able to perform quick load calculations
  • Determine angles and position of rigging to ensure all loads are safe and secure during lift
  • Must be able to perform quantity counts of equipment (incoming and outgoing)
  • Maintain the on-site riggers log book on a daily basis
  • Communicate with other trades as to positioning of their materials within the project boundaries and floor to floor
  • Must be able to communicate directions to crane operator while load is “in the blind”
  • Follow all project policies and working rules
  • ensure all that all work scope is completed in a safe manner ensuring no detrimental impact to personnel, fabric or environment

Summary of responsibilities and requirements:

  • Minimum two (2-5) years of construction experience as a Rigger, working on a variety of job sites including commercial and multi-residential
  • Experience with multiple crane sites is an asset
  • Must be willing to work overtime during regular work week and Saturday’s
  • Must have valid rigging certificate or Letter of Competence
  • Must hold a valid fall protection certificate
  • Staying alert and maintain a high level of concentration
  • Ability to work with hand and power carpentry tools and other construction equipment
  • Ability to assess situations and identify potential hazards
  • Represent the company, resolving customer concerns and keeping a positive attitude

Perks and Benefits:

  • Competitive pay and comprehensive benefit package
  • Paid time off
  • Programs to continuously develop and recognize employees
  • Wellness: lifeworks wellness platform
  • To top it all off - a great company culture with lots of exciting projects and career growth opportunities!

**Willing to train the right candidate, experience in a construction field or working at height a plus**

**Work in Edmonton and surrounding areas**
**Must live in or be willing to relocate to Edmonton area**

*Must be able to work in a team environment and be a valued member of the team and the company.
*Participate in ongoing training and certifications for telecom related work.

title: newRigger
description:
• Work From Home or In Studio.
  • Must be willing to relocate to British Columbia.


-


ICON Creative Studio is Canada’s largest independently owned animation entertainment company located in the historic Gastown district of Vancouver, BC Canada with design, storyboarding, modeling, rigging, animation, technical finaling, lighting, visual effects, and compositing artists alongside creative and management teams.


Known for our quality, efficiency, and timely deliveries, ICON has partnered alongside distributors, broadcasters, and streaming platforms around the world to help create, realize and produce noteworthy content.


ICON operates from a holistic philosophy that leverages individual skill sets to maximize production efficiency on the floor while maintaining an optimal balance of creativity and quality on-screen.-


-


During this challenging time, we have successfully transitioned to a virtual studio. The health of our employees is always our priority. We will see you soon!


-

Why work at ICON?


At ICON we constantly invest in raising the bar of our productions and fostering our people. If you are a passionate artist capable of sharing success with others, we'd like to hear from you!

  • Join the fastest growing CG Animation studio in Vancouver
  • Work in a safe environment. The company has successfully transitioned into a virtual studio via a high-speed Teradici connection
  • Work on top feature episodic CG franchises for leading streaming platforms (Netflix, Disney+, Apple TV+, Amazon, etc.)
  • Work with a diverse group of artists from all over the world who have come to BC to join our expanding studio
  • Use all of the latest tools and Softwares
  • We uphold a premium standard of quality across all of our production
  • We hire for the long term and give artists the opportunity to grow, get promoted and take on as much responsibility as they can manage
  • We offer flexibility and autonomy
  • We facilitate requests and make changes in a timely manner
  • We support PR applications
  • We offer a generous benefits package for all employees

-


SENIOR RIGGER

  • Overview:
    • Senior Riggers are strong rigging artists that can tackle an array of difficult rigging tasks.


  • Responsibilities:
    • Tackle the hardest rig tasks on the show
    • Help Mid and Junior riggers with technical issues
    • Write and maintain scripts for the department and show
    • Able to work by themselves on difficult tasks with little to no supervision.


  • Qualifications:
    • Have at least 2 years of related experience
    • Strong knowledge of Maya
    • Python knowledge is a must
    • Proficient in nCloth and nHair
    • GIT power user
    • Experience delivering tasks under deadlines
    • Experience in an animation production environment


INTERMEDIATE RIGGER

  • Overview:
    • Mid-level Rigging artists have a full grasp and ability to do everything expected from a Junior Rigger to higher quality and at a faster speed.


  • Responsibilities:
    • Able to rig a variety of characters, props, vehicles with minimal input
    • Work with Senior Riggers to learn and grow
    • Learn & expand coding abilities to start to assist the department with development and technical challenges
    • Stay in constant communication with the Lead Rigger
    • Assist Junior Riggers with simple questions
    • Take direction easily


  • Qualifications:
    • Have at least 1 year of related experience
    • Strong knowledge of Maya
    • Descent Python knowledge is required
    • Basic nCloth and nHair knowledge is required
    • Knowledge of GIT is a plus
    • Experience delivering tasks under deadlines


JUNIOR RIGGER

  • Overview:
    • Junior Riggers are responsible for building the rigs assigned to them by their Lead.


  • Responsibilities:
    • Create prop, vehicle, and character rigs to meet production requirements
    • Learn and use in-house rigging tools efficiently to create different types of rigs
    • Expected to learn and grow from all fellow rigging artists
    • Take direction easily


  • Qualifications:
    • Strong knowledge of Maya
    • Python experience a plus
    • nCloth experience a plus
    • Knowledge of GIT is a plus
    • Experience delivering tasks under deadlines

-

ICON Creative Studio is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.


  • Ask us about our generous benefits program.

title: newCrane Operators/Riggers
description:
COMPANY PROFILE:

Syber Concrete Forming Ltd. was established in 2004, specializing in the construction and erection of concrete formwork, focusing on high-profile commercial and institutional projects as well as high-rise residential dwellings.

Syber has built a reputation in the industry as an innovative company dedicated to superior craftsmanship with a commitment to time management and financial sustainability. This, along with the coupling of an outstanding management team and experienced construction crews, allows Syber to ensure that all projects are handled with the highest standard of professionalism while continually striving for excellence in customer satisfaction.

The company’s mission is to be the industry leader in Innovative Formwork Solutions for a greener environment by focusing on quality, versatility, attention to detail and incorporating the latest technological innovations within the concrete industry. Syber Concrete Forming Ltd. always strives to achieve optimal productivity in conjunction with meeting client requirements.

As an ever-growing company, we offer our employees opportunities for advancement. We offer a competitive salary and a full benefits package that covers you and your dependents.

We are “forming” the future and it starts with you!

Duties and Responsibilities

The Crane Operator is responsible for lifting, moving, positioning, and placing various equipment, materials, pre-fabricated forms, tables, and other large objects with the crane. In addition, the Crane Operator will assess, conduct, and record daily machine safety inspections, routine crane maintenance as well as any specific crane manufacturer routine maintenance. The Crane Operator continuously demonstrates safety awareness by complying to all WorkSafe (WCB) procedures/safety practices including on site work practices and guidelines.

Education, Skills and Experience:

· A Valid British Columbia Level A crane certificate is required (B ticket considered)

· Demonstrate the ability to effectively operate a crane to lift, move, position and place equipment and materials

· Commercial &/or Infrastructure construction experience/formwork considered an asset

· Perform routine and pre-operational crane maintenance such as cleaning and lubricating

· Perform pre-operational inspections, and calculate the capacities and weight to prepare rigging and hoisting

· Knowledge of WorkSafe (WCB) procedures/safety practices

· Ability to independently conduct daily crane inspections

· Ability to remain calm and respond effectively in a variety of situations

· Ability to problem-solve, apply reasoning and sound judgement in all situations

· Punctuality is a must

· Must be able to perform physical work including climbing, bending, stooping, kneeling, pushing, pulling and lifting up to 50lbs

· Must have and wear personal protection equipment (PPE), have fall protection gear and the appropriate ticket(s) (will train)

· Must be willing and able to work extended hours including weekends

· Must have means of reliable transportation to job sites

Benefits:

We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits plan which includes Health and Dental benefits, Extended health and vision care and Life and Disability insurance

Applicant Requirements:

All interested applicants (local applicants preferred), please submit your experience and applicable certifications online to our careers email. We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted further.

** Please know that most sites are usually located near Skytrain stations and transit routes however, some sites are not close to public transit

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $35.00-$50.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime

COVID-19 considerations:
We continue to comply with Provincial Health Guidelines.

Application question(s):

  • Do you have a Valid British Columbia Level A crane certificate or B ticket ?

Experience:

  • Tower Crane Operator: 1 year (preferred)
  • construction industry: 1 year (preferred)

title: newSummer Student position available - Suspended Access Rigger,...
description:
An exciting development opportunity awaits at Scafom Rux North America; a leading supplier of quality-driven shoring and scaffolding systems throughout Canada and the USA. Supported by seven global manufacturing facilities, our innovative products are designed to deliver operational efficiency to our customers. Apply today to learn more!

We are currently seeking a student that will be working in a temporary/seasonal position as a Suspended Access Rigger over the summer months, starting as soon as possible.

The Suspended Access Rigger will be working in our suspended access erection and dismantle department. The job will involve working at heights, repetitive lifting, and the carrying of equipment weighing up to 60lbs. The successful candidate will be working alongside a safety conscious team. Typical duties include, but are not limited to:

  • Delivering equipment to the job site.
  • Loading and unloading truck(s).
  • Carrying equipment to and from rig locations on the roof using a combination of elevator(s), stairs, and ground/sub roofs.
  • Assembling and dismantling equipment.
  • Lowering and pulling up cable, cord, and safety rope.

This is a physically demanding position and requires the successful candidate to work in all weather conditions. Normal hours of operation are, but are not limited to:

  • Monday-Thursday: 7AM-4PM
  • Friday: 7AM-3PM

The completion of Working at Heights training is an asset.

Scafom Rux North America is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties. We are pleased to accommodate individual needs of job applicants throughout the recruitment and selection process in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility of Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). If you require accommodation at any time throughout the recruitment process, please speak with the Hiring Manager.

Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal
Contract length: 5 months

Salary: $20.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Do you have the ability to lift heavy objects, weighing up to 60lbs, consistently, over the duration of the standard work day?

title: Senior Rigger
description:
Position: Senior Rigger
Location: Remote Work
Term: 1 Year Contract

About us

Company 3 Animation (CO3) provides a high-quality global animation studio supporting creators in bringing their stories to life. Our team of world-class animation production veterans are innovators and problem-solvers. CO3 Animation is a wholly owned subsidiary of Company3 (www.company3.com)

Job Description:
Company 3 Animation is seeking an experienced highly skilled Senior Rigger for a high-end animated series. The role of the Senior Rigger is to create rig construction, helping to establish the control rigs for all characters, sets and props for a show and carrying out their completion, on schedule, with an international team of artists.

Responsibilities – Your impact/What you’ll be doing:


  • Collaborate with CG Supervisor, Rigging Supervisor and key creative team to develop the rigging system to ensure that the desired performance can be achieved.
  • Collaborate with the Modeling Department to ensure that the models are optimized for rigging and performance needs.
  • Collaborate with the Animation Department to develop and maintain rigs for a wide range of creative, performance, and technical needs.
  • Develop and maintain procedural rig systems and components.
  • Maintain the rigs as they move through the pipeline.
  • Develop supplemental tools and processes for Animation.
  • Conduct steps for rigging review and approvals, meeting the performance needs for the film’s production. This includes properly executing changes and notes from the Rigging Supervisor and other key creative on a project in a timely manner.
  • Training and coaching the Rigging team of varied degrees of talent to produce high-end feature quality rigs properly and on schedule. This includes ensuring established procedures are being followed, answering questions and working with Riggers to find creative solutions for problems that may arise.
  • Support all departments with fixes/changes and any rigging issues that may arrive during the course of production.

Qualifications – What you bring to the team:

  • Bachelor degree in Animation, Film, Art or equivalent professional work experience
  • 2+ years of 3D feature animation experience.
  • Excellent knowledge of 3D rigging in Maya. Experience with other programs a plus.
  • Advance knowledge of Python scripting language.
  • Ability to communicate and collaborate with Supervisors, Technical Directors and Production Management throughout a project.
  • Strong Mathematical skills.
  • Link to Demo Reel/Portfolio showcasing 3D rigging work done in recent years.

About the Company:

Company 3 / Method Studios provides a full range of Creative Services for content creators, including conceptual design, pre-vis, look development, ideation and rapid prototyping, 3D animation/CGI, motion graphics/designers, matte painting, compositing, dailies and production services, color grading, post-production finishing, marketing/trailers, live-action production, experiences, and more.

Creativity has diversity at its core. We celebrate the value of each unique experience by being dedicated to fostering the most diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where every employee feels empowered and safe to show up to work as their full self.

It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. Please inform the company's HR representative if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

title: Telecom Tower Rigger- Edmonton & Calgary
description:
Vtelecom Inc. (A Tridon Technologies Company) –* Calgary and Edmonton*
Vtelecom is looking for steady and reliable workers for immediate local Alberta based and out of province work.

The Tower Rigger is responsible for building and maintaining communication towers, the safe installation of steel structures and wireless communication components, performing general ground procedures associated with installation, concrete foundations, plum & tension, crane direction, working with various antenna and transmission lines, identifying and selecting appropriate equipment for specific installations, and climbing and working on poles, towers, and ladders or other support structures up to 500 feet.

*
Responsibilities and Duties*

  • Building and maintaining communication towers
  • Safe installation of steel structures and wireless communication components
  • Performing general procedures associated with installation
  • Working with various antenna and transmission lines
  • Laying foundational concrete
  • Climbing and working on poles, towers, and ladders or other support structures up to 500 feet

Experience and Training:

  • Someone who has a proven track record of working at heights
  • Experience working with Gin poles
  • Experience with Steel work

title: Rigger
description:
Headquartered in Montreal, Reflector, a company of the Bandai Namco group, is a new breed of studio working with top talents to create high-quality, compelling content for global audiences. By employing a true transmedia approach, where content is built outwards from fully fleshed “Storyworlds”, the company is able to tell richer, deeper stories that connect with fans everywhere.

Summary
Our in-house video game team is presently looking to hire a rigger to work on Unknown 9: Awakening.

Responsibilities

  • Create custom character rigs in Maya;
  • Collaborate with the animation technical team to automate and streamline rigging processes;
  • Rig and skin characters and objects to create clean and high-quality animations and improve movements as well as ensure they respect naming conventions;
  • Collaborate with the artists, character modelers, technical animators and animation team to understand the game vision and rigging needs;
  • Find a balance between artistic aspects and technical limitations with the help of technical animators and Directors;
  • Create proxy meshes of existing models to improve framerates;
  • Ensure a nomenclature in accordance with the projects standards and the selection sets in the main scenes in order to facilitate animators’ work.

Qualifications

  • Minimum three to four (3-4) years experience in game development or equivalent rigging in Maya;
  • Experienced working on a published AAA game from conception to release is a strong asset;
  • College diploma in 3D Animation or equivalent;
  • In-depth knowledge of Maya is a must;
  • Knowledge of MotionBuilder and 3DS Max is a plus;
  • Experience with Unreal4 is a plus;
  • Knowledge of at least one programming or scripting language is preferred;
  • An excellent understanding of clothes and anatomy is important;
  • A fundamental understanding of animation;
  • Rigged at least one character or a complex object (with a video link);
  • Good communication skills and the ability to clearly document any work;
  • Have a general knowledge of videogames and the methods the developers used to create them;
  • Have some experience with facial animation is a must;
  • Have a curious nature and a thirst for knowledge;
  • Positive team-building skills;
  • Proven problem-solving skills adapted to rapid iteration development environment;
  • Excellent communication skills in English and French (both oral and written).

title: newCharacter Rigger
description:
Job reference

4437551003

Company Name

Rockstar Games San Diego & Toronto

Salary

Competitive

Location

Oakville, Canada

Country

Canada

Industry sector

Animation

Job start date

ASAP

Posted date

10/03/2022

Experience Level

Junior-Associate

Job type

Permanent | Full Time

Remote / Hybrid

No

At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar is looking for an experienced and passionate Character Rigger to join the team to help develop and support our titles.

This role will also involve the research and development of new technology for future titles as well as improving existing technology and tools.

This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar's unique game development studio in Oakville.

WHAT WE DO


  • We design, create, and maintain highly complex deformation systems for characters, animals and vehicles that bring our 3D assets to life.
  • We support rigging pipelines, including investigations for improvement of facial rig and animation solving solutions.
  • We work with Technical Artists to maintain and improve our proprietary animation tools.
  • We bring innovation to dynamic art pipelines through rigs, secondary motion setups, and evolving our tools and workflows - from asset creation to its visualization in the engine.
  • We collaborate and communicate with other departments such as Tools and Code (engine) teams to improve our authoring workflows and animation/graphics systems in runtime.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Build, test, and maintain body and face rigs, skinning, and secondary motion setups for a variety of 3D assets.
  • Use proprietary system to create and export constraints, custom deformers, and secondary motion to the game engine.
  • Work closely with animators, automation, and other TAs to create tools and improve pipelines that ensure the best results from our production workflows and processes.
  • Support facial pipeline and be heavily involved in face assets from motion capture.
  • Work with the team organizing, documenting, and maintaining libraries of rig modules that can be shared by a large team of riggers through multiple projects.
  • Support and help create production tools to support new pipelines and future tech.
  • Staying current with latest technologies/research ongoing in the field to help keep our dynamic art visuals at the cutting-edge regarding motion and deformation.

QUALIFICATIONS
  • Relevant experience in the game industry as a Character Rigger, Technical Animator, or similar/related position.
  • A demo reel and online portfolio that demonstrates exceptional skills creating motion controls for animation, complex deformation and skinning of body and face of characters and creatures.

SKILLS
  • Strong Python programming skills, and a 3D math background.
  • Experience creating tools for Rigging and Animation.
  • Experience using source control software (i.e. Perforce, Git).
  • Strong communication, self-management, and organizational skills.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
  • Professional experience developing pipelines and creating tools is highly advantageous.
  • Experience programming C++ plugins for Motionbuilder, Maya, 3DS Max, or similar DCCs.
  • Experience using other game engines (e.g. Unreal/Unity or proprietary tech).
  • Knowledge of current facial capture approaches, FACS poses, facial blend shape rigs, feature detection, etc.
  • Experience using a solver based face animation package (Dynamixyz or Faceware).
  • Professional experience as an Artist or Animator in games.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a resume and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race.

title: Lead Rigger - 3D
description:
Brown Bag Films, Toronto studio, is currently looking for an experienced Lead Rigger (3D)!
Applicants need to be legally eligible to work in Canada and have Ontario residency.

The position of Lead Rigger requires someone with a good general knowledge of Maya and excellent specific knowledge of its constraint, deformer and dynamics systems, and also be proficient with python and Maya tool development. He/she should have several years’ experience rigging in a broadcast / film production environment. Successful applicants will be open to direction, have good communication skills, leadership skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with multiple tasks in a fast paced production. A Lead Rigger will work closely with the Rigging Supervisor to ensure working practices are in line with department standards, and also contribute to the ongoing development of tools and practices.

Key Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop show specific custom rigs.

  • Maintain show specific code and tools.

  • Schedule and delegate work.

  • Liaise with Rigging Supervisor regarding project details.

  • Provide regular progress updates to production manager and Rigging supervisor on any technical bottlenecks concerning the rigging schedule.

  • Design, create, test and maintain character set ups.

  • Provide technical feedback to modelling dept.

  • Collaborate with animators to design motion controls.

  • Create secondary dynamics systems.

  • Work with production management to prioritize tasks.

  • Troubleshooting problems with animated rig.

  • Communicate with the overseas studio.

  • QC the external asset assignments and ensure the outsource partner has clear direction from a rigging perspective.

  • Prop rigging and modelling experience.

  • Character or more advanced rigging is an asset.

  • Experience in episodic animation is required.

  • Look out for Python scripting experience, will be a big asset.

    • Key Requirements

    Key Requirements:

  • Must have experience working as an Character Rigger(or similar position) in either broadcast or feature film work.

  • Must be comfortable with outsource management with an emphasis on clear communication and follow through.

  • Should have experience working as a Lead Rigger in either broadcast or feature film work.

  • Must have an excellent working knowledge of rigging in Maya.

  • Task Driven, self-motivated, and proactive.

  • Must be open to direction.

  • Must demonstrate attention to detail in finishing of assets.

  • Must have good leadership skills.

  • Must be a good communicator and be fluent in English.

  • Knowledge of Python is a must.

  • Proficiency in developing tools for Maya a big plus.

  • Experience with shotgun (or asset tracking systems) is considered a big plus.

  • Experience with GIT is considered a big plus.

    • Experience with developing tools in PySide and QT designer considered a big plus.

    Why work with us?

    Perks! Perks! Perks! Not only is 9 Story Media Group an amazing place full of artists, animators and creators from all corners of the industry, but we focus on helping staff grow and develop in their careers and make them long time team members. Along with a great work environment we offer first-rate health + dental benefits, summer hours, paid Health and Wellness Days, vacation periods that multiply with tenure, and more! We may love animation, but we love our employees even more!

    Please submit a full CV and outline all equivalent experience and why you wish to work with us in your Cover letter.

    Brown Bag Films/9 Story Media takes diversity and inclusion seriously, and we are committed to ensuring equity in the recruitment process. Candidates from a diverse group of backgrounds, including but not limited to, Indigenous peoples, Racialized and LGBT2SQ+ communities, candidates from a range of ages and religious beliefs, and people with disabilities, are encouraged to apply.

    As a company, we deliver high-quality kids' content, and we seek to have diverse characters so that all our audience feels represented. We also want the same for our own workforce, and Brown bag Films/9 Story Media is committed to looking for all kinds of talent to build a diverse workforce in which all identities are represented and respected.

    We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application and interview process to be successful in performing essential job functions. We'd love to know how we can support your requirements for accommodation.

title: Tower Rigger - Ontario & Alberta
description:
Tower Rigger - Ontario & Alberta



Tower Rigger

** The candidates wishing to apply must have all legal authorization to work in Canada such as; Canadian citizenship, permanent residency, valid work permit, Visa or any other official document


JOB SUMMARY:

Tower Riggers work in teams to complete the installation of towers and related projects. They occupy the ground for the general procedures of the installation and will work with various antennas, equipment and cabling.


RESPONSIBILITY:
Responsible for the installation of structures of any kind
Install various components and accessories on a tower with some supervision, including, antennas, transmission lines, FO cable, lighting system, protection system against lightning etc...
Working and being safe at all times

Perform emergency repairs and restoration of services when required
Ensure and complete all the other activities required for the successful implementation of the project

QUALIFICATIONS:
Possess a certificate of high angle rescue and work at heights or equivalent minimal experience
Having a good knowledge and experience in the installation of towers, antenna systems, transmission lines and meteorological equipment or in the field of construction is an asset


REQUIREMENTS:
Bilingual (English)
Be available to travel across Canada
Manual dexterity and he knows how to use tools effectively
Team player
Passionate
Holding a valid driver’s license

Must be willing to travel.

  • Building and maintaining communication towers
  • Safe installation of steel structures and wireless communication components
  • Performing general procedures associated with installation
  • Working with various antenna and transmission lines
  • Climbing and working on poles, towers, and ladders or other support structures up to 500 feet

  • Ability to safely climb to heights up to 500 feet
  • Ability to work at heights for extended periods of time in all types of weather
  • Ability to safely and properly operate motor vehicles up to ¾ ton pickup
  • Able to work regular shifts of up to 12 hours (or more in special circumstances)

  • Comtech (Communication Technologies) Ltd. is currently unable to facilitate or sponsor immigration into Canada.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00-$32.00 per hour

Licence/Certification:

  • Driver's License (preferred)

Willingness to travel:
