title: Rigger/Aerial Technician Sr and Jr
description:
Rigger/Aerial Technician Sr. and Jr.

WaveStar Networks is currently looking to add a number of qualified Sr./Jr. Aerial technicians to our teams with the GTA region. These positions are for the upgrading, repairing, rebuilding and preventive maintenance activities of roof top and low Cell towers located in and around the GTA.

With head offices located in Richmond Hill ON, WaveStar Networks is a Canadian company with over 15 years’ experience providing a wide array of network infrastructure and communication system services as well as professional and consulting services to telecommunication/ISP providers, data centre operators and corporate/business/public sector customers.

Responsibilities:

  • Involved in the build of Wireless sites on rooftops, lattice towers, guy towers and monopoles.
  • Tower climbing, tower rigging
  • Installation work on building rooftop, use of rappelling equipment and use of staging required
  • Install steel, cable tray, conduits, antenna mounts, antennas, waveguide ports, transmission lines and various wireless construction requirements.
  • Responsible for performing all general ground procedures associated with the installation of antennas and mounts on a communication tower or rooftop.
  • Install various antenna and transmission lines along with ancillary equipment on communication structures including remote radio units.
  • Ensure the proper inspection and use of personal safety equipment.
  • Work with communications tower structural steel.

Requirements:

  • Experience in installation of various transmission lines and connectors
  • Experience in performing orientation of microwave antennas and alignment of cellular antennas
  • Knowledge of communication cabinet installation on rooftops and tower bases
  • Certified in fall protection practice and procedures
  • Certified with high angle rescue procedures
  • Valid Driver's license (Abstract Required)

We are continually looking for quality candidates for all our job postings, regardless of how long they’ve been posted. Please visit our website at WaveStar.ca for additional information on us, and then search for us on Indeed for the many other opportunities available.

Unfortunately due to the nature of our work only applicants who physically reside in Canada and who are eligible to work in Canada will be considered at this time.

WaveStar Networks offers a wide array of network infrastructure services, professional services and consulting services to telecommunication, data centre, networking and business customers. Check out our website for additional information about us.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Are you in the GTA Area

Experience:

  • Telecommunications: 5 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Certified in fall protection practice and procedures (required)
  • Certified with high angle rescue procedures (required)
  • Driver's licence (Abstract Required) (required)

title: newJourneyperson B Pressure Welder
description:
Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday.

Description

Job Summary:

You are a Journeyperson B Pressure Welder that has extensive experience working in an industrial shop setting. We are looking for a Journeyperson B Pressure Welder to support us in our Module Fabrication shop in Nisku, AB. The successful candidate will be responsible for working in accordance with quality, safety, and efficiency standards.

Responsibilities:

  • Performs Pipe welding (capable of rolling pipe and/or position welding)
  • Work with riggers and laborers to successfully complete tasks
  • Cleans and checks for Weld defects
  • Mentors and coaches Apprentice Welders
  • May perform other related duties as assigned

Requirements:

  • Must be an Interprovincial Red Seal or have a Journeyman Welding ticket from a recognized provincial training authority
  • Must possess STT ( F6/F4) Welding ticket Max thickness in the 6G position
  • Previous experience working in an industrial shop environment
  • Must possess a valid “B” pressure ticket
  • Must successfully complete pre-access drug and alcohol testing

Additional Information:

Company Description

Ledcor Industrial offers an integrated range of services from construction, engineering, and maintenance to pipe fabrication and module assembly. We offer turnkey solutions to our oil and gas clients and have built some of the continent’s largest oil and gas projects.

But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!

Employment Equity

At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.


Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.

View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement
here
.

Date Posted
May 6, 2022

3925 8 Street, Nisku, AB, Canada

title: Production Operator (Experienced)
description:
NOV Downhole Manufacturing is seeking a Production Operator to join our Downhole Manufacturing Facility in Nisku, AB. This position is an entry level machine operator position. Shifts will be either morning or evening start times.

NOV is seeking a Production Operator to join our Downhole Manufacturing Facility in Nisku, AB. Shifts will be either morning or evening start times.

Job Summary:
As the Production Operator, you will part of a team that manufactures stators. You will operate a variety of manual and semi-automatic production equipment with a focus on quality and safety. Technical abilities, team work, collaboration, attention to detail, physical ability and pride in doing a good job are essential aspects of this role. You will promote and support all initiatives to ensure a safe, clean and efficient work environment is maintained for yourself and your co-workers.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Use precision measuring equipment and document findings
  • Operate manual and semi-automatic production/manufacturing equipment
  • Provide clear communications, both verbal and written
  • Operate overhead cranes and forklifts in a safe and responsible manner
  • Participate in all near miss / incident reporting
  • Adhere to all HSEQ policies and procedures
  • Perform all other duties as assigned

Education & Experience Qualifications

  • Minimum 2 years experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Power Engineering 4th Class
  • Ability to read and interpret basic drawings, comprehend written instructions and technical documentation
  • Physically fit and able to safely lift and move items (using appropriate aids if required)
  • Mechanical aptitude and awareness - hand tools, basic hydraulics, safe operation of machines
  • Have a strong sense of initiative and creative thinking to ensure quality products are manufactured
  • Work well in a team environment – promoting an environment of collaboration and support
  • High School

HSE

  • Able to work in shop environment (noise, fumes, standing) and lifting unassisted 35 lb.

Position is deemed safety sensitive and will require passing of a pre-employment physical and Drug & Alcohol test.

No phone calls please

National Oilwell Varco thanks all interested applicants, however only those selected for interview will be contacted.

National Oilwell Varco is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination or Harassment of Any Kind: NOV is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunities for everyone and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. National Oilwell Varco values inclusion and diversity; we encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

With over 40 different locations in Canada, and 30, 000 people worldwide, NOV is proud to offer their employees competitive pay and excellent benefits, Health Spending account and employer paid premiums. We are also proud to provide on the job training, with potential for advancement within our organization and an Educational Assistance Program

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • Salary expectations?
  • Preferred contact?

Education:

  • Secondary School (required)

Experience:

  • Machine Operator: 1 year (preferred)
  • Manufacturing: 2 years (preferred)
  • Blueprint reading: 1 year (preferred)
  • Crane Operators & Riggers: 1 year (preferred)
  • forklift: 1 year (preferred)
  • Power engineering: 1 year (preferred)

title: Tower Crane Rigger
description:
Tower Crane Rigger - Location: North Vancouver

COMPANY PROFILE

Syber Concrete Forming Ltd. was established in 2004, specializing in the construction and erection of concrete formwork, focusing on high-profile commercial and institutional projects as well as high-rise residential dwellings.

Syber has built a reputation in the industry as an innovative company dedicated to superior craftsmanship with a commitment to time management and financial sustainability. This, along with the coupling of an outstanding management team and experienced construction crews, allows Syber to ensure that all projects are handled with the highest standard of professionalism while continually striving for excellence in customer satisfaction.

The company’s mission is to be the industry leader in Innovative Formwork Solutions for a greener environment by focusing on quality, versatility, attention to detail and incorporating the latest technological innovations within the concrete industry. Syber Concrete Forming Ltd. always strives to achieve optimal productivity in conjunction with meeting client requirements.

As an ever-growing company, we offer our employees opportunities for advancement. We offer a competitive salary and a full benefits package that covers you and your dependents.

We are “forming” the future and it starts with you!

Position: Tower Crane Rigger

Rate: $25.00 - $35.00

Duties and Responsibilities

The main role of a tower crane rigger is to safely hook up loads for all trades on site and be able to communicate clearly to the operator where, when, and why a load is being moved. This position also requires the performance and recording of daily rigging inspections. Must always be able to multitask and stay calm and professional under pressure. This person must be punctual and steady for all hours of the crane’s operation. This person would report to the site foremen and Superintendent directly.

Employment Requirements:

· Safely attach loads to rigging to provide support or prepare them for moving

· Control movement of heavy equipment through narrow openings or confined spaces using chain falls with various types of tables

· Dismantle and store rigging equipment after use

· Work with crane operator daily via radio and hand signals

· Ability to work extended hours including weekends

· Must be able to work in adverse weather conditions, climb scaffolding, ladders and carry at least 50 pounds of weight

· Must have personal protection equipment (PPE) and always demonstrate safety awareness

· Must have fall protection gear and the appropriate ticket (will train)

· Knowledge and the ability to comply to ALL WorkSafe (WCB) procedures/safety practices including on site work practices and guidelines

· Must have means of reliable transportation to job sites (Sites are usually located near Skytrain stations and transit routes)

Skills and Experience:

· Knowledge and experience with flying various types of tables considered an asset

· Commercial &/or Infrastructure construction experience/formwork considered an asset

· Capacity to remain calm and respond effectively using good judgement in a variety of situations

· Peri/Doka Fork experience is an asset

· Pinch method with various types of tables

Benefits:

  • Health benefits, including health, dental and vision care as well as therapy and massage are available after 3 months' probationary period
  • Health benefits plan is shared 50/50 with the employee
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance

Applicant Requirements:

  • Submission of resume and applicable certifications

Work remotely

  • No

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $25.00-$35.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
We are following all provincial guidelines.

Experience:

  • crane: 1 year (preferred)
  • Construction: 1 year (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-13
Expected start date: 2022-05-16

title: Certified Rigger or Equivalent
description:
Certified Rigger or Equivalent

Seaspan Shipyards is proud to be Canada’s long-term, strategic shipbuilding partner for the Canadian Coast Guard and Royal Canadian Navy. As a direct result of this work, while creating jobs and rebuilding our domestic shipbuilding industry, Seaspan Shipyards is delivering on the promise of ships built in Canada, by Canadians.

Vancouver Shipyards, based in North Vancouver, has a very busy and exciting year ahead, as we continue to make progress on the first of two 174m long Joint Support Ships (JSS) for the Royal Canadian Navy – the largest ships ever built in Canada! We are also constructing an Offshore Oceanographic Science Vessel (OOSV) for the Canadian Coast Guard and have secured significant contracts to build a second JSS, a Polar Icebreaker, and several Multi-Purpose Vessels. These projects will bring long-term job stability for many years to come.

Now is the best time to be part of Canada’s shipbuilding industry! Join us and be part of the regeneration of the shipbuilding tradition and become a member of a talented, diverse team that is forging a bright future for Canadian shipbuilding at one of the most modern shipyards in North America.

Please send us your resume today!

Seaspan Vancouver Shipyards is currently seeking a certified rigger or equivalent with rigging qualifications, certification, or equivalent experience to work with our Services Department. This position will include working with mobile cranes up to 80 ton, tower cranes as well as our 300 Ton Goliath gantry crane “Big Blue”. Hand rigging and working at heights will also be part of daily tasks.

Your success will be defined by your ability to:

  • Perform pre-operational inspections including hazard assessments, defining rigging needed and weight to prepare for rigging and hoisting.
  • Work with mobile cranes to lift, move, position, flip, turn or place equipment and materials with single or multiple hook applications.
  • Safely and effectively follow shipyard’s regulations and procedures.
  • Work with our Maintenance department to ensure routine maintenance lifts are safely conducted on all projects.
  • Represents the company, help to resolve any customer concerns in a professional manner.
  • Following all site rules and adhering to at all times.
  • Attend toolbox meetings in a constructive and contributive manner.
  • All candidates must show proof of:
  • 5+ years’ experience working with rigging and cranes in an industrial environment
  • Ability to communicate and interact effectively.
  • Ability to remain alert and maintain a high level of concentration.
  • Good interpersonal skills and customer service orientation.
  • Understands the operations and limitations of the equipment.
  • Aerial work platform ticket and fall arrest certification.
  • Forklift and telehandler (zoom boom) tickets would also be considered an asset.

If you are interested in future opportunities, please apply online today; OR email your resume directly to: tradesrecruitment@seaspan.com


Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, aboriginal persons, and persons with disabilities.


Disclaimers:

By applying, you agree that Seaspan may share your resume with our Union partner, Marine and Shipbuilders Union Local 506.

Note: Unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies will not be accepted.

Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request.

title: Rigger – Dead by Daylight
description:
Le Rôle

En tant que Rigger, vous permettez aux animateurs de pouvoir faire rayonner leur talent. Armé.e d’une bonne connaissance des principes de rigging et de skinning, vous créez la structure qui permet à l’animateur de déformer le personnage ou l’objet selon les exigences du design.
Vos connaissances vous permettent de créer des structures réfléchies et optimisées selon les contraintes de production. Vous partagez votre expérience en orientant la structure polygonale des modèles pour obtenir la meilleure déformation possible et vous assurez le suivi auprès des animateurs pour valider la qualité et la pertinence de votre travail.


Dans ce rôle, vous devrez :

  • Comprendre la vision du développement technique en animation ;
  • Respecter les contraintes techniques ;
  • Créer des rigs et effectuer le skinning de modèles de diverses complexités ;
  • Proposer de meilleures pratiques et suggérer de nouveaux outils ;
  • Réutiliser les ressources lorsque possible ;
  • Établir une solide communication avec les animateurs et les designers ;
  • Évaluer l’impact des méthodes utilisées en production ;
  • Assister les animateurs afin d’optimiser l’intégration et l’utilisation des animations dans le moteur.

Ce que nous recherchons :

  • Expérience en rigging ;
  • Connaissances approfondies en animation 3D
  • Curiosité pour les nouveaux logiciels et les avancées en art technologique ;
  • Maitrise du module d’animation du logiciel Maya ;
  • Expérience de production avec Unreal ou Unity un atout ;
  • Compréhension des systèmes d’Anim Graph (atout) ;
  • Capacité à gérer les priorités ;
  • Maîtrise du français et de l'anglais.

Rejoindre Behaviour, c'est faire partie d'une entreprise qui croit en l'équité et la diversité. Nous basons toutes nos décisions d'emploi sur le mérite, les qualifications et les compétences. Nous ne pratiquerons jamais de discrimination fondée sur l'origine ethnique, la santé, la religion, l'âge, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité ou le handicap. Le masculin est utilisé sans aucune discrimination et dans le seul but d'alléger le texte.

title: Rigger / Rigger
description:
// ENGLISH VERSION WILL FOLLOW //


PERMANENT - TEMPS PLEIN


RIGGER

RELÈVE DE : DIRECTEUR ANIMATION TECHNIQUE


RESPONSABILITÉS :

  • Participer à la création des Rigs pour les personnages et les créatures;
  • Exporter les personnages vers l’engin;
  • Paramétrer les personnages et leur simulation dans l’engin;
  • Proposer des solutions pour l’amélioration des systèmes de physique;
  • Tenir compte des contraintes techniques de l’engin;
  • Tenir compte des contraintes techniques de l’équipe de développement;
  • Développer des outils pour faciliter et optimiser le rigging.


EXPÉRIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS :

  • 3+ ans d’expérience dans l’industrie du jeu vidéo comme Rigger de Personnages;
  • Avoir complété au moins une production de jeu vidéo, préférablement AAA sur consoles courantes;
  • Diplôme en animation 3D ou équivalent;
  • Une compréhension de l’anatomie du corps et du visage humain est un atout;
  • Connaissance en Scripting est un atout (Python, MEL);
  • Démontrer une excellente compréhension des fondements de l’animation;
  • Expérience avec Maya est requise;
  • Expérience avec un engin de jeux vidéo recommandé.


QUALITÉS INTERPERSONNELLES :

  • Être capable d’apprendre des autres et partager ses connaissances;
  • De bonnes habiletés de communication ainsi qu’une facilité à illustrer ses idées sont essentielles;
  • La maturité pour donner et recevoir des critiques constructives est attendue;
  • La capacité de s’adapter aux changements est requise;
  • Un désir de repousser les barrières de l’animation en jeu vidéo est requis.


MOTIVATIONS & INTÉRÊTS :

  • La passion et l’ambition pour les jeux vidéo sont essentielles!


// ENGLISH VERSION //


PERMANENT - FULL-TIME


RIGGER

REPORTS TO: DIRECTOR TECHNICAL ANIMATION


RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Create rigs for various characters and creatures;
  • Export characters to the engine;
  • Establish character parameters and simulation in the engine;
  • Suggest new solutions to improve physics systems;
  • Understand the engine’s technical constraints;
  • Understand the development team’s technical constraints;
  • Develop new tools to facilitate and optimize rigging.


EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3+ year of game industry experience as a Character Rigger/Skinner;
  • Must have participated in at least one full videogame production, preferably a AAA on current consoles;
  • Diploma in 3D Animation or equivalent;
  • Knowledge of Maya is mandatory;
  • Scripting Knowledge is an asset (Python, MEL);
  • Thorough understanding of animation principles;
  • Good understanding of Human Anatomy and facial expression is an asset;
  • Game engine experience recommended.


INTERPERSONAL QUALITIES:

  • Ability to learn from others and share knowledge;
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills;
  • The maturity to give and receive constructive feedback is expected;
  • Ability to adapt and embrace change is mandatory;
  • The desire to push the boundaries of animation in video games is required.


MOTIVATION & INTERESTS:

  • Passion and ambition for videogames are essential!

title: newHoisting Engineer
description:
With a legacy that spans over 100 years, Stelco is a company that has grown along with Canada and its global partners. We understand that twenty-first century competition demands the highest quality products, period. So, Stelco is bringing together the people, technology, and unmatched market knowledge to, once again, take on that challenge from here at home.

The Task Requirements of the job are as follows:

  • Operates mobile cranes by means of levers, pedals, pushbuttons, etc.
  • Operates cranes to load, unload and position materials, machinery and equipment.
  • Moves cranes to various work stations.
  • Works in partnership with other maintenance and operating personnel and may direct or assist these personnel as pertains to own work.
  • Raises or lowers personnel in baskets as required.
  • Judges overhead and side clearances, safe loads and speeds, use of outriggers if necessary.
  • Inspects rigging, works with and assists riggers and accepts responsibility for all lifts.
  • Assists in changing crane cables.
  • Checks condition of mobile cranes and auxiliary equipment using checklists or established procedures.
  • Records miscellaneous information as directed by supervision.
  • Responsible for the addition of fuel, oil, water, air, etc. as required.
  • Cleans, lubricates and makes minor repairs to cranes and equipment.
  • Keeps immediate working area and equipment in a clean and orderly condition.
  • Observes all safety regulations for the safe performance of duties.

Qualification Requirements:

  • Hoisting Engineer Certificate of Qualification (339A)
  • Minimum of two years experience in an industrial environment.

The Work Environment Requirements of the job are as follows:

  • The job is within a heavy industrial environment and you may be required to work within various areas of the facility. Depending on the area you work in, the environmental conditions may be hot, cold, dirty, dusty, wet or noisy.
  • Safety is our highest priority, and safety procedures and guidelines must be adhered to at all times. This includes wearing personal protective equipment, such as a hard hats, eye protection, hearing protection, respirators, flame retardant clothing and safety shoes with metatarsal protection at all times during a work shift.
  • Employees work in a unionized, highly industrial setting.

The Work Schedule Requirements of the job are as follows:

  • Our Hamilton facility operates 24 hours per day, 365 days a year with varying hours of work including 8 and 12 hour rotating shifts.
  • This means that you may be required to work different days of the week each time you rotate shifts. In other words, you may be required to work Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.
  • The position requires you to work overtime as needed.
  • Punctuality and attendance are extremely important to the success of the operations in general as well as contributing to an overall positive team environment.

The Physical Requirements of the job are as follows:

  • Temperature Tolerance: The ability to withstand extreme temperatures.
  • Reaction Time: The ability to quickly respond to process upsets.
  • Static Strength: The ability to exert significant muscle force to lift, push, pull, or carry objects.
  • Trunk Strength: The ability to use your abdominal and lower back muscles to support part of the body repeatedly or continuously over time, including bending and stooping.
  • Dynamic Strength: The ability to exert muscle force at intervals throughout a work shift. This involves muscular endurance and resistance to muscle fatigue.
  • Agility: The ability to negotiate different areas of the plant, including climbing stairs and ladders, and moving around barriers.
  • Manual Dexterity: The ability to quickly move, and react.

Why Join Us?

  • Competitive Benefit Wellness Package
  • Cost of Living Allowance & Shift Premiums paid out hourly starting Day 1
  • Competitive vacation entitlements and minimum 20% premium paid on vacation hours
  • Productivity payment plan and/ or profit sharing plan based on Company performance and key goals
  • Company paid Defined Contribution Pension Plan (RRSP) with no employee contribution required.
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program available
  • All Personal Protective Equipment, tools, and job training provided at no cost

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, Stelco is an equal opportunity employer who is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment and selection process. Applicants should advise Human Resources if they require any type of accommodation during the recruitment process.

Job Type: Full-time

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift

title: Rigger
description:
Description du poste


En tant que rigger chez Ubi MTL, vous permettez aux personnages et objets de prendre vie et de bouger de manière réaliste dans nos mondes.

Soit pivoter, plier, écraser, ou étirer, vous définissez ce qui peut être fait et comment à travers vos rigs flexibles et intuitifs. Vous vous inspirez de la réalité lorsque c'est possible et usez d'imagination lorsque ce ne l'est pas. Grâce aux divers outils internes à votre disposition, vous pouvez mettre l'accent sur la qualité et la cohérence de vos résultats sans avoir à tout recréer depuis le début chaque fois.

Ce que vous ferez

  • Collaborer avec l'équipe artistique pour comprendre la vision globale du jeu et les besoins en matière d'animation et d'apparences ;
  • Se familiariser avec l'art conceptuel et rechercher vos propres références.
  • Rig et skin les personnages et objets tout en restant organisé (assurer la propreté de vos scènes, suivre les conventions d'appellation, etc.) ;
  • Trouver l’équilibre entre les aspects artistiques et les contraintes techniques avec l’aide des directeur·trices techniques ;
  • Collaborer avec les modeleurs de personnages pour corriger les modèles au besoin ;
  • Travailler avec les animateur·trices pour faire bouger les modèles de manière réaliste et gérer les limites liées aux mouvements ;
  • Peaufiner votre travail selon les commentaires des équipes interdépendantes.

Qualifications


Ce que vous apportez à l’équipe

  • Expérience en création de systèmes animables, modélisation ou animation (ou autre expérience pertinente)
  • Connaissances des logiciels 3D (3DS Max, Maya et MotionBuilder) * + familiarité avec le scripting
  • Bonne connaissance de l'anatomie et des tissus
  • Excellentes aptitudes en observation, organisation, communication et relations interpersonnelles
  • Un esprit collaboratif, créatif et innovateur
  • Flexibilité et débrouillardise
  • Une motivation à solliciter l'avis des collègues et la capacité à s'y adapter
  • Familiarité avec des moteurs de jeu (p. ex. Unity ou Unreal) sera un plus

Pour info : Si vous avez besoin d'un permis de travail, votre admissibilité peut dépendre de votre éducation et de vos années d'expérience de travail pertinentes, comme l'exige le gouvernement.

Ce qu’il faut nous envoyer

  • Votre CV mettant en valeur votre formation, vos expériences et vos compétences

  • Un portfolio de vos meilleures réalisations en 3D! Joindre des images ou nous envoyer un lien vers votre site Web personnel ou votre portfolio en ligne.


Informations complémentaires


À propos de nous

Nous créons l'inconnu depuis 1997. Chez Ubisoft Montréal, un but commun nous uni·es : enrichir la vie des joueuses et des joueurs grâce à des expériences de jeu originales et mémorables. Nous développons des franchises emblématiques qui fascinent des millions de personnes à travers le monde, incluant Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, For Honor, Rainbow Six, Watch Dogs - et, bon, on ne peut quand même pas dévoiler tous nos secrets.

Notre plus grande force est (et sera toujours) notre communauté d’employé·es : les talents audacieux qui soutiennent et produisent les jeux de qualité qui ont marqué l’histoire de notre studio.

Quand vous rejoignez Ubi MTL, vous découvrez un milieu de travail qui éveille la créativité et favorise les connexions : un environnement composé d'une variété de voix, d'identités, d'origines, d'expériences et de perspectives. Nous offrons un espace axé sur la collaboration et qui mise sur l'avancement professionnel, une foule d'opportunités d'apprentissage ainsi que d’importants avantages sociaux pour le bien-être.

Ici, notre désir de rêver gros, de prendre des risques et d’évoluer contribue à l'innovation et au dépassement des limites qui mènent finalement à notre succès collectif.

Nous développons des franchises emblématiques qui fascinent des millions de personnes à travers le monde, incluant Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, For Honor, Rainbow Six, Watch Dogs - et, bon, on ne peut quand même pas dévoiler tous nos secrets.", "Quand vous rejoignez Ubi MTL, vous découvrez un milieu de travail qui éveille la créativité et favorise les connexions : un environnement composé d'une variété de voix, d'identités, d'origines, d'expériences et de perspectives. Nous offrons un espace axé sur la collaboration et qui mise sur l'avancement professionnel, une foule d'opportunités d'apprentissage ainsi que d’importants avantages sociaux pour le bien-être."]

title: Aerial Technician / Rigger
description:
Vertec Communications Inc.

Aerial Technician

About Us

Since its inception in 1990 Vertec Communications Inc. has continued to grow and we are
proud to be regarded as an industry leader. An energetic, motivated and highly trained
workforce is the cornerstone of our success. Our head office is located in North Burnaby, but
our technicians work all across western Canada.

Job Summary

The Aerial Technician is responsible for assisting in the construction, erection and repair of
towers. This position reports directly to the Project Manager – Construction, and takes
direction from both the Project Manager and corresponding project Foreman.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Climb towers and ladders at various heights.
Assist with the erection of various tower types and installation of new carriers on new builds
and existing towers.
Prepare and cleanup sites continuously and at the end of each project.
Accurately record daily hours and work descriptions.
Complete paperwork assigned by the Project Manager or Foreman.
Follow all safety guidelines and protection procedures.
Participate in safety meetings.
Perform other tasks as assigned by the Project Manager or Foreman.

Core Competencies

Good mechanical aptitude and working knowledge of simple hand and power tools.
Comfortable with technology, including MS Office, Adobe and wireless personal devices.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Excellent customer service skills.
Detail oriented, organized and able to meet tight deadlines.
Positive demeanor and able to work well independently and as part of a team.



Strong sense of professionalism.
Open and willing to accept coaching.

Qualifications

High School graduate or equivalent.
Must possess a valid driver's license.
Previous experience in construction or general labour would be considered at asset.
Job related certifications are an asset, including Occupational First Aid, WHIMS, Fall Protection
Defined, Rescue Training and TDG.

Working Conditions

Physically demanding position that requires the ability to lift, carry, grip and handle
unpredictable loads.
Carry out tasks in confined spaces, at heights and under diverse weather conditions including
heavy rain and/or snowfall.
Must be willing to travel to various locations, work weekends and overtime as needed.

We offer great compensation and benefits packages and a supportive team environment.
Further to this, we build on our employees’ strengths to help them be successful in their roles.
If interested in this opportunity please submit your cover letter and resume to
jobs@verteccommunications.com

title: newTelecommunications Tower Rigger/General Labourer
description:
Growing tower company in the Edmonton area requires labourers who will aspire to become riggers, lead hand riggers and eventually foremen. Rigging experience is not necessary; however common sense and a desire to learn is. A healthy respect for heights is a requirement. In addition, candidates must be able to speak and understand English for safety reasons. At this time our company is unable to facilitate or sponsor immigration into Canada.

Successful candidates must be willing to relocate to the Edmonton area. The company does not pay for relocation. Successful candidate must be able to pass scheduled testing. The successful candidate must sign an employee contract, as well.

Successful candidates MUST:

-be comfortable working at heights, upwards of 350 feet

-have reliable transportation to travel to Nisku, as well as a valid Class 5 driver’s license
-have the ability to travel for work within Alberta and out of province for extended periods
-be willing to work in all types of weather, including cold, wind, rain and heat
-be physically fit, able to lift heavy objects
-ability to work with power hand tools
-work in a safe manner and never jeopardize the safety of their fellow crew members

Pay is based upon certifications. Our company will provide paid training if necessary, including (but not limited to): CSTS-2020, WHMIS 2015, First Aid & Level C CPR, and Fall Protection.

After 3 months, successful candidates will be signed on to the health plan which the company pays for, as well as provided with a clothing allowance. Additional benefits include paid accommodations while working out of town, daily per diems for out of town work, and overtime on travel time.

New employees are required to have arc rated, CSA rated composite or steel toe work boots (must be above 6”), gloves made of natural fibres, and side impact hard hat. We will provide all other fall protection safety gear.

Please note: This IS NOT an apprenticeship position .

Applicants should forward their resume via reply to this ad or fax. Please DO NOT call our office. Due to the influx of applicants we will be only contacting successful candidates for an interview.

Fax: 780-955-2177
Please visit our website: www.jwpm.ca

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From $20.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance

Schedule:

  • Day shift

COVID-19 considerations:
J.W. Project Management takes the health and safety of our employees and customers seriously. We have up to date written policies in place in line with current provincial and federal guidelines.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Nisku, AB T9E 8B6: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • tower climbing: 1 year (preferred)

Language:

  • English (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Class 5 Licence (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 75% (required)

title: Driver Rigger
description:
Overview:
Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.

When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger – a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each other’s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.

Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provide you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
Job Requirements:
Has responsibility for operating equipment and/or machinery. Duties may involve some technical elements but primarily focused on running equipment/machinery /systems. Role is hands-on and directly manipulates the equipment, machinery or system; requiring precise instrumentation/operation. Acts at field operations as an effective member of a field crew, supporting the delivery under supervision of a Field Engineer or Field Specialist.

Responsibilities and duties:
  • Prepare accurate tickets, job reports, time sheets, and other administrative forms as required.
  • Assist in job safety analysis, job coordination and job installation with WFT supervisor and customer on location.
  • Verify all necessary equipment and supplies are on location and in proper working condition.
  • Perform all duties of a SES Service Technician II.
  • Learn the operation and routine maintenance requirements of all solid expandable services equipment.
  • Learn the maintenance procedures as they relate to solid expandable service equipment.
  • Independently operate and perform basic troubleshooting and minor repair of solid expandable service equipment.
  • Assist in pre-job safety meeting.
  • Available on a 24 hour basis to respond to customer needs.
  • Know and understand Weatherford Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions.
  • Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford.
  • Work assignments carried out to the highest quality level.
  • Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job.
Experience:
REQUIRED
  • Experience in OIL/GAS/WIRELINE
  • High School diploma, skilled labour certificate or equivalent
  • Valid Driver License
  • Strong operational and maintenance knowledge of equipment
  • Must have a telephone and the ability to be on 24 hour call
PREFERRED
  • Valid Commercial Driver's License or the ability to obtain one
  • Valid Hazardous Materials endorsement or the ability to obtain one
  • 4-5+ years expereince in Wireline operations
  • Comply with region specific driving regulations and Health Requirements. Work flexible schedule, including long and/or irregular hours

title: Journalier
description:
Vous recherchez de nouveaux défis? Vous êtes quelqu'un de débrouillard, manuel et vous aimez le travail bien fait?

Nous avons le poste qu'il vous faut!

Spécialisé en construction et réparations navales depuis 2001, Navamar, est actuellement le seul chantier naval sur l’île de Montréal et recherche d'un journalier pour rejoindre son équipe toujours grandissante.

Sous la supervision du contremaitre, l'employé devra effectuer différentes tâches dans l'usine ou sur chantier. Il devra aussi apporter son aide et supporter les équipes de travail en soudure et mécanique sur des navires et en usine.

Nous offrons pour le poste de Journalier :

  • Poste syndiqué permanent ;
  • Salaire compétitif
  • Temps plein avec possibilité d'effectuer du temps supplémentaire en temps double.
  • Assurances collectives a la fin de la probation
  • Milieu de travail stimulant, des tâches peu répétitive et possibilité de progression
  • Primes d'éloignement et pension lors de travaux en chantier

Compétences recherchées

  • Capable de sandblaster
  • Capable de peinturer
  • Capable de tester des hoses avec la machine à pression
  • Capable de monter des échaffauds
  • Capable de monter un set-up sur un navire
  • Capable de monter et démonter des intérieurs de bateau sans être un expert
  • Capable de monter et démonter un assemblage mécanique simple. Exemple tuyau,
  • Capable de rigger les appareils de levage (crane, boom truck) et connaitre la signalisation
  • Capable de conduire un chariot élévateur
  • Capable d'utiliser les ponts roulant sécuritairement
  • Capable d'assister un mécano ou un soudeur.
  • Capable de faire le watch men
  • Avoir un DEP en menuiserie ou peinture (un atout)
  • Avoir son permis de conduire classe 5 (classe 1 ou 3 un atout)

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, Permanent

Salaire : 19,05$ à 28,05$ par heure

Avantages :

  • Assurance Dentaire
  • Assurance Invalidité
  • Assurance Maladie Complémentaire
  • Assurance Vie
  • Assurance Vision
  • Congés de Vacances et Compensatoires
  • Stationnement sur place

Horaire :

  • 10 heures
  • 8 Heures
  • Heures supplémentaires

Rémunération supplémentaire :

  • Heures supplémentaires majorées
  • Primes

title: newSwamper/Rigger
description:
CAPSTAN Hauling, a diversified, trucking company (acquired by LAPRAIRIE Group of Companies) is recruiting a full-time Swamper/Rigger to join its growing, logistics team in Grande Prairie, Alberta.


LAPRAIRIE Group of Companies, established in 1982 as a one-crane, two-man operation in Tumbler Ridge, BC, has grown into a successful, group of companies employing over 600 local employees and offering full turnkey services within the mobile crane and rigging, heavy hauling, highway and bridge maintenance, frac sand mining, processing and distribution service sectors. This 100% Canadian, and family-owned group of companies services the Canadian and North Eastern USA markets through its various subsidiaries: LAPRAIRIE Crane, LAPRAIRIE Haul, LAPRAIRIE Works, LAPRAIRIE Oilfield, CAPSTAN Hauling, ENTREC, LAPRAIRIE Rock, and Canadian Silica Industries.


As a Swamper/Rigger you are required to set up machinery and secure it in place, or reeves’ rope through a pulley or a block and tackle. Splice either fiber rope or wire rope, set up hoist, attach to the end of a crane’s hoist to cargo awaiting movement and guide the cargo through narrow spaces or into storage. Take down the block, line or hoist and stow it for later use.


Responsibilities:

  • Signal or verbally direct workers engaged in hoisting and moving loads, in order to ensure safety of workers and materials
  • Test rigging to ensure safety and reliability
  • Attach loads to rigging to provide support or prepare them for moving, using hand and power tools
  • Select gear such as cables, pulleys, and winches, according to load weights and sizes, facilities, and work schedules
  • Control movement of heavy equipment through narrow openings or confined spaces, using chain falls, gin poles, gallows frames, and other equipment
  • Tilt, dip, and turn suspended loads to maneuver over, under, and/or around obstacles, using multi-point suspension techniques
  • Install ground rigging for yarding lines, attaching chokers to logs and then to the lines
  • Align, level, and anchor machinery
  • Fabricate, set up, and repair rigging, supporting structures, hoists, and pulling gear, using hand and power tools
  • Manipulate rigging lines, hoists, and pulling gear to move or support materials such as heavy equipment, ships, or theatrical sets
  • Clean and dress machine surfaces and component parts
  • Attach pulleys and blocks to fixed overhead structures such as beams, ceilings, and gin pole booms, using bolts and clamps
  • Dismantle and store rigging equipment after use

Desired skills and Experience:

  • Availability to work rotational shifts, including days and nights
  • Previous Jack and Slide experience is considered an asset
  • Previous Picker and Bed Truck experience is considered an asset
  • Ability to pass pre-employment drug and alcohol clearance
  • Solid communication skills
  • Ability to navigate work sites, and adapt to daily changes in scopes of work
  • Acceptable drivers abstract

We encourage all who are qualified and interested to apply in confidence, however, only those in consideration will be contacted.

title: newRigger/Swamper
description:
HIRING LEAD/DIRECT REPORT* |* John Baird / Gerrit Sterk
JOB TYPE* |* Permanent, Full-Time
LOCATION* |* Blackfalds, Alberta
DEPARTMENT* |* Yard/Shipping
DIVISION* |* Shop
CLOSING DATE* | Monday, May 9, 2022*
START DATE* | *As soon as possible

Position Summary

Are you looking to start a rewarding career with a construction company that can offer growth, stability, and consistency? In 2021, Eagle Builders has grown by over 150 full-time employees, and we are ramping up logistics for another busy year. We are hiring energetic individuals who want to contribute their skills and become a vital team member on our yard crew. If you are eager, hardworking, and seeking a long-term commitment, we want to hear from you!

The Rigger/Swamper position will require a high degree of organizational skills to ensure materials are loaded and ready to be transported to jobsites at a faster than average pace while ensuring quality is never compromised. The work requires coordination with crane operators and other team members to load and move our product throughout our Yard and to the jobsite in a safe and effective manner.

The ideal candidate is physically fit, has previous rigging/swamping experience, is familiar with overhead and gantry cranes, and has knowledge of proper crane safety and hand signals. This position is local to Blackfalds, will require you to work outside in all weather conditions and involves physical work as you will be expected to assist and instruct the crane operators and riggers. Must be comfortable climbing ladders, working at heights, willing to work a day or evening shifts, punctual and demonstrate a positive go-getter attitude.

Job Descriptions

  • Assist with the rigging and signals of cranes
  • Climb to heights and conduct work with proper safety restraints
  • Responsible for general yard and loading bay laboring duties
  • Work effectively within a crew of 3-5 team members in the yard
  • Physical activity including bending and lifting up to 50lbs
  • Work in a fast-paced environment with the ability to adhere to all company safety policies and procedures
  • Ensure the yard and shipping area is kept organized and clean
  • Working outdoors in all weather conditions

Assets

  • Previous construction and equipment operating experience
  • Overhead Crane experience and knowledge with rigging

Requirements

  • Available to work a minimum of 40 hours per week, must be flexible and willing to work overtime
  • Available to work; day shift (4:30am start time) or night shift (4pm or 6pm start time)
  • Occasional Saturday shift required
  • Must be physically fit to perform demanding work for extended periods of time
  • The ability to work under minimal supervision
  • Must be punctual and reliable
  • Valid class 5 license and reliable transportation to drive to the yard/shop every day
  • Local to central Alberta or willing to relocate to central Alberta
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada. Currently, we are unable to sponsor international candidates

What Eagle Builders Offers

  • A welcoming, supportive, and dedicated work environment that is proud of its diversity, equity, and inclusion of its employees
  • Personality and behaviour assessments to maximize individual and team effectiveness, productivity, and job satisfaction
  • Progressive performance management for the success of its employees
  • An employee reward and recognition program
  • Employee appreciation meals and company events
  • Competitive benefits after 3 months of employment
  • Honest hourly pay based on experience and skillset
  • Overtime pay after 8 hours day/44 hours a week
  • 3 weeks’ vacation to start/6% vacation pay
  • Guaranteed every Statutory Holiday and Sunday off
  • Full-time year-round work
  • Unlimited growth and opportunity for advancement within the company

We are a growing company with many opportunities which means your resume is distributed to multiple departments for review. We thank all applicants for their interest in Eagle Builders, however only short-listed candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Tower Rigger
description:
*** $1000 Hiring Incentive after 6 months for Tower Riggers with Wireless Telecom experience ***

The Tower Rigger is responsible for building and maintaining communication towers, the safe installation of steel structures and wireless communication components, performing general ground procedures associated with installation, working with various antenna and transmission lines, identifying and selecting appropriate equipment for specific installations, and climbing and working on poles, towers, and ladders or other support structures up to 500 feet.

Must be willing to travel.

Responsibilities:

  • Building and maintaining communication towers
  • Safe installation of steel structures and wireless communication components
  • Performing general procedures associated with installation
  • Working with various antenna and transmission lines
  • Climbing and working on poles, towers, and ladders or other support structures up to 500 feet

Requirements:

  • Experience working on communication towers
  • Experience in Telecommunications industry
  • Familiarity and experience with tower erection
  • Construction or rigging experience
  • Able and willing to work out of town
  • Able and willing to work at heights
  • Valid Driver’s License with a clean Driver’s Abstract
  • Clean Criminal Background
  • The ability to pass a Drug and Alcohol Test

Physical Demands:

  • Able to lift and carry up to 100lbs without assistance through a work shift
  • Able to safely push or pull up to 150lbs without assistance using proper equipment
  • Ability to safely climb to heights up to 500 feet
  • Ability to work at heights for extended periods of time in all types of weather
  • Ability to safely and properly operate motor vehicles up to ¾ ton pickup
  • Able to work regular shifts of up to 12 hours (or more in special circumstances)
  • Due to the safety and the nature of the responsibilities included in this position, strong English communication skills are required
  • Comtech (Communication Technologies) Ltd. is unable to facilitate or sponsor immigration in to Canada at this time.

Work Remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: Up to $38.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • Communications Tower: 2 years (required)
  • Communications Industry: 2 years (required)

title: newProduction Scheduler and Administrative Assistant
description:
Legend Boats is looking for a hard-working, individual with strong computers skill and experience in administrative/scheduling work to perform the shop production scheduling in the Wholesale role. The Production Scheduler/Administrative Assistant schedules the production shop efficiently in conjunction with the Production Manager. Their responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Coordinating and monitoring the workflow into the shop
  • Update and input Dealer Rigs, Standard Rigs, and Warranty Repairs in the Rigger Schedule based on upcoming truck loads
  • Schedule boat rigging using the FIFO report
  • Systematically verify that all parts are in stock prior to scheduling to reduce inefficiencies
  • Maintain the best efficiency times in the shop by maintaining an accurate rigging schedule.
  • Update partner boat sales and pre-rig ERPs. Ensure all parts/products used are correctly removed from the correct inventory warehouse. Monitor and track inventory, labour and internal discrepancies on work orders.
  • Create inter-company billings to the correct accounts, process internal warranty claims to vendors for work performed at time of pre rig, update work orders with technician's notes, and notify the Dealer Care team when the work order is completed.
  • Handle any additional administrative asks assigned by the Production Manger.

We understand not everyone will have experience with these tasks before coming to work here and that’s ok. We will train you!
We are looking for people who are the right fit with our culture and who are willing to help out in any way they can.

*
Why you’ll love working at Legend Boats?*

  • Great people! Legend Boats is a family-run business and we treat it that way. There may be a lot of us, but we’re family and you would be welcome into it with open arms.
  • Great Benefits! After 6 months of employment, you will be eligible for our Benefits Program. This covers all the standards: medical, dental, vision and prescriptions
  • Great Pension! After 1 year of employment, you will be eligible for our Pension Plan. Legend Boats will even match your contribution up to 3%!
  • Great potential! Legend Boats is committed to the development and potential of all employees. There are many training programs, conferences, seminars, meetings and tours that you will be invited to. All to further your skills, attitude and knowledge and ensure that you and the company are always working well together
  • Live a Legend Program: You’ll have the opportunity to use a Legend boat package during the boating season, whether it be for a day, a weekend or a week’s vacation.

So if you have an affinity for keeping things scheduled, are accustomed to fast-paced work, are a team player and you’ve got a good sense of humour, you very well may be perfect for us and we may be perfect for you

Wage: $19-$20 per hour based on qualifications

Work Schedule: 7:00 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday. Saturdays may also be scheduled. Hours may change with the seasonality of the business.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $19.00-$20.00 per hour

title: General Labour & Riggers for Telecom Tower and Rooftops
description:
General Labourers & Riggers for Telecom Towers and Rooftops

About COMsolve Inc.

There is great opportunity for growth at COMsolve - Our customers are among the largest, most innovative communications companies in Canada. As a market leader COMsolve provide deployment and professional services to carriers, data centers, service providers, municipalities and enterprises. We specialize in turnkey infrastructure deployment solutions such as macro site, small cell, in-building and structured cabling services. Our wealth of experience in regulatory affairs, design, installation, testing and maintaining infrastructure, enables our team to ensure the success of our customers’ business implementation.

The Position

COMsolve is looking for keen, punctual general labourers and riggers, eager to learn and advance their careers. COMsolve’s industry leading training course will provide all the knowledge and tools needed to work on a crew installing and maintaining wireless cellular networks:

· Paid training course

· Paid fall arrest course

· Paid rigging course

· Paid rope rescue course

· Paid cable testing course

· Paid fiber and data cable testing certification

Job Description:

  • Tower climbing and rope access
  • Installing and testing telecom equipment (antennas, microwave, lines, connectors RRU’s, etc.)
  • Grounding communication equipment
  • Working on communications sites on rooftops, self-support towers and monopoles
  • Installing pinwheels, structural steel, cable tray, conduits, antenna mounts, antennas and transmission lines
  • PIM testing, line sweeps and ODU testing highly preferable.
  • Proper inspection and use of personal safety equipment
  • Work safely on towers incorporating 100% tie-off fall protection practices
  • Ensure that all company equipment is well maintained and in safe operating condition

Qualifications:

  • Looking for tower and rooftop riggers, carpenters, electricians, plumbers, construction labours with experience
  • Must be physically fit and able to lift up to 50lbs unaided
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada
  • A driver license with clean record

Full Time Job

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: newTechnical Gameplay Animator
description:
Company Description


Created in 2008, DONTNOD is an independent French studio which creates and develop AA games in various genres : adventure (Life is Strange, Tell Me Why, Twin Mirror), action (Remember Me) and RPG (Vampyr). Each new game is an original creation with unique narrative gameplay experience and game mechanics.

In 2020, DONTNOD expanded internationally by creating its first branch in Montreal.


Job Description


Why join us?

  • You want to be part of the new DONTNOD Montreal narrative game, led by key members of the team behind Life is Strange, and bring your talent to the project;
  • You want to join a diverse and committed team, both in its culture and in the content of the games it creates;
  • You're looking for an environment where you'll be able to interact with all the teams;
  • You'd like to put your animation talents at the service of an original and sensitive experience based on its characters.

What you'll be doing

Reporting to the Montreal studio’s Lead animator, your role will be to support the production and implementation of our keyframed and mocap animation assets and systems for our next narrative project.

Your mission will be to :

  • Collaborate with your teammates across disciplines to deliver engaging narrative sequences (animators, designers, programmers, camera artists and riggers);
  • Work with your teammates to create, develop, test and maintain navigation, storytelling and gameplay animation systems of varying complexity (designers, animators and programmers);
  • Contribute to the design, integration and validation of the animation elements to be implemented, as well as to modify and maintain the nav/gameplay systems in Unreal;
  • Support the lead animator in any specific task.

Qualifications


The must-have skills we're looking for

  • At least 5 years of relevant experience;
  • Knowledge of Maya and Unreal;
  • Strong and practical understanding of animation logic: node graphs, animation trees and similar engine editors, blueprint and technologies;
  • Strong character animation skills and understanding of animation principles;
  • Enthusiastic, methodical and organised approach to work with high quality standards;
  • Sense of initiative, originality and resourcefulness in problem solving.

What would set you apart?

  • An interest in narrative games and their ability to convey emotions through their characters;
  • Previous experience with writing tool scripts in Python/Mel, etc.;
  • Familiarity with procedural animation systems.

Additional Information


At DONTNOD, we celebrate diversity and inclusivity within our games as well as our teams. We commit to equal opportunities and non-discrimination in our hiring process. We are respectful of the principles of equal employment opportunities, and that is why we encourage women, people of all sexual orientations and gender identities, First Nations people, people living with a disability, visible minorities, as well as any other person who can contribute to the diversity of our studio to apply for our positions.

We build close-knit teams to encourage a fulfilling work environment for all our employees.

Here is a small overview of what we offer to our employees :

  • The possibility of working anywhere in Quebec;
  • Flexible schedules;
  • Free access to a brand new gym and group classes and to a multi-sports field in summer which becomes an ice rink in winter;
  • Partial refund of the STM/RTM card;
  • A complete group insurance plan and an integrated health platform.

Sky-Tech Construction Ltd. is currently seeeking a Tower Rigger to add to our growing team.

title: Rigger (Contracteur indépendant)
description:
Nous sommes à la recherche d'un contracteur indépendant pour rig des personnages. Le travail consiste à rigger et bind des personnages. Ceux-ci incluent au moins un quadrupède, un bipède et un oiseau. Étant donné que les personnages sont fait un à un, le travail serait divisé en petits contrats séparés dans le temps, un par personnage. On aimerais travailler avec la même personne pour chacun de ces rigs. On estime un total d'autour de 10 personnages qui auront besoin d'un rig.

Voici plus de détails :


  • Le logiciel utilisé est Maya LT.
  • Les personnages ont besoin d'être rig autant en FK que IK, et avoir une switch FK/IK. The characters need to be rigged both in FK and IK, and have an FK/IK switch.
  • Nous avons besoin d'options pour étirer certaines parties du rig (Juste étirer, pas de squash et stretch où ça devient plus mince/gros).
  • Nous avons besoin d'une option pour grossir ou rapetisser le personnage.
  • Le binding devrait être très simple, étant donné que les personnages ont des membres séparés (Pensez à Rayman par exemple).
  • Pour information, notre style d'animation est semi-réaliste (pas cartoon ni réaliste, c'est du sci-fi avec des pièces qui flottent et s'assemblent)
  • Pour information, notre engin de jeu utilisé est Unreal Engine 4, mais nous nous occupons de l'intégration.


Intéressé(e)? Simplement nous contacter à contact@boldspiritgamestudio.com

title: Rigger
description:
Field Aerial Technician – Rigger
Location: Langley, BC
Do you love outdoor activities like rock climbing, backpacking, or snowboarding? Do you love to travel the country, and want to keep the frequent flyer miles you earn doing so? Are you looking for a career that lets you grow your skills while getting paid? If you answered “yes” to these questions, then Tower Engineering Canada, ULC. is the place for you!

Come take your career to new heights!
TEP Canada is seeking a full-time employee for one (1) Field Aerial Technician – Rigger, in our Langley, BC location. TEP Canada offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical and dental insurance, paid vacation, and RSP matching that will truly assist you in planning for the future. TEP Canada believes in rewarding its employees' hard work and providing a rich learning environment.
Responsibilities:
  • Must have a labor intensive attitude and be capable of climbing towers, water tanks or rooftops.
  • Work in a team of 2-4 people
  • Install antennas, lines, RRUs, mounts, pinwheels, towers, monopoles, tripoles and tower reinforcing
  • Perform inspections, tower mappings and post construction inspections on telecommunications towers.
  • Adhere to all company and industry standard/regulations
  • Willing to work overtime and travel
Qualifications:
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills; self-starter, team player, and results oriented.
  • Have a valid driver’s license, and a clean driving record to operate a company vehicle.
TEP Canada is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and value diversity and inclusion. Should you require accommodation for your application, please send an email with your request to the careers team.

description:
• Must be able to climb towers,

  • reliable, punctual and accountable at work

title: newVR Animator / Rigger (Contractor)
description:
Duration: Contract, ongoing

Location: Work from home (remote). Preference given to those living in Canada or Vancouver

Salary: $20~$35 per hour

—

Hello! Metanaut is a small award-winning team of virtual reality enthusiasts who are passionate about building a better future. We’ve been creating VR apps & games for over 5 years now! Our focus is to develop VR experiences that spark a sense of wonder and make a positive impact on the world.

We’re expanding the size of our team to work on a brand new VR experience that will knock your socks off. We’re in the early phases of the project right now so we can’t disclose much but what we can say is: This is the job for you if you want to work on exciting, bleeding edge entertainment that pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in VR. This is a project that can only exist in VR and has never been attempted before, and we’re looking for candidates who have the chops to explore this unknown territory with us!

You’ll be rigging and animating a wide variety of realistically proportioned low poly environments, props, and characters. Successful candidates can replicate realistic and out-of-this-world movements in a Unity-based VR experience.

—

Responsibilities:

  • Implement animation control rigging systems for complex characters and environment props using your software of choice
  • Work with the production team to create the desired animation controls and qualities for objects and characters
  • Troubleshoot animation controls, rigging issues, and make adjustments as necessary throughout the production cycle as they arise
  • Set up rigs for low poly, realistically proportioned 3D models
  • Design, create, and maintain animation rigs for characters and props that are clean, efficient, and animation friendly
  • Proactively give feedback and suggestions to improve the current animation pipeline
  • Maintain a consistent level of productivity while meeting deadlines and producing high quality work
  • Adhere to file management protocols
  • Manage assigned tasks on Trello
  • Participate in 1-on-1 check-in meetings every week
  • Respond to Slack messages within 24 hours
  • Track tasks using Toggl

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of professional experience in animating & rigging 3D models for use in Unity games
  • 1+ years of experience as a freelancer / contractor
  • Excellent understanding of physical motion, weight, balance, form, human & animal anatomy
  • Excellent knowledge in Maya, Blender, or equivalent
  • Bachelor’s degree in Fine Arts, Computer Animation, or other relevant area of study
  • Good knowledge of the game production process and pipeline
  • Disciplined without needing constant supervision in a home environment
  • Ability to multitask, prioritize and manage time efficiently

Nice to haves:

  • Proficiency in drawing and sketching
  • Experience working on a VR game or Unity-based mobile game
  • Experience animating cameras, and a good eye for cinematics
  • Experience with Blender, Python, Mel, C++, and 3dsMax

About Metanaut:

Metanaut is one of the first VR studios in Canada, and has won some of the world’s largest VR grants & competitions. Our team has backgrounds in industrial design, engineering, interactive arts, and computer science—which helps us apply proven real-world design principles to unfamiliar virtual worlds.

Our studio is entirely independent and Canadian owned and will forever stay that way. We understand the importance of not sacrificing integrity and ideas for sake of profit.

We split our time between the metaverse and Vancouver, and we want you to join us in the journey!

Benefits:

  • Steady, ongoing work on a multi-year project
  • Possibility of joining our team as a permanent, full-time artist with the following staff benefits:
  • Be part of a close-knit and friendly team!
  • Wear different hats and never be bored of your work
  • Make important decisions that affect the company and our projects
  • 100% coverage of any health-related spending within an allowance that renews every year
  • Work from home
  • 3 weeks of vacation
  • All computer and VR hardware is provided for you
  • Diverse and inclusive team members who care about making the world a better place

To Apply:

Apply with the following:

  • Cover Letter
  • Resume
  • A link to your portfolio
  • Your hourly rate
  • Tell us where you found the job posting
  • Tell us one interesting fact about yourself!

IMPORTANT: We are a Unity-based studio. Candidates who apply but do not have Unity experience will be automatically rejected.

Work Remotely

  • Yes

Job Type: Freelance

Salary: $20.00-$35.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • Work from home

Experience:

  • professional animation & rigging: 3 years (required)
  • freelancer / contractor: 1 year (required)

title: Senior Rigger
description:
Soho VFX is currently seeking talented and experienced Senior Riggers to join our ranks.

Job Description:

A Senior Rigger’s primary responsibility is to create highly versatile character rigging systems and animation interfaces. The rigs will be used for feature film in the animation of 3D characters and props.

- implement animation control rigging systems for complex characters and props using Maya.

- set up rigs for low and high-res characters.

- set up and rig character models.

- work with animators to design, create, and maintain animation rigs for characters that are clean, efficient, and animation friendly.

- design user interfaces and controls for characters and facial animation systems (bone and blend shape driven).

- maintain and improve current animation pipeline.

- knowledge of animation sharing, and motion capture transfer between character rigs.

- maintain a consistent level of productivity while meeting deadlines and producing high quality work.

- troubleshoot and wrangle character-rigging issues for artists.

Requirements:

- minimum 3 years industry experience in 3D CG for digital animation or visual effects.

- excellent communication skills a must.

- experience in setting up cloth simulation rigs highly desirable.

- experience with Maya and/or other high-end animation software required.

- experience with mel, csh, python, TCL, perl or other scripting languages a must.

- skilled knowledge of anatomy for animal/quadraped and human/biped.

- ability to work well under pressure.

- must be an Ontario resident.

To Apply:

Email with attachments of your cover letter, resume (in PDF format) & links to your online demo reel. Please include a full detailed breakdown of each shot on your reel.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $45,000.00-$109,620.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Do you currently reside in Ontario, Canada ?
  • Please include a link to your Demo Reel.

Work remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

title: Heavy Machine Operator
description:
The Loader Operator in Nisku, Alberta is responsible for using the loaders/forklifts and other equipment provided to load, offload, move and store customer inventory.

Job Summary:

The Loader Operator in Nisku, Alberta is responsible for using the loaders/forklifts and other equipment provided to load, offload, move and store customer inventory.

Essential Job Responsibilities:

  • Operating industrial equipment such as forklifts, winches and other devices to load and unload Sucker Rods onto and off of trucks, railway cars and storage areas
  • Operating industrial equipment to transport materials to and from transportation vehicles and loading docks to store and retrieve materials from yard storage
  • Under the direction and supervision of the District Manager, will maintain storage racks and storage areas
  • Moving rods throughout the inspection and rod guide processes, assist in the maintenance of the yard, and assist in the construction of storage racks
  • Assist in inventory functions as required, include but not limited to cycle counts and product verification
  • Responsible for monitoring equipment, performing regular equipment checks and notifying District Manager when equipment is due for scheduled maintenance or requires repairs.
  • Responsible to follow all applicable company and corporate policies, guiding principles, procedures and programs; including but not limited to the process map, support processes, health, safety and environmental requirements
  • Participate in training programs as required by the company
  • All other duties as assigned

Qualification Requirements:

  • Partial high school education with the ability to read, write and speak a minimum amount of English to perform job duties
  • Candidates possessing a valid Wheeled Loader ticket is an asset
  • Prior experience handling pipe or sucker rods is beneficial in this role
  • Prior experience operating heavy equipment and/or machinery is an asset
  • Preference will be given to candidates who have knowledge of Sucker Rods, tubing, casing, and drill pipe

HSE Requirements:

  • Yard environment and working outdoors. Possibility to be exposed to dust, fumes, or gases and changes of temperature/humidity
  • Physical requirements: squatting, lifting above 23 kilograms, reaching, twisting, ladder work, climbing, walking on rough ground, and working near moving equipment
  • Required to at all times wear proper protective clothing and equipment and perform duties in a safe manner

Preferred method of application and to view all opportunities visit:

https://www.nov.com/Careers

NOV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination or Harassment of Any Kind: NOV is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunities for everyone and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. NOV values inclusion and diversity; we encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

With over 40 different locations in Canada, and 30, 000 people worldwide, NOV is proud to offer their employees competitive pay and excellent benefits, including a Health Spending account, employer paid premiums, and employer contributions to our employee’s RRSP. We are also proud to provide on the job training, with potential for advancement within our organization and an Educational Assistance Program.

NOV thanks all interested applicants, however only those selected for interview will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • Salary expectations?
  • Preferred contact?

Education:

  • Secondary School (required)

Experience:

  • Machine Operator: 1 year (preferred)
  • Manufacturing: 2 years (preferred)
  • Blueprint reading: 1 year (preferred)
  • Crane Operators & Riggers: 1 year (preferred)
  • forklift: 1 year (preferred)
