title: Character Rigger
description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar is looking for an experienced and passionate Character Rigger to join the team to help develop and support our titles.

This role will also involve the research and development of new technology for future titles as well as improving existing technology and tools.

This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar's unique game development studio in Oakville.

WHAT WE DO

  • We design, create, and maintain highly complex deformation systems for characters, animals and vehicles that bring our 3D assets to life.
  • We support rigging pipelines, including investigations for improvement of facial rig and animation solving solutions.
  • We work with Technical Artists to maintain and improve our proprietary animation tools.
  • We bring innovation to dynamic art pipelines through rigs, secondary motion setups, and evolving our tools and workflows – from asset creation to its visualization in the engine.
  • We collaborate and communicate with other departments such as Tools and Code (engine) teams to improve our authoring workflows and animation/graphics systems in runtime.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Build, test, and maintain body and face rigs, skinning, and secondary motion setups for a variety of 3D assets.
  • Use proprietary system to create and export constraints, custom deformers, and secondary motion to the game engine.
  • Work closely with animators, automation, and other TAs to create tools and improve pipelines that ensure the best results from our production workflows and processes.
  • Support facial pipeline and be heavily involved in face assets from motion capture.
  • Work with the team organizing, documenting, and maintaining libraries of rig modules that can be shared by a large team of riggers through multiple projects.
  • Support and help create production tools to support new pipelines and future tech.
  • Staying current with latest technologies/research ongoing in the field to help keep our dynamic art visuals at the cutting-edge regarding motion and deformation.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Relevant experience in the game industry as a Character Rigger, Technical Animator, or similar/related position.
  • A demo reel and online portfolio that demonstrates exceptional skills creating motion controls for animation, complex deformation and skinning of body and face of characters and creatures.

SKILLS

  • Strong Python programming skills, and a 3D math background.
  • Experience creating tools for Rigging and Animation.
  • Experience using source control software (i.e. Perforce, Git).
  • Strong communication, self-management, and organizational skills.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.

  • Professional experience developing pipelines and creating tools is highly advantageous.
  • Experience programming C++ plugins for Motionbuilder, Maya, 3DS Max, or similar DCCs.
  • Experience using other game engines (e.g. Unreal/Unity or proprietary tech).
  • Knowledge of current facial capture approaches, FACS poses, facial blend shape rigs, feature detection, etc.
  • Experience using a solver based face animation package (Dynamixyz or Faceware).
  • Professional experience as an Artist or Animator in games.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a resume and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race.

title: Parts Sales
company: Bass Pro Shops - Niagara on the Lake
description:
Position summary:

Maintain and control boat, motor, trailer, and ATV parts inventory and assist external and internal customers with purchases of or questions regarding parts.

Position responsibilities:

1. Support a strong commitment to world class customer service and ensure a

pleasant and productive shopping experience for all customers.

2. Receive inquiries from customers requesting retail parts, price quotes or general information either by phone or at the parts counter.

3. Research customer inquiries using Internet sites, manufacturer contact or on-site reference materials.

4. Perform part sales transactions either on the phone or at the parts counter.

5. Safeguard funds received and perform till reconciliation procedures on a daily basis.

6. Create purchase orders to buy parts needed for stock, customer or work order requirements and forward order to appropriate vendor.

7. Receive parts ordered and check shipping documents vs. merchandise/quantities received for accuracy.

8. Perform data entry of parts received into the inventory tracking system.

9. Place merchandise received in designated location for easy retrieval.

10. Verify and validate receipt of payment in full before special order parts are shipped.

11. Issue parts to technicians and riggers as per work order requirements then

subsequently enter those parts issued on work order in IDS to track parts inventory.

12. Verify and complete refund transactions on returned parts or cancellations.

13. Ensure returned and warranty parts are sent back to the appropriate vendor and credit is received.

14. Prepare for and conduct required parts inventories as per established schedules.

15. Report and reconcile any inventory shortages or parts variances resulting from physical inventory.

16. Maintain a clean and professional work area.

17. Perform other duties, assignments and responsibilities as needed.

Education and/or Experience

High School education or equivalent experience

Mathematical Skills / Reasoning Ability

Ability to calculate figures such as discounts or percentages and make change to customers

Communication Skills

Ability to communicate in a friendly and professional manner to our customers and other associates. Good phone etiquette

Physical requirements

Able to lift up to 50 pounds

Able to stand for extended periods

Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with Management, coworkers, and customers

Ability to operate computer and perform data entry functions

Marine knowledge helpful

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent

Salary: From $15.25 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: Event Rigger- Toronto
description:
Position Overview

Responsible for performing rigging activities in a Hotel Venue or Convention Center environment while upholding safety and quality standards per all trade, Encore/property guidelines and SOP’s. Reports to Lead Rigger or Rigging Coordinator.


Key Job Responsibilities

Rigging

  • Gather and organize all rigging tools and equipment per event needs.
  • Confirm carpet protected as required by local conditions.
  • Provide ground rigging support to teams building points from lifts by staging motors and equipment under rig points, handing up motor chain, tools and equipment and spotting lift movements.
  • Establish hang-point, connect hoist and attachments to permanent rigging points, connect GAC Flex spanset attachments to truss, connect/run and dress motor cables, run cable picks, ensure safety of scenic elements to hang-points and proper use of all truss protection equipment, inspect all cabling tie-offs.
  • Check that all truss bolts are tight and pieces of flown equipment are safe tied to truss.
  • Support other trades needing help raising gear through use of motor or lift, and check work for safety.
  • Remain on site until all motors have been raised to trim.


Safety

  • Responsible for observing and maintaining all safety concerns during an event, including escalation of any observations of personnel who are acting in an unsafe manner.
  • Ensure the power phasing of motor controller is appropriate to prevent limit switches from being defeated.
  • Verify all elements are securely fastened and checked for safety.
  • Must secure and maintain proper lift and/or Working At Height certifications as necessary.
  • Follow all manufactures recommendations and local conditions when using personnel lifts.
  • Riggers must be qualified prior to making any temporary rigging points or any points outside of a protected lift of any kind.


Project Management

  • Secure and review advanced rigging plan and execute through Rigging Coordinator/Lead Rigger or other leadership supervision.
  • Identify possible rigging obstacles and recommend solutions to resolve issues.
  • Assist other technical trades with coordination efforts to execute show plot in harmony with all floor activity.


Maintenance

  • Provide ongoing visual inspection of all hardware in use including truss, motors, lighting, sound, projection, and personnel lifts.
  • Escalate any problems with hardware and recommend solutions to resolve issues to supervisor.


Job Qualifications

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • 500+ hours of onsite rigging experience
  • Qualified-Basic Rigging certification
  • Lift Certification
  • Lift operation experience
  • Ground Rigging experience
  • High rigging without harness experience
  • Previous experience supervising a rigging team preferred


Work Environment

Work is performed in a hotel/convention center environment with moderate exposure to outdoor temperatures and to dirt, sand and/or dust. The working conditions will vary between moderately quiet to noisy volumes. Team members will use high-end equipment and electrical components, and will be exposed to heights via lifts and ladders for long periods of time. Team members may be asked to work in multiple hotel locations. Working times will include irregular hours and on-call status including days, evenings, weekends and holidays. Team members must adhere to appearance guidelines as defined by Encore based on an individual hotel or a representation of hotels in that city or area.


Following Health Canada's guidance and other applicable provincial public health guidance, to prevent the infection and spread of COVID-19 in the workplace, and as an integral part of its public health and safety measures, Encore is requiring that all employment candidates who attend at its Canadian offices be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless they are exempt from vaccination for a legally-protected reason and show proof of said exemption.

title: Maintenance Technician - Industrial Electrician
description:
Description

Industrial Electrician - $42.00/hr Regular Rate with potential to earn $47.00/hr

Flexible Benefits Package and Competitive Pension Plan

''Innovation is facilitated by having the right people in the right roles with the right skills and values.''
  • Charles Koch, Koch Industries Chairman and CEO

Our INVISTA Kingston, ON facility is seeking entrepreneurial, innovative leaders to join the team as an Industrial Electrician (Maintenance Technician). We are looking for individuals interested in leading transformation and strengthening our competitive advantage in the growing nylon intermediates market. This role will have responsibilities to first and foremost protect the health and safety of our workforce, the community, and the environment. You will deliver effective and efficient production and maintenance to the facility to ensure continuous operation. You will have the opportunity to assist in advancing our Shift-runs-the-Shift ownership culture to create superior value for our customers.

What You Will Do In Your Role

  • Industrial electricians are primarily responsible for electrical preventive maintenance and repair work in accordance with our Environmental, Health, and Safety practices as part of the operating shift team. You will:
  • Review the weekly work schedule and coordinate with the operating shift team to align on priorities to successfully execute critical work to maintain equipment availability and PM compliance
  • Execute preventative maintenance and condition monitoring
  • Maintain accurate maintenance logs including labor hours and critical preventive maintenance findings, and analysis and suggestions on frequency
  • Assist in the development and implementation of reliability centered maintenance strategies
  • Provide training for operating shift team members to build capability within the team
  • Expand your capabilities within the operations teams as needed to create superior value on shift
  • Challenge yourself to understand the value of your work and market competitiveness
  • Electrician will be responsible for Installation, performing routine, preventative maintenance, troubleshooting and repair of industrial electrical and instrumentation equipment
  • Reading/interpreting technical work orders, blueprints, technical manuals, single line electrical drawings, electrical code specifications, schematics, P&IDs and instrument loop drawings

The Experience You Will Bring

Requirements:

  • Licensed as an Industrial Electrician/Construction & Maintenance Electrician Minimum of 2 years recent working experience as an Electrician
  • At least one year of experience troubleshooting Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) and Variable Frequency Drives (VFD)
  • Experience working with and understand electrical, hydraulic, and pneumatic schematics and P&IDs
  • Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot, locate, identify, and diagnose malfunctions
  • Strong ability to work under minimal supervision
  • Good interpersonal skills, communication skills and the ability to collaborate well with peers, engineering, and management
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and interest in continuous learning and improvement.
  • Availability and willingness to work shift, on-call, holidays, weekends, and overtime as needed
  • Must place a high value on safety and have past work experience demonstrating same
  • Able to work in a tobacco free environment

Physical Requirements:

  • Ability to work a rotating 12-hour shift. Work schedule is subject to change with notification, depending upon business needs. Additionally, must be available to work scheduled (Planned) or unscheduled (unplanned/short-notice hours on nights and/or weekends, holidays as needed), to meet business needs.
  • Required to wear any or all the following PPE: safety glasses, hearing protection, goggles, hard hats, FRC, acid suits, breathing air, gloves, safety boots, respirators, and encapsulated suits. PPE use is in accordance with the Job Safety Analysis (JSA) for a given task.
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50lbs.
  • Ability to work in hot, cold, and inclement climate conditions.
  • Must be able to work in confined spaces with supplied breathing air and congested areas.
  • Elevated work - must be able to climb stairs, ladders, ladders on vessels and columns, ladders associated with scaffolds.

What Will Put You Ahead

  • Work experience as an Industrial Electrician in an industrial, manufacturing, refining and or chemical facility
  • Multi-craft certifications
  • SAP Experience
  • At least 1 year Operations experience in an industrial, manufacturing, refining and or chemical facility
  • At least 1 Year of experience as a Soft Craftsman (Scaffolding/Rigger/Painter/Sandblaster/Operator) in an industrial.
  • Planning experience in an industrial or refining or petrochemical facility
  • Experience troubleshooting equipment issues and facilitating RCA, Cause Mapping, and Failure Mode Cause Analysis.
  • Served as a member of the emergency response team
  • Experience utilizing a variety of technology
  • Computer skills including Microsoft Office programs, use of mobile technologies (tablets, phones, etc), use of apps, wi-fi connected technology.

We Provide:

  • $42.00 per hour plus shift premium
  • Value Creation Incentive, our VCI is based on individual employee performance, it’s value is the equivalent of an additional 2-12% of classification base rate, applied to every hour worked
  • Flexible benefits package
  • Competitive Pension plan
  • Performance Bonus Program
  • Vacation Purchase Program
  • Additional Floating Holidays
  • Education Assistance Program for Job Related Training
  • Advancement Opportunities
  • 6-month probationary period

About INVISTA

From the fibers in your carpet to the plastic in your automobiles, INVISTA’s commitment to continuous improvement has led its employees to develop some of the most durable, versatile polymers and fibers in the world.

INVISTA also offers specialty chemical intermediates and process technologies. See the bigger picture atINVISTA.com

Want to learn more about the INVISTA experience? Watch this!

To find out more about working at INVISTA’s Kingston Site: Watch this!

How to apply?

If you have the above qualifications, we would like to hear from you. We thank all applicants, in advance, and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


Successful candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check.

We are an equal opportunity employer. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located at the bottom of kochcareers.com webpage.

title: newBoom Truck Operator
description:
Position Summary

The Boom truck / Principal Heavy Equipment Operator position is the highest level in its class. The principal operator is responsible for operating heavy equipment in a safe and effective manner used to support the construction and maintenance operations of Vault Pipelines equipment in Northern Ontario. The heavy equipment operator handles complex work activities using heavy equipment which include, Picker Truck (T/A) with Positive Air Shutdown, Allison Automatic Transmission. Including a 23.5 Ton Hydraulic Stiff Boom Crane with 92’ Full Power Boom. Camp Accommodations will be provided, the shift consists of a 14 and 14 schedule.

Responsibilities

  • Refuse and report unsafe work
  • Ensure all work processes and procedures are followed properly
  • Participate and contribute in the Company’s Health, Safety & Environment Programs and Processes
  • Ensure all safety equipment and personal protective equipment is inspected, maintained and worn properly
  • Follow Safe Work Practices and Procedures
  • Operate a variety of mid-size to light construction and/or maintenance equipment, for the installation and maintenance of pipeline systems or supporting tasks in compliance with manufacturer guidelines - includes excavators, loaders, boom truck
  • Observe and inspect the work site and equipment to detect and protect against unsafe or hazardous operating conditions in compliance with manufacturer and OH&S guidelines
  • Perform periodical safety, maintenance or servicing checks to ensure proper functioning of the equipment in compliance with manufacturer guidelines
  • Operate two-way radios and other communication equipment
  • Assist in training apprentice and intermediate operators
  • Perform other related duties as assigned
  • Comply with all regulations and legislative requirements of the Occupational Health and Safety Act for the Province of Alberta and environmental standards

Requirements

  • 5+ years experience working general construction site
  • 5+ years experience operating heavy equipment
  • Possess acute visual perception ability to accurately judge distances
  • Thorough knowledge of equipment operations and construction and maintenance procedures
  • Ability to work independently or as a team member successfully
  • Ability to read and write to record activities and maintain daily logs/records
  • Class 1 or AZ Ontario driver's license for truck and trailer hauling is an asset with a current driver’s abstract
  • Must have valid journeyman boom truck operating license and be able to present this upon hire. Boom truck up to 23.5 ton is being considered for this work
  • Must be able to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Must be able provide a satisfactory Alcohol & Drug test in accordance with the company's Alcohol & Drug Policy. In order to be valid, the test must have been conducted at the direction of Vault Pipelines Ltd.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be an exhausted list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required.

Career Package

Vault Pipelines offers competitive compensation packages and promotes the growth of individuals careers throughout their employment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, therefore all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. We are committed to providing a sound, positive and safe work environment.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $38.00-$45.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift

Experience:

  • Crane Operators & Riggers: 1 year (preferred)
  • crane: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Class 1 or AZ License (preferred)

title: General Labour & Riggers for Telecom Tower and Rooftops
description:
General Labourers & Riggers for Telecom Towers and Rooftops

About COMsolve Inc.

There is great opportunity for growth at COMsolve - Our customers are among the largest, most innovative communications companies in Canada. As a market leader COMsolve provide deployment and professional services to carriers, data centers, service providers, municipalities and enterprises. We specialize in turnkey infrastructure deployment solutions such as macro site, small cell, in-building and structured cabling services. Our wealth of experience in regulatory affairs, design, installation, testing and maintaining infrastructure, enables our team to ensure the success of our customers’ business implementation.

The Position

COMsolve is looking for keen, punctual general labourers and riggers, eager to learn and advance their careers. COMsolve’s industry leading training course will provide all the knowledge and tools needed to work on a crew installing and maintaining wireless cellular networks:

· Paid training course

· Paid fall arrest course

· Paid rigging course

· Paid rope rescue course

· Paid cable testing course

· Paid fiber and data cable testing certification

Job Description:

  • Tower climbing and rope access
  • Installing and testing telecom equipment (antennas, microwave, lines, connectors RRU’s, etc.)
  • Grounding communication equipment
  • Working on communications sites on rooftops, self-support towers and monopoles
  • Installing pinwheels, structural steel, cable tray, conduits, antenna mounts, antennas and transmission lines
  • PIM testing, line sweeps and ODU testing highly preferable.
  • Proper inspection and use of personal safety equipment
  • Work safely on towers incorporating 100% tie-off fall protection practices
  • Ensure that all company equipment is well maintained and in safe operating condition

Qualifications:

  • Looking for tower and rooftop riggers, carpenters, electricians, plumbers, construction labours with experience
  • Must be physically fit and able to lift up to 50lbs unaided
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada
  • A driver license with clean record

Full Time Job

title: Ready to come onboard? Apply to National Defence's Ship's Of...
description:
National Defence - Royal Canadian Navy
Victoria (British Columbia), Vancouver Island - Other locations (British Columbia), Halifax (Nova Scotia)

Closing date: 31 March 2023 - 23:59, Pacific Time

Who can apply: Persons residing in Canada, and Canadian citizens and Permanent residents abroad.

If you have experience in any of the following positions, apply today!

Possible positions could include the following:

SO-FLP-04- Barge Master
SO-MAO-02 Engineer
SO-MAO-03- Class A Vessel Pool Chief Engineer; Relief Engineer; Yardcraft Master; First Officer- Glen Tug
SO-MAO-04- Class A Vessel Pool Master
SO-MAO-05- Chief Engineer- Glen Tugs
SO-MAO-06- Tug Master; Vessel Master
SO-MAO-10- QHM Pilot
SC-DED-05- Maintenance Deckhand, Supervisor
SC-DED-04- Maintenance Deckhand

Apply online

Important messages

We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request specialized accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.

Assessment accommodation

When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.

Applying to this inventory is a way to connect with hiring managers who are looking for qualified Tradespersons. Apply Today!

How does this work?

Step 1: Let us know you’re interested! Click “Apply online”.

Step 2: Tell us about you! Attach your resume and answer the screening questions in the online application.

Step 3: We will carefully review all of your qualifications. If your talent matches one of our immediate or upcoming opportunities we may contact you for further information or assessment.

Creating an environment where diverse perspectives are valued begins with self-declaration. Count yourself in and self-declare by identifying to which employment equity group(s) you belong to. In order to self-declare, please ensure to indicate this by checking off the appropriate box within the online application as part of the Employment Equity section.

Work environment

  • Are you looking for new and exciting opportunities as a Ships’ Officer or Ship’s Crew? Have you just graduated from a marine training college? Are you a serving or retired Canadian Armed Forces member? Then look no further!

  • We are seeking a Ship’s Officer and Ship’s Crew who would enjoy a challenging work experience in a dynamic environment. Embarking on this journey will provide you with a stable career in which your marine expertise is valued while allowing you to maintain work/life balance. You will work as part of a diverse team on a variety of vessels to facilitate collective objectives in support of the National Defence Team.

On top of completing valuable work that directly benefits Canada’s Pacific and Atlantic Naval Fleet, you will also enjoy the many benefits of working for the Department of National Defence (DND):
  • complementary fitness facilities and pools;
  • paid training and reimbursement of tuition for approved training;
  • dirty work pay;
  • allowances for meals;
  • allowance for Nuclear Response Team members;
  • one of the best pension plans in Canada with comprehensive dental/ medical benefits.

  • Applicants who are serving or former military, when you transition into the Federal Public Service, your pensionable time and earned vacation credits will be recognized.

Intent of the process

This inventory may be used by the Department of National Defence to fill immediate short term vacancies (90 calendar days or less than 3 month term) in various locations.

We may also use this inventory to fill future vacancies with various employment tenures (temporary and permanent), security requirements, and conditions of employment.

Positions to be filled: Number to be determined

Information you must provide

Your résumé.

In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)

For all positions:

Depending on the position to be staffed, occupational certifications may be required. These could include:

  • Valid Transport Canada Certificate of Competency as Marine Engineer, Fourth Class Motor or higher; or
  • Valid British Columbia Fourth Class (or higher) Power Engineering Certificate with STCW Basic Safety training or domestic Marine Emergency Duties A1 and B2
_______________________________________________________________________________________
Requirements Specific to Ship’s Officer Positions (SO- Marine Engineer positions only):

Recent* related** marine engineering experience

  • Recent is define as within the last three (3) years.
** Related experience may be obtained through a minimum of one (1) year of sea service working on a vessel or floating industrial barge OR one (1) year service in a shore-based marine operations, maintenance, repair, training or related facility.
_______________________________________________________________________________________

Requirements Specific to Ship’s Crew Positions:

Experience working in the marine industry as a deckhand or oiler, or an equivalent military naval occupation or trade.

If you possess any of the following, your application must also clearly explain how you meet it (other qualifications)

Asset Experience and Certification for Ship’s Officer Positions:

Experience:

  • Watchkeeping or Command experience within the last five (5) years related to the position.
  • Experience in the operation, maintenance and repair of steam and diesel marine machinery;
  • Experience in the repair and maintenance of marine machinery;
  • Experience overseeing vessel refits and machinery overhauls;
  • Experience in supervision;
  • Experience working with government or commercial repair facilities and contractors;
  • Experience working with vessel Planned Maintenance Systems;
  • Experience performing inspections and trials on vessels and marine machinery;
  • Experience working with a budget under the Federal Financial Administration Act;
  • Experience operating harbour tugs;
  • Experience in towing;
  • Experience operating small vessels;
  • Experience with pollution control equipment and/or counter measures.

Certification:

  • MED STCW Advanced Firefighting Course;
  • Transport Canada Small Vessel Operator Proficiency (SVOP);
  • Radio Operator Certificate-Maritime Commercial (ROC-MC);
  • Valid Transport Canada Certificate of Competency Master 500 GT Domestic or higher
  • Standards of Training, Certification and Watchkeeping (STCW) 95 Compliance
  • Bridge Resource Management (BRM) Training Certificate;
  • Electronic Chart Display and Information System (ECDIS) Training Certificate;
  • Current Marine Advanced First Aid Certificate;
  • Valid Transport Canada Certificate of Competency Chief Mate, Near Coastal or higher with (STCW)
_______________________________________________________________________________________
Asset Experience and Certifications for Ship’s Crew Positions:

Experience:

  • Engine room experience as an Oiler or Motorman;
  • Experience working with an environmental response team in the marine environment;
  • Experience as a Rigger;
  • Experience as an oiler or deckhand on tugboat;
  • Experience in the maintenance, repair, and operation of marine machinery or equipment;
  • Experience performing maintenance, repair or fabrication work in a commercial or industrial environment;
  • Experience operating, maintaining, or working aboard small vessels;
  • Experience in supervision.

Certification:

  • Possession of an Able Seaman’s Certificate
  • Possession of a Bridge Watchman’s Certificate
  • Cadet Programs (Deck or Engine)
  • Possession of an Engine Room Assistant’s Certificate
  • Small Vessel Machinery Operator (SVMO)
  • Small Vessel Operator Proficiency (SVOP)
___________________________________________________________________________________
For all positions:

  • Experience working or volunteering in a mixed public service and military environment

The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)

English essential

Information on language requirements

Competencies:

  • Demonstrating integrity and respect.
  • Showing initiative and being action-oriented.
  • Thinking things through.
  • Working effectively with others.

The following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)

Asset Competency:

  • Communication

Selection may be limited to members of the following Employment Equity groups: Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, visible minorities, women

Information on employment equity

The Department of National Defence is committed to providing an environment where justice, fairness and the elimination of barriers helps build a skilled, diverse and representative workforce reflective of Canada. We welcome diversity in all its forms, promote employment equity and encourage you to indicate if you belong to one of the designated groups when you apply. Please note that preference for hiring will first be given to candidates who are members of the above mentioned designated groups.

In support of Strong, Secure, Engaged (SSE) initiative #24, consideration may be given to the spouses or common-law partners of CAF members.

Conditions of employment

Reliability Status security clearance - Various security levels - (we will help you attain this during the hiring process)

All employees of the core public administration are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless accommodated based on a medical contraindication, religion, or another prohibited ground for discrimination as defined under the Canadian Human Rights Act and attest to their vaccination status.

Other conditions of employment may be required for some positions. These conditions will be communicated to the candidates considered for that specific appointment. They may include:

  • Possession of a Transport Canada Marine Medical Certificate.
  • Must meet the medical requirements of Health Canada in accordance with the Treasury Board guidelines.
  • Possession of a valid Provincial driver's license
  • Must be available to work unexpected and scheduled overtime as required
  • Wearing of safety footwear and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is mandatory

Managers may establish conditions of employment specific to the position being staffed. Candidates must meet and maintain the conditions of employment throughout their employment.

Other information

The Public Service of Canada is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that reflects the Canadians we serve. We promote employment equity and encourage you to indicate if you belong to one of the designated groups when you apply.

Information on employment equity

Applications will only remain active in the system for 90 days. The system will send you an application expiry warning 14 days before your application expires. It will be your responsibility to update your application to ensure it remains active and is considered for future assessment.

1. Persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice.

2. All information obtained throughout the selection process, from the time of application to close of process, may be used to evaluate the candidates.

3. A variety of assessment tools may be used. This may include application screening, interviews, role play scenarios, recorded presentation, written assessments, reference checks, board knowledge and interactions with internal staff during the process.

4. A random and/or top down selection of candidates may be used in the determination of those to be given further consideration in the assessment process

5. Additional qualifications, and/or Operational Requirements, may be required for some positions and you may be contacted and asked to submit information or to be further assessed.

6. Asset qualifications can be invoked as essential qualifications as identified by the hiring manager

7. Appointment decisions may be based on one or more of the following criteria:
a. Matching of the individual's experience or qualifications to the strengths and weaknesses of the work team;
b. Matching of the individual's experience or qualifications to the specific duties of the position being staffed;
c. Depth, breadth, type of work-specific experience;
d. Level/degree of one or more competencies/qualifications; and
e. Organizational needs, including Employment Equity

8. Our organization will only accept on-line applications for this opportunity. Please click “Apply online” to submit your application. Should you have a disability or an exceptional circumstance that requires an alternative application method, please contact us for guidance.

On October 6, 2021, the Government of Canada announced details of its plans to require vaccination across the federal public service.



As per the new Policy on COVID-19 Vaccination for the Core Public Administration Including the Royal Canadian Mounted Police federal public servants in the Core Public Administration and members of the RCMP must attest to their vaccination status. The requirement for employees to be fully vaccinated applies whether they are teleworking, working remotely or working on-site. This is a condition of employment and it applies to indeterminate (permanent), determinate (term), casual, and student hiring. Should you reach the point in the selection process where it is necessary to verify terms and conditions of employment then the hiring manager or a human resources representative will contact you in order to complete an attestation.

Preference

Preference will be given to veterans first and then to Canadian citizens and permanent residents, with the exception of a job located in Nunavut, where Nunavut Inuit will be appointed first.

Information on the preference to veterans

We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Rigging & Power Coordinator
description:
Responsible for the management and safe execution of rigging & “wall out” power distritution events within assigned home location/cluster of Encore venues. With Support from Rigging management team; approves all Rigging designs using structural data and weight load limits for both internal and external rigging production needs. Supervise both full-time and part-time Riggers and Power distribution Technicians as required. Schedules labor and supervises team members to ensure they are following the rigging and power distribution standard operating procedures. Ensure all Encore standards and local regulations for Rigging and Power Distribution are adhered to, within assigned location/cluster.

This position requires you collaborate closely with cluster, area and regional Encore sales and operations teams. This position reports to a DET/Cluster DET, Area Director or Regional Ops Leader with dotted line to the Area/Regional Rigging and Power Distribution leaders, based on services provided in the assigned location/cluster. Position will also complete additional duties as required based on needs of home location/cluster.


Key Job Responsibilities


Staff Development

  • Ensure all on-site personnel have received proper training and acquired necessary skills to safely execute rigging and power distribution according to the Encore standards.
  • Supervise full-time and part-time team members on show site.
  • Participate in the hiring, training, development and evaluation of performance of team members.
  • Assist in developing full time technicians(venue/PC) as cross-trained in Rigging and/or Power distribution and developing a pool of part-time Riggers and Power Distributino Technicians.

Equipment/Labor Management

  • Determine, coordinate and schedule in collaboration with cluster/area/region Operations management/MLT all labor and equipment to facilitate the load-in and load-out of all events requiring rigging & power services.
  • Partner with operations team within cluster/area to manage rigging and power inventory and assist with rigging and power sub rental and sub contract labour management and cost reduction.
  • Create and execute rigging and power distribution load-in/load-out plans for in venue events. Complete load-in/load-out of Rigging and Power Distribution equipment/services as needed.


Equipment Compliance

  • Make recommendations and escalate compliance and safety needs to Rigging and Power Distribution leadership.
  • Assist with annual compliance related activities and equipment certification procedures established by Encore Rigging and Power Distribution standards.
  • Assist Rigging and power management team with facility infrastructure evalution (new or existing).
  • Ensure completion of ongoing maintenance schedule and test equipment & cabling, as per Encore standards.


Safety and Compliance

  • Review and ensure compliance on all Provincial Occupational Health & Safety regulations and standards pertaining to fall protection and electrical standards.
  • Assist Rigging and power management team with field assessments regarding safety compliance.
  • Perform load calculations and approve working loads for all events when assigned by Rigging management.
  • Escalate any/all safety concerns, to Rigging and Power distribution leadership

Company Support

  • Assist Sales and operations teams as the technical solutions expert for Rigging and Power Distribution in the assigned location/cluster, escalating within Rigging and Power Distribution team as as needed.
  • Action Rigging advances and Power Distribution requests for assigned location/cluster and/or as assigned.


Job Qualifications

  • High School diploma or equivalent
  • ETCP certification in Rigging and/or Power is preferred.
  • Working knowledge of 110v-220v, single and three phase equipment, electrical connectors, power phases, amperages and voltages.
  • 2-5 years of experience in rigging in either the entertainment, theatrical or production environment, including but not limited to, work as both ground and overhead rigger with Encore Rigging team.
  • Working knowledge of CAD (Auto Sketch, Vector Works, AutoCAD, LD Assistant or other) software.
  • Interact professionally and effectively with a diverse work force, customer base and executive level management
  • Strong working knowledge of general business computer systems and functions
  • Experience with managing teams of 2-10 and able to delegate multiple tasks/initiatives.
  • Strong customer, client and coworker interface experience and abilities


Competencies


  • Decision Making
  • Staff Development
  • Concern for Quality
  • Analytical Thinking
  • Problem Solver
  • Exceeds Customer Expectations


Travel

  • Requires flexibility to travel within region of hire at 50% level as required meeting show support and business needs.

title: new3D Modeling Supervisor - ON
description:
At Mainframe Studios, we’re creators first. We eat creative and technical challenges for breakfast and come back for more. We’ve been doing this for 25+ years, and we’re still going strong. We’re lucky enough to have the best team in the business. From our artists to our technical and production folks, everyone is passionate about collaborating on some kickass projects. We’ve partnered with the biggest names in the business to create a huge library of content. With partners like Mattel, Netflix, DreamWorks, Sony, Silvergate, and Nickelodeon, it's no wonder we’ve established ourselves as a creative force to be reckoned with.
WE WANT YOU (and your mad skills)!
On a CG animated film, the Modeling Supervisor is responsible for guiding the modeling team in conceptualizing and developing all digital assets. Under his/her supervision, all models must meet the project's specifications including performance complexities and aesthetic requirements.
Responsibilities and Duties

  • Under the guidance of the Director and the creative leadership of the Modeling Supervisor, the modeling team translates all 2D designs in to 3 objects.
  • Supervises all modeling efforts as they are conceptualized and completed in alignment with the determined creative style and technical direction of a project.
  • Supervises all digital asset creations in collaboration with the art director, visual effects supervisor, CG supervisor and riggers, surfacing artist and animators in order to facilitate optimal shot production while adhering to the schedule and quota fulfillment.
  • Collaborates with the Rigging Department Supervisor to ensure models are structured in such a way to achieve intended performance requirements.
  • Collaborates with the Surfacing Department Supervisor to ensure that the models match the aesthetic and creative requirements of the project's overall look.
  • Collaborates with Animation Director and Supervisor to ensure models are structured in such a way to achieve intended performance requirements.
  • Collaborates with the Design Supervisor and management team to ensure all necessary designs are created.
  • Guides all efforts to establish the project's standard of modeling and level of complexity for characters, environments and props. Supervises the modeling team to creatively enhance the assets in order to meet the set performance objectives.
  • Motivates, mentors and supports the crew to consistently strive towards excellence within the parameters of the production plan.
  • Evaluates and casts artists to models characters, environments or props based on their strengths and level of expertise.
  • Reviews modeling process with the goal of optimal performance while adhering to the production's budget and timeline.
  • Collaborates with Producer and HR on managing performance. Responsible for completing artists’ performance reviews.
  • Collaborates with the production management team to prioritize work on models pending production schedule. Liaises with Art Direction, Design, Rigging, Surfacing and Animation Departments as needed.
  • Provides vision, feedback, motivation and encouragement to the team.
  • Responsible for managing the workflow within the Modeling Dept. and fulfilling production schedule requirements on a weekly basis.
  • Interprets and implements notes and feedback from the Director and Producer in a timely and qualitatively acceptable way.
  • Adheres to digital file management protocols.
  • Aligns and engages with the values of Mainframe: a culture of community, connectivity, creativity and collaboration.

Qualifications and Skills

  • Degree and/or diploma in fine arts or animation or equivalent experience is required.
  • 6+ years of experience working in a professional environment within their discipline.
  • Lead experience preferred.
  • Outstanding ability to work with polygonal, NURBS and subdivision topologies to create surface models ranging from highly stylized cartoon characters to photorealistic fantasy creatures.
  • Superior knowledge of human and animal anatomy, physical motion, weight, balance and form.
  • Experience in 3D animation and rigging preferred.
  • Superior proficiency in using Photoshop and Maya is required. Experience with XSI, Shave and Fur/Hair tools is considered an asset.
  • Ability to collaborate and facilitate feedback requested by executives and/or clients.
  • Excellent leadership skills, inspiring the team to work as a cohesive unit and excel in modeling skills.
  • Open to and encourages feedback and new initiatives. Shares information and techniques with team members.
  • Ability to liaise with production management to define and articulate production requirements. Ability to predict potential problems and troubleshoot as necessary.
  • Highly motivated, pro-active, solutions-oriented, solid work ethic and positive attitude. Ability to work well under pressure. Consistently strives to expand knowledge base.
  • Superior organizational and time management skills. Ability to multi-task and delegate. Thorough knowledge of the production process and pipeline.
  • Exceptional problem solving skills and ability to work collaboratively. Actively improves skill set. Ability to quickly assimilate new information and adapt as needed.
  • Outstanding ability to communicate ideas clearly and concisely both verbally and visually. Excellent inter-personal skills. Practices attentive and active listening. Shares information, methodologies and ideas with others.
  • Makes decisions in a timely manner. Accepts accountability for own actions. Creatively solves problems, eliminates roadblocks and focuses on issue at hand.
  • Ability to deliver work on time and meet set performance objectives. Responsible for managing the modeling process and the department's workflow and quota expectation per project's requirements.

-
Mainframe Studios is an Equal Opportunity Employer, which means we will not discriminate against any individual based on race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors prohibited by applicable law. This policy applies to every aspect of employment at Mainframe Studios, including recruitment, hiring, training, advancement, and termination. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and partners. Should you require accommodation throughout the recruitment process, please let us know your requirements when contacted.

title: Rigger - Facial Animation
description:
Company Description


With a team of more than 500 creative, passionate and innovative talents, Ubisoft Quebec continues to grow and expand. Founded in 2005, the Quebec City studio has carved out a place for itself among the leaders in the video game industry. Involved in several of Ubisoft's flagship franchises, it has acquired solid expertise, positioning it in the development of major AAA games. Involved in the Assassin's Creed franchise since 2010, the Quebec City team has assumed leadership of Assassin's Creed Odyssey, Immortals Fenyx Rising as well as the new crossover stories of Assassin's Creed Odyssey and Valhalla.


Job Description


As a Rigger at Ubi Québec, you make it possible for characters and objects to come to life and move realistically within our worlds.

From pivoting to bending, squashing and stretching, you define what can be done and how through flexible and intuitive rigs. You take inspiration from the real world when you can – and turn to your imagination when you can’t. With a variety of internal tools at your disposal, you can focus on achieving quality and consistency without having to build everything from the ground up time after time.

What you’ll do

  • Collaborate with the character and animation team to deliver high quality assets for a wide range of art styles
  • Create facial setups that are true and unique to the design and personality of the characters
  • Ensure that characters’ quality objectives are met within the game engine
  • Support the cinematic design team with their narrative and technical needs
  • Validate and edit the result of the analysis of the script & voice recording, collaborating with the audio team in doing so
  • Work with and maintain the existing facial animation system
  • Contribute to the facial research and development efforts
  • Plan and scope deliverables with production teams

Qualifications


What you bring

  • Solid understanding of the principles of animations and the anatomy of facial expression
  • Strong proactivity and troubleshooting skills
  • Strong artistic skills and must be comfortable with the technical aspects of the pipeline
  • Experience in working collaboratively as a team, and able to work with minimum input
  • Good communication skills, willing to give and receive direction well
  • A degree in 3D Animation or equivalent (or related training)
  • Experience in rigging, modelling, or animating (or other related experience)
  • Knowledge of 3D software (3DS Max, Maya, and MotionBuilder)* + familiarity with scripting, an asset but not mandatory.
  • Knowledge of game engines (e.g. Unity or Unreal), a plus

Additional Information


What you send our way

  • Your CV, highlighting your education, experience, and skills
  • A demo reel with a breakdown of your best work – seriously, show us your process! Attach samples or send us a link to your personal website or online portfolio.

Have access to benefits that make a real difference in your day-to-day life :

  • A hybrid and flexible work mode, 6 weeks of vacation in your first year, an enriched parental leave, a Ubi gym directly in our offices, a complete group insurance program, access to complete Dialogue telemedicine services, an RRSP with a contribution from Ubisoft, an advantageous bonus program, concrete measures to ensure the right to disconnect, the option of working part-time and much more. Click here for all the details.
  • Joining a team of 21,000 Ubisoft employees working across more than 40 locations around the world, are boundby a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their dedication and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come;
  • Working for an equal opportunity employer who believes that diversity of backgrounds and perspectives is essential to creating worlds where gamers and their teams can thrive and express themselves. It's about taking on exciting challenges, being at the forefront of cutting-edge technology and being part of the future of entertainment.

title: Foreman - Rigging Crew Chief
description:
Foreman - Rigging Crew Chief



** The candidates wishing to apply must have all legal authorization to work in Canada such as Canadian citizenship, permanent residency, valid work permit, Visa or any other official document.


SUMMARY

The rigging crew foreman, also known as a rigging crew chief, performs a designation that involves providing instructions, advice, and directives to team members. The foreman is held responsible for the work, work at heights and actions of his workers and subcontractors.


TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

You will be responsible for organizing, assigning, supervising and coordinating the work of the team of workers, for the following functions;

  • Construction of towers of type; monopole, self support and guyed;
  • The installation of antennas and equipment / devices, etc.
  • Adjustment, maintenance and repairs as needed;
  • Monitor of the work in progress;
  • Keep the project manager informed of the work in progress;
  • Perform various cross-checks on the work performed by workers;
  • Contribute to the training of employees;
  • Ensure that occupational health and safety regulations are applied and respected by all and that working conditions do not threaten the lives of workers, subcontractors, and others on site at all times
  • Coordinate truck inventory and make purchases as needed;
  • Perform various administrative tasks: employee timesheet, material orders, reports, etc. ;
  • Apply current company policies;
  • Perform any other required task

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Have a rigger school certificate (QC) or equivalent experience in this field;
  • Have a minimum of 8 years experience in the industry. Experience in wireless telecommunications is an asset;
  • Have experience in team management;
  • Be bilingual (English / French) verbal and written;
  • Be available to travel anywhere in Canada;
  • Knowledge of Outlook, Word and Excel software in Office 365 environment.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Have leadership
  • Have a good work organization;
  • Ability to communicate clearly with workers and managers
  • Relational skills and ability to teach and motivate workers
  • Be resistant to stress and be able to work as a team;
  • Respect schedules and deadlines
  • Willingness to work in any type of environment
  • Willingness to perform manual work, and with tools
  • Ability to perform quality controls and meet set standards

title: Rigger TD
description:
Rigging TD at ReDefine are integral to the development of animation rigs for digital doubles, creatures, props and vehicles and the subsequent support that is required. You will find technical and creative solutions to develop high quality rigs according to the needs of the production. This is a team effort so you’ll work closely with our Creature Supervisors and Animation Leads/Supervisors to develop the most suitable rigging solutions according to the needs of the production.

Must have
  • Minimum of 3 years experience on multiple VFX feature films
  • Full working knowledge of Maya
  • Comfortable with the more technical aspects of creature work
  • Programming or scripting skills, preferably in Python
  • Have strong visual and artistic skills
  • Familiarity with pipeline issues and a typical creature heavy post-production environment
Nice to have
  • Strong facial rigging experience
  • Knowledge of areas in CFX including cloth, hair, and muscle/skin
  • A good general TD background
  • Understanding of Linux/Unix based operating systems
About you
  • Organized, pro-active and a self-starter
  • A team player and clear communicator, and a keenness for collaboration
  • Adaptable and with a willingness to learn new skills and techniques - including proprietary software
  • Calm under pressure and committed to meet production deadlines
  • A positive, can-do attitude

title: Character Artist - SENIOR
description:
Company Description


With a team of more than 500 creative, passionate and innovative talents, Ubisoft Quebec continues to grow and expand. Founded in 2005, the Quebec City studio has carved out a place for itself among the leaders in the video game industry. Involved in several of Ubisoft's flagship franchises, it has acquired solid expertise, positioning it in the development of major AAA games. Involved in the Assassin's Creed franchise since 2010, the Quebec City team has assumed leadership of Assassin's Creed Odyssey, Immortals Fenyx Rising as well as the new crossover stories of Assassin's Creed Odyssey and Valhalla.


Job Description


As a Character Artist at Ubi Quebec, you'll create people, creatures, and animals for players to interact and connect with. You’ll combine your artistic and technical talents to form the physical features that define the characters that live within our worlds.

You enjoy the detailed, versatile, far-from-boring character development process. To you, creating new blend shapes, good edge flow, and optimized meshes are opportunities to push your skills. Always eager to improve, you’re constantly on the lookout for feedback to refine your art and build the best foundation for characters to be brought to life.

What you’ll do

  • Collaborate with the art and narrative teams to understand the game’s creative and artistic visions.
  • Study concept art & narrative guidelines and research your own references to prototype character features (face, physique, clothing, etc.).
  • Develop and polish your character art throughout the 3D pipeline (modelling, sculpting, texturing, retopologizing, UV unwrapping, etc.).
  • Find balance between artistic aspects and technical constraints to achieve aesthetic quality and technical functionality.
  • Partner with riggers and animators to make characters move believably.
  • Adapt your work based on feedback from play testers and interdependent teams.

Qualifications


What you bring

  • A college diploma in 3D Modelling, Fine Art, or equivalent (undergraduate degree an asset)
  • At least 5 years of experience in modelling, texturing, or other related experience
  • Knowledge of 2D art tools (e.g. Photoshop) and 3D software (3DS Max, Maya, Substance Painter, Marvelous Designer, and ZBrush) *
  • Solid understanding of topology, materials, textures, proportion, and anatomy + animation and game limitations (poly count, memory, etc.)
  • A highly creative, collaborative, and innovative spirit
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Motivation to reach out for feedback and adapt to it
  • Knowledge of 3D scanning and optimization techniques, a huge plus

Additional Information


What to send our way

Your CV, highlighting your education, experience, and skills

A portfolio of your best 3D work – especially the transition of a 2D design into a 3D character! Attach images or send us a link to your personal website or online portfolio.

Working at Ubisoft means

  • Have access to benefits that make a real difference in your day-to-day life :
  • A hybrid and flexible work mode, 6 weeks of vacation in your first year, an enriched parental leave, a Ubi gym directly in our offices, a complete group insurance program, access to complete Dialogue telemedicine services, an RRSP with a contribution from Ubisoft, an advantageous bonus program, concrete measures to ensure the right to disconnect, the option of working part-time and much more. Click here for all the details.
  • Joining a team of 21,000 Ubisoft employees working across more than 40 locations around the world, are boundby a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their dedication and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come;
  • Working for an equal opportunity employer who believes that diversity of backgrounds and perspectives is essential to creating worlds where gamers and their teams can thrive and express themselves. It's about taking on exciting challenges, being at the forefront of cutting-edge technology and being part of the future of entertainment.

title: Rigging & Power Coordinator
description:
Responsible for the management and safe execution of rigging & “wall out” power distritution events within assigned home location/cluster of Encore venues. With Support from Rigging management team; approves all Rigging designs using structural data and weight load limits for both internal and external rigging production needs. Supervise both full-time and part-time Riggers and Power distribution Technicians as required. Schedules labor and supervises team members to ensure they are following the rigging and power distribution standard operating procedures. Ensure all Encore standards and local regulations for Rigging and Power Distribution are adhered to, within assigned location/cluster.

This position requires you collaborate closely with cluster, area and regional Encore sales and operations teams. This position reports to a DET/Cluster DET, Area Director or Regional Ops Leader with dotted line to the Area/Regional Rigging and Power Distribution leaders, based on services provided in the assigned location/cluster. Position will also complete additional duties as required based on needs of home location/cluster.


Key Job Responsibilities


Staff Development

  • Ensure all on-site personnel have received proper training and acquired necessary skills to safely execute rigging and power distribution according to the Encore standards.
  • Supervise full-time and part-time team members on show site.
  • Participate in the hiring, training, development and evaluation of performance of team members.
  • Assist in developing full time technicians(venue/PC) as cross-trained in Rigging and/or Power distribution and developing a pool of part-time Riggers and Power Distributino Technicians.

Equipment/Labor Management

  • Determine, coordinate and schedule in collaboration with cluster/area/region Operations management/MLT all labor and equipment to facilitate the load-in and load-out of all events requiring rigging & power services.
  • Partner with operations team within cluster/area to manage rigging and power inventory and assist with rigging and power sub rental and sub contract labour management and cost reduction.
  • Create and execute rigging and power distribution load-in/load-out plans for in venue events. Complete load-in/load-out of Rigging and Power Distribution equipment/services as needed.


Equipment Compliance

  • Make recommendations and escalate compliance and safety needs to Rigging and Power Distribution leadership.
  • Assist with annual compliance related activities and equipment certification procedures established by Encore Rigging and Power Distribution standards.
  • Assist Rigging and power management team with facility infrastructure evalution (new or existing).
  • Ensure completion of ongoing maintenance schedule and test equipment & cabling, as per Encore standards.


Safety and Compliance

  • Review and ensure compliance on all Provincial Occupational Health & Safety regulations and standards pertaining to fall protection and electrical standards.
  • Assist Rigging and power management team with field assessments regarding safety compliance.
  • Perform load calculations and approve working loads for all events when assigned by Rigging management.
  • Escalate any/all safety concerns, to Rigging and Power distribution leadership

Company Support

  • Assist Sales and operations teams as the technical solutions expert for Rigging and Power Distribution in the assigned location/cluster, escalating within Rigging and Power Distribution team as as needed.
  • Action Rigging advances and Power Distribution requests for assigned location/cluster and/or as assigned.


Job Qualifications

  • High School diploma or equivalent
  • ETCP certification in Rigging and/or Power is preferred.
  • Working knowledge of 110v-220v, single and three phase equipment, electrical connectors, power phases, amperages and voltages.
  • 2-5 years of experience in rigging in either the entertainment, theatrical or production environment, including but not limited to, work as both ground and overhead rigger with Encore Rigging team.
  • Working knowledge of CAD (Auto Sketch, Vector Works, AutoCAD, LD Assistant or other) software.
  • Interact professionally and effectively with a diverse work force, customer base and executive level management
  • Strong working knowledge of general business computer systems and functions
  • Experience with managing teams of 2-10 and able to delegate multiple tasks/initiatives.
  • Strong customer, client and coworker interface experience and abilities


Competencies


  • Decision Making
  • Staff Development
  • Concern for Quality
  • Analytical Thinking
  • Problem Solver
  • Exceeds Customer Expectations


Travel

  • Requires flexibility to travel within region of hire at 50% level as required meeting show support and business needs.

HighAngle Contracting Inc. is Western Canada's premier wireless communications contractor based in Coquitlam, near Vancouver, British Columbia. Since 2002, HighAngle has built a rock-solid industry reputation based upon the high quality of our installations and our responsive customer service.

Highangle is looking for motivated people to start right away on some high profile, exciting projects.

JOB DUTIES:

  • Part of a team building and installing communication equipment and related infrastructure (including erecting towers and monopoles, installing and aligning antennas, installing transmission lines, building wireless rooftop sites)
  • Tower climbing and rope access (ensuring the proper inspection and use of personal safety equipment for working safely at heights)

CRITERIA / QUALIFICATIONS:

  • General construction experience is an asset
  • Experience in stacking monopoles and erecting towers is an asset
  • Due to safety and the nature of the responsibilities, the ability to speak, read and write English is required
  • HighAngle Contracting offers competitive salary from $20 to $30 per hour depending on experience

title: 3D Rigger
description:
IoM Media Ventures is a 3D animation studio located in Halifax, Nova Scotia. Our studio’s talent-friendly, encouraging atmosphere is where highly-skilled individuals come together to create ground breaking animated content.


Why work at IoM?


At IoM (Island of Misfits) we’re constantly raising the bar for our productions and developing our pipeline and people. If you are a passionate artist looking for an opportunity to grow your skillset in a collaborative environment, we’d like to hear from you!


  • Join the fastest growing CG animation studio in Halifax, Nova Scotia
  • Gain a flexible work environment with options for remote and in-studio positions
  • Collaborate on new properties and well-known brands to create TV series with industry-leading partners
  • Work with a talented group of artists to reach your highest potential
  • Utilize the latest tools, technology and software, with training support provided, when necessary

IoM upholds a premium standard of quality across all of our projects, both large and small.

  • We hire for the long-term and give artists the opportunity to grow and advance within the company.
  • We support PR applications.
  • We offer a generous benefits and RRSP package for all employees.
  • We are committed to increasing the diversity of our team and promoting equity in hiring and career progression. We welcome applications from people of all identities, professional backgrounds, competencies and skill levels.


We’re looking for a Rigger to join our exciting 3D productions!


Responsibilities:

  • Construct and maintain 3D rigs for assigned assets
  • Troubleshoot and fix rigging issues for artists within various disciplines
  • Work collaboratively in a team environment
  • Actively participate in production-related meetings by offering thoughts and ideas
  • Keep current on pipeline techniques and technology
  • Ensure the Build Supervisor’s instructions are carried through
  • Carry out duties in a professional and positive manner
  • Be a positive and creative force on the team
  • Additional responsibilities as required

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience in television or relevant industry experience
  • Proficiency with standard industry software (eg. Maya)
  • Comprehension of core principles relating to rigging such as deformation order and the transformation matrix
  • Thorough understanding of techniques and technologies relating to rigging and animation
  • Advanced knowledge of skeleton setup, skinning, constraints and deformers
  • Basic knowledge of character facial expression setup
  • Understanding of 3D computer graphics theory and practice
  • Understanding of shape, composition, physical motion, weight and balance
  • Ability to take direction, collaborate, and be a team player
  • Communicate creative and technical thoughts and ideas in a professional manner
  • Able to prioritize and manage time efficiently
  • Work independently and collaboratively, often with multiple tasks and under deadline pressure

Thank you for your interest in joining our island.


IoM Media acknowledges that our work is created in Mi’kma’ki, the ancestral and unceded territorial lands of the Mi’kmaq People. We are privileged to be able to create stories for a worldwide audience in a place of great natural beauty and cultural significance, and recognize that acknowledgment is only the first step to advancing truth, reconciliation, and equity.

description:
Trilinks Communications Inc - 20+ Years of experience Building our Nation's Wireless Telecommunications Networks - Safely, Efficiently and on-Time.

We are a privately held, full turnkey Canadian wireless network & infrastructure general contracting and consulting firm with regionalized offices in Ontario, Alberta and British Columbia.

Our skilled teams have worked on communication network projects in all Canadian provinces and territories both in urban and rugged remote settings.

We are looking to fill full time permanent Aerial Technician/Riggers, Foreman, Lead hand and Rigger/General Labourer full-time, permanent positions available. Compensation based on experience.

  • Relevant training, equipment and PPE provided
  • Salary: $18-$40 per hour (based on role and experience)
  • Travel Allowance (including LOA and per diems where applicable)
  • Benefits package and RRSP matching (after 3 months)

Job Description:

Communications Tower and Rooftop Site installations, working at heights of up to 300 feet. Installation of tower accessories and associated auxiliary equipment. Extensive travel to job locations all over Canada. Working outdoors in all conditions; safely and productively in a team environment producing a high quality of work. Use of Winches, Rigging/ Hoisting equipment. Network and Technology Upgrade works, Troubleshooting and maintenance.

Requirements:

· Ability to work at heights (No fear of heights). Fall arrest and fall rescue training provided.

· Travel working outdoors throughout the year, in a team environment.

· Ministry of Labour Working at Heights Training Certification. Preferred

· Hands on Mechanical aptitude, proficient with wrenches and hand tools etc.

· Proficient in the use of modern technology, computers and devices.

· Professional image and good communications skills.

· Dependability, Honesty, Physical Stamina, Mechanical & Technical Aptitude, Team Player.

· Valid Canadian driver’s license is required

· Must be authorized to work in Canada.

· A clean criminal background check.

Compensation & Benefits:

We offer Training, comprehensive safety program, competitive wages, paid travel, living allowance, Employee benefits, and RRSP matching.

We thank all applicants for submitting resumes however only those qualified will be contacted for an interview
