title: newMaintenance - Millwright
description:
Description

Millwright - $42.00/hr Regular Rate with potential to earn $47.00/hr

Flexible Benefits Package and Pension Plan

''Innovation is facilitated by having the right people in the right roles with the right skills and values.''

  • Charles Koch, Koch Industries Chairman and CEO

Our INVISTA Kingston, ON facility is seeking entrepreneurial, innovative leaders to join the team as a Millwright (Maintenance Technician). We are looking for individuals interested in leading transformation and strengthening our competitive advantage in the growing nylon intermediates market. This role will have responsibilities to first and foremost protect the health and safety of our workforce, the community, and the environment. You will deliver effective and efficient production and maintenance to the facility to ensure continuous operation. You will have the opportunity to assist in advancing our Shift-runs-the-Shift ownership culture to create superior value for our customers.

We Provide:

  • $42.00 per hour plus shift premium
  • Value Creation Incentive, our VCI is based on individual employee performance, it’s value is the equivalent of an additional 2-12% of classification base rate, applied to every hour worked
  • Flexible benefits package
  • Competitive Pension plan
  • Performance Bonus Program
  • Vacation Purchase Program
  • Additional Floating Holidays
  • Education Assistance Program for Job Related Training
  • Advancement Opportunities
  • 6-month probationary period

What You Will Do In Your Role

  • Mechanical Technicians are primarily responsible for mechanical preventive maintenance and repair work in accordance with our Environmental, Health, and Safety practices as part of the operating shift team. You will:
  • Review the weekly work schedule and coordinate with the operating shift team to align on priorities to successfully execute critical work to maintain equipment availability and PM compliance
  • Execute preventative maintenance and condition monitoring
  • Maintain accurate maintenance logs including labor hours and critical preventive maintenance findings, and analysis and suggestions on frequency
  • Assist in the development and implementation of reliability centered maintenance strategies
  • Provide mechanical training for operating shift team members to build capability within the team
  • Expand your capabilities within the operations teams as needed to create superior value on shift
  • Challenge yourself to understand the value of your work and market competitiveness
  • Type of work can include but not limited to troubleshooting, installing, aligning, dismantling, repairing, and maintaining industrial machinery, and mechanical equipment that may include motors, bearings, valves, piping, pumps, compressors, gearboxes, hydraulic, and pneumatic components

The Experience You Will Bring

Requirements:

  • A minimum of (2) years of maintenance mechanic experience as an Industrial Mechanical Millwright (Red Seal Certified or equivalent) from an accredited vocational/community college. Working in industrial, manufacturing, refining and or chemical facility.
  • Experience working with and understand mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and pneumatic schematics and P&IDs
  • Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot, locate, identify, and diagnose malfunctions
  • Strong ability to work under minimal supervision
  • Good interpersonal skills, communication skills and the ability to collaborate well with peers, engineering, and management
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and interest in continuous learning and improvement.
  • Availability and willingness to work shift, on-call, holidays, weekends, and overtime as needed
  • Must place a high value on safety and have past work experience demonstrating same
  • Able to work in a tobacco free environment

Physical Requirements:

  • Ability to work a rotating 12-hour shift. Work schedule is subject to change with notification, depending upon business needs. Additionally, must be available to work scheduled (Planned) or unscheduled (unplanned/short-notice hours on nights and/or weekends, holidays as needed), to meet business needs.
  • Required to wear any or all the following PPE: safety glasses, hearing protection, goggles, hard hats, FRC, acid suits, breathing air, gloves, safety boots, respirators, and encapsulated suits. PPE use is in accordance with the Job Safety Analysis (JSA) for a given task.
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50lbs.
  • Ability to work in hot, cold, and inclement climate conditions.
  • Must be able to work in confined spaces with supplied breathing air and congested areas.
  • Elevated work - must be able to climb stairs, ladders, ladders on vessels and columns, ladders associated with scaffolds.

What Will Put You Ahead

  • SAP Experience
  • At least 1 year Operations experience in an industrial, manufacturing, refining and or chemical facility
  • At least 1 Year of experience as a Soft Craftsman (Scaffolding/Rigger/Painter/Sandblaster/Operator) in an industrial.
  • Multi-craft certifications
  • Planning experience in an industrial or refining or petrochemical facility
  • Experience troubleshooting equipment issues and facilitating RCA, Cause Mapping, and Failure Mode Cause Analysis.
  • Served as a member of the emergency response team
  • Experience utilizing a variety of technology
  • Experience/knowledge related to pump overhaul and repair
  • Rotating equipment background including fans, blowers and centrifugal compressors
  • Flanged Joint make up, pipe fitting
  • Familiarity with machinery laser alignment
  • Elevated work (Lifts, hoists, mobile crane)
  • Computer skills including Microsoft Office programs, use of mobile technologies (tablets, phones, etc), use of apps, wi-fi connected technology.

How to apply?


If you have the above qualifications, we would like to hear from you. We thank all applicants, in advance, and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Successful candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check.

We are an equal opportunity employer. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located at the bottom of kochcareers.com webpage.

Prime Movers has a opening available in both our Calgary and leduc branches

Prime Movers Rigging & Industrial Services is a specialty moving company working in a variety of different industries. We are looking for a ticketed millwright to add additional value and complement our growing team of industrial movers, equipment operators and mechanics. title: Industrial Machinery Mover (and Rigger)
description:
What is the opportunity?

As a Redmond & Associates Machinery Mover, you will be in the forefront of our day-to-day operations. You will champion the R&A brand and drive business by interacting positively with our clients, as well as loading machines and equipment onto trailers for transport, often with the use of forklifts or overhead cranes. This position does not require a degree, but Mover/Rigging experience is valued. If you have the self-motivation to deliver exceptional work ethic and thrive in a dynamic, ever-changing environment, you can build a great career with us as you learn and develop new skills.

**For the right candidate, we would consider hiring as a Machinery Mover Trainee. This would be an entry-level position, where someone would be given a path to developing the skills required to be a successful Machinery Mover**

What will you do?

  • Load, unload and move industrial machines (ie. CNC Mills, Lathes, etc.), forklifts and other company equipment onto trailers on location and within our warehouse
  • Assist Drivers to load and unload machines/equipment with the use of high-capacity forklifts and overhead cranes.
  • Proactively take ownership reporting equipment performance and resolving/preventing equipment damage/malfunction when possible
  • Assisting our drivers in tarping and ensuring safety and security of cargo
  • Diligently fill out paperwork & relevant reports relating to the days’ work
  • Proactively engage with clients on-site

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Experience as a Machinery Mover
  • Experience with rigging
  • Speak, read and write English fluently
  • Ability to lift 50lbs
  • Positive attitude, discipline to work hard
  • Punctual & dependable team-player
  • Demonstrated passion for learning and growing, as well as success in hands-on work
  • Drive and self-motivation, as well as excellent communication skills and emotional intelligence
  • Ability to work flexible hours
  • Exhibit professionalism in manner and appearance.
  • Steel-Toed Safety Boots

Nice-to-have

  • Machinery Moving experience
  • Experience operating forklifts and overhead cranes
  • Millwrighting experience
  • Warehousing experience
  • Familiarity with flatbed tie-down (to assist drivers)

What’s in it for you?

  • A comprehensive benefits program including health, medical and dental group benefits
  • Competitive compensation, with progression at certain employment milestones
  • Overtime available
  • Excellent career development and access to a variety of job opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and hard-working team.
  • Paid training & professional development
  • Opportunity for growth and advancement within the company
  • $125 safety boot allowance per calendar year
  • Free parking

About R&A

Redmond & Associates is a business built upon the values of honesty, efficiency, hard work and dedication. The company was founded in Oshawa, Ontario as a family-run business in 1996 by Tony and Jennifer Redmond. At first, they started out small with a 1400 square foot facility, but with the loyalty and perseverance of their employees and founders, their success began to grow, eventually leading them to their current warehouse in Mississauga, Ontario, where they operate out of a 35,000 sq. ft. facility. The growth and success that Redmond & Associates has experienced can be attributed to the hardworking employees, managers and founders who keep their customers satisfied time and time again.

Our goal at Redmond & Associates is to provide excellent service and efficient single-source moving solutions for all of our customers. We take pride in our work and are dedicated to exceeding our customers’ expectations by catering to each customer’s individual needs. We employ millwrights and riggers with many years of experience. In addition to this, we are a part of SC&RA (specialized carriers and rigging association) and OTS (Ontario Trucking Association). With Redmond and Associates, you can always be sure that the job will be done right and on time. Worry-free moving services is what we specialize in. For more information, please visit www.redmondmovers.com

title: 3D Environment Artist / Artiste d’environnement 3D
description:
Art
Montreal
Permanent
Rovio Montreal is looking for an experienced 3D Environment Artist, with a proven track record in working in the mobile video game development field. Creating level art for the project will be your responsibility in collaboration with the Art Director and Lead Environment Artist. You will also be responsible for monitoring and optimizing your levels in Unreal Engine with a focus on delivering a high-quality and optimized in-game experience.

-

Rovio Montréal est à la recherche d'un artiste d'environnement 3D expérimenté, ayant fait ses preuves dans le domaine du développement de jeux vidéo mobiles. La création de level art pour le projet sera votre responsabilité en collaboration avec le directeur artistique et le Lead Environment Artist. Vous serez également responsable du suivi et de l'optimisation de vos levels dans Unreal Engine, avec pour objectif de fournir une expérience de jeu de haute qualité et optimisée.

Responsibilities: What you will do :
You will be creating 3D models and textures within deadlines and Art Direction;
Implementing the lighting and post-processing in your scenes;
Ensuring your work is optimized by following technical guidelines and developing best practices;
Supporting designers in maintaining the layout and improving user experience.

Ce que vous ferez
Livrer des animations finales accrocheuses et de haute qualité dans un court délai;
Rigger et implémenter les personnages dans le moteur;
Optimiser votre travail selon les meilleures pratiques;
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les artistes de personnages 3D.

Who we think will do great in this role has:
Proficiency in Blender
Shipped multiple real-time projects made with Unreal Engine
Experience with cross-platform development (Mobile, PC, Consoles)
In-depth knowledge of Substance Painter and Designer, ZBrush and Photoshop (or equivalents)
An understanding of PBR pipeline
A solid understanding of art pipelines
The ability to create appealing environments for a mainstream audience
Strong art foundations in form, color, texture, and light, as well as in architecture, urban spaces, and landscapes
Strong interpersonal communication skills
A high degree of self-motivation and initiative-taking
A passion for video game development.

Vous aurez besoin de ces compétences
Livré plusieurs projets en temps réel réalisés avec Unreal Engine
Expérience de développement sur plusieurs plateformes (mobile, PC, consoles)
Une connaissance approfondie de Substance Painter et Designer, ZBrush et Photoshop (ou équivalents)
Une compréhension du pipeline PBR
Une bonne compréhension des pipelines artistiques
La capacité de créer des environnements attrayants pour un grand public
De solides bases artistiques en matière de forme, de couleur, de texture et de lumière, ainsi que d'architecture, d'espaces urbains et de paysages
De solides compétences en communication interpersonnelle
Un haut degré d'auto-motivation et de prise d'initiative
Une passion pour le développement de jeux vidéo.

Recruitment process:
First meeting: You will meet the Recruiter of our team. Before diving deeper into your skills, we want to know who you are and what motivates you. This is also an opportunity for you to learn more about Rovio and the specifics of the role.
Second round: You will meet with some members of the development team in Montreal well. Our aim is to get a clear overview of your skills, your ambitions and where we can help you develop.
Final round: You will discuss with our HR team as a final step, to talk about Rovio’s culture, values and how we can help you grow in our team.

Processus de recrutement

Première rencontre: Vous rencontrerez la personne en charge du recrutement de notre équipe. Avant d'approfondir vos compétences, nous voulons savoir qui vous êtes et ce qui vous motive. C'est aussi l'occasion pour vous d'en savoir plus sur Rovio et les spécificités du poste.
Deuxième rencontre: Vous rencontrerez certains membres de l'équipe de développement à Montréal. Notre objectif est d'avoir un aperçu clair de vos compétences, de vos ambitions et des domaines dans lesquels nous pouvons vous aider à vous développer.
Rencontre finale: Vous discuterez avec notre équipe RH, pour parler de la culture, des valeurs de Rovio et de la façon dont nous pouvons vous aider à grandir dans notre équipe.

-
We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name.

What to expect when you join us
Meet the Rovians
About Rovio

title: Machinery Mover Trainee
description:
What is the opportunity?

**This is an entry-level position, where someone would be given a path to developing the skills required to be a successful Industrial Machinery Mover/Rigger.**

As a Redmond & Associates Machinery Mover Trainee, you will be in the forefront of our day-to-day operations. You will champion the R&A brand and drive business by interacting positively with our clients, as well as loading machines and equipment onto trailers for transport, often with the use of forklifts or overhead cranes. This position does not require a degree, but Forklift or Rigging experience is valued. If you enjoy physical, hands-on work and doing something new each day, you can build a great career with us as you learn and develop a wide range of practical new skills.

What will you do?

  • Load, unload and move industrial machines (ie. CNC Mills, Lathes, etc.), forklifts and other company equipment onto trailers on location and within our warehouse
  • Assist Drivers to load and unload machines/equipment with the use of high-capacity forklifts and overhead cranes.
  • Proactively take ownership reporting equipment performance and resolving/preventing equipment damage/malfunction when possible
  • Assisting our drivers in tarping and ensuring safety and security of cargo
  • Diligently fill out paperwork & relevant reports relating to the days’ work
  • Proactively engage with clients on-site

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Experience with counterbalance forklift
  • Speak, read and write English fluently
  • Ability to lift 50lbs
  • Consistent, positive attitude & discipline to work hard
  • Punctual & dependable team-player
  • Demonstrated passion for learning and growing, as well as success in hands-on work
  • Drive and self-motivation, as well as excellent communication skills and emotional intelligence
  • Ability to work flexible hours
  • Exhibit professionalism in manner and appearance.
  • Steel-Toed Safety Boots

Nice-to-have

  • Machinery Moving experience
  • Experience operating forklifts and overhead cranes
  • Rigging Experience
  • Millwrighting experience (or other mechanical aptitudes)
  • Warehousing experience
  • Familiarity with flatbed tie-down (to assist drivers)

What’s in it for you?

  • A comprehensive benefits program including health, medical and dental group benefits
  • Competitive compensation, with progression at certain employment milestones
  • Overtime available
  • Excellent career development and access to a variety of job opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and hard-working team.
  • Paid training & professional development
  • Opportunity for growth and advancement within the company
  • $125 safety boot allowance per calendar year
  • Free parking

About R&A

Redmond & Associates is a business built upon the values of honesty, efficiency, hard work and dedication. The company was founded in Oshawa, Ontario as a family-run business in 1996 by Tony and Jennifer Redmond. At first, they started out small with a 1400 square foot facility, but with the loyalty and perseverance of their employees and founders, their success began to grow, eventually leading them to their current warehouse in Mississauga, Ontario, where they operate out of a 35,000 sq. ft. facility. The growth and success that Redmond & Associates has experienced can be attributed to the hardworking employees, managers and founders who keep their customers satisfied time and time again.

Our goal at Redmond & Associates is to provide excellent service and efficient single-source moving solutions for all of our customers. We take pride in our work and are dedicated to exceeding our customers’ expectations by catering to each customer’s individual needs. We employ millwrights and riggers with many years of experience. In addition to this, we are a part of SC&RA (specialized carriers and rigging association) and OTS (Ontario Trucking Association). With Redmond and Associates, you can always be sure that the job will be done right and on time. Worry-free moving services is what we specialize in. For more information, please visit www.redmondmovers.com

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00-$23.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime

Application question(s):

  • Do you live within (or near) the GTA?
  • What would you rate your own forklift operation competency, out of 10?

title: INDUSTRIAL EQUIPMENT/MACHINERY INSTALLER (U.S. BASED)
description:
INDUSTRIAL EQUIPMENT MACHINERY INSTALLER – U.S. BASED

Summary

Due to continued growth and expanding business in the US market, Kernic Systems is looking for experienced and qualified individuals to join our installation team.

Responsibilities in this role will include working as part of an installation team to install custom-engineered systems and equipment at our customer’s facilities.

This includes the installation of air conveying systems, dust collection systems and recycling equipment (balers, shredders etc.)

Core Competencies

  • Safe and Efficient Approach
  • Time Management
  • Creative and Innovative Thinking
  • Development and Continual Learning
  • Problem Solving
  • Accountability and Dependability
  • Operating Equipment
  • Ethics and Integrity
  • Planning and Organizing
  • Communication
  • Team Work

Job Duties

  • Assist in developing installation plan, working with the project team
  • Take job site measurements
  • Cut and drill work-pieces using drills, saws and other similar hand or power tools
  • Rigging and hoisting of large equipment for installation
  • Prepare sketches and diagrams; estimates material requirements for specific jobs
  • Keep minor records and performs simple administrative tasks
  • Meet all internal & customer quality requirements
  • Work safely & efficiently
  • Maintain a clean work area, & alert management of any safety concerns
  • Perform related duties as required

Requirements

  • High School Diploma, GED or equivalent
  • Ability to work safety at heights
  • Ability to work with a minimal amount of supervision
  • Experience with industrial machinery rigging and installation will be an asset
  • Experience in sheet metal work will be an asset
  • Ability to assess the occupational hazards and safety precautions that exist.
  • Ability to maintain simple records
  • Skill in the use and care of a variety of basic hand and power tools and equipment
  • Forklift, Aerial Platform, Working at Heights certifications will be an asset.
  • Clean drivers abstract and no restrictions on travelling and working within the United States
  • US Citizenship or Permanent Resident Status

Work Conditions

  • Frequent travel to customer site locations through the USA
  • Extended travel for out of town installations (1-4 weeks)
  • Physical ability for lifting and supporting heavy loads
  • Use of safety equipment will be required, e.g. steel-toed safety boots, safety glasses/goggles, etc.
  • Overtime and weekend work as required
  • Hazards associated with the trade
  • Work both indoors and outdoors

Compensation

Kernic Systems Inc. offers competitive wage packages and benefits, a positive work environment, and career advancement opportunities.

About Kernic Systems

Kernic Systems has been a leading North American provider of recycling equipment solutions since 1978. Today we serve our customers with an expanded offering of standard product and custom-engineered solutions through our three primary business divisions: Recycling Solutions, Dust Collection and Air Pollution Control, and Material Handling.

Related Job Titles

Sheet Metal Installer, Rigger, Equipment Mover, Installation Technician, Dust Collector Installer, Air Handing Installer, HVAC Installer

Job Type: Full-time

Join the Kernic Team

Kernic Systems is open to receiving resumes from qualified candidates. Please email resumes to administration@kernicsystems.com

SALES

sales@kernicsystems.com

OFFICE

Canada: (905) 632-0562
USA: (440) 250-8560

SERVICE

service@kernicsystems.com

SALES

sales@kernicsystems.com

OFFICE

Canada: (905) 632-0562
USA: (440) 250-8560

SERVICE

service@kernicsystems.com

ABOUT US

Kernic Systems is Global Designer, Integrator and Installer of complete systems including, Air Conveying & Dust Collection Systems, Baling and Shredding Systems, Recycling Equipment and Industrial Vacuums. Our goal is to provide you with economical and quality solutions to your needs in any of the areas that we serve. We have a skilled staff, some of whom have worked with us for over 20 years.

Parts & Service

Our factory-trained technicians specialize in servicing balers, shredders, fans, separators, ducting, dust collectors, and their components.

Parts & Service

Complete System Sales

System options include both above-roof and below-roof systems that can include: balers, shredders, air conveying systems, dust collectors, and more!

Our Scrap Recovery Systems deliver long life, provide superior reliability, meet current safety levels and generate the lowest total cost of ownership (TCO).

Complete Systems

Custom Integrations

Kernic Systems’ OneSource™ for Simplicity suite of professional services leverages our expertise in Design, Integration, Project Management and Support.
Professional Services

title: Rigger - Intermediate/Senior
description:
POSITION PURPOSE


The Rigger is responsible for delivering high quality assets in a quick and efficient manner. They will act as an example to and mentor junior artists and will deliver all tasks within the required timeframe. They will have practical experience in all areas of rigging. Riggers will be able to apply briefing notes with minimal direction from Team Leads or Supervisors. They will quality check all of their work and occasionally assist the Leads to quality check the work of junior artists should the workload require it. Riggers will complete all aspects of their work on assets across multiple shows, and create high quality assets at varying levels of difficulty.


In addition, Riggers will assist the Leads and Asset Supervisor to flag issues. They will potentially assist in the Lead role on a short term basis in the event of an absence or should production needs require it.


DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Create final rigged assets with minimal supervision and within the studio pipeline
  • Apply client notes to all assets with minimal guidance
  • Identify solutions and approaches to solve difficult assets
  • Build and maintain animation rigs of varying complexity (creature rigs, props, hero and background assets, motion capture rigs, face rigs etc) with minimal supervision and within the studio pipeline
  • Responsible for the integration of rigs into the show pipeline
  • Process requests from other departments
  • Use time management skills to meet weekly targets
  • Write utility scripts to help other riggers, animators and pipeline developers when necessary
  • Provide daily, reviews and team meetings as required
  • May need to participate in bidding new projects
  • Work within the defined pipeline
  • Promote interdepartmental collaboration
  • Ensure all email correspondence and scheduling is up to date
  • Respond to emails in a timely manner
  • Work within a team of artists in a hands-on capacity to ensure technically and artistically proper implementation or rigged assets

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE


  • 3+ (Intermediate) 5+ (Senior) years’ experience creating high quality rigs for visual effects for film
  • Proficiency in creating photo-realistic hard surface assets
  • Thorough understanding of traditional art skills (Form, architecture, topology, color theory, and UV mapping)
  • Strong understanding of human anatomy
  • Strong understanding of some animal anatomies (dogs, birds, etc) and a desire to learn more depending on the requirements of the project

SKILLS AND ABILITIES


Technical skills

  • Experience in MEL / Python / C++/PERL scripting (python preferred)
  • Understanding of the Maya rigging tool sets
  • Experience with Houdini is also appreciated
  • Experience with LINUX/UNIX
  • Ability to come up with creative and efficient rendering solutions

Core skills

  • Ability to provide Leads with estimate of time of task completion to support Supervisor in the bidding process
  • Ability to troubleshoot and deal with competing priorities
  • Ability to take direction positively, work well within a diverse group, and thrive under the pressure of tight production deadlines
  • Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and applications
  • Ability to complete quality control on individual work
  • Excellent time management and communication skills
  • A strong understanding of Animator requirements
  • Eye for detail

title: Associate Technical Artist
description:
Technical Artist – Rigging

EA Create is a collective of content production teams partnering with EA Studios game teams to bring outstanding visuals, audio and technology to life. Our teams comprise of artists, engineers, technicians, designers and development directors. Worldwide, we combine our teams to form a global group of extraordinary individuals fueled by imagination and a unified passion for creating amazing visuals, sound and experiences. We are a diverse team, unified through collaboration, culture and craft.

The Rigging team creates systems to support character and vehicle animation by developing body and facial rigging systems, animation interfaces and by supporting animators with technical setup and production.

Responsibilities:

  • Reporting to the Rigging Project lead, you will create outstanding rigging projects and assets for AAA game titles.
  • You and your team will design global rigging workflows and systems with the goal of convergence and efficiency, and creating and supervising the development of varying levels of complexity skeletons, control rigs, secondary animation, and skin deformations
  • Develop and maintain animation tools, workflows, and pipelines to improve production efficiency.
  • Implement techniques and process to solve character, animation and deformations challenges as identified by department lead
  • You will help build problem identification processes and develop solutions.
  • Establish and estimate tasks.
  • You and your team will work with game partners, both up and downstream while concurrently aiding in the growth of junior Riggers.
  • Assist production in the maintenance of scheduling software and ensuring milestones are maintained and accomplished.

Qualifications:

  • 2-5 years of technical art/rigging/animation experience with multiple shipped game titles or VFX/feature animation.
  • Expert Knowledge of Python, C#, C++ and familiarity with Maya API
  • Background in rigging and skinning complex assets with expert knowledge of animation principles and human anatomy.
  • Experience in standard industry tools including Maya, Houdini, and MotionBuilder.
  • Identify issues and implement solutions.
  • Degree in visual effects or technical subject area.

Electronic Arts is an innovative tech company that creates incredible experiences for millions of players around the world. But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need innovative, collaborative, diverse and adaptable people to keep making Electronic Arts better.

title: BC, Rigging Artist
description:
Rigging Artist

This position is based in Vancouver. All applicants must reside in the United States or British Columbia/Ontario if applying within Canada.

Zoic Studios is an Award winning VFX company made up of accomplished artists and producers who understand story, process and relationships. Partnership, integrity and enthusiasm are our key founding principles. We have three locations, Los Angeles, New York City and Vancouver, Canada. Some of our recent credits include, Stargirl, Legends of Tomorrow, Space Force and Haunting of Bly Manor.
"Visual Evolution" is our mission; we invest in constantly improving our technological and studio processes so that our artists can focus on being creative even in the lightning fast paced world of visual effects. We apply these principles to our work on some of the most VFX intensive film and television projects out there. We like a challenge. Do you?
We are seeking an Rigging Artist for our Vancouver studio. This position will work on a variety of projects and assets within the Rigging Department. The Rigging Artist reports to the Rigging Supervisor.
The ideal candidate will get the opportunity to design and maintain smooth and efficient rigs for CG assets beyond the standard bipedal rigs. They will have an opportunity to work on a variety of rigs from facial, to creature and mechanical to quadrupeds as well as interact with build, animation and production teams. The ideal candidate will have strong MAYA skills, extensive experience in scripting, and the ability to manage multiple tasks in any given day. The Rigging Artist will be a part of the Rigging & Animation team and in regular contact with other department leads. Good communication and problem solving skills are mandatory.
Responsibilities

  • Create new rigs and rig components.
  • Create of realistic FK/IK rigs for a variety of humanoids, creature, and mechanical models.
  • Work with modeling and animation departments to ensure rigs meet requirements.
  • Perform rig fixes and troubleshooting during production as requested by Rigging, CG or VFX Supervisors.
  • Modify and extend existing Python based studio rigging toolset.
  • Develop python based scripts for asset specific rigging needs when necessary.

Qualifications:

  • Min 3 yrs experience as a Rigger within live action VFX or animation studio in TV and/or film.
  • Experience with weighting and skinning must be demonstrated.
  • Ability to rig a variety of characters / objects in a realistic (non-cartoon manner).
  • Solid understanding of Character set-up and rigging tools in Maya.
  • Facial rigging for humans and creatures
  • Production experience with Deformers, Constraints, Hierarchies, Utility Nodes, Expressions, Hair & Cloth, Maya python commands.
  • Core knowledge of anatomy and kinematics to create rigs that match the objectives of the final product.
  • Experience in Python in Maya.
  • Must have some experience with scripting (Python, Mel).
  • Knowledge of Api, PyQt, GitHub, Pyside, Shotgun a plus.
  • Must be organized with a strong attention to detail and ability to work independently.
  • Excellent communication skills in English; both written and verbal.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with a variety teams.
  • Positive attitude and ability to easily adapt to changes in production needs.
  • Mentor and assist other artists.
  • Must showcase an up-to-date demo reel demonstrating rigging abilities.

Would be nice to have:

  • Knowledge and experience with mechanical systems
  • Motion capture and crowd rigging experience
  • Rig creation for VFX and realtime game engine environments
  • Maya Live Link and Unreal dev kit experience

Additional information

  • Candidates MUST be located in the United States, British Columbia or Ontario. This is a remote (work from home) position.
  • Zoic does not cover relocation costs.
  • This job description contains the basic requirements for the position and is NOT intended to be a complete list of responsibilities; other duties may be assigned.
  • Due to the volume of applications we receive across our different openings we regret that only those selected to interview will be contact.

OhxuuDkIzE

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: Technical Animator/Rigger
description:
ABOUT THIS POSITION

Digital Extremes is currently seeking a Technical Animator/Rigger to join our team. You will be working closely with the Tech team as well as Animators and Artists to create animator-friendly rigs, tools and scripts. A strong portfolio demonstrating your ability to create animator friendly rigs and MEL scripts is a must. You have superior knowledge and experience with Maya and MEL and a strong understanding of animation techniques. Knowledge of Motion Builder and Python would be preferred extras.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Work closely with techs, animators and artists to create animator-friendly rigs, tools and scripts
  • Design and implement processes that support and improve all applicable areas of the animation pipeline
  • Understand and work with the game engine
REQUIREMENTS

  • A portfolio that demonstrates the ability to create animator-friendly rigs and MEL scripts
  • Experience with Maya
  • Knowledge of MEL
  • An understanding of animation techniques
  • Excellent troubleshooting, problem-solving, creativity and organizational skills
  • A genuine enthusiasm and interest in video games
ABOUT DIGITAL EXTREMES

Founded in 1993 by James Schmalz, Digital Extremes ranks as one of the world's top independent video game development studios. Originating with the co-creation of Epic Games' multi-million unit selling Unreal® franchise including Unreal and Unreal Tournament, Digital Extremes went on to develop Dark Sector®, BioShock® for the PlayStation®3, the BioShock 2 multiplayer campaign, and The Darkness® II.

The studio has reached its greatest critical and commercial success with the free-to-play action game, Warframe®, boasting a global community of 50 million registered players on PC, PS4™, Xbox One and Nintendo Switch™.

For more information about Digital Extremes, visit www.digitalextremes.com. To sign up for Warframe, visit www.warframe.com.

WHY WORK AT DIGITAL EXTREMES

Our culture is centered on providing great opportunities to our employees so that everyone feels they are making a meaningful impact. Developing new and existing talent is our long-term focus. We are honored that our work environment has been consistently recognized as one of “Canada’s Top 100 Employers”. We summon you to join our elite team!

The rewards of a career with Digital Extremes include:
  • Competitive salary with bonus opportunities
  • Excellent benefits and paid time off
  • Matching RRSP plan
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Virtual access to Dialogue, our mental wellness and healthcare services app
  • Professional development and career support
  • Work-life balance fitness subsidies
  • Employee recognition program to celebrate personal success through an online platform
  • Be part of “Giving Back” through a multitude of fundraising venues at DE
  • Virtual events such as team building exercises, Games night, Live band performances, Adult and separate children’s holiday and summer parties for global teams!
JOIN US

Digital Extremes is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment process. We thank you for your interest, however, only those candidates selected for the next steps in the hiring process will be contacted.

title: newAnimateur.trice technique Gameplay
description:
Description de l'entreprise


Créé en 2008, DONTNOD est un studio français indépendant de création et de développement de jeux vidéo « AA » de genres populaires, aventure (Life is Strange, Tell me Why, Twin Mirror), action (Remember Me) et jeux de rôle (Vampyr). Chaque nouveau jeu est une création originale avec une expérience narrative et une mécanique de jeu uniques.

En 2020, DONTNOD décide de s'ouvrir à l'international avec sa filière DONTOND Montréal.


Description du poste


Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?

  • Tu souhaites participer au nouveau projet narratif de DONTNOD Montréal, porté par des membres clef de l'équipe Life is Strange et enrichi de talents Montréalais;
  • Tu désires rejoindre une équipe diverse et engagée, à la fois dans sa culture comme dans le contenu des jeux qu'elle crée;
  • Tu recherches un studio dont la taille contrôlée maximise l'efficacité d'itération, les interactions humaines simples, et la satisfaction individuelle de chaque membre de l'équipe;
  • Tu voudrais mettre tes talents en animation au service d'une expérience originale et sensible reposant sur ses personnages.

Quelle sera ta job ?

Rattaché.e au Lead Animator du studio de Montréal, ton rôle sera de supporter la réalisation des animations traditionnelles (keyframes) et capture de mouvements (gameplay, narration et cinématique), ainsi que leur implémentation dans l'engin (Unreal Engine) pour notre prochain projet narratif.

Ta mission sera:

  • de collaborer avec tes coéquipiers de multiple disciplines (animateurs, designers, programmeur, camera artists et rigger) pour livrer une expérience narrative engageante;
  • travailler avec tes coéquipiers pour créer, développer, tester et entretenir des systèmes d’animation de navigation, narration et gameplay de différentes complexités (designers, animateur et programmeurs);
  • de contribuer à la conception, à l’intégration et à la validation des éléments d’animation à implémenter, ainsi qu’à modifier et maintenir les systèmes de nav/gameplay dans Unreal;
  • de soutenir l’animateur en chef dans toute tâche ponctuelle.

Qualifications


Quelles compétences dois-tu avoir ?

  • Au moins 5 ans d’expérience pertinente;
  • Connaissance de Maya et Unreal;
  • Bonne compréhension et expérience pratique de la logique d’animation : graphes de nœuds, arbres d’animation et autres éditeurs de moteurs, blueprints et technologies similaires;
  • Solides compétences en matière d’animation de personnages;
  • Approche enthousiaste, méthodique et organisée pour travailler avec des normes de qualité élevées;
  • Sens de l’initiative, originalité et ingéniosité en matière de résolution de problèmes.

Qu'est-ce qui serait un plus pour nous ?

  • Un intérêt pour les jeux narratifs et leur capacité, via leurs personnages, à véhiculer des émotions;
  • Une précédente expérience de rédaction de scripts d’outils en Python/Mel, etc.;
  • Une familiarité avec les systèmes d’animation procédurale.

Informations complémentaires


À DONTNOD Montréal, nous célébrons la diversité et l'inclusivité dans nos jeux, mais aussi dans nos équipes. Nous sommes respectueux des principes d'égalité des chances à l'emploi, et c'est pour cela que nous encourageons les femmes, les personnes de toutes orientations sexuelles et identités de genre, les personnes autochtones, en situation de handicap, les minorités visibles, ainsi que toute autre personne pouvant contribuer à la diversité de notre studio à poser leur candidature à nos postes.

Nous constituons des équipes à taille humaine afin d'encourager l'épanouissement professionnel de chacun.e d'entre nous.

Voici un petit aperçu de ce que nous offrons à nos employés :

  • La possibilité de travailler partout au Québec;
  • Des horaires flexibles;
  • Un accès gratuit à un gym flambant neuf et des cours de groupe et à un terrain multi-sports l'été qui devient patinoire en hiver;
  • Remboursement partiel de la carte STM/RTM;
  • Un plan d'assurance collective complet et une plateforme de santé intégrée.

Nous sommes respectueux des principes d'égalité des chances à l'emploi, et c'est pour cela que nous encourageons les femmes, les personnes de toutes orientations sexuelles et identités de genre, les personnes autochtones, en situation de handicap, les minorités visibles, ainsi que toute autre personne pouvant contribuer à la diversité de notre studio à poser leur candidature à nos postes."]

title: Creature Technical Director (Feature Animation & VFX) Vancou...
description:
Description

Position at Industrial Light & Magic

Position Summary

The Creature Technical Director is responsible for rigging and enveloping hero to background creature, vehicles, and props in Maya. They are able to wrangle rigging and creature pipeline issues proficiently under the direction and support of their supervisors; and have the ability to run flesh-surface, hair, rigid sim, crowd, and/or cloth simulations.

What You'll Do

  • Provide rigging and enveloping in Maya for various vehicles, characters, and creatures
  • Run cloth, hair, rigid body, crowd, or muscle simulations
  • Troubleshoot creature pipeline issues for artists in other disciplines
  • Script utilities/tools/plug-ins in Maya and/or Houdini
  • Participate in reviews, dailies, and department meetings as required
  • Mentor entry level artists
  • Special projects as necessary

What We're Looking For

  • At least three years of relevant professional VFX experience and at least a college level diploma or higher in computer graphics, fine arts, design, or photography, or related field; OR at least five years of relevant professional VFX experience in lieu of education
  • Experience as Maya rigger for assets in digital animation, visual effects, games, commercials
  • Experience running simulation shotwork
  • Experience in corrective sculpting
  • Knowledge of anatomy and enveloping
  • Positive attitude and team player
  • Good communication skills
  • Proficiency with Linux
  • Expertise with Maya and Houdini
  • Experience with python scripting
  • Nice to have:
    • C++
    • Basic proficiency in another discipline - modeling, texture, TD, animation

This position is with Lucasfilm Entertainment Company Ltd. LLC, which is part of a business segment we call Industrial Light & Magic. Lucasfilm Entertainment Company Ltd. LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. Lucasfilm fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world. **FOR U.S. BASED NEW HIRES ONLY:** We are taking a responsible approach to creating environments that allow us to do what we do best - entertain and inform millions around the world. As part of our commitment to health and safety, COVID-19 vaccines are required for current U.S. salaried and non-union hourly employees, as well as all newly hired U.S. employees.


Lucas
Lucas
Lucas

title: Rigging Artist
description:
Framestore Vancouver is currently looking for a Rigging Artist. Working closely with the CG Supervisor and the Rigging Supervisor, the Rigger will be responsible for building robust and efficient rigs and working with the CG team to implement and support these rigs.


In this role, you will:

  • Identify the production's specific rigging needs with the CG Supervisor, Rigging, Animation, and Modeling Leads;
  • Design efficient rigs appropriate to the production’s needs;
  • Advise modelling teams on the suitability of models for rigging and propose any changes needed;
  • Work with the CG team, implementing the rigs and rigging the assets;
  • Design and implement scripted solutions for maximum speed and efficiency of rigging;
  • Work with leads and supervisors in the testing of rigged assets;
  • During production, support all the rigged assets.


This job is for you if:

  • At least 2 years of experience;
  • Rigging knowledge in industry production software such as Maya or Houdini;
  • Knowledge of other packages an asset, such as Motion Builder;
  • Must have some experience as a rigger on high-end feature film productions;
  • Excellent problem solving and communication skills required;
  • Excellent leadership skills required;
  • A strong sense of self-motivation and ability to work with little supervision required;
  • Linux scripting experience, especially in Bash/Python is desirable.


Interested? What are you waiting for? Apply now; we can't wait to get to know you!

Creativity has diversity at its heart. We celebrate the value of every unique experience by dedicating ourselves to promoting the most diverse and fair, and inclusive culture where employees feel empowered and safe to present themselves at work as such.

Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. Therefore, please inform the company's HR representative if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

title: Marine Installer/Rigger
description:
Sherwood Marine Centre is Vancouver Island's premier boat dealership. Our busy marine dealership is looking for a Marine Rigger to join our team. You must be hardworking, organized and attention to detail. If you enjoy working on and rigging boats and are flexible in accepting a variety of tasks to perform, then we want to hear from you.

Job Requirements

  • Mounting and rigging of all major outboard brands.
  • Install diesel heating systems
  • Perform electronics installations, VHF, GPS, Depth sounder, etc.
  • Install and repair outboard hydraulic steering systems.
  • Install and repair boat's 12V DC Systems
  • Able to operate yard equipment including a forklift.
  • Valid Drivers' License.

Qualifications

  • Preference will be given to applicants who currently hold Yamaha, Suzuki, or Honda certifications.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to multitask in and establish priorities in a busy environment
  • A positive attutiude and helping mindset
  • An eye for detail
  • Marine knowledge not required but would be an asset

title: Artiste en rigging
description:
Description du poste

Sous la supervision du superviseur Rigging, le titulaire de ce poste est responsable de la création et la conception de squelettes des personnages, des véhicules et des accessoires permettant une une parfaite interaction pendant l’animation.

Responsabilités
  • Créer les squelettes des personnages et des accessoires et y intégrer les outils permettant la déformation.
  • Fournir l’orientation technique relative aux personnages et accessoires, pour que, une fois qu’un personnage ou accessoire atteint le stade du squelette, il respecte les exigences techniques nécessaires pour le niveau supérieur de création du squelette et de la peau.
  • Travailler étroitement avec les animateurs pour élaborer des squelettes qui leur fourniront la gamme complète des mouvements et des gestes nécessaires, ainsi qu’une structure de contrôle logique et harmonieuse.
  • Communiquer au superviseur Rigging, aux autres artistes en rigging et aux directeurs techniques les besoins en ce qui a trait aux outils et aux scripts sur mesure, entre autres. Aider à planifier et concevoir, ainsi qu’à mettre au point les outils et les scripts, selon les besoins.
  • Créer des squelettes qui offrent une gamme complète de mouvements avec une structure de contrôle logique, harmonieuse et bien conçue.
Qualifications
  • Diplôme d’étude collégial ou universitaire ou expérience équivalente
  • Minimum d’une année d’expérience en «rigging» (ou l’équivalent)
  • Bonne compréhension des «workflow» de l’animation et de la modélisation
  • Bonne compréhension des formes humaines et animales, ainsi que de la biomécanique
  • Solide connaissance de Maya, avec solide compréhension du graphique, des points et du fonctionnement des expressions.
  • Connaissance fonctionnelle de MEL souhaitée.
  • Connaissance fonctionnelle de Python obligatoire.
  • Connaissance de l’API pour développeurs C non requise, mais constitue un avantage distinctif.
  • Compréhension générale des principes de l’animation. Capacité à réfléchir comme un animateur pour déterminer le mouvement des squelettes.
  • Expérience en animation, un atout.

Remarque :
Cette description du poste ne se veut pas exhaustive. L’employé pourrait avoir à réaliser d’autres tâches pour répondre aux besoins courants de l’entreprise.
Veuillez noter que les candidatures de citoyens et de résidents permanents du Canada seront examinées en priorité.
Seules les personnes dont la candidature aura été retenue seront contactées.
Des références peuvent être demandées.
Notez que le générique masculin est utilisé dans le but d’alléger le texte.
Reel FX Montréal souscrit au principe d’équité en matière d’emploi.

Job Summary

Under the direct supervision of the Rigging Supervisor, this position is responsible for character, vehicle, and prop set up and designing rigs that allow for clean interaction during animation.

Responsibilities
  • Set-up characters and props with skeletons and deformers
  • Provide technical direction on models, so that by the time a model reaches the rigging phase it meets the technical requirements needed for the highest level of rigging and skinning.
  • Work closely with Animators to develop rigs that will allow animators the full range of motion and acting that is called for by the story, as well as, a logical and easy to use control structure
  • Communicate needs for custom tools, scripts, etc, to Rigging Supervisor, other Riggers, and TD’s. Assist in the planning and design, as well as developing the tools and scripts as needed.
  • Ability to create rigs that allow for a full range of movement, with a logical, easy to use, and well thought out control structure.
Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s (BA) degree from accredited four-year college or university or equivalent experience
  • At least 2 years production experience
  • A strong understanding of animation and modeling workflows
  • A strong understanding of human and animal form and bio-mechanics.
  • Excellent knowledge of Maya, with a strong understanding of the dependency graph, utility nodes, and the use of expressions.
  • Working knowledge of MEL is preferred.
  • Working knowledge of Python is a must.
  • Knowledge of the C API is not required, but is a distinct advantage.
  • A general understanding of the principles of animation. Must be able to think like an animator when considering how rigs will move.
  • Prior animation experience is a plus.

This job description is not meant to be all inclusive. Employee may be required to perform other duties to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

Please note that Canadian citizen or a permanent resident of Candidate will be treated in priority.
Only the selected candidates will be contacted. Please note that you may be asked to provide references.

Must be able to think like an animator when considering how rigs will move.', 'Working knowledge of Python is a must.', 'Minimum d’une année d’expérience en «rigging» (ou l’équivalent)', 'Excellent knowledge of Maya, with a strong understanding of the dependency graph, utility nodes, and the use of expressions.', 'Work closely with Animators to develop rigs that will allow animators the full range of motion and acting that is called for by the story, as well as, a logical and easy to use control structure']

title: Rigger
description:
ABOUT THE JOB

BRON Digital, is a state-of-the-art virtual production and service company, that utilizes the Unreal Engine to develop and produce long-form animation for series television, short-form content, and motion pictures. This division leverages BRON’s extensive experience producing traditional CGI animation to apply and adapt the best practices of linear animation pipelines and marry those with Unreal Engine centered, virtual production workflows. The move allows BRON to broaden and expand its production and produce high quality content with much faster turnarounds.

We are seeking a Rigger to join our Rigging Department. Whether you are looking for fixed-term employment or a freelance gig, check us out!


Requirements

Role & Responsibilities

  • Build, test, and maintain rigs for various types of assets (Characters, Props and Sets) under the supervision of the Rigging Supervisor and working collaboratively with Modelers and Animators.
  • Deliver clean production rigs.
  • Provide clean skin and deformer weighting to satisfy the production’s required articulation standard.
  • Ability to work efficiently and adapt within the existing and changing workflows in Production and Pipe workflows.
  • Provide additional custom deformer solutions and corrective model sculpts as required.
  • Execute rigging efficiently by maintaining a fair level of scripting knowledge (Python, Mel) and understanding the rigging pipeline.


Qualifications

  • Experience with Autodesk Maya is required.
  • Knowledge of (Python, MEL) to understand the inside of the rigging pipeline and execute rigging efficiently.
  • Experience with Mudbox, Zbrush is a plus.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Good communication skills.
  • Experience with the Unreal Engine is a plus.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package, including Extended Health Benefits and Employee Family Assistance Program
  • Paid holiday closure between Christmas and New Year
  • 7 health days per year (prorated per any partial year, and/or contract length)

title: VFX Rigger - Senior
description:
Sinking Ship Entertainment is currently seeking a skilled and enthusiastic VFX Rigging Artist to join our talented VFX crew. If you are a motivated Rigger with industry experience and are looking to work with an award winning team, let’s talk!


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Rig a wide variety of characters and creatures. Experience with animal rigging a plus
  • Work closely with modeling and animation departments to facilitate articulate realistic appealing characters and creatures
  • Troubleshoot and solve creative & technical issues
  • Provide support and updates to rigs throughout production
  • Manage time, expectations and resources to meet deadlines
  • Attend reviews and team meetings as required
  • Remain current with latest rigging tools & techniques through industry research and training

QUALIFICATIONS

  • 5+ years' experience as a rigging artist in feature films and/or high-end television series
  • Proficient with Maya and thorough understanding of CG rigging tools and principles
  • Strong knowledge of animation’s needs and restrictions
  • Knowledge of scripting is a must, preferably python
  • Knowledge in anatomy, muscle and bone structure
  • Good communicator and team player who loves to share their knowledge and help the team grow and create the best possible work
  • Ability to take on assigned tasks with minimum supervision
  • Ability to take direction/critiques positively and thrive under the pressure of tight deadlines
  • Experience with Shotgun a plus


Sinking Ship Entertainment would like to thank all applicants. Due to the anticipated high volume of applications, only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Please no phone calls.

Sinking Ship Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity in the workplace. We would be happy to accommodate individual needs in keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation in order to participate in our recruitment process, please contact us to make your needs known in advance.

title: Artiste de personnages - SENIOR
location: Hybrid remote in Quebec City, QC
description:
Description de l'entreprise


Fort d’une équipe de plus de 500 talents créatifs, passionnés et novateurs, Ubisoft Québec continue de grandir et poursuit son ascension. Fondé en 2005, le studio de Québec s’est taillé une place parmi les leaders de l’industrie du jeu vidéo. Impliqué sur plusieurs franchises phares d’Ubisoft, il a acquis une solide expertise, le positionnant dans le développement de jeux d’envergure AAA. Impliquée sur la franchise Assassin's Creed depuis 2010, l'équipe de Québec a assumé le leadership d'Assassin's Creed Odyssey, Immortals Fenyx Rising ainsi que les nouveaux récits croisés d'Assassin's Creed Odyssey et Valhalla.


Description du poste


En tant que modeleur de personnages chez Ubi Québec, vous produirez des personnes, des créatures et des animaux qui interagiront avec les joueurs. Vous userez de vos talents tant artistiques que techniques pour créer les traits physiques des personnages qui peuplent nos mondes.

Vous appréciez tout particulièrement le processus de conception de personnages détaillés, complexes et intéressants. Vous voyez la création de nouvelles blend shapes, de bonne topologie et de maillages optimisés comme une occasion de parfaire vos compétences. Vous demandez régulièrement l'avis de vos collègues pour affiner votre art et développer de solides bases afin de donner vie aux personnages.

Ce que vous ferez

  • Collaborer avec les équipes d’art et de narration afin de comprendre les visions créative et artistique du jeu.
  • Se familiariser avec l’art conceptuel et les directives narratives, et rechercher vos propres références pour créer des prototypes de personnage (visage, physique, vêtements, etc.).
  • Créer et raffiner vos concepts de personnages à travers le pipeline 3D (modélisation, sculptage, texturation, retopolisation, dépliage UV, etc.).
  • Trouver l’équilibre entre les aspects artistiques et les contraintes techniques afin d’allier l'esthétique à la technique.
  • Collaborer avec les riggers et les animateurs pour rendre les déplacements et mouvements des personnages vraisemblables.
  • Adapter vos travaux en fonction des commentaires des testeurs de développement et des équipes collaboratrices.

Qualifications


Ce que vous apportez à l’équipe

  • Un diplôme collégial en modélisation 3D, beaux-arts, ou l’équivalent (diplôme de premier cycle est un atout)
  • Au moins 5 ans d’expérience en modélisation, texturation, ou autre expérience pertinente
  • Une bonne compréhension des outils d’art 2D (p. ex. Photoshop) et des logiciels 3D (p. ex. 3DS Max, Maya, Substance Painter, Marvelous Designer et ZBrush) *
  • Connaissance approfondie de la topologie, des matériaux, des textures, la proportion et l’anatomie + l’animation et les limitations liées au jeu (nombre de polygones, mémoire, etc.)
  • Un esprit créatif, collaboratif et innovateur
  • Excellentes aptitudes à la communication et aux relations interpersonnelles
  • Motivation à solliciter l'avis des collègues et capacité à s'y adapter
  • Connaissance de scanning 3D et des techniques d’optimisation est un atout

Informations complémentaires


Ce qu’il faut nous envoyer

Votre CV mettant en valeur votre formation, vos expériences et vos compétences

Un portfolio de vos meilleures réalisations en 3D, en particulier celles relatives à la transformation d'une conception 2D en un personnage 3D ! Joindre des images ou nous envoyer un lien vers votre site Web personnel ou votre portfolio en ligne.

Travailler chez Ubisoft c’est

  • Avoir accès à des avantages qui font une réelle différence au quotidien :
    • Un mode de travail hybride et flexible, 6 semaines de vacances dès votre première année, un congé parental enrichi, un gym Ubi directement dans nos bureaux, un programme d’assurances collectives complet, l’accès aux services complets de télémédecine Dialogue, un REER avec contribution d’Ubisoft, un programme de bonification avantageux, des mesures concrètes pour assurer le droit à la déconnexion, l’option de travail à temps partiel et bien plus. Cliquez ici pour connaître tous les détails.
  • Joindre les rangs d’une équipe de 21 000 collaborateur·trices d'Ubisoft, réparti·es sur plus de 40 sites à travers le monde, sont lié·es par une mission commune : enrichir la vie des joueur·euses par des expériences de jeu originales et mémorables. Leur énergie et leur talent ont permis de donner vie à de nombreuses franchises acclamées telles que Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, et bien d'autres à venir;
  • Travailler pour un employeur soucieux de l'égalité des chances et qui estime que la diversité des origines et des perspectives est essentielle pour créer des mondes où les joueur·euses et ses équipes puissent s'épanouir et s'exprimer. C’est relever des défis passionnants, être à l’avant-garde des technologies de pointe et prendre part au futur du divertissement.

title: Chef.fe d'équipe d'armature
description:
Description de l'entreprise


En tant qu’entreprise fondée et dirigée par un artiste, notre mission est d'offrir aux talents la liberté et les ressources dont ils ont besoin afin de favoriser la réalisation de travail de qualité et de prospérer dans un environnement amusant et créatif.


Description du poste


Le.la Chef.fe d'équipe d'armature crée des armatures et squelettes 3D pour différents types d'objets, de véhicules, de personnages et de créatures, dans le respect des exigences de qualité élevées de Rodeo FX. Il.elle soutient les artistes d’armature au sein de son équipe de projet, notamment en répondant aux questions, en offrant des conseils et en aidant à résoudre les problèmes de manière positive et constructive. Il.elle travaille en étroite collaboration avec la production pour attribuer des tâches aux artistes, communiquer l'état d'avancement du travail et proposer des solutions aux problèmes.


Principales responsabilités

  • Créer des armatures 3D pour différents types d’objets, véhicules, personnages et créatures ;
  • Créer le squelette et rigger l'anatomie interne d'une créature, afin de piloter la déformation finale de la peau ;
  • Créer des rigs scriptés de qualité et les affiner en fonction des besoins des animateurs et des départements en aval ;
  • Mettre en place et peaufiner les rigs des personnages, des corps/visages, des tissus/déformateurs et des surfaces dures ;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les artistes modélisateur.trice.s et les artistes animateur.trice.s afin de veiller à l’efficacité de l’armature d’un accessoire 3D de façon à ce que ses mouvements soient crédibles ;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le.la Superviseur.e en images de synthèse et la production pour trouver des solutions et des approches créatives et techniques qui respectent les spécifications et les délais du projet ;
  • Participer à la création d'outils pour le département. Tester les outils avant leur intégration, et rédiger une documentation claire et accessible ;
  • Superviser le travail d'une équipe d'artistes sur un projet, en faisant preuve d'un haut niveau d'expertise dans la spécialité et d'une attitude positive orientée vers les solutions ;
  • En collaboration avec la production, planifier et assigner les tâches appropriées aux membres de l'équipe, en tenant compte de leurs capacités et de leur niveau ainsi que du flux de travail et du calendrier du projet ;
  • Fournir des commentaires sur le travail de l'artiste pour s'assurer qu'il réponde aux exigences de qualité et respecte la vision artistique des client.e.s ;
  • Communiquer rapidement avec l'équipe de production au sujet de tout artiste qui n'aurait pas assez de travail. Aider à trouver des tâches alternatives si nécessaire (formation, recherche et développement d’outils pour le pipeline, etc.) ;
  • Encadrer les membres de son équipe en leur offrant de la formation et en partageant ses connaissances avec eux.elles. Communiquer tout besoin de formation spécifique au.à la Chef.fe du département. Participer éventuellement à la préparation de matériel de formation ou à des séances de formation en groupe ;
  • Participer aux évaluations à mi-parcours et post mortem, ainsi qu'aux évaluations annuelles des artistes en faisant part de ses commentaires au.à la Chef.fe du département ;
  • Tenir la production et l'équipe de projet informées de l'état d'avancement du travail, des problèmes à résoudre et de leurs ramifications et recommander des solutions potentielles ;
  • Veiller au respect des échéances et informer rapidement l'équipe de projet si des délais additionnels sont à prévoir, que ce soit de sa part ou de la part d’un membre de son équipe ;
  • Tenir ses connaissances à jour et rester à l’affût des dernières avancées technologiques et méthodes de travail dans l'industrie VFX.

Qualifications
  • Minimum de 3 ans d'expérience en tant qu’artiste d’armature dans l'industrie VFX ;
  • Connaissance de l'anglais et du français - doit parler couramment l'une de ces langues et être fonctionnel.le dans l'autre ;
  • Excellente connaissance du logiciel Maya ;
  • Expérience en programmation avec Python et PySide ;
  • Connaissance du logiciel de gestion de projet Shotgun/Shotgrid ;
  • Bonne compréhension des schémas anatomiques (bipèdes, quadrupèdes, squelettes et muscles) et des expressions faciales ;
  • Connaissance des outils de modélisation pour la déformation par mélange de formes ;
  • Connaissance des outils d'animation pour la création de test d'animation de déformation ;
  • Excellent sens des priorités et du respect des délais ;
  • Capacité à rester calme sous pression et à agir comme modèle positif et mentor.e.

Informations complémentaires
  • Contrat permanent à temps plein;
  • 5 jours de congé de maladie payé;
  • 2 jours de congé additionnel au temps des Fêtes;
  • Assurances collectives, accès au service en ligne Dialogue et à un programme d’aide aux employés;
  • REER avec cotisation de l'employeur;
  • Rabais avec Bixi, Nautilus Plus et plusieurs autres entreprises locales.

La diversité est une valeur fondamentale chez Rodeo FX. Créer et maintenir un environnement de travail inclusif et équitable où la diversité est célébrée et valorisée nous tient à coeur. Nous croyons que chaque membre de notre équipe enrichit notre travail en nous exposant à un large éventail de façons de percevoir et d'interagir avec le monde, d'identifier les défis, et de concevoir et réaliser des projets.

title: Class AZ Driver/Machinery Mover
description:
What is the opportunity?

As a Redmond & Associates AZ Driver/Machinery Mover, you will be at the forefront of our day-to-day operations. You will champion the R&A brand and drive business by transporting industrial machinery, forklifts, and other equipment to each job site. Once you are on-site, you will assist a team in transporting and placing the machines. This position is for those already experienced in Machinery Moving who also have a valid AZ License. This position does not require a degree, but the driving experience is valued. If you have the self-motivation to deliver exceptional work ethic and thrive in a dynamic, ever-changing environment, you can build a great career with us as you learn and develop new skills.

What will you do?

  • Load, unload, and move industrial machines (ie. CNCs, Mills, Lathes, Grinders, etc.), forklifts and other company equipment between our warehouse and job sites
  • Operate a variety of Tractor/Trailer combinations, including Tilt N Load, Sliding-Axle and Floats
  • Load and unload goods with forklifts, booms, overhead cranes, etc.
  • Proactively take ownership reporting vehicle performance and resolving/preventing equipment damage/malfunction
  • Receive and relay information to the dispatcher
  • Use GPS Equipment and/or maps
  • Tarping and ensuring safety and security of cargo
  • Diligently fill out paperwork & eLog book relating to the days’ work
  • Proactively engage with clients on-site
  • Be willing to, on rare occasions, travel inter-provincial/overnight (accommodation and expenses paid

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Positive attitude, discipline to work hard
  • Punctual & dependable team-player
  • Demonstrated passion for learning and growing, as well as success in hands-on work
  • Drive and self-motivation, as well as excellent communication skills and emotional intelligence
  • Ability to work flexible hours
  • Own transportation to work; valid driver’s license
  • Ability to lift 50lbs
  • Speak, read and write English
  • Exhibit professionalism in manner and appearance.
  • Valid AZ Driver’s License, with the acceptable driving record (abstract)
  • Steel-Toed Safety Boots
  • Basic Hand Tools
  • Confidence and ability to learn all aspects of Machinery Moving

Nice-to-have

  • AZ driving experience
  • Machinery Moving/Rigging experience
  • Experience operating forklifts and overhead cranes
  • Millwrighting experience
  • Warehousing experience

What’s in it for you?

  • A comprehensive rewards program including bonuses, health, medical, and dental group benefits, and competitive compensation
  • Overtime Available
  • Excellent career development and access to a variety of job opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and hard-working team
  • Paid training & professional development
  • Opportunity for growth and advancement within the company
  • $125 safety boot allowance per calendar year
  • Free parking

About R&A

Redmond & Associates is a business built upon the values of honesty, efficiency, hard work and dedication. The company was founded in Oshawa, Ontario as a family-run business in 1996 by Tony and Jennifer Redmond. At first, they started out small with a 1400 square foot facility, but with the loyalty and perseverance of their employees and founders, their success began to grow, eventually leading them to their current warehouse in Mississauga, Ontario, where they operate out of a 35,000 sq. ft. facility. The growth and success that Redmond & Associates has experienced can be attributed to the hardworking employees, managers and founders who keep their customers satisfied time and time again.

Our goal at Redmond & Associates is to provide excellent service and efficient single-source moving solutions for all of our customers. We take pride in our work and are dedicated to exceeding our customers’ expectations by catering to each customer’s individual needs. We employ millwrights and riggers with many years of experience. In addition to this, we are a part of SC&RA (specialized carriers and rigging association) and OTS (Ontario Trucking Association). With Redmond and Associates, you can always be sure that the job will be done right and on time. Worry-free moving services is what we specialize in. For more information, please visit www.redmondmovers.com

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $55,000.00-$75,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime

Application question(s):

  • Are you able to drive manual transmission?
  • Can you work overtime if necessary?

Experience:

  • Machinery Moving (ie. CNCs, Lathes, Mills, Grinders, etc.): 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • AZ License (required)

title: Lead Rigger
description:
ABOUT THE JOB

BRON Digital, is a state-of-the-art virtual production and service company, that utilizes the Unreal Engine to develop and produce long-form animation for series television, short-form content, and motion pictures. This division leverages BRON’s extensive experience producing traditional CGI animation to apply and adapt the best practices of linear animation pipelines and marry those with Unreal Engine centered, virtual production workflows. The move allows BRON to broaden and expand its production and produce high quality content with much faster turnarounds.

Type: This position is fully remote.


Requirements

Role & Responsibilities

  • Build, test, and maintain rigs for various types of assets (Characters, Props and Sets) under the supervision of the Line Producer and working collaboratively with Modelers and Animators.
  • Deliver clean production rigs.
  • Provide clean skin and deformer weighting to satisfy the production’s required articulation standard.
  • Ability to work efficiently and adapt within the existing and changing workflows in Production and Pipe workflows.
  • Provide additional custom deformer solutions and corrective model sculpts as required.
  • Execute rigging efficiently by maintaining a fair level of scripting knowledge (Python, Mel) and understanding the rigging pipeline.
  • Run body, crowd, or muscle simulations.
  • Troubleshoot pipeline issues for animation under direction.
  • Participate in reviews and department meetings.

Qualifications

  • Experience as Maya rigger for assets in digital animation, visual effects, games, commercials.
  • Knowledge of (Python, MEL) to understand the inside of the rigging pipeline and execute rigging efficiently.
  • Experience with Mudbox, Zbrush is a plus.
  • Experience with the Unreal Engine is a plus.
  • Experience in assets and shotwork.
  • Knowledge of anatomy, cloth and hair simulation.
  • Basic knowledge/skill in other disciplines - modeling, texture, TD, animation.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Good communication skills.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package, including Extended Health Benefits and Employee Family Assistance Program
  • Holiday closure between Christmas and New Year
  • 7 health days per year (prorated per any partial year, and/or contract length)

title: Senior Rigging Artist
description:
Overview:
Encore VFX is currently in search of a Senior Rigger with a focus in animation and character technology to join the Rigging team. Working on a variety of issues, such as mechanical systems, animals, complex realistic body and face deformation, automation thru scripting, tentacles, ropes, vehicles, crowd characters, and anything else you can imagine.


Main Duties:

  • A solid understanding of modular rigging systems and their framework.
  • Must have good tool design logic. Keeping things as simple as possible while creating complex projects.
  • Experience working with FACS based facial rigging system is a plus.
  • Experience working with mGear rigging system is a plus.


What You Bring:

You are passionate about the world of Character Rigging. You have worked in fast paced VFX environments in the past where speed and constant changing needs were the norm.

  • Minimum of 5 years working with a strong understanding of VFX production workflow
  • Experience in Python a plus
  • Strong Maya production experience
  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
  • Willingness to learn and grow further.
  • Must be a self starter. Solid time and project management skills.
  • Must be willing to take direction well, a good team player
  • Demonstration of both control systems and complex deformations
  • Strong comprehension of anatomy and articulation


About the Company:

Company 3 / Method Studios provides a full range of Creative Services for content creators, including conceptual design, pre-vis, look development, ideation and rapid prototyping, 3D animation/CGI, motion graphics/designers, matte painting, compositing, dailies and production services, color grading, post-production finishing, marketing/trailers, live-action production, experiences, and more.


Creativity has diversity at its core. We celebrate the value of each unique experience by being dedicated to fostering the most diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where every employee feels empowered and safe to show up to work as their full self.

It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. Please inform the company's HR representative if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.
