title: Directrice, Directeur d’animation, Ubisoft Sherbrooke
description:
Description du poste


En tant que directrice ou directeur d'animation chez Ubi Sherbrooke, vous définissez comment les personnages, les environnements et les objets vont bouger dans un monde parfaitement cohérent et convaincant.

Vous donnez forme à la vision globale d'animation d'un jeu et ralliez votre équipe d'animateur·trices derrière elle. Vous leur donnez les conseils et le contexte dont ils et elles ont besoin pour saisir le style général que vous essayez de réaliser. Puis, vous leur laissez la liberté d'expérimenter et d'itérer.

Pendant que vos animateur·trices construisent un monde à partir de la base, vous surveillez la forme et la fonction du point de vue des joueur·euses, en vous assurant que l'aspect et la sensation du mouvement atteignent leurs intentions : de soutenir le gameplay, transmettre la narration, créer des liens et faire en sorte que l'expérience soit immersive, engageante et fluide.


Ce que vous ferez

  • Travailler en partenariat avec les autres membres de l'équipe de direction afin de développer l’ensemble du jeu + unifier vos visions.
  • Lancer des idées et effectuer des recherches pour définir le style d'animation.
  • Relier les riggers et les animateur·trices à la vision de l'animation en leur fournissant des repères visuels, des références et de la formation.
  • Faire le point avec les directeur·trices techniques pour établir les pipelines et les flux de travail + sélectionner les outils pour obtenir une qualité esthétique et une fonctionnalité technique.
  • Choisir les acteurs + les guider lors des sessions de mocap.
  • Tester le jeu (très souvent) pour avoir une idée de la réactivité des animations et de l'ambiance générale du jeu.
  • Collaborer avec les équipes interdépendantes (notamment, la conception du jeu, l’art et la narration) pour assurer la cohésion du jeu.
  • Examiner et valider le travail intégré + fournir un mentorat et un feedback constructif pour développer un style d'animation visuelle de qualité, harmonieux et raffiné.
  • Participer au recrutement pour construire votre équipe + favoriser leur développement professionnel.

Qualifications


Ce que vous apportez à l’équipe

  • Environ 7 ans d'expérience dans le domaine de l'animation (sur un jeu de tir à la première personne, un grand atout) + 3 ans de leadership
  • Connaissance approfondie des logiciels d'animation comme Motion Builder, 3DS Max et Maya
  • Une compréhension des moteurs de jeu (p. ex. Unity ou Unreal) et des contraintes techniques
  • Une bonne compréhension des interdépendances et une prise en compte de l'impact de vos choix sur les autres départements
  • Un diplôme en animation 3D ou infographie (ou une formation connexe)
  • Une vaste culture du jeu vidéo + un sens aigu du détail pour évoluer l'animation
  • La souplesse nécessaire pour s'adapter et surmonter les obstacles et les défis qui se présentent à vous
  • La capacité de rendre une vision accessible et de s'assurer qu'elle est bien comprise par toutes et tous
  • Solides aptitudes en communication, présentation, mentorat et relations interpersonnelles
  • Un esprit de collaboration, de créativité et d'innovation

Informations complémentaires


À propos de nous

Ubisoft Sherbrooke ouvrira ses portes dès 2022.

Le studio sera composé d’une équipe d’expert·es multidisciplinaire qui participeront, au cœur même de Sherbrooke, à développer des franchises de jeu emblématique qui fascinent des millions de personnes à travers le monde.
Nous recherchons des créatrices et créateurs passionnés qui souhaitent concevoir des jeux exceptionnels et faire vivre des expériences mémorables à nos joueur·euses. Joindre les rangs d’Ubi Sherbrooke, c’est jouer un rôle clé dans l’industrie du jeu vidéo, de contribuer à l’avancement technologique d’Ubisoft, mais également dans celui du développement économique et social de l’Estrie. Notre expertise locale bénéficiera d’un rayonnement international!

Le monde du travail évolue, et nous aussi. Notre politique de congé universel, notre politique de travail hybride et flexible, de nombreux avantages sociaux concurrentiels, une foule d’opportunités d’apprentissage vous permettront d’atteindre votre plein potentiel. Ici, l’équilibre travail-vie personnelle est au cœur de notre quotidien.

Au studio de Sherbrooke, vous découvrirez un milieu de travail qui éveille la créativité et favorise les connexions : un environnement composé d'une variété de voix, d'identités, d'origines, d'expériences et de perspectives.

Notre désir de rêver grand, de prendre des risques et d’évoluer contribuera à l'innovation et au dépassement des limites qui mèneront à notre succès collectif.


Chez Ubisoft, vous êtes les bienvenu·es tel·les que vous êtes. Nous accueillons la diversité sous toutes ses formes. Nous nous engageons à favoriser un environnement de travail inclusif et respectueux de toutes les différences.

Nous accueillons la diversité sous toutes ses formes. Nous nous engageons à favoriser un environnement de travail inclusif et respectueux de toutes les différences.']

title: 3D Animator / Animateur rice 3D
description:
Art
Montreal
Permanent
Rovio Montreal is looking for an experienced 3D Animator, with a proven track record in working in the mobile video game development field. Creating character rigs and animations for the project will be your responsibility in collaboration with the Art Director and Lead Animator. You will also be responsible for monitoring and optimizing your work in Unreal Engine with a focus on delivering a high-quality and optimized in-game experience.

-

Rovio Montréal est à la recherche d'un animateur 3D expérimenté, ayant fait ses preuves dans le domaine du développement de jeux vidéo mobiles. La création de personnages rigs et d'animations pour le projet sera votre responsabilité en collaboration avec le directeur artistique et l'animateur principal. Vous serez également responsable du suivi et de l'optimisation de votre travail dans Unreal Engine, dans le but de fournir une expérience de jeu de haute qualité et optimisée.

Responsibilities:What you will do:
You will be delivering eye-catching and high-quality final animations within a tight schedule;
Rigging and implementing characters in the engine;
Optimizing your work according to best practices;
Work closely with the 3D character artists.

Ce que vous ferez:
Livrer des animations finales accrocheuses et de haute qualité dans un court délai;
Rigger et implémenter les personnages dans le moteur;
Optimiser votre travail selon les meilleures pratiques;
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les artistes de personnages 3D.

Who we think will do great in this role has:
Proficiency in Blender
Shipped multiple real-time projects made with Unreal Engine
Experience with cross-platform development (Mobile, PC, Consoles)
A solid understanding of art pipelines
Experience in 3D modeling
Strong art foundations in anatomy, acting techniques, cinematography, interactive storytelling, and graphic art
The ability to express a wide range of emotions through acting with great attention to detail
Strong interpersonal communication skills
A high degree of self-motivation and initiative-taking
A passion for video game development.

Vous aurez besoin de ces compétences
Une bonne maîtrise de Blender
Livré plusieurs projets en temps réel réalisés avec Unreal Engine
Expérience de développement sur plusieurs plateformes (mobile, PC, consoles)
Une solide compréhension des pipelines artistiques
Expérience en modélisation 3D
De solides bases artistiques en anatomie, techniques de jeu, cinématographie, narration interactive et art graphique
La capacité d'exprimer un large éventail d'émotions par le jeu d'acteur avec une grande attention aux détails
De solides compétences en communication interpersonnelle
Un haut degré d'auto-motivation et de prise d'initiative
Une passion pour le développement de jeux vidéo.

Recruitment process:
First meeting: You will meet the Recruiter of our team. Before diving deeper into your skills, we want to know who you are and what motivates you. This is also an opportunity for you to learn more about Rovio and the specifics of the role.
Second round: You will meet with some members of the development team in Montreal well. Our aim is to get a clear overview of your skills, your ambitions and where we can help you develop.
Final round: You will discuss with our HR team as a final step, to talk about Rovio’s culture, values and how we can help you grow in our team.

Processus de recrutement

Première rencontre: Vous rencontrerez la personne en charge du recrutement de notre équipe. Avant d'approfondir vos compétences, nous voulons savoir qui vous êtes et ce qui vous motive. C'est aussi l'occasion pour vous d'en savoir plus sur Rovio et les spécificités du poste.
Deuxième rencontre: Vous rencontrerez certains membres de l'équipe de développement à Montréal. Notre objectif est d'avoir un aperçu clair de vos compétences, de vos ambitions et des domaines dans lesquels nous pouvons vous aider à vous développer.
Rencontre finale: Vous discuterez avec notre équipe RH, pour parler de la culture, des valeurs de Rovio et de la façon dont nous pouvons vous aider à grandir dans notre équipe.

-
We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name.

What to expect when you join us
Meet the Rovians
About Rovio

title: Foreman | Contremaître (Rigger)
description:
Are you ready to take your career to new heights? Join our growing team at WesTower Communications Ltd. as a Foreman - Aerial Field Technician!
We are Canada’s largest wireless/wireline network service contractor offering Engineering, Design, Fabrication, Construction, Project Management, and Maintenance Services for wireless telecommunication carriers and independent tower operators. We aim to make a positive impact nationwide in the Telecom industry and to seek excellence in all aspects of our business.
We offer competitive wages paid out living allowances, paid holidays, comprehensive benefits, RSP matching, stock options, and opportunities to further develop your skillset and grow your career.

Job Description:
  • Responsible for managing field crew safely
  • Daily communication to project management and customers on site
  • Supervise tower and cell-site installation
  • Supervise antenna modifications/adds
  • Troubleshoot equipment to locate the transmission faults
  • Completing timesheets
  • Extensive travel throughout the province and/or country
Qualifications:
  • Previous experience managing a crew
  • 2-5 years of previous experience with Wireless/ Cell Site installation
  • Strong safety skillset or background
  • Telecom troubleshooting experience required
  • Ability to interpret engineered drawings and knowledge of fibre and DC drawings
  • Demonstrate strong adherence to safety procedures
  • Good physical condition and comfortable working at heights
  • Willing to work outdoors and be exposed to all types of weather
  • Valid Canadian driver’s license is required
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada
  • Must be mechanically inclined
  • Strong written and verbal skills
  • Clean Criminal record
  • Maintain a professional working relationship with co-workers and clients
  • Must be reliable, trustworthy and have a positive attitude!
At WesTower Communications Ltd. you can expect to be treated fairly. We recognize that it is our people who drive the success of our business, so we make it our priority to foster inclusive work environments welcomed to diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to accommodating prospective employees. We proudly offer a drug-free workplace with a zero-tolerance safety program.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
What we Offer

  • A competitive compensation package including extended medical and dental. A profit share program for all our employees where everyone shares a stake in the outcome.
  • Employee incentives such as referral bonuses, efficiency awards, tool allowances and Get Smart initiatives
  • Culture and team building events such as our biannual trip to Whistler, annual BBQs, annual team building events, weekly Après work (Friday get togethers).
  • Our Core values of Crush it, Love it and Own it are what makes Caliber great. We hire employees who embrace these values and by this we create a team of A players who want to win together.

Job Responsibilities

Project Development

  • Complete a detailed review of all construction drawings to ensure drawings are correct and consistent. Use Caliber’s drawing review SOP and checklist to complete the review
  • Review scopes of work for each contract and inform Project manager of any concerns or inconsistencies

Project Tender and Budget

  • Attend contract award meetings and assist Project manager on negotiate contracts. Ensure that contracts include all items noted in the scope of work.
  • Enforce Contract objectives as per Scopes of Work (LOI Appendix A), as per the Project Manager and/or Estimating Team.
  • Collaborating with Project Manager in the preparation of pre-approved preferred Trades/Suppliers list for said project. Project Manager has final decision.
  • Once Anchor Budget is established and approved, the Site Superintendent to deliver project on or under budget.
  • Any variance to Anchor Budget to be reported immediately to the Project Manager.
  • Actual Budget to be reviewed against the Anchor Budget on a weekly/monthly basis and results communicated to the Project Manager
  • Ensure that the project is delivered in accordance with Caliber’s Performance Standards, Appendix ‘A’ scopes of work, all Municipal & Code Standards, all Safety Standards, Work Safe BC and Caliber’s Health & Safety program.
  • Review, understand and agree with Construction Contracts for assigned site.

Project Schedule

  • Baseline Schedule to be established and mutually approved between Project Manager & Superintendent, Superintendent is responsible for delivery of project
  • on or ahead of schedule.
  • Actual Performance schedule to be reviewed with Project Manager on a weekly basis and at regularly scheduled trades meetings. Project 6-week look ahead schedule to be updated for bi-weekly meetings with trades on site.
  • Any changes to Baseline schedule will be communicated to the Project Manager and addressed at Consultants meetings as schedule updates – quarterly.
  • Assist with the advancement of the project in all stages focusing on meeting the contract schedule whilst maintaining a safe work environment.

Project Permits

  • Arrange required permits from Municipalities
  • Receive all Municipal finals in order to achieve provisional/final Occupancy

Cost Control

  • Collaborate with Project Manager regarding any cost variance affecting the Anchor Budget in a timely manner.
  • Review and Communicate in a timely manor any RFI’s, CCO’s as they come to your attention through trade’s communication, drawing documentation, lack of information, etc.
  • Monitor project to ensure use of labour and required material controls. (Productive labour force, Lumber Orders, Concrete Orders, etc.)
  • All communications regarding progress draw payments, change order approvals, contract scope of work conflicts should be referred directly to Project Manager.
  • Any sub-trade back charges should be appropriately documented with picture and written backup and send to Project Manager for distribution to trade’s office.
  • Review with Project Manager whether to rent or purchase tools/equipment based on duration of use, wear and tear, future repairs, etc. Will also maintain tool and rental logs on a regular basis.
  • Regularly review invoices and approve per invoice processing SOP.
  • Track time and material costs and regularly check with Project Manger on budget management.

Safety

  • Understand and ensure adherence to all required safety policies as directed by Caliber’s Health & Safety Manual and Work Safe BC Health & Safety Regulations.
  • Setup meeting with Work Safe BC rep. during excavation to review project plan in regard to access, crane swings, exterior envelope, etc.
  • Oversee daily activities of CSO and perform daily site audit with CSO to ensure worker safety compliance on site.
  • Review daily safety inspection reports, trade toolbox meeting minutes, trade JHA’s and provide comments/feedback/follow-up as required. Notify Project Manager if trades are not up to date with their paperwork.
  • Update site management/safety plan as required.
  • Ensure all required Engineering is provided prior to performing tasks on site (eg. flying DEP box, formwork, etc.)
  • Ensure crane operator, rigger, maintenance logs are up to date.

Personnel Management

  • Supervise the personnel necessary for the effective execution of assigned project, throughout all stages.
  • Coordinate all trades to ensure they carry out all their duties as prescribed in their scopes of work.
  • Be familiar with trade’s Scopes of Work, to ensure we are not self-performing something already covered contractually.
  • Coach and Connect with Caliber employees to help train them in their role. Report any concerns with Caliber employee performance to the Project Manager.
  • Ensure all site staff are aware of and adhere to all Corporate Performance, Employment Standards and Company Policies.
  • All timecards for Caliber Employees and temporary labour must be verified and signed off by Superintendent.
  • Chair bi-weekly trade meetings to review site safety, schedules, etc. Minutes to be distributed no later than 2 days following meeting date.

Quality Control/Reports/Logs

  • Ensure project is completed with Caliber performance standards and project specific ‘Scope’s of Work’.
  • monitor project to ensure conformity with all milestones, building code requirements, applicable specifications and drawings.
  • Make Project Manager aware of any conflicts within plans and/or between specifications and plans.
  • Adhere to any Caliber construction protocols as developed over time.
  • Perform audits of trade layout on a regular basis – if it appears to be wrong it probably is.
  • Maintain photo documentation of site progress daily and upload to Site Max daily
  • Maintain “detailed” daily superintendent reports and send copy of reports to Project Manager on a weekly basis.
  • Maintain a trade foreman contact/phone list with site administrator and update on a weekly basis.
  • Ensure use of concrete pour verification checklist and have all trades sign off “prior to” placing concrete and keep an up to date concrete pour log.
  • Ensure up to date knowledge of ALL RFI’s, SI’s, Shop Drawings, etc. and make sure trades are following the required changes on site.
  • Maintain set of working drawings noting all changes for quick cross reference.
  • Maintain Purchase Order Log and make sure all suppliers reference PO on invoice along with correct company name for billing.

Personal Development

  • Maintain awareness of general market conditions as it pertains to personnel, suppliers and trade availability.
  • Maintain a thorough understanding of the issues facing the construction industry.
  • Maintain a network of: Sub-trades, Suppliers, Industry Peers.
  • Stay abreast of technical advancements in the construction industry.
  • Partake in continuing education to constantly grow ability and knowledge of construction practices and procedures.
  • Continue to hone verbal and written communication skills.

Interactions

  • Report to Project Manager on site and Senior Project Manager as called upon.
  • Key internal interactions: Construction Department and Accounting Department, as necessary.
  • Key External interactions: Sub-trade/Supplier Team, Municipality/Consultants/ General Public
  • Any Site incidents requiring reporting or press to flow through the Project Manager to the Senior Project Manager

Skills & Knowledge

  • Post Secondary Education in Engineering, Technology or Trades Training or the equivalent on job experience.
  • Minimum of 5 years or the relevant site Superintendent experience
  • Possess superior organizational, project management and critical thinking skills.
  • Proven effective communication skills (Verbal, written and e-mail) able to communicate with a variety of people and groups.
  • Knowledge of MS Outlook, MS Word, MS Project, and MS Excel

title: Character TD (Rigger) (DNEG Animation)
description:
Rédigé au masculin pour alléger le texte
Depuis 2014, le département d'Animation chez DNEG collabore avec des cinéastes et des propriétaires de propriétés intellectuelles pour créer des long métrages d'animation de haute gamme. Présentement en production sur des films d'animation d'envergure, nous cherchons de nouveaux talents pour joindre notre équipe grandissante. Ensemble, nous donnerons vie à la vision des grands studios hollywoodiens et des productions indépendantes en prospérant sur la collaboration et l'énergie créative de notre équipe! Visitez notre site web pour en savoir plus sur le département d'Animation chez DNEG: https://www.dneg.com/dneg-animation/
Notre objectif est de rivaliser avec les meilleurs du secteur et nous nous appuierons sur nos brillants artistes Character TD pour créer des plate-formes d'animation pour les personnages, les créatures, les accessoires et les véhicules qui donne vie à une histoire animée.
Notre équipe utilise sa connaissance approfondie de ses spécialisations de personnage pour développer, tester et maintenir les configurations de mouvement et de déformation des personnages. En travaillant en étroite collaboration avec notre équipe de modélisation, nos superviseurs de montage et nos responsables / superviseurs d'animation, nos Character TD aident à développer de nouvelles techniques pour créer des meilleures plates-formes efficaces afin de rationaliser le processus de production.
De temps en temps, il peut être nécessaire de mettre en œuvre des outils internes pour aider à la création de plates-formes d'animation. Vous serez suffisamment expérimenté pour anticiper et communiquer tout problème lié à la pipeline et garantir le respect des protocoles de pipeline de production d'animation long metrage.
Qualifications
  • Années d'expérience démontrées ave des projets majeurs de personnage ou de créatures
  • Connaissance approfondie de votre domaine de spécialisation de personnage (anatomie corporelle, expression faciale, script orienté vers les objets, gestion des outils)
  • Expérience de collaboration avec l'équipe d'animation pour développer des systèmes de mouvement intuitifs et de déformation des personnages
  • Connaissance approfondie de Maya en plus de compétences de script élémentaires avec Python ou Mel
  • Fortes compétences visuelles et artistiques et à l'aise avec les aspects techniques du travail des personnages / créatures
  • Connaissance des problèmes de pipeline et d'un environnement de post-production important en personnages / créatures
Atouts
  • Compétences en programmation / script (Python, Maya aPI, C ++) pour le développement de modules et d'outils
  • Expérience de simulation de tissu avec nCloth, Houdini ou similaire
  • Expérience avec Unreal Engine ou d'autres logiciels de rendu en temps réel
À propos de toi
  • Esprit d'équipe
  • Travaille bien de façon autonome
  • Proactif et bon communicateur
  • Excellentes compétences en gestion du temps et en organisation
  • Capacité d'adaptation à gérer différentes tâches et attentes
  • Bonne attention aux détails
  • Débrouillard et orienté vers la résolution de problèmes
À propos de nous

Nous sommes DNEG, un des leaders mondiaux d'effets visuels, d'animation et de conversion stéréo pour des longs métrages et pour la télévision, avec des studios à Londres, Vancouver, Mumbai, Los Angeles, Chennai, Montréal, Chandigarh, Hyderabad et Goa.

*******************************************

Since 2014 DNEG’s Animation division has been collaborating with filmmakers and IP owners to create high-end animated feature films. Currently in production on major animated features we are looking for new talent to join our growing team. Thriving on collaboration and the creative energy it provides, we will craft together spectacular visuals and bring to life the vision of both major Hollywood studios and independent productions! Visit our website to find out more about Animation at DNEG: https://www.dneg.com/dneg-animation/

We aim to compete with the best in the business and rely on our talented Character TD’s to create animation rigs for characters, creatures, props and vehicles that bring an Animated story to life.

Our team use their thorough knowledge of their character specialisations to develop, test and maintain character motion and deformation set ups. Working closely with our Modelling team, Rigging Supervisors and Animation Leads/Supervisors, our Character TDs help to develop new techniques to create better and more efficient rigs to streamline the production process.

From time to time it may be a requirement to implement proprietary tools to aid in the creation of animation rigs. You’ll be experienced enough to anticipate and communicate any pipeline issues and ensure adherence to the DNEG Animation production pipeline protocols.

Must Have

  • Proven years of experience with major character or creature projects
  • Thorough knowledge of your area of character specialisation (body anatomy, facial expression, object orientated scripting, tool management)
  • Experience collaborating with Animation to develop intuitive motion systems and character deformation
  • Full working knowledge of Maya with elemental scripting skills using Python or Mel
  • Strong visual and artistic skills, and must be comfortable with the technical aspects of character/creature work where appropriate
  • Familiarity with pipeline issues and a big character/creature heavy post-production environment

Nice to Have

  • Programming/scripting skills (Python, Maya aPI, C++) for module and tool development
  • Cloth Simulation experience using nCloth, Houdini or similar
  • Experience in Unreal Engine or other real-time rendering softwares

About You

  • Team oriented.
  • Works well without constant supervision
  • Proactive and a good communicator
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Adaptable at handling different tasks and expectations
  • Good attention to detail
  • Resourceful and a good problem solver

title: Unreal Rigger
description:
BRON Digital, is a state-of-the-art virtual production and service company, that utilizes the Unreal Engine to develop and produce long-form animation for series television, short-form content, and motion pictures. This division leverages BRON’s extensive experience producing traditional CGI animation to apply and adapt the best practices of linear animation pipelines and marry those with Unreal Engine centered, virtual production workflows. The move allows BRON to broaden and expand its production and produce high quality content with much faster turnarounds.

Requirements

Role & Responsibilities

  • Build, test, and maintain rigs for various types of assets (Characters, Props and Sets) under the supervision of the VFX Supervisor
  • Collaborate with Modeling and Animator teams to help define topology and performance specifications
  • Deliver clean production rigs, including skin and deformer weighting, corrective model shapes and more
  • Work efficiently within the existing Production and Pipe work flows
  • Provide additional custom deformer solutions and corrective model sculpts as required
  • Utilize your scripting knowledge (Python, Mel) and understanding the rigging pipeline to work in the studio’s automated assembly system
  • Perform detailed character model finaling post animation
  • The successful candidate will develop the bridge between Maya and Unreal Engine


Qualifications

  • Experience with Autodesk Maya is required.
  • Experience with Epic Games Unreal Engine a strong plus
  • Scripting (Python, MEL) and visual programming skills (BluePrints in UE) a plus
  • Experience with Houdini, Mudbox, Zbursh and similar, a plus
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Good communication skills

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package, including Extended Health Benefits and Employee Family Assistance Program
  • Holiday closure between Christmas and New Year
  • 7 health days per year (prorated per any partial year, and/or contract length)

title: Animation Technical Director
description:
At Tuque Games, a Wizards of the Coast studio, our mission is simple:

Build great games and have fun doing it!

We are passionate game developers working on original high quality AAA games while enjoying a healthy studio culture. Our ambition is guided by strong values such as respect, honesty and humbleness. We truly believe in the power of a diverse team in which each individual has the opportunity to deploy their full potential and contribute to our collective success.

That speaks to you? Join us!

Job description

Tuque Games is looking for an Animation Technical Director. This role will be part of the core design team, collaborating with other designers, artists, and engineers to be the glue between vision and implementation.

What You'll Do:

  • Collaborate with game leadership to develop the overall vision & determine technical feasibility;

  • Build up and maintain detailed documentation for all owned features, leaving no pathways unexplored.

  • Evaluate the game's vision, design and technical needs and identify risks and mitigation plans

  • Work closely with programmers to assess existing animation and rigging tools + occasionally design custom ones to improve pipelines;

  • Support animators, game designers, and riggers with their technical needs + informatively and constructively explain the root causes of risks, blockers, etc.

  • Train team members on tools and techniques + raise awareness of new processes;

  • Resolve complex, escalated issues & make technical validations;

  • Work with engineers to assess animation and rigging tools

  • Anticipate technological advancements and stay up to date on market trends to define our best practices + share them with our studios and the industry;

  • Responsible for performance metrics with regards to animation

  • Evaluate, design and develop the pipelines within the animation team and between other departments for ingame integration and cinematics

  • Support technical development across all animation driven systems (gameplay, cinematics, ingame events etc)

  • Regularly play the game, providing constructive feedback and suggestions to other members of the team.

What You'll Bring:

  • 10+ years experience developing AAA titles

  • 5+ years of experience as an Animation Technical Director on AAA titles

  • Proficient with MotionBuilder, cinematics workflows & Unreal Engine

  • Strong analytical skills and a love for efficient problem solving.

  • Positive, direct, collaborative communication to improve our shared vision.

  • Flexible, adaptable approach with a constant appetite for new knowledge and experiences.

  • Self-sufficient and self-motivated, able to manage a feature from start to finish but also know when to ask for mentorship or help.

  • Ability to program or edit scripts.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

Tuque Games commits to offer equal working chances to every individual, without regard based on the following: age, sex, sexual orientation, physical disability, race, religion, citizenship, native country or any other possible particularities. We sincerely believe in a respectful and open-minded work environment, in which everyone can fully contribute to

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Software Engineer - Animation & Rigging
description:
Are you a Software Engineer interested in contributing to our animation tools that stretch from Layout to Final animation, with Rigging as a pivotal point of the effort? You will work as a part of the global development team to advance its animation production tools and processes, especially in the areas of animation and rigging.

What you'll get to do:

  • Develop core tools, plugins, nodes and applications used by Animation and Rigging, mostly in Autodesk Maya
  • Work alongside some of the best artists and developers in the world and have an opportunity to make significant and varied contributions to a modern and unique Character Animation Pipeline
  • Advance a modern and dynamic toolset that is proven on high-end productions, making a significant contribution to our large roster of upcoming feature animation and film VFX projects

What you bring:

  • At least 2 years proven experience working directly on, and in close collaboration with users of, rigging and animation tools
  • Knowledge and experience of current rigging, animation and deformation techniques and algorithms
  • Demonstrable knowledge of a high end DCC application and its API (Maya or Houdini)
  • Proficient Python Developer
  • Intermediate or above C++ knowledge including performance optimisation
  • A tertiary qualification in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering or Computer Science, or demonstrable equivalent experience applicable to mathematical and engineering tasks
  • Ability to work as part of a team and flexibility to work alternatively to both strict specifications and more open and creative challenges
  • A passion for regularly working with end-user clients and production staff

The following will be considered a bonus, and might become required learning during your contribution to the project:

  • Rigging experience (experienced riggers are welcome to apply!)
  • An appreciation of design aesthetics
  • UI/UX design and development experience
  • More advanced C++ skill level
  • GPU development skills

What we offer you:

  • The opportunity to join a growing, independently owned and operated, award-winning studio!
  • A chance to contribute to the success of ground-breaking animated feature films
  • Exposure to working within a USD pipeline
  • A dedicated Learning and Development team focused on your personal career growth
  • Flexible work arrangements, with work from home options
  • A generous leave policy including paid annual leave, sick days, as well as 'Volunteer' days to support those causes close to your heart!
  • A world-renowned working environment packed with social clubs, activities and events
  • A variety of employee benefits including breakfast, free use of barista coffee machines and snacks galore!

If this sounds like the opportunity you've been waiting for, then we want to hear from you. Submit your application to the link below!

title: newAnimation R&D Programmer: Computer Vision and ML
description:
Job reference

4057617003

Company Name

Rockstar Games San Diego & Toronto

Salary

Competitive

Location

Oakville, Canada

Country

Canada

Industry sector

Programming

Job start date

ASAP

Posted date

10/03/2022

Experience Level

Junior-Associate

Job type

Permanent | Full Time

Remote / Hybrid

No

At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar is currently seeking an Animation Programmer with an interest in researching Computer Vision and Machine Learning.

We are looking for a talented engineer to help us develop advanced facial performance capture, animation, and rigging technology for our character based games. You should have strong initiative, a detailed knowledge of image processing, photogrammetry, and machine/deep learning techniques, as well as an interest in realistic, high quality facial performance capture.

RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Join our core animation technology team and work closely with performance capture, animation, rigging, technical art, and tools teams across different Rockstar studios.
  • Research, develop, maintain, extend, and support a wide range of image/video/mesh processing, surface reconstruction, animation, and rigging performance capture technology, editing pipelines, tools, and runtime systems.
  • Keep up to date with the latest academic and industry breakthroughs, independently research and develop improvements to continuously push our technology forward.

QUALIFICATIONS
  • A degree in Computer Science or a related discipline, or equivalent industry experience.
  • Experience developing within a large existing codebase, collaborating or working independently within a large team.

SKILLS
  • Strong Python programming skills.
  • Expertise in image, video or mesh processing and computer vision techniques, photogrammetry, and surface reconstruction.
  • Practical success in data engineering, applying the latest machine learning/deep learning (ML/DL) approaches to production scale problems.
  • Ability to research and develop latest published ML techniques and models, and derive new solutions based on established ones.
  • Good communication skills, ability to clearly share complex technical information with programmers, technical artists, animators, and riggers.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
  • Industry experience working on AAA character based games, or character based VFX animation.
  • C/C++ and C# programming skills.
  • Strong 3D math skills.
  • Knowledge of standard ML deployment technologies - Docker, Kubernetes, Portainer, etc.
  • Proficiency in animating or rigging (using skeletal bones or blend shapes) in 3DS Max, Maya, or Blender, etc.
  • Strong R&D mindset, adept at taking the initiative on researching and experimenting with new ideas, solutions, and technologies.
  • Passion for character based games, good eye for facial performance capture.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a resume and cover-letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race.

At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar Toronto is on the lookout for experienced Tools Programmers who possess a passion for Tools development and improving workflows. This is a full time permanent position based out of Rockstar's unique game development studio in Oakville.

WHAT WE DO


  • We create and maintain software tools that are used by all game development disciplines to support the creation of all Rockstar Games projects.
  • These software tools range from digital content exporters, a data processing asset pipeline to game, CI/CD automation systems and UI editors.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Work within the Tools team on all animation related technology, mainly focused on animation exporters, editors and pipelines.
  • Collaborate with animators, collating requirements and developing solutions to the technical challenges faced when building hugely complex and ambitious video games.
  • Maintaining and fixing bugs in the toolchain.
  • Implement tasks to specification defined by the Lead Tools programmers.

QUALIFICATIONS
  • A degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or equivalent work experience.

SKILLS
  • Programming skills (e.g. C++ and/or C#).
  • Knowledge of 3D mathematics (e.g. linear algebra, trigonometry and matrices).
  • Problem solving skills.
  • Strong communication skills as well as the ability to work within a team.
  • Ability to work within a schedule and deliver effectively to deadlines.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
  • Experience with Motionbuilder and/or Maya.
  • Experience working with animators and riggers.
  • Games industry experience working on AAA titles.
  • Passion for creating tools and working closely with your user base.
  • Knowledge of Rockstars' game titles and passion for playing videogames.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a CV and cover-letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race.

title: Machinery Mover
description:
Industrial Riggers & Machinery Movers Wanted

Job Type: Full-time:

Salary: $60,000.00 to $85,000.00 /year

About Wingenback Inc.

Since 1975, Wingenback Ltd. has been providing businesses and organizations across North America with premier services as high-end industrial moving and millwrighting. We have grown over the years to serve hundreds of clients in a variety of industries including; Printing, Stamping, Automation, Automotive, Electrical and Mechanical, Machine tools, Telecommunications, Health care and others.

What Wingenback Offers:

  • Highly competitive compensation (Starting wage to negotiate based on experience)
  • Career opportunity through internal advancement
  • Bonus program
  • Shared benefit package
  • Dental care
  • Extended heath care
  • Group RRSP program after 2 years
  • Great company culture
  • Training programs

Responsibilities:

  • Machinery Moving & Rigging experience preferred
  • Extensive knowledge in load securement and transportation
  • Operate rigging equipment i.e. Forklifts, scissor lifts
  • Willing to work long, non-standard hours when the need arises
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Adhere to company & customer policies and provisions

Qualifications and Education Requirements

  • Great attitude and willingness to learn
  • Class AZ Driver’s License preferred
  • Machinery Moving & Rigging experience preferred
  • Extensive knowledge in load securement and transportation preferred
  • Operate rigging equipment i.e. Forklifts, scissor lifts preferred

Part-time hours: 40-50 per week

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $60,000.00-$85,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Overtime

Experience:

  • driver: 1 year (preferred)
  • delivery driver: 1 year (preferred)
  • driving: 1 year (preferred)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Artiste d'armature, contenu d'animation
description:
Description de l'entreprise


Entreprise fondée et dirigée par un ancien artiste, notre mission est de donner aux artistes talentueux la liberté et les ressources dont ils ont besoin pour fournir un travail de qualité et s’épanouir dans un environnement de travail amusant et créatif.


Description du poste


L’Artiste d’armature crée des armatures et squelettes 3D pour différents types d’objets, de véhicules, de personnages et de créatures, dans le respect des exigences de qualité élevées de Rodeo FX.

Principales responsabilités

  • Créer des armatures 3D pour différents types d’objets, véhicules, personnages et créatures ;
  • Créer le squelette et rigger l'anatomie interne d'une créature, afin de piloter la déformation finale de la peau ;
  • Créer des rigs scriptés de qualité et les affiner en fonction des besoins des animateurs et des départements en aval ;
  • Mettre en place et peaufiner les rigs des personnages, des corps/visages, des tissus/déformateurs et des surfaces dures ;
  • Collaborer avec les modélisateur.trice.s et animateur.trice.s afin de veiller à l’efficacité de l’armature d’un accessoire 3D de façon à ce que ses mouvements soient crédibles ;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le.la Superviseur.e en images de synthèse et le.la Chef.fe d’équipe d’armature pour trouver des solutions et des approches créatives et techniques qui améliorent les accessoires 3D, tout en respectant les spécifications et les délais du projet ;
  • Si nécessaire, participer au développement d'outils et de techniques pour le département ;
  • Effectuer un contrôle de qualité pour s’assurer que toutes les normes techniques et créatives soient respectées sur les prises de vue avant leur soumission pour révision et approbation, et intégrer rapidement les modifications demandées ;
  • Tenir la production et l'équipe de projet informées de l'état d'avancement du travail, des enjeux à résoudre et des ramifications des problèmes rencontrés, recommander des solutions potentielles ;
  • Veiller au respect des échéances et informer rapidement l'équipe de projet si des délais additionnels sont à prévoir.

Qualifications
  • Expérience dans un poste similaire dans l'industrie d'Animation ;
  • Excellente connaissance du logiciel Maya ;
  • Expérience en programmation avec le langage Python ;
  • Bonne compréhension des schémas anatomiques (bipèdes, quadrupèdes, squelettes et muscles) et des expressions faciales ;
  • Connaissance des outils de modélisation pour la déformation par mélange de formes ;
  • Connaissance des outils d'animation pour la création de test d'animation de déformation ;
  • Excellent sens des priorités et du respect des délais.

Informations supplémentaires
  • Contrat permanent à temps plein;
  • 5 jours de congé de maladie payé;
  • 2 jours de congé additionnel au temps des Fêtes;
  • Assurances collectives, accès au service en ligne Dialogue et à un programme d’aide aux employés;
  • REER avec cotisation de l'employeur;

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Swamper
description:
Roil Projects Inc. (Grande Prairie) is currently hiring for swamper/rigger positions. We're looking for eager individuals willing to come to work with a Can Do attitude.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

-Arrive to work when scheduled, clean shaven, and fit for duty

-Ability to work in all weather conditions and an always-changing atmosphere

-Obtaining client/contractor safety orientations year round and update when necessary

-Assist operators to chain up truck, setup and demobe of picker truck, and load securement

-Monitor work area for hazardous and changing conditions throughout the job

Job Components:

- Competitive wages throughout the industry

- Potential for apprenticeships after probation period

- Benefits after 6 months

  • dental care
  • health care
  • vision care

Job Requirements:

-Have a valid Class 5 Licence (Clean Abstract) and reliable personal transportation

-Possess valid H2S, CSO, and First Aid Ticket(s), accompanied by other safety tickets if possible

-Be willing to work all hours of the day and long shifts (Weekends included)

Please contact us by:

Emailing in a copy of your resume to the address(s) provided

You can also visit our website at roil.ca and click on our 'careers' link to fill out an application

Please include valid copies of current safety tickets

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Apprenticeship

Salary: $23.00-$30.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • On call
  • Overtime
  • Weekends

COVID-19 considerations:
Anyone visiting the facilities must follow all provincial rules and regulations regarding Covid-19. Anyone entering the building/yard/shop must wear a mask.

Licence/Certification:

  • Drivers License (preferred)
  • H2S Alive (required)
  • First Aid Certification (required)
  • CSO (required)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Character TD (Rigger) (DNEG Animation)
description:
Description

Position at DNEG

Rédigé au masculin pour alléger le texte
Depuis 2014, le département d'Animation chez DNEG collabore avec des cinéastes et des propriétaires de propriétés intellectuelles pour créer des long métrages d'animation de haute gamme. Présentement en production sur des films d'animation d'envergure, nous cherchons de nouveaux talents pour joindre notre équipe grandissante. Ensemble, nous donnerons vie à la vision des grands studios hollywoodiens et des productions indépendantes en prospérant sur la collaboration et l'énergie créative de notre équipe! Visitez notre site web pour en savoir plus sur le département d'Animation chez DNEG: https://www.dneg.com/dneg-animation/
Notre objectif est de rivaliser avec les meilleurs du secteur et nous nous appuierons sur nos brillants artistes Character TD pour créer des plate-formes d'animation pour les personnages, les créatures, les accessoires et les véhicules qui donne vie à une histoire animée.
Notre équipe utilise sa connaissance approfondie de ses spécialisations de personnage pour développer, tester et maintenir les configurations de mouvement et de déformation des personnages. En travaillant en étroite collaboration avec notre équipe de modélisation, nos superviseurs de montage et nos responsables / superviseurs d'animation, nos Character TD aident à développer de nouvelles techniques pour créer des meilleures plates-formes efficaces afin de rationaliser le processus de production.
De temps en temps, il peut être nécessaire de mettre en œuvre des outils internes pour aider à la création de plates-formes d'animation. Vous serez suffisamment expérimenté pour anticiper et communiquer tout problème lié à la pipeline et garantir le respect des protocoles de pipeline de production d'animation long metrage.
Qualifications
  • Années d'expérience démontrées ave des projets majeurs de personnage ou de créatures
  • Connaissance approfondie de votre domaine de spécialisation de personnage (anatomie corporelle, expression faciale, script orienté vers les objets, gestion des outils)
  • Expérience de collaboration avec l'équipe d'animation pour développer des systèmes de mouvement intuitifs et de déformation des personnages
  • Connaissance approfondie de Maya en plus de compétences de script élémentaires avec Python ou Mel
  • Fortes compétences visuelles et artistiques et à l'aise avec les aspects techniques du travail des personnages / créatures
  • Connaissance des problèmes de pipeline et d'un environnement de post-production important en personnages / créatures
Atouts
  • Compétences en programmation / script (Python, Maya aPI, C ++) pour le développement de modules et d'outils
  • Expérience de simulation de tissu avec nCloth, Houdini ou similaire
  • Expérience avec Unreal Engine ou d'autres logiciels de rendu en temps réel
À propos de toi
  • Esprit d'équipe
  • Travaille bien de façon autonome
  • Proactif et bon communicateur
  • Excellentes compétences en gestion du temps et en organisation
  • Capacité d'adaptation à gérer différentes tâches et attentes
  • Bonne attention aux détails
  • Débrouillard et orienté vers la résolution de problèmes
À propos de nous

Nous sommes DNEG, un des leaders mondiaux d'effets visuels, d'animation et de conversion stéréo pour des longs métrages et pour la télévision, avec des studios à Londres, Vancouver, Mumbai, Los Angeles, Chennai, Montréal, Chandigarh, Hyderabad et Goa.

*******************************************

Since 2014 DNEG’s Animation division has been collaborating with filmmakers and IP owners to create high-end animated feature films. Currently in production on major animated features we are looking for new talent to join our growing team. Thriving on collaboration and the creative energy it provides, we will craft together spectacular visuals and bring to life the vision of both major Hollywood studios and independent productions! Visit our website to find out more about Animation at DNEG: https://www.dneg.com/dneg-animation/

We aim to compete with the best in the business and rely on our talented Character TD’s to create animation rigs for characters, creatures, props and vehicles that bring an Animated story to life.

Our team use their thorough knowledge of their character specialisations to develop, test and maintain character motion and deformation set ups. Working closely with our Modelling team, Rigging Supervisors and Animation Leads/Supervisors, our Character TDs help to develop new techniques to create better and more efficient rigs to streamline the production process.

From time to time it may be a requirement to implement proprietary tools to aid in the creation of animation rigs. You’ll be experienced enough to anticipate and communicate any pipeline issues and ensure adherence to the DNEG Animation production pipeline protocols.

Must Have

  • Proven years of experience with major character or creature projects
  • Thorough knowledge of your area of character specialisation (body anatomy, facial expression, object orientated scripting, tool management)
  • Experience collaborating with Animation to develop intuitive motion systems and character deformation
  • Full working knowledge of Maya with elemental scripting skills using Python or Mel
  • Strong visual and artistic skills, and must be comfortable with the technical aspects of character/creature work where appropriate
  • Familiarity with pipeline issues and a big character/creature heavy post-production environment

Nice to Have

  • Programming/scripting skills (Python, Maya aPI, C++) for module and tool development
  • Cloth Simulation experience using nCloth, Houdini or similar
  • Experience in Unreal Engine or other real-time rendering softwares

About You

  • Team oriented.
  • Works well without constant supervision
  • Proactive and a good communicator
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Adaptable at handling different tasks and expectations
  • Good attention to detail
  • Resourceful and a good problem solver


About Us
We are DNEG, one of the world’s leading VFX and animation studios for the creation of award-winning feature film, television and multiplatform content. We employ nearly 7,000 people with worldwide offices and studios across North America (Los Angeles, Montréal, Toronto, Vancouver), Europe (London) and Asia (Bangalore, Chandigarh, Chennai, Mumbai).

title: Rigging Lead
description:
The Rigging Lead adds controls to digital characters. These controls are used to position, move, and pose the models. Rigging requires an understanding of anatomy and expression, and riggers work closely with animators to design a set of controls that support all of the desired range of poses and behaviors. Scripting is often used to construct more sophisticated rigs, so it is valuable for a rigger to have good programming skills.

The Rigging Lead is responsible for creation, revision, maintenance and support of the digital assets, responding to guidance and review notes from the Director as well as Creative and Technical Supervisors and Directors. Digital assets must meet standards and specifications with respect to appearance and aesthetics, user interface, performance, and robustness.


Responsibilities

  • Work with Modelers to create a model that meets the rigging and cfx technical requirements.
  • Collaborates in the character design process to ensure that the rigs will allow the characters to have the look and the complete range of motion required for the project.
  • Understanding of body and facial deformations.
  • Understanding of cloth, hair and rigid body simulations.
  • Able to provide technical support for the animation team.
  • Writes utility scripts and software code that streamline character set-up / rigging process.
  • Must be able to work efficiently as part of a team or independently.
  • Must have strong problem solving and communication skills.
  • Motivates, mentors and supports the team to consistently strive towards excellence.
  • Work with CG Supervisor to prioritize tasks and inform key individuals of progress, changes or any other critical issues.
  • Develops realistic skeletal rigs for a variety of humanoids and complex creatures
  • Creates tools with the Maya API and MEL scripts to enable animators to create realistic animation
  • Work with senior TD’s in the studio to develop and integrate tools into a robust pipeline

Requirements

  • 4 years minimum experience working as a Character Rigger in Maya in a professional production environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to rig a variety of characters/objects in a realistic, non-cartoon manner
  • Extensive knowledge of anatomy and a thorough understanding of bio-mechanics, kinesiology for humanoid and animals
  • Thorough understanding of weighting and skinning and be able to work interactively with modelers to resolve challenges
  • Must be proficient in both MEL and Python, Maya API, and Perl scripting skills
  • Ability to supervise and mentor rigging artists
  • Great attitude and ability to work with others and communicate well with all team members
  • Strong ability to solve problems quickly and creatively
  • Background or experience in traditional arts which shows a thorough understanding of physical motion, weight, balance and volume preservation.

title: Red Seal Crane Operator
description:
Red Seal Crane Operator

Seaspan Shipyards is proud to be Canada’s long-term, strategic shipbuilding partner for the Canadian Coast Guard and Royal Canadian Navy. As a direct result of this work, while creating jobs and rebuilding our domestic shipbuilding industry, Seaspan Shipyards is delivering on the promise of ships built in Canada, by Canadians.

Vancouver Shipyards, based in North Vancouver, has a very busy and exciting year ahead, as we continue to make progress on the first of two 174m long Joint Support Ships (JSS) for the Royal Canadian Navy – the largest ships ever built in Canada! We are also constructing an Offshore Oceanographic Science Vessel (OOSV) for the Canadian Coast Guard and have secured significant contracts to build a second JSS, a Polar Icebreaker and several Multi-Purpose Vessels. These projects will bring long-term job stability for many years to come.

Now is the best time to be part of Canada’s shipbuilding industry! Join us and be part of the regeneration of the shipbuilding tradition and become a member of a talented, diverse team that is forging a bright future for Canadian shipbuilding at one of the most modern shipyards in North America.

Please send us your resume today!

Seaspan Vancouver Shipyards is currently seeking a Red Seal Certification, B.C. Level “A” or Equivalent crane operator to work with our Services Department. This position will include the operating of mobile cranes up to 80 tons as well as our 300 Ton Goliath gantry crane “Big Blue”.

All candidates must show proof of:

  • Perform pre-operational inspections including hazard assessments, calculating crane capabilities and weight to prepare for rigging and hoisting.
  • Operate mobile crane to lift, move, position, flip, turn or place equipment and materials with single or multiple hook applications.
  • Safely and effectively follow rigger's signals.
  • Work with our Maintenance Department to ensure routine maintenance of crane equipment.
  • Helps to resolve any customer concerns while representing the company in a professional manner.
  • Following and adhering to all site rules at all times.
  • Attend toolbox meetings in a constructive and contributive manner.

Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • Journeyman Red Seal Certification, B.C. Level “A” or Equivalent.
  • 5+ years’ experience operating a crane.
  • Forklift and telehandler (zoom boom) tickets considered an asset.
  • Ability to communicate and interact effectively.
  • Ability to remain alert and maintain a high level of concentration.
  • Good interpersonal skills and customer service orientation.
  • Understands the operations and limitations of the equipment.
  • Mechanical ability to make minor repairs when needed.


These are Union roles with Marine & Shipbuilders - Local 506 and offers an excellent health, welfare & pension package after the completion of 480 hours.


If you are interested in future opportunities, please apply online today; OR email your resume directly to: tradesrecruitment@seaspan.com


Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, aboriginal persons, and persons with disabilities.


Disclaimers:

By applying, you agree that Seaspan may share your resume with our Union partner, Marine and Shipbuilders Union Local 506.

Note: Unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies will not be accepted.

Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request.

title: Industrial Millwright/Machinery Mover
description:
What is the opportunity?

As a Redmond & Associates Industrial Millwright/Machinery Mover, you will be aiding your team with quick and effective assembly and disassembly of our customer’s manufacturing machinery. Although millwrighting is the primary role of this position, all of our millwrights are eventually trained over time to become a qualified Forklift Operator, Rigger and Machinery Mover as well. This position does not require certification, but any industry-related experience is valued. If you enjoy good, honest work with your hands, and the opportunity to do something different each day, you could build a great career with us as you learn and develop new skills.

**If you are an apprentice Millwright, this position will offer you the hours needed to complete your apprenticeship**

What will you do?

  • Dismantle, relocate and reassemble industrial machinery (ie. CNCs, Lathes, Boring Mills, Grinders, Lasers, Milling Machines, Presses, Shears, etc.)
  • Assist in loading, unloading and moving industrial machines, forklifts and other company equipment onto trailers on location and within our warehouse
  • Proactively take ownership reporting equipment performance and resolving/preventing equipment damage/malfunction when possible
  • Diligently fill out paperwork & relevant reports relating to the days’ work
  • Proactively engage with clients on site

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Millwrighting experience
  • Positive attitude, discipline to work hard
  • Punctual & reliable team-player
  • Demonstrated passion for learning and growing, as well as success in hands-on work
  • Drive and self-motivation, as well as excellent communication skills and emotional intelligence
  • Ability to follow the leadership of your crew leader
  • Ability to work flexible hours
  • Own transportation to work; valid driver’s license
  • Ability to lift 50lbs
  • Speak, read and write English fluently
  • Basic Hand Tools
  • Desire to also learn the skillset of an Industrial Machinery Moving

Nice-to-have

  • Machinery Moving experience
  • Rigging Experience
  • Experience operating forklifts and overhead cranes
  • Warehousing experience

What’s in it for you?

  • For an apprentice: signed hours toward your certification
  • A comprehensive benefits program including health, medical and dental group benefits
  • Competitive compensation, with progression at certain employment milestones
  • Overtime available
  • Excellent career development and access to a variety of learning experiences
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and hard-working team.
  • Paid training & professional development
  • Opportunity for growth and advancement within the company
  • $125 safety boot allowance per calendar year
  • Free parking

About R&A

Redmond & Associates is a business built upon the values of honesty, efficiency, hard work and dedication. The company was founded in Oshawa, Ontario as a family run business in 1996 by Tony and Jennifer Redmond. At first, they started out small with a 1400 square foot facility, but with the loyalty and perseverance of their employees and founders, their success began to grow, eventually leading them to their current warehouse in Mississauga, Ontario, where they operate out of a 35,000 sq. ft. facility. The growth and success that Redmond & Associates has experienced can be attributed to the hardworking employees, managers and founders who keep their customers satisfied time and time again.

Our goal at Redmond & Associates is to provide excellent service and efficient single source moving solutions for all of our customers. We take pride in our work and are dedicated to exceeding our customers’ expectations by catering to each customer’s individual needs. We employ millwrights and riggers with many years of experience. In addition to this, we are a part of SC&RA (specialized carriers and rigging association) and OTS (Ontario Trucking Association). With Redmond and Associates you can always be sure that the job will be done right and on time. Worry free moving services is what we specialize in. For more information, please visit www.redmondmovers.com

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $50,000.00-$80,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Mississauga, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Millwright: 1 year (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Millwright Certification (preferred)

title: Telecommunication Tower Technician (Rigger)
description:
Our team is our family. We are an employee focused, Canadian owned, business with a team of highly skilled and expertly trained employees. At Rigarus, we know our success is a direct result of our staff and their day-to-day successes. It’s time you worked for a company that appreciates your skills and helps you grow throughout your career.

Rigarus is looking for the best talent in the communications and construction industries. Our go word is RELIABLE. We want people who can be depended on so that our customers can depend on us. Are you the one who is solving problems, improving efficiency, and consistently standing out above the others? Sounds like you were made to work here. You’re going to love it at Rigarus Construction.

We offer uplifting careers in construction, project management, fabrication and other positions with great salaries and benefits. Our staff receive professional training and development on a regular basis to help them maintain that expertise.

  • Competitive wages with great opportunity for growth
  • Paid holidays and personal leave days
  • Employer paid group benefits
  • Group RRSP Plan with employer matching contributions
  • Per Diem / LOA with paid travel time
  • Annual boot and clothing allowance
  • Industry specific PPE provided
  • Training, development, and career planning
  • Employee referral bonus
  • Employee assistance plan

Rigarus Construction Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including decisions to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs.

Telecommunication Tower Technician (Rigger)

Duties and responsibilities

  • Install & service communication towers, rooftops, and various site types for major wireless carriers in Canada
  • Climb towers at heights of up to 500ft to perform the safe installation of steel structures, components, hardware, etc.
  • Antenna installation and alignments
  • Cable termination and splicing
  • Communication with PMs to see projects through, from start to completion, with the support of field crew
  • Travel within Canada for extended periods
  • Implement construction deliverables on a project-by-project basis, client submittals/checklists
  • Safe installation of steel structures, components, and associated general procedures
  • Knowledge of safe rigging practices
  • Willing to work outdoors and be exposed to all types of weather
  • Installation of antenna and transmission line systems on towers, roof-tops, and other structures
  • Performing all general ground duties associated with tower construction and equipment shelter
  • Run sweep test gear on lines and antennas.
  • Perform plumb & tensions, both pulse time method and use of Dillon meters.
  • Read and follow construction drawings or specialized methods of procedures to perform installation or maintenance on equipment or sites.
  • Participate in daily tailboard safety meetings
  • Communicate with Project Managers, Foremen, Lead-Hand, and other crew members daily
  • Work/Drive-in compliance with Health and Safety and MTO guidelines.
  • Perform job tasks in a safe manner in accordance with company policy and regulations.

Qualifications

Requirements include:

  • Experience specifically with telecommunication tower rigging
  • General construction knowledge
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills (able to work closely with others for long periods of time)
  • Must be comfortable working at heights;
  • Must be in good physical condition with the ability to bend and lift 50 lbs.
  • Safety conscious, proven positive attitude, and a strong commitment to customer service
  • Must be available to travel up to three weeks at a time as needed (longer periods can be expected on occasion)

Additional assets include:

  • Leadership qualities fortified with the ability to coach and delegate.
  • Adherence to safety standards, working knowledge of all safety & quality control requirements, fall protection practices, regulations, and procedures for crew
  • First aid training
  • Valid driver's license and driving record meeting the company policy conditions.
  • A-Restricted or AZ license and comply with CVOR regulations
  • Microsoft Office skills (Excel, Word, and Outlook)
  • 2 years of industry experience preferred
  • Proficient computer, communication, and organizational skills
  • Experience with major Canadian wireless carriers

Important Information for Applicants:

  • Candidates must submit a clean driver’s abstract to drive company vehicles
  • Candidates must submit a criminal record check
  • Drug-free workplace and zero tolerance safety program

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $23.00-$30.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • How many years of Working at Heights do you have?
  • How many years of Climbing experience do you have?
  • Do you live in Canada?

Experience:

  • telecommunication: 1 year (preferred)

title: Rigger
description: Looking for a mid/senior rigger for our team. Comfortable with characters/props/vehicles. Strong Python knowledge. Good problem-solving skills. Good team member. Bring it on!

title: Rigger / Monteur (Equest)
description:
Saturday, April 2, 2022

Are you ready to take your career to new heights? Join our growing team at WesTower Communications Ltd. as an Aerial Field Technician!

We are Canada's largest network service contractor offering Engineering, Design, Fabrication, Construction, Project Management, and Maintenance Services for telecommunication carriers, independent tower operators, broadcast, and utility.

We offer competitive wages with paid out living allowances, paid holidays, comprehensive benefits, RSP matching, stock options, a generous referral bonus program and opportunities to further develop your skillset and grow your career.

Job Description
  • Tower and cell-site installation and routine maintenance
  • Antenna modifications / adds
  • Repair or replace defective equipment on tower
  • Perform tests equipment to locate transmission faults
  • Extensive travel throughout the province and or country
Qualifications
  • 2 years of basic knowledge of construction and tool manipulation
  • Telecom troubleshooting experience preferred but not required
  • Ability to interpret engineered drawings and knowledge of fibre and DC drawings
  • Knowledge of OTDR test equipment and fibre fusion
  • Demonstrate strong adherence to safety procedures
  • Good physical condition and comfortable working at heights
  • Willing to work outdoors and be exposed to all types of weather
  • Valid Canadian driver's license is required
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada
  • Must be mechanically inclined
  • Strong written and verbal skills
  • Clean Criminal record
  • Maintain a professional working relationship with co-workers and clients
  • Must be reliable, trustworthy and have a positive attitude!
At WesTower Communications Ltd. you can expect to be treated fairly. We recognize that it is our people who drive the success of our business, so we make it our priority to foster inclusive work environments welcomed to diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to accommodating prospective employees. We proudly offer a drug-free workplace with a zero-tolerance safety program.

Value

title: Rigger
description:
Are you physically fit, love working outside and not afraid of heights? Are you looking for a career in a cutting edge, growing industry with competitive wages, a generous benefits package and accelerated performance related pay? If so, Tall City Telecom Solutions Inc. (TCTS) is seeking you – a Telecommunications Aerial Technician.

Must not be afraid of heights and must be physically able to climb towers while utilizing proper use of personal safety equipment. Tower climbing experience is required .
Working knowledge of fall protection practices and procedures.
Ability to take direction and follow instructions to successfully complete assigned tasks in a safe, efficient and timely manner.
Punctual, reliable, accountable.
Team/safety focused.
Able to understand the principle of tower erection, read blueprints and understand drawings.
Able to identify problems and find reasonable solutions.
Perform all general ground procedures associated with installation.
Ensure that all company equipment is well maintained and in safe operating condition as well as conduct inventory inspections and sort received materials on site.
Foreman, Lead hand and Rigger/General Labourer full-time, permanent positions available. Compensation based on experience.

Relevant training, equipment and PPE provided
Valid Class 5 driver’s license with clean abstract
Salary: $22-$50 per hour (based on role and experience)
Travel Allowance (including paid flights, LOA and per diems where applicable)
Benefits package and RRSP matching (after 3 months)
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $22.00-$50.00 per hour

Additional pay:

Overtime pay
Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Overtime
Weekend availability
Experience:

cell tower climbing: 1 year (preferred)
Licence/Certification:

Driver's license and clean driving record (preferred)
Hiring Insights

title: Rigger
description:
PERMANENT - FULL-TIME

RIGGER

REPORTS TO: DIRECTOR TECHNICAL ANIMATION

Responsibilities
  • Create rigs for various characters and creatures;
  • Export characters to the engine;
  • Establish character parameters and simulation in the engine;
  • Suggest new solutions to improve physics systems;
  • Understand the engine’s technical constraints;
  • Understand the development team’s technical constraints;
  • Develop new tools to facilitate and optimize rigging.
Experience & Qualifications
  • 3+ year of game industry experience as a Character Rigger/Skinner;
  • Must have participated in at least one full videogame production, preferably a AAA on current consoles;
  • Diploma in 3D Animation or equivalent;
  • Knowledge of Maya is mandatory;
  • Scripting Knowledge is an asset (Python, MEL);
  • Thorough understanding of animation principles;
  • Good understanding of Human Anatomy and facial expression is an asset;
  • Game engine experience recommended.
Interpersonal Qualities
  • Ability to learn from others and share knowledge;
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills;
  • The maturity to give and receive constructive feedback is expected;
  • Ability to adapt and embrace change is mandatory;
  • The desire to push the boundaries of animation in video games is required.
Motivation & Interests
  • Passion and ambition for videogames are essential!
Apply Now
