title: Lead Rigger (3D)
description:
Job Description


The position of Lead Rigger requires someone with a good general knowledge of Maya and excellent specific knowledge of its constraint, deformer and dynamics systems, and also be proficient with python and Maya tool development. He/she should have several years’ experience rigging in a broadcast / film production environment. Successful applicants will be open to direction, have good communication skills, leadership skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with multiple tasks in a fast paced production. A Lead Rigger will work closely with the Rigging Supervisor to ensure working practices are in line with department standards, and also contribute to the ongoing development of tools and practices.


Key Responsibilities


•Develop show specific custom rigs.

•Maintain show specific code and tools.

•Schedule and delegate work.

•Liaise with Rigging Supervisor regarding project details.

•Provide regular progress updates to production manager and Rigging supervisor on any technical bottlenecks concerning the rigging schedule.

•Design, create, test and maintain character set ups.

•Provide technical feedback to modelling dept.

•Collaborate with animators to design motion controls.

•Create secondary dynamics systems.

•Work with production management to prioritize tasks.

•Troubleshooting problems with animated rig.

•Communicate with the overseas studio.

•QC the external asset assignments and ensure the outsource partner has clear direction from a rigging perspective.

•Prop rigging and modelling experience.

•Character or more advanced rigging is an asset.

•Experience in episodic animation is required.

•Look out for Python scripting experience, will be a big asset.


Key Requirements


•Must have at least 6 years’ experience working as an Character Rigger(or similar position) in either broadcast or feature film work.

•Must be comfortable with outsource management with an emphasis on clear communication and follow through.

•Should have at least 3 years’ experience working as a Lead Rigger in either broadcast or feature film work.

•Must have an excellent working knowledge of rigging in Maya.

•Task Driven, self-motivated, and proactive.

•Must be open to direction.

•Must demonstrate attention to detail in finishing of assets.

•Must have good leadership skills.

•Must be a good communicator and be fluent in English.

•Knowledge of Python is a must.

•Proficiency in developing tools for Maya a big plus.

•Experience with shotgun (or asset tracking systems) is considered a big plus.

•Experience with GIT is considered a big plus.

•Experience with developing tools in PySide and QT designer considered a big plus.


- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -


Why work with us?


Perks! Perks! Perks! Not only is Brown Bag Films an amazing place full of artists, animators and creators from all corners of the industry, but we focus on helping staff grow and develop in their careers and make them long time team members. Along with a great work environment we offer first-rate health + dental benefits, summer hours, paid Health and Wellness Days, vacation periods that multiply with tenure, and more! We may love animation, but we love our employees even more!


Our Toronto office can be found in the cool and trendy Liberty Village with over 200 artists working on award winning animated children’s content. You will benefit from a competitive compensation package, interesting work and a fun/supportive work environment.


Applicants need to be legally eligible to work in Canada and have Ontario residency.



We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


9 Story Media takes diversity and inclusion seriously and we are committed to ensuring equity in the recruitment process. Candidates from diverse backgrounds, including but not limited to, Indigenous peoples, Racialized and LGBT2SQ+ communities, candidates from a range of ages and religious beliefs and people with disabilities, are encouraged to apply.


As a company, we deliver high-quality kids' content, and we seek to have diverse characters so that all our audience feels represented. We also want the same for our own workforce, and 9 Story Media is committed to looking for all kinds of talent to build a diverse workforce in which all identities are represented and respected.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application and interview process to be successful in performing essential job functions. We’d love to know how we can support your requirements for accommodation.

title: Senior Rigger
description:
About Us...

Versatile Media is a global company that has created an end-to-end virtual production workflow. Our new North American headquarters are based in Vancouver, Canada where we run performance capture and visualization stages that run on real-time technology. Our upcoming LED stage is scheduled to open later this year.

Our Vancouver location is focused on Virtual Production, combining real-time rendering technology, traditional film workflows and proprietary research and development, as well as creating original animation and live action I.P for Sci-Fi and fantasy genres. We offer competitive compensation, flexible schedules and a work/life balance; working alongside a lovely group of talented people.

Why Virtual Production?

The film industry is rapidly moving towards real time feedback. Deformation rigs previously only seen in post production are now at the forefront of visualizing and driving story and motion. High quality rigs, running in real time, is an exciting and constantly growing field. It is our focus to stay with this emerging and ever improving technology.

Who are we looking for?

Versatile Media is looking for a Senior Rigger who is interested in the exciting new field of Virtual Production. Bring your skills and passion to help us develop the next generation of animation and film making tools.

The function of a Senior Rigger at Versatile Media is to work closely with the Asset, Mocap and Animation teams to build rigging and creature FX systems for organic models, hard-surfaced models, and props.

How you will spend your time….
  • Designing efficient rigs appropriate to the production’s needs.
  • Developing and maintaining an efficient dynamics setup for muscles and/or cloth for various creatures.
  • Working with multiple teams on suitability of rigs for assets, mocap and animation
  • Research and development for future rigging tool sets
  • Implementing rigs within unreal
  • Updating and working with metahuman assets

We'd love to hear from you if you have....
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience in a similar role within the gaming or VFX industry.
  • Degree or relevant experience in VFX, Gaming, Computer Graphics.
  • Proficient in current Maya rigging techniques.
  • Experience with muscle and cloth simulations for creature FX a must.
  • Knowledge of creature rigging using Anim Blueprints in Unreal Engine a bonus.
  • Proficiency in Python a must. We will ask for code samples.
  • Knowledge of PySide and PyQt a bonus but not required.
  • Desire to work with new machine learning rigging techniques and procedures.
  • Experience with Ziva Dynamics toolset a plus.
  • Experience developing and maintaining tools for use in a studio pipeline.
  • Able to work independently when required.
  • Excellent time management skills.
  • Interest and ability to mentor other team members and share knowledge.
  • Strong solution-based trouble-shooting skills.
  • Excellent English communication skills both verbal and written.
  • Up-to-date reel and resume showcasing required skills.
  • This job is based in Vancouver and is open to qualified candidates worldwide.

Powered by JazzHR

title: Swamper Rigger for precast
description:
TKL Group is a Toronto based company with production facilities located in both Toronto, Ontario and Niagara Falls, Ontario. TKL Group prides itself in the supply and installation of some of the most intricate precast concrete projects supplied to both Canada and the United States. Although experience is ideal when hiring a candidate for a position, we are also willing to train.



We offer a great target incentive program with bonus pay!

We offer an RRSP program where the company will match a certain amount per month!

Our Company also offers a Benefits package after 3 months!

We are an Essential Precast Manufacturing Company 365 day work environment

Day Shift and overtime as required

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Include, but are not limited to, the following
  • Riggers are expected to tie down loads, rigging lifts, signaling crane movements
  • Overhead crane experience is a must
  • Safe storage and stockpiling of concrete panels as well as other materials
  • Loading precast concrete panels onto trailers for safe transportation to sites
  • Majority of work is outdoors both in winter and summer
  • Available to work overtime and occasional Saturday
  • Hard working, punctual and the ability to work on a team
  • Capable of lifting 50+ Lbs, bending, crouching, kneeling, standing for extended periods

title: Aerial Field Technician (Rigger) - Foreman
description:
Saturday, April 2, 2022

Are you ready to take your career to new heights? Join our growing team at WesTower Communications Ltd. as a Foreman - Aerial Field Technician!

We are Canada's largest wireless/wireline network service contractor offering Engineering, Design, Fabrication, Construction, Project Management, and Maintenance Services for wireless telecommunication carriers and independent tower operators. We aim to make a positive impact nationwide in the Telecom industry and to seek excellence in all aspects of our business.

We offer competitive wages paid out living allowances, paid holidays, comprehensive benefits, RSP matching, stock options, and opportunities to further develop your skillset and grow your career.

Job Description
  • Responsible for managing field crew safely
  • Daily communication to project management and customers on site
  • Supervise tower and cell-site installation
  • Supervise antenna modifications/adds
  • Troubleshoot equipment to locate the transmission faults
  • Completing timesheets
  • Extensive travel throughout the province and/or country
Qualifications
  • Previous experience managing a crew
  • 2-5 years of previous experience with Wireless/ Cell Site installation
  • Strong safety skillset or background
  • Telecom troubleshooting experience required
  • Ability to interpret engineered drawings and knowledge of fibre and DC drawings
  • Demonstrate strong adherence to safety procedures
  • Good physical condition and comfortable working at heights
  • Willing to work outdoors and be exposed to all types of weather
  • Valid Canadian driver's license is required
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada
  • Must be mechanically inclined
  • Strong written and verbal skills
  • Clean Criminal record
  • Maintain a professional working relationship with co-workers and clients
  • Must be reliable, trustworthy and have a positive attitude!
At WesTower Communications Ltd. you can expect to be treated fairly. We recognize that it is our people who drive the success of our business, so we make it our priority to foster inclusive work environments welcomed to diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to accommodating prospective employees. We proudly offer a drug-free workplace with a zero-tolerance safety program.

title: Technical Animator/Rigger
description:
ABOUT THIS POSITION


Digital Extremes is currently seeking a Technical Animator/Rigger to join our team. You will be working closely with the Tech team as well as Animators and Artists to create animator-friendly rigs, tools and scripts. A strong portfolio demonstrating your ability to create animator friendly rigs and MEL scripts is a must. You have superior knowledge and experience with Maya and MEL and a strong understanding of animation techniques. Knowledge of Motion Builder and Python would be preferred extras.


RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Work closely with techs, animators and artists to create animator-friendly rigs, tools and scripts
  • Design and implement processes that support and improve all applicable areas of the animation pipeline
  • Understand and work with the game engine


REQUIREMENTS


  • A portfolio that demonstrates the ability to create animator-friendly rigs and MEL scripts
  • Experience with Maya
  • Knowledge of MEL
  • An understanding of animation techniques
  • Excellent troubleshooting, problem-solving, creativity and organizational skills
  • A genuine enthusiasm and interest in video games


ABOUT DIGITAL EXTREMES


Founded in 1993 by James Schmalz, Digital Extremes ranks as one of the world's top independent video game development studios. Originating with the co-creation of Epic Games' multi-million unit selling Unreal® franchise including Unreal and Unreal Tournament, Digital Extremes went on to develop Dark Sector®, BioShock® for the PlayStation®3, the BioShock 2 multiplayer campaign, and The Darkness® II.

The studio has reached its greatest critical and commercial success with the free-to-play action game, Warframe®, boasting a global community of 50 million registered players on PC, PS4™, Xbox One and Nintendo Switch™.


For more information about Digital Extremes, visit www.digitalextremes.com. To sign up for Warframe, visit www.warframe.com.


WHY WORK AT DIGITAL EXTREMES


Our culture is centered on providing great opportunities to our employees so that everyone feels they are making a meaningful impact. Developing new and existing talent is our long-term focus. We are honored that our work environment has been consistently recognized as one of “Canada’s Top 100 Employers”. We summon you to join our elite team!


The rewards of a career with Digital Extremes include:


  • Competitive salary with bonus opportunities
  • Excellent benefits and paid time off
  • Matching RRSP plan
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Virtual access to Dialogue, our mental wellness and healthcare services app
  • Professional development and career support
  • Work-life balance fitness subsidies

description: description

title: Telecommunications Tower Rigger
description: We currently have immediate openings for Experienced Telecommunication Tower Riggers for our Ontario location.  Telecommunication Tower Riggers perform all required duties associated with the installation of communication towers, accessories, antenna systems on towers or rooftops and any other telecommunications related activities that may be required. Tower Technicians work outdoors in all weather conditions.

title: Carpenter
description:
PattyMac Inc. has over 15 years’ experience as builders of luxury homes, cottages and boathouses in Muskoka, and we stand behind every one of them. At PattyMac we are looking for enthusiastic people to join our hard-working team. If you are looking for a company that provides room for growth and positive work environment, we’d love to hear from you!

We are seeking for a Carpenter, who enjoys working outside, has strong work ethics, good teamwork skills and leadership experience.

Carpenter Responsibilities:

• Building foundations, installing floor beams, laying sub-flooring and installing walls and roofing systems

• Fitting and installing trim, doors, stairs, moulding and hardware

• Measuring, cutting and joining materials made of wood or wood substitutes

• Repairing and renovating wooden structures

• Reading and interpreting blueprints, drawings and sketches

• Inside finishing

Carpenter Requirements:

• Operate a variety of hand and power tools of all types: hammer, drills, chainsaws, skill saws, jack jammer * Install of windows & doors, roof trusses, sheathing, hardware,

• Erect scaffolding and ladders working at heights training a requirement

• Ability to work independently

• Experience working in a physical environment. Must be able to lift 80lbs and work outdoors in all weather conditions

• Valid Ontario driver’s license, as well as transportation to work.

• Minimum 2 years of experience required

Job Type: Full-Time Position

Salary: $25.00 - $35.00 depending on experience

Location: Muskoka Region

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $25.00-$30.00 per hour

title: Carpenter - Ottawa
description:
Job Title: Carpenter

Company: Tamarack Developments

Reports to: Site Superintendent

Location: Ottawa, Ontario

 

Tamarack Developments

Tamarack Homes has a legacy of home-building in Ottawa that dates back to the 1940s when Harold Taggart began building homes for returning war veterans. Since then we have built hundreds of homes in communities across the Ottawa and Kingston regions. We take pride in quality workmanship and creating homes that are more than just houses. The communities we construct are built on excellence and attention to detail. Today, Tamarack Homes continues to be one of the most sought-after home builders in eastern Ontario.

 

We are currently looking for Carpenters for each of the following sites:

- Westwood/Edenwylde (Kanata/Stittsville)

- Cardinal Creek (Orleans)

- Meadows (Barrhaven)

- Findlay Creek (Ottawa South)

 

Work Description

The Carpenter is responsible for the overall delivery of repair work inside Tamarack home building projects.

 

Major Responsibilities:

Carpenter

  • Perform repairs to the internal and external structure while ensuring the buildings are safe.
  • Install structures and fixtures, such as windows, frames, hanging doors and closets, trim or hardware, using carpenter's hand and power tools.
  • Installation of dry-wall, and minor repairs of drywall after home completion should there be a deficiency.
  • Fill cracks and other defects in plaster or plasterboard and sand patch, using patching plaster, trowel, and sanding tool.
  • Sanding surfaces, taping and preparing the home prior to the trades coming in for installation
  • Repair any issues after the trades have been in the homes.
  • Caulk tiles and fixtures, and repair minor deficiencies as required.
  • Recognize problems and deficiencies and provide recommendations to supervisors on how to fix issues, execute and perform repairs.
  • When the trade comes back to repair something meets them on site and oversee their work. While also bringing it to the attention of the Finishing Foreman/ Site Superintendent.
  • Prepare and install cosmetic wood working repairs and replacements.
  • Operate and maintain carpentry tools and equipment in a safe and efficient manner.
  • Work with Finishing Foreman and Site Superintendent to order supplies as they are required during the building phases.
  • Repair all flooring issues, creaking or cracking. Removing and replacing floor pieces as required.
  • Prepare houses for customer move in; ensuring they are ready for delivery.
  • Fix home issues after homeowner move in as per the Home Inspectors and Service Technician's reports on an as-needed basis.
  • Complete checklists to ensure accurate and detailed completion of carpentry duties prior to handover.
  • Perform other related duties, including minor duties of other trades where certification is not required, and the work does not exceed own limitations.
  • Any other duties as required.

 

Statement of Qualifications:
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Certificate of apprenticeship, carpenter. Red Seal is considered a strong asset.
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience as an interior finishing carpenter or performing interior finishing duties.
  • Physically fitness and manual dexterity are required.
  • Quality orientation and attention to detail.
  • Proficiency in reading plans. Recognizing potential discrepancies or errors.
  • Experience in a high-volume home building environment is considered an asset.
  • Able to identify the source of a deficiency and under most circumstances, perform the repair necessary.
  • Knowledge and use of imperial and metric measurements. Strong mathematical reasoning.
  • Ability to use power tools.
  • Demonstrated ability to assist and guide Labourers and Carpenters as needed.
  • Demonstrated critical analysis and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to independently coordinate several simultaneous tasks while maintaining a positive attitude and flexible work style.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate verbally and in writing in English.
  • Good organizational and time management skills, with the ability to complete tasks independently as per the prescribed schedule/timelines.
  • Ability to prioritize tasks based on various schedules (trades, closing, etc).
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work well independently, and a willingness to learn.
  • Demonstrated strong customer service and interpersonal skills in dealing with colleagues, trades, and potentially homeowners.

 

Physical/Sensory Effort/Work Environment

  • Providing service to several people or departments, working under many simultaneous deadlines
  • Sitting or Standing for long periods of time at workstation
  • Heavy manual labor, requires ability to climb ladders, push, pull, lift, carry and manipulate objects of up to 80 lbs.
  • Use of Personal Protection Equipment will be required (e.g. hard-hat, safety boots, etc.)
  • Hazards associated with the construction industry.

 

Application
All candidates are asked to apply via the following link: https://taggartgroup.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=255&source=aWQ9MTk%3D

Any questions regarding the position can be directed to careers@taggart.ca. We thank all candidates for their interest, however only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

For more information on our company, please visit: http://www.taggartgroup.ca.

 

Accommodation
The Taggart Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, physical or mental handicap, or financial ability.


In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with a Disabilities Act, we’re committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. If you require accommodation or special assistance, please send an email to hr@taggart.ca with your request. Your information will be treated as confidential.

title: Lead Hand (Labourers/Carpenters/Apprentices)
description:
• Don't miss this opportunity to take on a pivotal role with a rapidly growing organization
  • Receive extensive benefits and a highly competitive salary of $18-$36+ based on skills and experience
  • Enjoy working in a collaborative and supportive team environment

About Tribuild Contracting

Tribuild Contracting took on its first construction management project, a commercial office interior in downtown Calgary, in the year 1982. Thanks to our high-quality work and excellent customer service we have grown since then into an industry leader with a diverse group of clients including corporate offices, government buildings, and critical facilities. At Tribuild Contracting, we pride ourselves on our services that go above and beyond the normal offerings of our competitors by working closely with our clients to ensure that any disruption that could arise from working in an occupied space is either minimized or taken away completely. 

At Tribuild Contracting, we're equally passionate about the individuals that make up our staff and drive the success of our organization. Our excellent work-life balance and our culture are underpinned by our values of integrity, loyalty, accountability, and balance. Diversity and the different opinions, ideas, viewpoints, and opportunities it generates is also hugely important to us which is why our workforce is more diverse than the Alberta average and its why we're striving to increase the diversity of our organization at all levels.  

For more information, please visit our website.

About the Opportunity 

Currently, Tribuild Contracting is looking for a Lead Hand to work on-site in Winnipeg, MB on a full-time basis. Journeyperson carpenters, labourers, and apprentices are all welcome to apply. 

As our new Lead Hand, you'll train under our Site Supervisor to support work on our projects that focus on critical facilities, specifically regarding chiller plants. You'll work to ensure that our client's projects are built to the highest quality standards and are completed both on time and within budget. You will help conduct safety evaluations, maintain scheduling, track and communicate progress back to the project team and client, while managing the expectations for our various sub-trades.

In order to qualify for this role, you must be willing to learn, with previous experience working with tools; experience in commercial/industrial construction, specifically in critical facilities, is an asset.

As our ideal candidate, you'll be a highly motivated individual with excellent communication skills, the ability to ask relevant questions while taking direction, and an eagerness to learn and train under the Site Supervisor. You are detail-oriented, can multitask, and have pride in what you do. Your passion, your desire to continuously learn and grow, and your ability to build quality relationships with both colleagues and clients will set an example for those working with you and foster a positive and fun working environment.  

Above all, you'll be a dedicated construction professional that is passionate about fostering a safe and productive work site. 

About the Benefits

In return for your hard work and dedication, you will be awarded with highly competitive compensation from $18-$36+/hr based on skills and qualifications along with a wide host of benefits including:

  • Starting wage for General Labourers/Carpenter Helpers is $18/hr.
  • Starting wage for Apprentices at $23.40/hr, dependent on the year of studies.
  • Starting wage for Journeyman Carpenters/Lead Hand at $36/hr.
  • Per diem, accommodations, mileage reimbursement and overtime pay available when travelling.  
  • Full benefits offered through Canada Life.
  • RRSP matching. 
  • Flexible shifts so that you don't miss important moments with your family.
  • A Kindle Fire tablet for both work and personal use.
  • An annual Costco membership.
  • A company cellphone. 
  • Covered mileage as per Canadian standards. 
  • Full support for additional education and training. 
  • Opportunities to customize your role or learn skills outside of your traditional field. 
  • An annual corporate family holiday party with special guests and gifts for kids. 
  • Huge opportunities for career progression - we're rapidly growing and we want our team to grow with us.

But that's not all, upon joining Tribuild Contracting, you'll be welcomed into a family team environment where we take pride in the work that we do but also deliver our product as friends and family. We're passionate about diversity in our organization which is why we invite and encourage applications from individuals that self identify as a member of an equity-seeking group such as female, trans* (trans, transgender, transsexual, genderqueer, two-spirit, transwoman, transman), a visible minority or racialized people, aboriginal or indigenous people, people with a disability, lesbian, gay, or bisexual.  

For the safety and well-being of our clients and employees, we require proof of COVID-19 vaccination before commencing employment. Accommodations will be made for those exempt from the COVID-19 vaccination, based on grounds protected by relevant human rights law.
 
Don't miss this unique opportunity to take on an exciting safety role with a rapidly growing organization - Apply Below!

title: Carpenter
description:
Sibwest Inc., with the head office located at 1495 Bonhill Rd., Unit#12, Mississauga, ON L5T 1M2, has translated their restoration experience into a business that focuses on concrete – new concrete works and restorations. Sibwest’s experience, working for well-established construction companies in the GTA, has told them that there is another approach – «be customer focused».

In addition to providing concrete forming and restoration services for large-scale industrial and commercial construction projects across the GTA, Sibwest is strengthening its expertise in residential and midrise construction, providing cost effective advice to our clients. We build positive relationships that provide future opportunities – client references and repeat business.

THE POSITION:

We are now looking for two skilled, experienced, and hard-working Carpenters to join our team of talented individuals.

The candidates will be responsible for the following:

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Erect and install scaffolding, falsework and other working platforms
  • Prepare layouts in conformance to building codes, using measuring tools
  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings and sketches to determine specifications and calculate requirements
  • Measure, cut, shape, assemble and join materials made of wood, wood substitutes, lightweight steel and other materials
  • Build foundations, install floor beams, lay subflooring and erect walls and roof systems

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Minimum 7 months of experience as a carpenter
  • Secondary school diploma. Post-secondary education is an asset
  • Good English language skills (written and oral)
  • Familiarity with workplace safety, safe lifting and handling procedures

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:

  • Full-time, permanent position consisting of at least 35 weekly work hours
  • The remuneration will be set at CAD$26.10 per hour
  • Occasional overtime may be required for meeting critical deadlines. Overtime pay will apply after 44 hours of work per week and will be remunerated at one and a half times the regular pay rate
  • Address: 1495 Bonhill Rd., Unit#12, Mississauga, ON L5T 1M2
  • Work location: various customers’ sites around GTA and Ontario
  • Great environment with professional individual approach and friendly atmosphere

How to apply:

Please apply by email to sibwest.hires@gmail.com with resume and cover letter. Kindly put “Carpenter” in the subject line. Do not contact the office directly, as resumes and cover letters submitted will be assessed by our management before interviews are scheduled.

Sibwest Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. As such, we welcome all applications from all qualified candidates. However, please note that only those who meet the requirements of the position will be contacted for an interview.

Visit our website https://www.sibwest.ca/  to get more information about our company.

title: Rigger
description:
ABOUT THE JOB

BRON Digital, is a state-of-the-art virtual production and service company, that utilizes the Unreal Engine to develop and produce long-form animation for series television, short-form content, and motion pictures. This division leverages BRON’s extensive experience producing traditional CGI animation to apply and adapt the best practices of linear animation pipelines and marry those with Unreal Engine centered, virtual production workflows. The move allows BRON to broaden and expand its production and produce high quality content with much faster turnarounds.

We are seeking a Rigger to join our Rigging Department. Whether you are looking for fixed-term employment or a freelance gig, check us out!


Requirements

Role & Responsibilities

  • Build, test, and maintain rigs for various types of assets (Characters, Props and Sets) under the supervision of the Rigging Supervisor and working collaboratively with Modelers and Animators.
  • Deliver clean production rigs.
  • Provide clean skin and deformer weighting to satisfy the production’s required articulation standard.
  • Ability to work efficiently and adapt within the existing and changing workflows in Production and Pipe workflows.
  • Provide additional custom deformer solutions and corrective model sculpts as required.
  • Execute rigging efficiently by maintaining a fair level of scripting knowledge (Python, Mel) and understanding the rigging pipeline.


Qualifications

  • Experience with Autodesk Maya is required.
  • Knowledge of (Python, MEL) to understand the inside of the rigging pipeline and execute rigging efficiently.
  • Experience with Mudbox, Zbrush is a plus.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Good communication skills.
  • Experience with the Unreal Engine is a plus.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package, including Extended Health Benefits and Employee Family Assistance Program
  • Paid holiday closure between Christmas and New Year
  • 7 health days per year (prorated per any partial year, and/or contract length)

By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Tower Rigger
description:
We are a cellular contractor looking for some good guys. Looking for someone who is good with heights. Heights ranging from rooftops to 400 feet.

We install lights, remove bird nests, and repair equipment including fiber. We do a lot of maintenance, looking for someone to take over some of the workloads. I will train, no experience is needed.

We guarantee 40hrs a week. We also pay half your fuel cost to get back and forth from the shop!!

We work out of Palmerston ON. Send me a resume and I will probably get you to start the next day!

If we need to work on the road and be gone for a few days, everything is paid for. We don't do much for long hauls. Twice a year if it's good work.

This is a great opportunity for someone or an experienced crew to take.

title: Rigging Artist
description:
Framestore Vancouveris currently looking for a Rigging Artist. Working closely with the CG Supervisor and the Rigging Supervisor, the Rigger will be responsible for building robust and efficient rigs and working with the CG team to implement and support these rigs.


In this role, you will:

  • Identify the production's specific rigging needs with the CG Supervisor, Rigging, Animation, and Modeling Leads;
  • Design efficient rigs appropriate to the production’s needs;
  • Advise modelling teams on the suitability of models for rigging and propose any changes needed;
  • Work with the CG team, implementing the rigs and rigging the assets;
  • Design and implement scripted solutions for maximum speed and efficiency of rigging;
  • Work with leads and supervisors in the testing of rigged assets;
  • During production, support all the rigged assets.


This job is for you if:

  • At least 2 years of experience;
  • Rigging knowledge in industry production software such as Maya or Houdini;
  • Knowledge of other packages an asset, such as Motion Builder;
  • Must have some experience as a rigger on high-end feature film productions;
  • Excellent problem solving and communication skills required;
  • Excellent leadership skills required;
  • A strong sense of self-motivation and ability to work with little supervision required;
  • Linux scripting experience, especially in Bash/Python is desirable.


Interested? What are you waiting for? Apply now; we can't wait to get to know you!

Creativity has diversity at its heart. We celebrate the value of every unique experience by dedicating ourselves to promoting the most diverse and fair, and inclusive culture where employees feel empowered and safe to present themselves at work as such.

Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. Therefore, please inform the company's HR representative if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

title: Rigger junior·e - Dead by Daylight
description:
The rigger is the person whose work allows animator to leverage their skills. They use their strong knowledge of rigging and skinning principles to create the structure that animators need to bring characters to life according to design requirements. 
The rigger also has the necessary knowledge to create well-thought-of and optimized structures depending on production constraints. They share their experience working with polygonal structures of models to get the best possible deformation and follows up with animators to validate the quality and relevance of their work. 

In this role, you will:

  • Understand the technical development vision in animation; 
  • Work withing the technical restraints; 
  • Create rigs and skinning for models with various degrees of complexity; 
  • Suggest new tools and best practices; 
  • Reuse resources wherever possible; 
  • Maintain strong communication with animators and designers; 
  • Assess the impact of methods used during production; 
  • Support animators to optimize the integration and use of animations in engine. 

What we’re looking for:

  • Experience in rigging; 
  • In-depth knowledge of 3D animation; 
  • Willingness to explore new software and technical art advances with curiosity; 
  • Proficiency with Maya animation software; 
  • Production experience with Unreal or Unity is considered an asset; 
  • Understanding of AnimGraph systems; 
  • Experience with motion capture is considered an asset; 
  • Ability to manage priorities; 
  • Proficiency in French and English. 

Dans ce rôle, vous devrez :

  • Comprendre la vision du développement technique en animation ; 
  • Respecter les contraintes techniques ; 
  • Créer des rigs et effectuer le skinning de modèles de diverses complexités ; 
  • Proposer de meilleures pratiques et suggérer de nouveaux outils ; 
  • Réutiliser les ressources lorsque possible ; 
  • Établir une solide communication avec les animateurs et les designers ; 
  • Évaluer l’impact des méthodes utilisées en production ; 
  • Assister les animateurs afin d’optimiser l’intégration et l’utilisation des animations dans le moteur. 

Ce que nous recherchons :

  • Expérience en rigging ; 
  • Connaissances approfondies en animation 3D 
  • Curiosité pour les nouveaux logiciels et les avancées en art technologique ; 
  • Maitrise du module d’animation du logiciel Maya ; 
  • Expérience de production avec Unreal ou Unity un atout ; 
  • Compréhension des systèmes d’Anim Graph (atout) ; 
  • Capacité à gérer les priorités ; 
  • Maîtrise du français et de l'anglais. 
En tant que Rigger, vous permettez aux animateurs de pouvoir faire rayonner leur talent. Armé.e d’une bonne connaissance des principes de rigging et de skinning, vous créez la structure qui permet à l’animateur de déformer le personnage ou l’objet selon les exigences du design. 
Vos connaissances vous permettent de créer des structures réfléchies et optimisées selon les contraintes de production. Vous partagez votre expérience en orientant la structure polygonale des modèles pour obtenir la meilleure déformation possible et vous assurez le suivi auprès des animateurs pour valider la qualité et la pertinence de votre travail.

title: Rigging Lead
description:
Company Description

As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.

Job Description

The Rigging Lead will create 3D rigs for different types of objects, vehicles, characters and creatures, ensuring to meet the high quality standards of Rodeo FX, while supporting the Rigging Artists within their project team. This includes answering questions, offering guidance and helping to resolve issues in a positive and constructive manner.  They will work closely with production to assign tasks to artists, communicate the status of work, propose solutions to problems 

Main responsibilities:

  • Create 3D rigs for different types of objects, vehicles, characters and creatures;
  • Create and rig the internal anatomy of a creature, in order to drive the final deformation of the skin;
  • Create feature-quality, scripted rigs and refine them based on the needs of animators and downstream departments;
  • Implement and refine character, body/face, cloth/deformer and hard-surface rigs;
  • Work closely with modelers and animators to ensure an asset is efficiently rigged and capable of believable movements.
  • Work closely with the CG and Animation Supervisors and Production to find creative and technical solutions and approaches that meet project requirements and deadlines;
  • Participate in the creation of tools for their speciality. Test the tools before their integration, and ensure clear and accessible documentation;
  • Oversee the work of a team of artists on a show, demonstrating an expert standard of skills in the specialty and a positive, solution-driven attitude;
  • In collaboration with production, plan and assign appropriate tasks to team members, taking into consideration their abilities, level and the project workflow and timing;
  • Provide feedback on artist’s work to ensure it meets quality standards and corresponds with client’s artistic vision;
  • Communicate promptly with the Production Team and Department Manager regarding any artist who may not have enough work. May assist in finding alternative tasks (training, R&D pipeline tools, etc);
  • Mentor members of their team by providing training and sharing knowledge. Communicate any training needs for their team to the Head of Department. May participate in preparing training materials or giving group training sessions;
  • Participate in mid & post mortem reviews, and annual reviews of artists by providing feedback to the Head of Department;
  • Keep Production and the project team informed of the status of work, issues to be resolved, ramifications of problems encountered and recommend potential solutions;
  • Ensure deadlines are met, advising the project team promptly if delays could be expected, whether by themselves or a member of their team;
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of their specialty and be on the lookout for the latest technological advances in methods and approaches.
Qualifications

  • Minimum of 3 years experience as an Rigging Artist, within the VFX industry;
  • Knowledge of English and French - should be fluent in one of these languages, functional in the other;
  • Excellent knowledge of Maya software;
  • Experience in programming using Python and PySide;
  • Good knowledge of of the principles of anatomy (bipeds, quadrupeds, skeletons and muscles) and facial expression;
  • Knowledge of modeling tools for blend shapes;
  • Knowledge of animation tools for the creation of animation test deformation;
  • Excellent sense of prioritization and respect of deadlines;
  • Ability to stay calm under pressure and act as a positive role model and mentor.


Additional Information

  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Offshore Ironworker - Rigger
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is actively recruiting Riggers to support upcoming Q3 2022 Maintenance Turnaround activities.

 

This position will require you to travel to offshore Newfoundland and Labrador via helicopter or supply vessel. Individuals must be comfortable working in remote locations, confined spaces, and heights.

 

Responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to:                                        

  • Safe execution of work in accordance to agreed guidance documents (i.e. work packs, work instructions, procedures) and governing specifications.
  • Ensure that safe rigging practices are used during the movement of loads including risk assessment, proper lift planning and equipment selection.
  • Monitor rigging materials and highlight any overages/shortages to Offshore Maintenance Supervisor.
  • Ensure all rigging equipment is in fit-for-purpose condition (i.e. pre and post use) and quarantine any defective materials.
  • Must be conversant with relevant rigging standards, specifications, rules, regulations etc. including Permit to Work (PTW).

 

 

Skills / Qualifications (Text Only):Candidates should possess the following qualifications:- Interprovincial Boilermaker / Iron Worker or Journeypersonâ€™s certificate. Any equivalent combination of experience and / or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved may also be considered. - Must have successfully completed Rigging Training as outlined in CAPP from a recognized training institution.- Must have a basic understanding of the construction (i.e. wire rope, nylon, chain), inspection, maintenance and selection of lifting equipment, including limitations and safety issues associated with the material. - Must be familiar with the safe use of mechanical handling equipment (i.e. chain hoists, tirfors, hydraulic jacks, etc.) used in an offshore construction environment.- Strong working knowledge of industrial rigging practices and equipment.                                                          For this position, the following training/certifications would be considered an asset:- Basic Survival Training (BST) including HUET and HUEBA. - Advanced Offshore Rigging: Stage 1 or 2- Hydrogen Sulphide (H2S) Alive. - Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS 2015). - Offshore Safety Regulatory Awareness- Fall Protection- Confined Space Entry- Emergency First AidSuccessful Candidates must meet the following requirements- Pass a site-specific drug and alcohol test and meet COVID-19 vacination requirements- Be able to safely lift and carry up to 50lbs- Possess enough strength and stamina to perform the technical duties and essential functions as identified above- Able to move and work in confined spaces, following proper protocol- May be required consistently to work 10-12 hour shifts performing physical labour in varying temperatures and weather conditions.- Be able to climb and maintain balance on stairs, ladders, scaffolds and steel framework, utilizing proper fall arrest procedures when required. - Able to safely and comfortably work at heights without posing a danger to oneself or others- Able to meet physical requirements of frequent walking, climbing, standing, bending, twisting and crawling for the duration of the shiftCompany Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Telecommunications Tower Rigger
description: We currently have immediate openings for Experienced Telecommunication Tower Riggers for our Ontario location.  Telecommunication Tower Riggers perform all required duties associated with the installation of communication towers, accessories, antenna systems on towers or rooftops and any other telecommunications related activities that may be required. Tower Technicians work outdoors in all weather conditions.

title: CG Rigging Artist - My Little Pony Series
description:
Are you a CG Rigging Artist looking for your next opportunity? Our Vancouver studio is looking to fill a CG Rigging position on an upcoming CG My Little Pony series for Netflix.

____

Atomic Cartoons Inc. is an award-winning animation studio with locations in Vancouver's Mt. Pleasant Animation District, Ottawa's Hintonburg neighborhood and LA. Since its inception over 20 years ago, Atomic Cartoons has created and produced numerous 2D and CG animation productions including Last Kids on Earth and Hello Ninja. Atomic is well known for its artist-friendly culture and flexible work environment. We are always looking for artists of all levels to join our team!

____

 

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

 

  • Create and support interfaces, control mechanisms, and tools for production assets.
  • Design and implement new tools and techniques for the production.
  • Work closely with the animators and modelers to set up character rigs that will maintain a cohesive look during the animation process.
  • Share ideas, collaborate and work closely with other members of the production.
  • Meet deadlines as assigned by production management.
  • Be updated and familiar with new techniques, tools or other related software.

 

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

 

  • Rigging experience with Autodesk Maya.
  • Experience with Python required.
  • Experience rigging a variety of characters and props, including facial animation systems.
  • Able to communicate creative and technical thoughts and ideas.
  • Background in visual arts/design with a strong understanding of form, geometry, and movement.
  • Basic modeling skills and ability to understand polygonal mesh flow.
  • Knowledge of dynamics, animation and/or previs is an asset.
  • Previous industry experience (CG and/or Visual Effects) is an asset.
  • Currently legally able to work in Canada.
  • BC residents preferred. 

 

START DATE: As soon as possible

 

INTERESTED?

Atomic Cartoons Inc. and Thunderbird Entertainment welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Show us what you would like to contribute to Atomic by providing us with relevant examples of your previous work along with your resume and cover letter. 

We thank you for your submission; only short-listed candidates will be contacted. No phone calls, please.

 

Atomic Cartoons is an equal opportunity employer and employs personnel without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, language, citizenship, creed, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, physical and/or mental handicap or financial ability.

While remaining sensitive, fair, and providing equitable treatment for all, Atomic Cartoons works to increase participation and advancement to reflect all personnel – including Women, Indigenous People, Visible Minorities, and Persons with Disabilities, who are all qualified members. Thus, it helps identify and remove barriers that prevent the full participation of members of designated groups in the workplace.

title: Certified Rigger or Equivalent
description:
Seaspan Shipyards is proud to be Canada’s long-term, strategic shipbuilding partner for the Canadian Coast Guard and Royal Canadian Navy. As a direct result of this work, while creating jobs and rebuilding our domestic shipbuilding industry, Seaspan Shipyards is delivering on the promise of ships built in Canada, by Canadians.

Vancouver Shipyards, based in North Vancouver, has a very busy and exciting year ahead, as we continue to make progress on the first of two 174m long Joint Support Ships (JSS) for the Royal Canadian Navy – the largest ships ever built in Canada! We are also constructing an Offshore Oceanographic Science Vessel (OOSV) for the Canadian Coast Guard and have secured significant contracts to build a second JSS, a Polar Icebreaker, and several Multi-Purpose Vessels. These projects will bring long-term job stability for many years to come.

Now is the best time to be part of Canada’s shipbuilding industry! Join us and be part of the regeneration of the shipbuilding tradition and become a member of a talented, diverse team that is forging a bright future for Canadian shipbuilding at one of the most modern shipyards in North America.

Please send us your resume today! 

Seaspan Vancouver Shipyards is currently seeking a certified rigger or equivalent with rigging qualifications, certification, or equivalent experience to work with our Services Department.  This position will include working with mobile cranes up to 80 ton, tower cranes as well as our 300 Ton Goliath gantry crane “Big Blue”.  Hand rigging and working at heights will also be part of daily tasks.

Your success will be defined by your ability to:

  • Perform pre-operational inspections including hazard assessments, defining rigging needed and weight to prepare for rigging and hoisting.
  • Work with mobile cranes to lift, move, position, flip, turn or place equipment and materials with single or multiple hook applications.
  • Safely and effectively follow shipyard’s regulations and procedures.
  • Work with our Maintenance department to ensure routine maintenance lifts are safely conducted on all projects.
  • Represents the company, help to resolve any customer concerns in a professional manner.
  • Following all site rules and adhering to at all times.
  • Attend toolbox meetings in a constructive and contributive manner.
  • All candidates must show proof of:
  • 5+ years’ experience working with rigging and cranes in an industrial environment
  • Ability to communicate and interact effectively.
  • Ability to remain alert and maintain a high level of concentration.
  • Good interpersonal skills and customer service orientation.
  • Understands the operations and limitations of the equipment.
  • Aerial work platform ticket and fall arrest certification.
  • Forklift and telehandler (zoom boom) tickets would also be considered an asset.

 

If you are interested in future opportunities, please apply online today; OR email your resume directly to:

tradesrecruitment@seaspan.com

 

Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, aboriginal persons, and persons with disabilities.

 

Disclaimers:

By applying, you agree that Seaspan may share your resume with our Union partner, Marine and Shipbuilders Union Local 506.

Note: Unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies will not be accepted.

title: BC, Rigging Artist
description:
Rigging Artist

This position is based in Vancouver. All applicants must reside in the United States or British Columbia/Ontario if applying within Canada.

Zoic Studios is an Award winning VFX company made up of accomplished artists and producers who understand story, process and relationships. Partnership, integrity and enthusiasm are our key founding principles. We have three locations, Los Angeles, New York City and Vancouver, Canada. Some of our recent credits include, Stargirl, Legends of Tomorrow, Space Force and Haunting of Bly Manor.

"Visual Evolution" is our mission; we invest in constantly improving our technological and studio processes so that our artists can focus on being creative even in the lightning fast paced world of visual effects. We apply these principles to our work on some of the most VFX intensive film and television projects out there. We like a challenge. Do you?

We are seeking a Rigging Artist for our Vancouver studio. This position will work on a variety of projects and assets within the Rigging Department. The Rigging Artist reports to the Rigging Supervisor.

The ideal candidate will get the opportunity to design and maintain smooth and efficient rigs for CG assets beyond the standard bipedal rigs. They will have an opportunity to work on a variety of rigs from facial, to creature and mechanical to quadrupeds as well as interact with build, animation and production teams. The ideal candidate will have strong MAYA skills, extensive experience in scripting, and the ability to manage multiple tasks in any given day. The Rigging Artist will be a part of the Rigging & Animation team and in regular contact with other department leads. Good communication and problem solving skills are mandatory. 

Responsibilities

  • Create new rigs and rig components.
  • Create of realistic FK/IK rigs for a variety of humanoids, creature, and mechanical models.
  • Work with modeling and animation departments to ensure rigs meet requirements.
  • Perform rig fixes and troubleshooting during production as requested by Rigging, CG or VFX Supervisors.
  • Modify and extend existing Python based studio rigging toolset.
  • Develop Python based scripts for asset specific rigging needs when necessary.

Qualifications:

  • Min 3 yrs experience as a Rigger within live action VFX or animation studio in TV and/or film.
  • Experience with weighting and skinning must be demonstrated.
  • Ability to rig a variety of characters / objects in a realistic (non-cartoon manner).
  • Solid understanding of Character set-up and rigging tools in Maya.
  • Facial rigging for humans and creatures
  • Production experience with Deformers, Constraints, Hierarchies, Utility Nodes, Expressions, Hair & Cloth, Maya python commands.
  • Core knowledge of anatomy and kinematics to create rigs that match the objectives of the final product.
  • Experience in Python in Maya.
  • Must have some experience with scripting (Python, Mel).
  • Knowledge of Api, PyQt, GitHub, Pyside, Shotgun a plus.
  • Must be organized with a strong attention to detail and ability to work independently.
  • Excellent communication skills in English; both written and verbal.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with a variety teams.
  • Positive attitude and ability to easily adapt to changes in production needs.
  • Mentor and assist other artists.
  • Must showcase an up-to-date demo reel demonstrating rigging abilities.

Would be nice to have:

  • Knowledge and experience with mechanical systems 
  • Motion capture and crowd rigging experience
  • Rig creation for VFX and realtime game engine environments 
  • Maya Live Link and Unreal dev kit experience

Additional information

  • Candidates MUST be located in the United States, British Columbia or Ontario. This is a remote (work from home) position. 
  • Zoic does not cover relocation costs.
  • This job description contains the basic requirements for the position and is NOT intended to be a complete list of responsibilities; other duties may be assigned.
  • Due to the volume of applications we receive across our different openings we regret that only those selected to interview will be contact.

 

Powered by JazzHR

We encourage you to complete an application on our new careers site so that your profile can be reviewed by our Talent team for any current and future opportunities at our studio! If you donâ€™t have time to complete a full application you can simply apply with one click.

 

Donâ€™t see quite the right role for you? You can also send us a speculative application and share your skills.

We love what we do and it shows in the quality content we produce! Our custom-built Vancouver studio in beautiful British Columbia is a wonderful backdrop for our artists, but it doesnâ€™t end there, we have employees working remotely across BC, Canada, and the world!   Our artist-centric culture means we invest in our people, we provide training and growth opportunities, a healthy work-life balance, and fun activities throughout the year to meet, mingle and get creative with your team. If you like what you are reading so far, well buckle up, weâ€™re just getting started!

title: Rigging Artist
description:
Are you a Rigging Artist interested in joining the team in our Vancouver studio?! The Rigging Artist will work closely with a variety of departments including; R&D, Art, Modelling, Layout and Animation, to develop, implement and maintain character and prop assets for use in both Layout and Animation.

What you’ll get to do:

  • Develop and maintain procedural rig components using a custom Python Rigging API. This includes:
    • Following a brief to produce complex production ready rigs of a high standard
    • Ensure that models are suitable for rigging and performance requirements
    • Develop and prototype rigs for a broad range of creative and technical requirements
    • Supporting rigs as they move through the animation pipeline
    • Adhere to deadlines and communicate and troubleshoot technical issues with production

What you bring:

  • 3+ years’ experience in feature animation, VFX, and/or animated television with a focus in Rigging
  • Proficiency demonstrated through past project work and/or reel/portfolio
  • Software development experience using Python, and relevant application API
  • Experience with both mechanical and/or organic type rigs
  • Production proven knowledge of rigging in either XSI or Maya
  • Solid understanding of OOP in Python and learning/working to proprietary APIs
  • Solid understanding and ability to apply foundation knowledge of pertinent mathematical disciplines (basics of linear algebra and trigonometry as required)
  • Production proven knowledge in pipeline, process, tools and techniques with an understanding of industry standards, conventions, formats and common practice
  • Proven ability to create and deliver production ready rigs
  • C++ knowledge helpful but not mandatory
  • Proven technical and visual skills, excellent attention to detail
  • English written and oral communication skills and the ability to connect with a wide variety of personalities
  • Ability to work solo as well as collaboratively within a team environment
  • The ability to efficiently organise and prioritise work across multiple areas
  • Excellence in problem solving and balancing quick turnaround with long term quality
  • Ability to take direction and feedback and apply this to assets or rigs moving forward

title: Driver Rigger
description:
Overview:

Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.

When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger â€“ a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each otherâ€™s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.

Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provide you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.

 

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Job Requirements:

Has responsibility for operating equipment and/or machinery. Duties may involve some technical elements but primarily focused on running equipment/machinery /systems. Role is hands-on and directly manipulates the equipment, machinery or system; requiring precise instrumentation/operation. Acts at field operations as an effective member of a field crew, supporting the delivery under supervision of a Field Engineer or Field Specialist.

 

Responsibilities and duties:  

  • Prepare accurate tickets, job reports, time sheets, and other administrative forms as required.  
  • Assist in job safety analysis, job coordination and job installation with WFT supervisor and customer on location.  
  • Verify all necessary equipment and supplies are on location and in proper working condition.  
  • Perform all duties of a SES Service Technician II.  
  • Learn the operation and routine maintenance requirements of all solid expandable services equipment.  
  • Learn the maintenance procedures as they relate to solid expandable service equipment.  
  • Independently operate and perform basic troubleshooting and minor repair of solid expandable service equipment.  
  • Assist in pre-job safety meeting.  
  • Available on a 24 hour basis to respond to customer needs.  
  • Know and understand Weatherford Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions.  
  • Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford.  
  • Work assignments carried out to the highest quality level.  
  • Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job.
Experience:

REQUIRED

  • Experience in OIL/GAS/WIRELINE    
  • High School diploma, skilled labour certificate or equivalent
  • Valid Driver License
  • Strong operational and maintenance knowledge of equipment
  • Must have a telephone and the ability to be on 24 hour call

PREFERRED

  • Valid Commercial Driver's License or the ability to obtain one
  • Valid Hazardous Materials endorsement or the ability to obtain one
  • 4-5+ years expereince in Wireline operations
  • Comply with region specific driving regulations and Health Requirements.   Work flexible schedule, including long and/or irregular hours

title: 3D Rigger
description:
Job Brief:



For our Characters, Creatures, NPC’s and Animals, you become the connective pipeline from our 3D Modelers, to check their production and confirm or correct 3D structures before models are UV Mapped for textures. Once you have approved the 3D model, you will rig and skin the model to the animator’s specifications.







Responsibilities:



DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:





  • Refine and manage production workflows




  • Confirming 3D models are built correctly




  • Rig 3D Models for animation




  • Skin 3D Models for animation




  • Create Rig scripts in Maya and/or Motion Builder as required




  • Develop a flexible character production pipeline within the team




  • Create high-performance, animation-friendly character and creature rigs




  • Provide feedback and develop standards for character production




  • Work closely with 3D artists and animators





WORKING CONDITIONS: 





  • Mentally exhausting at times




  • Extraordinary opportunity for personal growth and skills development, due to high level of responsibility and challenges 




  • Work will primarily take place remotely




  • Must have access to laptop or desktop and internet access





 









Skills Required:



REQUIRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, AND SKILLS:





  • Good knowledge of rig scripting




  • Experience with Unreal Engine 4




  • Experience in game development 




  • 2+ Years of experience in rigging and general 3D art production




  • Essential knowledge of animation and other 3D art processes




  • Excellent knowledge of anatomy and topology for 3D characters




  • Excellent knowledge of Maya; experience working with MotionBuilder




  • Solid knowledge of how to develop a character production pipeline, along with rigging and animation workflows




  • Experience being part of a creative team




  • Strong analytical, problem solving, time management and organizational skills




  • Verbal and written communication skills 




  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment.




  • General knowledge of online gaming

title: Foreman | Contremaître (Rigger)
description:
Thursday, February 3, 2022

Are you ready to take your career to new heights? Join our growing team at WesTower Communications Ltd. as a Foreman - Aerial Field Technician!

We are Canada's largest wireless/wireline network service contractor offering Engineering, Design, Fabrication, Construction, Project Management, and Maintenance Services for wireless telecommunication carriers and independent tower operators. We aim to make a positive impact nationwide in the Telecom industry and to seek excellence in all aspects of our business.

We offer competitive wages paid out living allowances, paid holidays, comprehensive benefits, RSP matching, stock options, and opportunities to further develop your skillset and grow your career.

Job Description:

  • Responsible for managing field crew safely
  • Daily communication to project management and customers on site
  • Supervise tower and cell-site installation
  • Supervise antenna modifications/adds
  • Troubleshoot equipment to locate the transmission faults
  • Completing timesheets
  • Extensive travel throughout the province and/or country

Qualifications:
  • Previous experience managing a crew
  • 2-5 years of previous experience with Wireless/ Cell Site installation
  • Strong safety skillset or background
  • Telecom troubleshooting experience required
  • Ability to interpret engineered drawings and knowledge of fibre and DC drawings
  • Demonstrate strong adherence to safety procedures
  • Good physical condition and comfortable working at heights
  • Willing to work outdoors and be exposed to all types of weather
  • Valid Canadian driver's license is required
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada
  • Must be mechanically inclined
  • Strong written and verbal skills
  • Clean Criminal record
  • Maintain a professional working relationship with co-workers and clients
  • Must be reliable, trustworthy and have a positive attitude!

At WesTower Communications Ltd. you can expect to be treated fairly. We recognize that it is our people who drive the success of our business, so we make it our priority to foster inclusive work environments welcomed to diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to accommodating prospective employees. We proudly offer a drug-free workplace with a zero-tolerance safety program.

title: Senior Rigger
description:
About us...

Versatile Media is a global company that has created an end-to-end virtual production workflow. Our new North American headquarters are based in Vancouver, Canada where we run performance capture and visualization stages that run on real-time technology. Our upcoming LED stage is scheduled to open later this year.

Our Vancouver location is focused on Virtual Production, combining real-time rendering technology, traditional film workflows and proprietary research and development, as well as creating original animation and live action I.P for Sci-Fi and fantasy genres.We offer competitive compensation, flexible schedules and a work/life balance; working alongside a lovely group of talented people. 

Why Virtual Production?

The film industry is rapidly moving towards real time feedback. Deformation rigs previously only seen in post production are now at the forefront of visualizing and driving story and motion. High quality rigs, running in real time, is an exciting and constantly growing field. It is our focus to stay with this emerging and ever improving technology.

Who are we looking for?

Versatile Media is looking for a Senior Rigger who is interested in the exciting new field of Virtual Production. Bring your skills and passion to help us develop the next generation of animation and film making tools.

The function of a Senior Rigger at Versatile Media is to work closely with the Asset, Mocap and Animation teams to build rigging and creature FX systems for organic models, hard-surfaced models, and props. 

 

How you will spend your timeâ€¦.

  • Designing efficient rigs appropriate to the productionâ€™s needs.
  • Developing and maintaining an efficient dynamics setup for muscles and/or cloth for various creatures.
  • Working with multiple teams on suitability of rigs for assets, mocap and animation
  • Research and development for future rigging tool sets
  • Implementing rigs within unreal
  • Updating and working with metahuman assets

 

We'd love to hear from you if you have....

  • Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar role within the gaming or VFX industry.
  • Degree or relevant experience in VFX, Gaming, Computer Graphics.
  • Proficient in current Maya rigging techniques.
  • Experience with muscle and cloth simulations for creature FX a must.
  • Knowledge of creature rigging using Anim Blueprints in Unreal Engine a bonus.
  • Proficiency in Python a must. We will ask for code samples. 
  • Knowledge of PySide and PyQt a bonus but not required.
  • Desire to work with new machine learning rigging techniques and procedures.
  • Experience with Ziva Dynamics toolset a plus.
  • Experience developing and maintaining tools for use in a studio pipeline.
  • Able to work independently when required.
  • Excellent time management skills.
  • Interest and ability to mentor other team members and share knowledge.
  • Strong solution-based trouble-shooting skills.
  • Excellent English communication skills both verbal and written.
  • Up-to-date reel and resume showcasing required skills.

 

*This job is based in Vancouver and is open to qualified candidates worldwide.

title: Senior Character Rigger
description:
Our customer, a leading software developer of synchronized speech and facial animation tools is seeking a senior level character rigger to join their team. The position can work from home or remotely from anywhere in Canada either as a permanent employee or contractor.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Collaborate with the development team on all animation related technology, mainly focused on rigging, animation and exporters, editors, and pipelines.
  • Support the design, develop, and optimize features of the Unreal plugin for JALI using a combination of C++, python, blueprints
  • Work closely with animation and engineering leads to turn ideas from design, through prototyping, to production
  • Collaborate with the sales team to assemble and organize user requirements, feedback and technical challenges faced by our customers.
  • Stay current with latest technologies/research ongoing in the field to help keep our dynamic art visuals at the cutting-edge regarding motion and deformation
  • Maintain and fix bugs in the toolchain.
  • Test, debug, profile, analyze and optimize your code


SKILLS/REQUIREMENTS

  • Strong Programming skills in Python, C++ and Blueprints
  • Knowledge of 3D mathematics (e.g. linear algebra, trigonometry and matrices).
  • Proficiency in animating and rigging (using skeletal bones or blend shapes) in Maya specifically and other DCCC platforms
  • In depth and detailed understanding of animation and deformation in run time and in editor
  • Professional experience developing pipelines and creating tools
  • Knowledge of current facial capture approaches, FACS poses, facial blend shape rigs, feature detection, etc.
  • Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Experience using source control software (i.e. Perforce, Git).
  • Passionate about games development and technology

title: Senior Rigger
description:
About Pixomondo: 

Founded in 2001 by CEO and Executive Producer Thilo Kuther, Pixomondo is a solutions-oriented design company that solves creative challenges for our clients and partners. Whether we are crafting never-before-seen visual effects for a feature film or developing innovative original concepts for a global marketing campaign, we leverage our collaborative design process to develop truly award-winning work. Our passion is to deliver the best ideas at the highest levels of quality on-time and on-budget, with the outstanding service you expect from a world-class company.

Minimum Requirements:

â€¢ /- 4 years work experience.
â€¢ Knowledge of rigging systems.
â€¢ Comprehensive knowledge of Maya
â€¢ Experience with Python scripting is a must
â€¢ A reel demonstrating mechanical rigging abilities
â€¢ Strong comprehensive knowledge of anatomy, deformation and mechanics of movement
â€¢ Experience with muscle systems is a plus
â€¢ Good organizational and communication skills

user-friendly rigs
