title: Senior Rigging Artist
description:
Overview:
Encore VFX is currently in search of a Senior Rigger with a focus in animation and character technology to join the Rigging team. Working on a variety of issues, such as mechanical systems, animals, complex realistic body and face deformation, automation thru scripting, tentacles, ropes, vehicles, crowd characters, and anything else you can imagine.

 

Main Duties:

  • A solid understanding of modular rigging systems and their framework.
  • Must have good tool design logic. Keeping things as simple as possible while creating complex projects.
  • Experience working with FACS based facial rigging system is a plus.
  • Experience working with mGear rigging system is a plus.

 

What You Bring:

You are passionate about the world of Character Rigging. You have worked in fast paced VFX environments in the past where speed and constant changing needs were the norm. 

  • Minimum of 5 years working with a strong understanding of VFX production workflow
  • Experience in Python a plus
  • Strong Maya production experience
  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
  • Willingness to learn and grow further.
  • Must be a self starter.  Solid time and project management skills.
  • Must be willing to take direction well, a good team player
  • Demonstration of both control systems and complex deformations
  • Strong comprehension of anatomy and articulation

 

About the Company: 

Company 3 â€¯/ Method Studios provides a full range of Creative Services for content creators, including conceptual design, pre-vis, look development, ideation and rapid prototyping, 3D animation/CGI, motion graphics/designers, matte painting, compositing, dailies and production services, color grading, post-production finishing, marketing/trailers, live-action production, experiences, and more.â€¯ 
 

Creativity has diversity at its core. We celebrate the value of each unique experience by being dedicated to fostering the most diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where every employee feels empowered and safe to show up to work as their full self. 

It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. Please inform the company's HR representative if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

title: Artiste rigger Sénior / Rigger Artist Senior
description:
RESPONSABILITÉS

  • Créer des rigs 3D en s’assurant des besoins du département d’animation et des spécificités de la production pour différents types de personnages et accessoires.
  • Exécuter les corrections demandées par le directeur d’animation.
  • S’assurer d’atteindre les objectifs établis et respecter les échéanciers et les livrables.
  • Favoriser un environnement de travail respectueux et un bon esprit d’équipe.

 

QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES

  • Maitrise de Maya, essentielle.
  • Expérience en rigging de personnage.
  • Solide connaissance et compréhension des principes de l’anatomie.
  • Souci du détail, minutie.
  • Connaissance d’un asset manager tel que Shotgun, un atout.

 

 _______________________________________________________________________________________

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Create 3D rigs by ensuring the needs of the Animation Department and the specifics of production for different types of character and accessories.
  • Execute the corrections requested by the Animation Director.
  • Meet established objectives and respect timelines and deliverables.
  • Foster a respectful work environment and good team spirit.

 

SKILLS and QUALIFICATIONS

  • Proficiency in Maya is essential.
  • Experience in character model rigging.
  • Solid knowledge and understanding of the principles of anatomy.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Knowledge of an asset manager such as Shotgun is an asset.

title: Journeyman Carpenter
description:
Golderado provides civil site work and common construction services to the oil and gas industry in Western Canada with primary focus on the Northern Alberta region. The key bases of work have most recently been to the oil refineries, oil sands development and oil and gas pipeline sectors in the greater Edmonton, Fort Saskatchewan and Fort McMurray areas.

**PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS IS ALOCALTO EDMONTON POSITION**

This is not a camp job and does NOT pay LOA.

At Golderado, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values. Then we simply give them the freedom to take their career further.

In the position of a Journeyman Carpenter, we would ask you to do the following:

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Journeyman Carpenter ticket
  • Ability to read and understand technical guides, drawings and specifications
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs
  • Comfortable working at heights
  • Ability to work in adverse weather conditions
  • Manual dexterity and ability to use carpentry tools safely

*Qualifications:

  • Journeyman Carpentry ticket
  • CSTS 09, H2S Alive
  • Fall Protection & Rescue, Aerial Platform, Confined Spaces, Rigging/Hoisting and Hand Signals, and First Aid/CPR certification would be an asset
  • Meet drug and alcohol policy requirements
  • Meet background screening requirements

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!

We are an equal opportunity employer. While only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview, be sure to continually check our website for other related positions as they are posted.

title: Carpenter - Non-Journeyman
description:
Job Description

Key Responsibilities

  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings and sketches to determine specifications and calculate requirements
  • Prepare layouts and patterns in conformance to building codes using measuring tools
  • Plan sequences and methods of work
  • Load and unload construction materials, including moving materials to work location
  • Select, measure, cut, shape, assemble and join materials made of wood, wood substitutes and other materials using nails, staples, screws, bolts or glue
  • Frame floors, walls, roofs, conduct exterior and interior finishing
  • Fit and install doors, windows, flooring, cabinets, stairs, handrails, paneling, molding and ceiling tiles
  • Trim and sand joints, molding or other wooden parts to be assembled using hand and power tools
  • Install floor beams, lay sub-flooring and erect walls and roof systems
  • Attach previously fabricated walls, ceilings and floors together
  • Install insulation in flooring and walls
  • Assemble wood and metal products such as metal siding, window sashes, doors, door jambs, boxes, and pallets, using screws, bolts, staples, glue or other fasteners
  • Reinforce assembled products with dowelling or other supports, and install hardware such as knobs and hinges
  • Set up and operate woodworking equipment
  • Scrape and sand the unit and apply a finish such as paint, stain, plastic laminate, varnish or lacquer
  • Repair and fix/remodel existing structures
  • Assist with maintenance of machinery if necessary
  • Establish high standards of personal performance with a continuous emphasis on achieving quality of work, delivery on time and within budget
  • Provide suggestions for improving construction systems and processes, methods of work, tools, etc.
  • Prepare ad-hoc detailed specifications and cost estimates

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or GED.
  • At least three years' experience as a carpenter preferably in residential, commercial, light industrial construction and renovation industries.
  • Valid Class 5 driver's license with clean drivers abstract
  • Good math and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Outstanding critical thinking skills.
  • Specialized knowledge and experience working with modular structures.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with others.
  • Flexibility and adaptability.
  • Ability to work 10 hours per shift in the remote site location
  • Physically fit and able to lift up to 50 lb. on a consistent basis.
  • Preference will be given to candidates with certificates in Fall Protection (OSSA), Confined Space (OSSA), CSTS, ESTS, Wilderness/Bear Awareness, Aerial Work Platform, Fork Lift, Scissor/Boom Lift, Rigging and Hand Signaling, and Standard First Aid.
About Us

Civeo Installations Employees LP is a premier remote workforce lodge installations and maintenance provider for the Western Canadian resource industry. We help people maintain healthy, productive and connected lives while living and working away from home. Our unique approach focuses on guest wellbeing, operational efficiency and community building - making us a leading provider of accommodation solutions.

title: Slinger
description:
Job Number: 40082 
Group: Magna Exteriors  
Division: Mytox Mfg. 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: Woodbridge 

 

Group Description

The Magna Exteriors portfolio of products includes access systems such as liftgates, exterior trim, modular systems, front-end modules including fascia, active aerodynamic systems and other lightweight structural components for automotive, commercial truck and other industrial markets.

Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.

 

QUALIFICATIONS NECESSARY TO DO THE JOB:

•    Experience in operating forklift required
•    Good English (both written and verbal) communication skills
•    Basic Mathematical skills
•    Experience with computerized data entry 
•    Knowledge of WHMIS/GHS

DESIRABLE ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:

•    Current valid forklift license
•    Current valid crane certificate
•    Familiarity with production software 
•    Capability of operating overhead crane equipment
•    Good organizational skills, ability to work well without supervision

MAIN DUTIES AND ACTIVITIES OF JOB:

•    Conducts pre-shift inspection of crane and / or forklift
•    Loads, unloads and moves material, parts, components within or near plant, yard, or workcell
•    Organizes and prioritizes steel coil placement and removal from uncoiler to support production schedule
•    Maintain material Kan Ban Board
•    Re-strapping of steel coil when necessary
•    Follows instructions to ascertain materials, parts, boxes, containers are moved from or to production lines/
      work centers
•    Loads and unloads coils onto or from pallets, trays, racks or shelves
•    Supplies production lines with required coils and components
•    Assist in removable of customer returnable’s to its designation location
•    Reports any defective packaging and stores them in designated areas
•    Utilizes effective Housekeeping Practices 
•    Assist with housekeeping at door #8, cleaning of yard and use of floor cleaning machine when needed
•    Adheres to all Mytox safety rules and regulations

•    Attends training based on Mytox Internal Training Matrix
•    Follows all applicable Mytox BOS procedures 
•    Any other reasonable request by management 

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

07--Operations F--Permanent/Regular

title: Laborer
description:
Overview

Celanese is a Fortune 500 global chemical innovation company that engineers and manufactures chemicals used in products essential to everyday living. Headquartered in Dallas, TX, we employ over 7,700 dedicated people working between 43 facilities across 18 countries. We are committed to employee growth and creating shareholder value to ensure continued opportunities make a difference. Our company focuses on the safety of its employees, provides competitive compensation (including benefits starting day 1), and emphasizes giving back to the community. For more information about Celanese and our products please visit www.celanese.com

Responsibilities

  • Responsible for carrying out of various general labour duties using a variety of hand tools and motorized equipment in a safe, competent, and efficient manner, all of which contribute to the overall function and operation of the overall facility.
  • Operate general purpose trucks of 5-ton or less (without air brakes)
  • Ability to operate a forklift, man-lift, scissor lift, skid-steer loader, and tractor
  • Delivery of goods on, and off plantsite
  • Understanding of the Laborer roles, responsibilities and accountabilities and has demonstrated their ability to competently fulfill these requirements

Qualifications

  • 5-10 Years experience in the role
  • High School Diploma or recognized equivalent
  • Provincial Vehicle Operating License (Alberta)
  • Fully trained to operate a forklift, man-lift, scissor lift, skid-steer loader, and tractor
  • Operate crane and perform very simple rigging work in a competent manner
  • Safe truck loading and unloading practices for gas cylinders, drums and general parts
  • Safe use of snow removal equipment (Plow-truck, Sanding-truck, backpack blower, etc.)
  • General knowledge of machine lubricants and steps taken to complete oil changes on equipment
  • General knowledge of Safe Work Permitting requirements

Celanese is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Celanese does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Labourers
description:
• An excellent opportunity to start your career in a cutting-edge organization!
  • Enjoy a competitive $22 hourly wage plus overtime and other attractive benefits! 
  • Travel to various locations throughout Northern Alberta and BC! 

About White Water Management Ltd.

Whitewater Management is a cutting-edge fluids management company, started by industry leaders with decades of expertise in the industry, a great reputation, and an excellent environmental and safety record. Experts in engineering, remediation chemicals, and regulatory compliance; we handle water and industrial fluid needs for our clients, offering them the best and most flexible water management programs. 

For more information about our organization, please visit our website by clicking here.

About the Opportunity

White Water Management is currently looking to employ multiple Labourers to join our Water Transport Technician team on a full-time, casual basis. Our projects are primarily based in Chilliwack, Grande Prairie, Fort St. John, Red Deer, Fort McMurray, Prince George, and other cities throughout Northern Alberta and BC. 

Reporting to the Site Superintendent, your responsibilities and duties will include:

  • Rigging in hose lines for water transfer
  • Operating equipment (loader, skidsteer)
  • Operating, maintaining, and troubleshooting water pumps
  • Tracking water flows and water pressure
  • Building and tearing down frac ponds
  • Testing, repairing and maintaining hoses
  • Changing out equipment as needed
  • Communicating regularly with site supervisors and team members
  • Completing other related duties as assigned

More About You 

In order to qualify for this role, you will need a valid Class 5 Drivers' License, with a minimum of 3 years of off-highway driving experience with a pick-up truck, hauling a trailer or other comparable vehicle. In addition, you will need to have completed H2S Alive and First Aid training. Previous experience in the oilfield or water management industries will be considered an asset, but are not required. 

As our ideal candidate, you are safety oriented and customer focused. You have a mechanical aptitude, basic math skills, and strong communication and teamwork skills. Candidates who are reliable, self-motivated, and eager to learn are strongly encouraged to apply.

This opportunity is Veteran friendly, and we also welcome seasonal workers from the Agricultural background during off-season. 

Please note: Pre-employment illicit drug testing will be required.

About the Benefits

In exchange for your hard work and dedication, you can expect a competitive starting wage of $22 per hour plus overtime, along with:

  • Transportation to/from project sites from our depot locations in Grande Prairie & Innisfail, Alberta
  • Paid travel time while en route to and from project sites
  • Accommodations provided
  • Meals provided (or a meal allowance when away from our camps)
  • $100 boot allowance
  • Extended health, vision and dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Wellness program
  • Growth opportunities
  • Company events such as our annual Christmas party
  • The opportunity to join a friendly tight-knit team environment

If you are a collaborative team-player and this opportunity excites you, then we want to hear from you - apply today!

title: Entry Level Labourer
description:
Job Description:

We are currently seeking 1 person  for a day shift role.  

     

Role:     Must be physically fit to work outside loading and unloading trucks and trailers. Shipping and Receiving Experience would be nice otherwise able to work outside assisting with loading and unloading trucks etc.

 

This is a permanent role based out of Sherwood Park, AB.    

     

   

What would you be doing?  

  • Work with loader and forklift operators Loading and unloading pipe,  materials,  tools,  and equipment.  
  • Work as a spotter rigging up pipe and material  and learn how to signal to direct equipment operators where to locate the materials you are moving
  • Work as a spotter to direct the equipment in tight or blind areas where the operator needs visual assistance to do hi job
  • A forklift ticket would be a great Asset    
  • Load and unload materials,  tools,  and equipment.  
  • Maintain overall cleanliness of our  facility.    
  • Other duties as assigned.    

 

Does this sound like you?  

  • 1-year minimum labor experience in an industrial setting  
  • Must be physically fit to work outside loading and unloading trucks and trailers
  • Strong oral and written communication    
  • Experience with shipping receiving would be an asset  
  • Physically fit    
  • Positive attitude  

 

Perks of the job  

  • Permanent position    
  • Monday-Thursday 10 hour shifts with 3 shifts off per week  

 

 

Other important details

   

This position has beenâ€¯identifiedâ€¯as a safety sensitive position and will require completion of drug and alcohol testing.â€¯â€¯  

â€¯    

 

Why ClearStreamâ€¯    

â€¯â€¯    

We are the clear  choice  for  rewarding  opportunities and  challenging  careers. Joining our team would mean you would  contribute  to the quality of work we do and to the  success  of ClearStream along with the  values  we  share. If you are  driven,  dedicated  and have a  passion  for helping our  customers  bring resources to our world, then ClearStream is the team to join.â€¯â€¯  

   

We are  committed  to creating a culture of equity,  diversity, and  inclusion, including  fostering  a  safe  and respectful  environment  that allows for  diverse  perspectivesâ€”a work  environment  in which all employees are valued and have an equal opportunity to achieve success.â€¯ Qualified applicants will receive  consideration  for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected  veteran  status, or other legally protected factors.â€¯

title: Carpenter (NOC 7271)
description:
JOB ADVERTISEMENT
 

  • Company operating name: Patty Mac Inc.

 

  • Company business address: 3785 Muskoka District Hwy 169, Bala ON  P0C 1A0

 

  • Title of the position: Carpenter (NOC 7271)

 

  • Job duties:

 

  • Building foundations, installing floor beams, laying sub-flooring, and installing walls and roofing systems
  • Fitting and installing trim, doors, stairs, moulding, and hardware
  • Measuring, cutting, and joining materials made of wood or wood substitutes
  • Repairing and renovating wooden structures
  • Reading and interpreting blueprints, drawings, and sketches
  • Inside finishing
  • Fitting and installing trim items, such as doors, stairs, moulding hardware
  • Preparing layouts in conformance to building codes, using measuring tools
  • Supervising apprentices and other construction workers
  • Operating a variety of hand and power tools of all types: hammer, drills, chainsaws, skill saws, jack jammer
  • Installing windows, doors, roof trusses, sheathing, hardware,
  • Erecting scaffolding and ladders working at heights training a requirement

 

  • Terms of employment: Permanent and Full-Time

 

  • The language of work: English

 

  • Wage: CA $26.50 per hour for 44 hours per week

 

  • Benefits package being offered: Vision care and prescriptions

 

  • Location or locations of work: District of Muskoka, ON

 

  • Contact information to apply for the job: Email - steve.macdonald@pattymac.ca & Tel. - 705-765-1919

 

  • Skills requirements:

 

  • Ability to work independently
  • Team player
  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Ability to lift 80lbs
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Good problem solving and decision-making
  • Organized and efficient
     
  • Required education: Completion of secondary school is preferred but not required

 

  • Required work experience: 2 years of work experience as a carpenter

title: Labour Worker
description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE Gold’s Gym British Columbia is hiring a labour worker, with potential to grow! Are you hard working, a good team player, with a passion for fitness? We would love to hear from you!

About Gold’s GymGold’s Gym has been the authority on fitness since 1965. It was then that fitness legend Joe Gold took the knowledge and expertise he gained from training at the world famous “Muscle Beach” and opened up the first Gold’s Gym on Pacific Avenue in Venice, California. At Gold’s Gym, our goal is simple: We’re here to help you Know Your Own Strength®. We are committed to helping people find their inner strength and reach their goals.

Key Responsibilities
  • Basic maintenance work (moving equipment, driving parts, manual labour, painting, general maintenance)
  • Assist in gym maintenance at 4 lower mainland locations (Port Coquitlam, Langley, West Broadway, University Market Place)
  • Assist in general equipment repair
Qualifications
  • Must be able to move and carry up to 50lbs 
  • Drivers License and vehicle 
  • No prior experience is required but it is an asset 
What We Offer
  • Positive, rewarding, and collaborative team environment
  • Competitive compensation
  • Complimentary club membership
  • Discount on Gold’s Gym products and services
NOTE: This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.Gold’s Gym British Columbia is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at https://goldsgymbc.ca/Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest.

description:

Gold’s Gym B.C. is hiring full time Maintenance Worker, with potential to grow! Are you hard working, experienced, and driven? We would love to hear from you!About Gold’s Gym


Gold’s Gym has been the authority on fitness since 1965. title: Labourer
description:
Are you looking for long term employment with a proven employer? As a member of the FBL team you will enjoy many career advancement opportunities such as development training, career growth, and promotional opportunities from within.

Forbes Brothers Ltd, OA FB Bullet is looking for qualified individuals to join our growing team in SURREY BC. Specializing in underground utility construction FB Bullet offers a competitive compensation package, benefits and pension contribution.


Civil Labourer

The ideal candidate will either have previous experience as a Construction Labourer or seeks the opportunity to join our growing team and advance their knowledge and skill base. The role of Civil Labourer will be responsible to report to the Crew Leader and execute the day-to-day activities of their crew. As a valued member of our team, you will be able to support and take instructions from crew members with assigned duties to gain and improve efficiencies.

Responsibilities:

  • Receive duties, delegations from the Crew Leader, and assist crew members execute these tasks
  • Work closely with all crew members, and learn the construction industry standards
  • Complete installation of conduit and other utility infrastructure with crew members
  • Work on tight timeline power outage worksites
  • Assist in maintaining a clean and organized work site
  • Able to problem solve through coordination with Crew Leader
  • Ensure quality of work meets or exceeds expectations
  • Complete daily pre-trip inspections on company equipment/vehicles
  • Participate and engage in daily Tailboard meetings, identify hazards and assist in crew compliance to safety policies and regulations
  • Work with construction equipment such as compactors, shoring, core drills, various hand tools
  • Ensure all small tools assigned to crew are cleaned, stored and maintained properly
  • Work closely with Crew Leader/Lead Hand to install conduit per specifications to correct grades/elevations
  • Assist drivers and vehicles navigate through busy work sites via proper hand signals and guidance

Schedule:

  • Due to the demand of our workload, all crews are scheduled Monday-Friday with the opportunity for weekend work quite frequently. Nightshift work is also scheduled on a less frequent basis
  • All shifts are scheduled for 8-10 hours, and due to the type of work we perform can extend past that
  • Daily overtime/double time is offered in all FB positions

Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid Class 5 driver's licence, Class 1 or 3 preferred
  • Preferred experience in underground utility construction, hydro/telecommunications considered an asset
  • Physically fit and able to provide hands on assistance to crew members
  • Must be safety orientated
  • Ability to take and execute instructions and duties assigned to you
  • Lead by example attitude
  • Existing knowledge of WorkSafeBC standards and policies is an asset for this position

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: Construction Labourer
description:
Location:

GTA - West, Ontario

Department:

Employment Type:

Construction, GTA Lowrise Division

Full-Time

Reports to:

Builder

Who We Are

Mattamy Homes is the largest privately owned homebuilder in North America, with 40-plus years of history across the United States and Canada. Every year, Mattamy helps more than 8,000 families realize their dream of home ownership. In Canada, our communities stretch across the Greater Toronto Area, as well as in Ottawa, Calgary and Edmonton.

What We Offer

In keeping with the Mattamy Mission of providing The Best Homeowner Experience, the Construction Labourer safely constructs new homes which meet the high standards of quality set by the company.

 Responsibilities

  • Prepare house for next trade as required including cutting concrete, covering floors, scraping floors, straw placement and removal and stripping floors
  • On a daily basis, collect and dispose of debris at construction site, placing it in appropriate designated places, while ensuring compliance with waste recycling programs
  • Assist with having porches filled, garages and basements cleaned so cement can be poured. Ensure driveways are cut, stone is ordered and that patio slabs are installed on each lot.
  • Make sure houses are graded and safe for the bricklayer trades to work; ensure footings and walls ready for inspection
  • Advise Administrator when to contact garbage company for delivery and exchange bins for interior cleaning
  • Ensure availability of temporary heat for inside trades (tile setters, tapers, etc.)
  • Locate water boxes (dig up and repair) and ensure water turned on for each house; includes ensuring water boxes are raised and marked for sod
  • Review, assess and report any issues on safety to Health & Safety Rep. or direct supervisor, includes ensuring protective gear used/worn
  • Address any complaints or inquiries forwarded by homeowners

 What You Bring

  • No formal education is required although any training related to construction skills would be an asset.
  • Experience in residential building or related construction industry.
  • Experience dealing with tools and machinery, includes machine skills – rough grading, digging hydro, gas trenching, water boxes, backhoe operation, etc.
  • Good organizational skills with ability to get things done according to timelines.
  • Good communication skills – especially verbal.
  • Good customer service skills.
  • Must have the ability to perform physically challenging work.
  • Must have a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record.

 Health & Safety

We are doing our part to safeguard your health and taking extra steps to reduce the spread of COVID-19. All work sites and premises will allow for required physical distancing requirements, and new routines and resources such as hand sanitizer, antiseptic wipes, masks, or other protective equipment.

Vaccination is the single best protection against COVID-19 for us as individuals and our communities and is vital to maintaining our commitment to health and safety. The successful applicant will be required, as a condition of employment with Mattamy, to provide Mattamy with proof that they have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine (or combination of vaccines) authorized by Health Canada, subject to accommodations required under applicable human rights legislation.

 Why Mattamy

At Mattamy, we’re passionate about creating and promoting a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work. Diversity and inclusion are important aspects of the work we do to support our homebuyers, colleagues and communities. We offer a workplace that allows our employees to experience exciting possibilities in their career including continuous learning, opportunity for growth, competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package.

When you’re part of the Mattamy family, your day to day work has an incredible impact. What we do takes teamwork, and everyone pulls together to give our very best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting career possibilities are waiting for you at Mattamy. Based on the culture we pride ourselves on, we’ve been recognized with external awards as well. Some of our most recent recognition includes:

  • Canada’s Best Managed Companies for 2021 & 2020
  • Greater Toronto’s Top Employers for 2022, 2021, 2020 & 2019
  • Canada’s Top 100 Employers for 2020 & 2019
  • Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures for 2017

We have big plans for our business and our team. Be part of our ambitious future!

Mattamy Homes is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us on your application and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Qualified applicants will be contacted directly by the Talent Acquisition team.

title: General Labourer
description:
Oakridge Landscape Contractors has a need for General Labourers (Full-time Year Round) to join our dynamic team of talented individuals!

Oakridge Group Inc. Established in 1992, our team of trusted professionals strives to accomplish the best outcome for every single one of our clients, every time. With 30 years of experience, we stand firmly behind our work and take immense pride in all of our projects, both big and small. Our focus and client dedication can be seen throughout decades of Oakridge Landscape Contractors' award-winning residential and commercial projects. We have won 9 Landscape Ontario awards in 2021 for our residential and commercial projects.

Job Details:
  • Position: General Labourer.
  • Location: Hamilton, Ontario.
  • Pay: $20/hr.
  • Benefits after probationary period.
  • Company events.

Key Job Duties:
  • The job involves lifting, bending, digging, raking, using a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, and other tools.
  • Ability to dig holes (when needed), place soils, plant trees, and shrubs, etc.
  • Building retaining walls
  • Installation of natural stone (flag, armor, etc).
  • Installation of interlock paving stone.
  • Snow removal in winter months.

Job Requirements:
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Must have access to your own vehicle.
  • Ability to work long hours.
  • Self-motivated.
  • Ability to think as a team player.
  • Ability to do physical work.
  • Respect for on-site safety.
  • Ability to work Saturdays as required.
  • Tolerance to various weather conditions.

Application Details:
  • Oakridge Group is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties.
  • If you are a person with a disability and have a question or require assistance with the application.




    About Oakridge Landscape Contractors:

    Oakridge Landscape Contractors specializes in landscape applications for industrial, commercial, institutional, parks, heritage sites, and highway road infrastructure restoration.Our extensive landscape construction knowledge and installation abilities combined with our team, sub trade relationships and central location allow our company to complete both large and small scale successfully.

title: General Laborer (FT)
description:
Description

Purpose:
This is a hands-on, physical role working with a small construction team with responsibility for refurbishing and building gas stations for MacEwen Petroleum Inc. We are looking for a candidate who brings construction experience.

Main Responsibilities:
  • Maintenance of pumps, replace nozzles, spouts, hoses and filters, contain and clean up spills and leaks.

This Includes:
  • Working in a small construction crew under the direction of the Construction Manager.
  • Working alongside and supporting the work of contractors.
  • Maintaining a safe work environment.
  • Using a variety of large equipment. E.g. back hoes.
  • When certifications have been completed, carrying out the service and maintenance of petroleum equipment, systems, and accessories essential to their operation including installation, removal, repair, maintain, start-up of dispensing and suction systems and submersible pumps.

Requirements
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  • Must be willing and able, with Company support, to upgrade knowledge and skills to hold relevant PM licenses.
  • Must have a clean driving record and hold a 'D' license.
  • Previous experience working with the installation of tanks is highly desirable.
  • Knowledge of service station equipment including dispensers and suctions systems and fuel handling equipment and related tank gauging is also highly desirable.
  • Physically able to move and handle loads, up to 50 lbs.
  • Must be willing to travel as required, including occasionally working away from home base, as the projects determine.
  • Able to complete tasks effectively with minimal supervision.

Our Core Values:
It is important to us that when you consider a new opportunity, you understand a little about the company, its history and values. It is important to us that our values fit with yours, then everyone wins. Our core values are the cornerstone of who we are as a company, and what we value. We hope that our core values speak to you and what you value.
  • Customers First - We exist, first and foremost to serve our customers. They must be at the heart of all the decisions we make.
  • Long Term Focused - We value long-term success over short-term gains.
  • Respect Each Other - Each person with whom we work, communicate and do business is valued and treated with dignity and respect.
  • Do The Right Thing - We stand by our word and do what's right.
  • Own It - We are encouraged to be entrepreneurial and make decisions as if the business were our own.
  • Ever Evolving - We embrace positive change and always seek to improve.

Benefits
Why work with us?
  • Supportive colleagues and leaders who are passionate about providing exceptional service.
  • Learn and collaborate with the best in the industry.
  • “The perks” include employee gym membership reimbursement, discounts on motor fuels at our service stations, and purchases of equipment and heating oil.

Before an offer of employment is extended, a minimum of two business references will be required and candidates must complete pre-employment testing which comprises a drug/alcohol test and a criminal record check.

Prior to any offer of employment being extended, a minimum of two business references will be required and candidates must complete pre-employment testing which comprises a criminal record check.

Candidates wishing to receive this job posting in a different format are asked to contact Human Resources.

MacEwen Petroleum Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

INDHP

Apply for this job

title: General Labourer
description:
Matrix is looking for local labourers for a long term project in Victoria, BC starting immediately.  This role is a great opportunity to learn new skills while working with knowledgeable trades people.  

Scope of Work:
  • Assisting various constructions trades on site
  • Misc. Labour tasks
  • Other duties assigned by the supervisor
  • Lifting and moving large loads of supplies ect.
  • Working primarily outdoors in all types of weather
Qualifications:
  • Reliable
  • Previous construction experience 
  • Full PPE
If you think you are a great for this role and would like to be earning soon, apply now!




    About Matrix Labour Leasing Ltd.:

    Matrix Labour Leasing is a full-service recruitment agency specializing in the placement and administration of the skilled trades workforce all across Canada. We have been in business for over nineteen years and have placed over 4,000,000 employment-hours in the Canadian workforce. We have been recognized as one of Alberta Venture’s Fast Growth 50 and as a Leader of Tomorrow by Business in Calgary.As a leader in our industry, Matrix remains committed remaining cutting edge of the Full Service Temporary/Permanent Placement model as well as best in class managed services in Payroll and Back Office Support. We are proud to serve the following industries:Industrial ConstructionCommercial ConstructionOil and GasManufacturingWarehousingHospitality HealthcarePipeline Construction

title: Summer Labourer
company: Sun Peaks Resort LLP/Sun Peaks Grand Hotel & Conference Centre
description:
Work, Live and Play

Sun Peaks Resort LLP has proven to be one of the highest levels of guest service providers within the ski industry. We can promise you a memorable and gainful working experience within our high volume and challenging work environments. Sun Peaks Resort LLP has many benefits to offer our employees including:

  • Full access Summer Alpine Hike and Downhill Bike season pass
  • Employee access to Golf Membership and discounted Golf Cart season pass
  • Employee Health and Wellness Program including EFAP services
  • Companywide discounts and benefit programs 
  • Eligibility to participate in our Peak Performer Recognition Program, awarded at the end of our summer season at a specially planned event
  • Reciprocal riding at other participating BC and Alberta bike parks

Your Responsibilities will include:

  • Assist carpenters and/or plumbers with tasks as assigned
  • Odd jobs include, but are not limited to, power washing, washing windows, painting
  • Unload tools, prepare building site materials, stack building materials, and set up equipment
  • Prepare work zones by digging, moving dirt, moving construction materials
  • Use construction and maintenance tools and equipment to complete daily tasks
  • Ensure regulated and proper headgear, earplugs, gloves, safety glass, CSA steel-toed boots, and clothing are worn
  • Clean and clear debris and construction waste
  • Follow all OH&S and Work Safe regulations worn

Ideal Candidates:

  • Physically fit as the job involves physical labor
  • Must be able to lift 50 pounds (23 kg)
  • Experience working construction laborer or similar is preferred
  • Valid BC driver’s license and able to produce a clean driver’s abstract
  • Ability to work independently and unsupervised, while prioritizing duties effectively
  • Ability to work well with the public and promote Sun Peaks' image
  • Ability to operate 2-way radio
  • Dependable, reliable, and punctual

Incentive Program:

If you are a student, currently enrolled in a college/university tourism and/or hospitality program, please note, that this role is eligible for fully reimbursed staff accommodation for the Summer season for successful applicants.

Please ensure you provide the required documentation and complete the information on your student status in the job application fields. (Conditions apply and will be discussed in detail with successful applicants during the interview and at the job offer stage).

If you have been referred by a current employee of Sun Peaks Resort/Sun Peaks Grand Hotel (or someone who has an accepted job offer for the Summer 2022 start), please ensure you indicate their name and current department in the required field in your application form.

title: Labourer
description:
Like working with your hands? Don't mind heavy work, using hand tools, working in a team environment?

You'll be working with scaffolding, taking it apart, reshaping it, using tools like grinders and screw guns. This is a growing company and there will be opportunity for advancement and more pay. They have trained people on new skills (welding/forklift/truck driving) once you show initiative and interest. If you have fork lift experience handling wide loads, please make sure to note that in your application. If you have any auto-body experience, that will be considered an asset.

Job title: General Labour

Pay rate: $18-19 based on experience

Location: Highway 404 & Herald Road (Newmarket)

Shift time: Start training on the day shift (6 AM - 3 PM or 7 AM - 4 PM)

Ongoing Contract

Advantages
What's great about this opportunity:
-Work for a growing company in Newmarket
-Full time hours
-Flexible start times
-$18-19/hr
-Possibility of permanent placement once the contract is over
-Physical work
-Potential to learn new skills
-Growing company with new roles

Randstad Perks
-Weekly pay with 4% vacation pay added to your cheque
-Benefits from day 1 - Randstad offers immediate benefits for contract workers


Responsibilities
-Assembly of metal frames
-Lifting up to 50 lbs
-Following health and safety procedures
-Using hand and power tools such as grinders, cutting discs, screw guns and hammers
-Other duties as assigned

Qualifications
-experience in assembly/general labour role (landscaping, construction, roofing, etc.)
-Comfortable with hand and power tools
-Able to lift 50 lbs
-Steel toed safety boots

Summary
Apply bellow!

If this General Labour/Assembler role in Newmarket sounds like a position that interests you we want to hear from you right away!

Have questions? Give us a call at (905) 305-2843 and ask for Jordan or send an email to jordan.dewit@randstad.ca

Search all of our open jobs. If you are an expert in a specific role, let’s find a job that’s a perfect match for you. Some of the most in-demand jobs at the moment include machine operators, general laborers, warehouse workers, forklift and counterbalance drivers, and brake press operators.

If this role interests you, but is not quite the right fit, I'd love to have you give us a call so we can discuss exactly what it is that you are looking for.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: General Labourer (Shop / Buses/Trucks)
description:
About Vicinity Motor Corp.

Vicinity Motor Corp. (NASDAQ:VEV) (TSXV:VMC) (FRA:6LGA) is a North American supplier of electric vehicles for both public and commercial enterprise use. The Company leverages a dealer network and close relationships with world-class manufacturing partners to supply its flagship electric, CNG and clean-diesel Vicinity buses, the VMC 1200 electric truck and a VMC Optimal-EV shuttle bus. In addition, the Company sells its proprietary electric chassis alongside J.B. Poindexter business unit EAVX, the Companyâ€™s strategic partner, for upfitting into next-generation delivery vehicles. For more information, please visit www.vicinitymotorcorp.com.

 

We are currently looking for a Shop Helper /Mechanical Assistant/General Labourer

 

Responsibilities:

  • Assist the Heavy Equipment Technicians on the shop floor
  • Maintaining the cleanliness of the shop
  • Moving tools, equipment, and other materials
  • Cleaning work areas and equipment
  • Sorting and picking of parts
  • Parts runs, washing equipment
  • General yard cleanup and maintenance
  • Other duties as required

 

Qualifications:

  • Previous general labourer or shop helper experience in a similar environment would be preferred
  • Pre-apprentice training in a heavy equipment environment with aspirations towards a career in trades would be an asset
  • Possess a proven mechanical aptitude and a keen interest in heavy equipment
  • Welding experience would be considered an asset

title: Layout Carpenter
description:
CHANGING SKYLINES, BUILDING FUTURES

Do you want to be a part of a close-knit, family-run organization where management appreciates and recognizes your hard work and values your input? If you are ready for a financially rewarding yet challenging position that promotes personal and professional growth, keep reading!

Pagnotta Inc. is a mid-sized, full-service provider of structural concrete, general contracting, and tower crane and hoist services with job sites located throughout Western Canada.  We provide value-added construction services to our customers by creating a successful partnership with them throughout the construction process. To learn more, visit www.pagnotta.ca or click here to view a short video about our company culture and values.

We are currently recruiting an experienced Carpenter with Layout experience for construction projects in Vancouver. Reporting to the Superintendent and/or Foreman.

Wage

  •  $35 - $45/hr depending on experience, negotiable

Benefits

  • Employer-paid health, dental and vision benefits for you and your family
  • Life insurance 
  • Travel insurance
  • RRSP matching up to 4% of regular earnings
  • Year-round, full-time work
  • Opportunities for advancement - wage increases and promotions are regularly extended to those who take initiative, work hard and take pride in producing quality work

Culture

  • Our employees would describe the work environment as fast-paced and entrepreneurial-focused. We believe in hiring "A" Players who are self-motivated and intrinsically driven to succeed. These types of people thrive because they are resourceful and can seek out information on their own to make informed decisions

Duties/Responsibilities

Planning:

  • Review blueprints and construction drawings with Project Coordinator /Site Superintendents 
  • Review scope of work with Superintendents and determine layout requirements
  • Ensure layout equipment and tools are always maintained and available

Operations:

  • Responsible for all elements of layout and elevation requirements and ongoing monitoring checks
  • Document and maintain "as-builts" for submission as required
  • Arrange for survey checks and updates at various stages of projects
  • Ensure work site and tools are organized and cleaned at the end of each day

Tracking:

  • Record and maintain all calculations and equipment; maintain and troubleshoot technical equipment
  • Completion of daily work records, daily diary, and equipment reports as required
  • Review site for accuracy and keep current documentation on hand while working on the project.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

  • Excellent communication/interpersonal skills (verbal and written)
  • Ability to work in a team or alone
  • Detail orientated
  • Able to prioritize quickly
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Able to set and maintain your own schedule to meet project requirements
  • Works well under pressure with strict deadlines
  • Punctual and reliable
  • Self-motivated

Qualifications/Education

  • Certified Journeyman Carpenter or equivalent non-ticketed experience
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role
  • Experience working on high-rise, mixed-use, commercial and institutional projects preferred
  • Experience reading blueprints and construction drawings
  • Experience with Trimble Robotic Total Station and other survey equipment and tools
  • Experience with layout work preparation in AutoCAD  
  • WHMIS2015 (can provide if needed)
  • Fall Protection (can provide if needed)

Working Conditions

  • Long term, steady, year-round work
  • Overtime for those who want it
  • Two paid 15 minutes breaks and one Â½ hour unpaid lunch break per day
  • Working at heights
  • Must be able to stand, crouch, kneel, walk and climb for long periods of time
  • Exposure to hot and cold extremes. Must have appropriate gear for the weather.
  • Exposure to noise, dust and pollution.

title: Labourer
description:
Labourer









Location: Nisku, AB, Canada Job ID: R9882 Job Status: Full-Time



Share:











Apply Now



Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday.













Description





Job Summary:

You are a knowledgeable General Laborer that has extensive experience working in an industrial shop setting. We are looking for a General Laborer to support us in our Module Fabrication shop in Nisku, AB. The successful candidate will be responsible for working in accordance with quality, safety, and efficiency standards.







Responsibilities:



+ Completing work in the module yard such as cutting grass, moving materials, loading and unloading materials


+ Perform manual labor such as shovel / broom work, digging, pulling and removing material, job site cleans up and various tasks associated with module fabrication


+ Competently operate equipment, hand tools and lift items up to 50 lbs.


+ Working with and assisting trades as required


+ Meet and follow all safety requirements and applicable safety policies





Requirements:



+ Must have at least 1 years of previous experience in oil field or general construction


+ Module yard experience considered an asset


+ Knowledge and tools, materials and equipment used in modular yard


+ Strong attention to detail with the ability to problem solve


+ Vaccinations against COVID 19 are not required on site, however masks (provided by Ledcor) must be worn when social distancing is not possible





Additional Information:


Company Description


Ledcor Industrial offers an integrated range of services from construction, engineering, and maintenance to pipe fabrication and module assembly. We offer turnkey solutions to our oil and gas clients and have built some of the continent’s largest oil and gas projects.




But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!




Employment Equity


At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.



Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.




View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement here (https://www.ledcor.com/who-we-are/inclusion-and-diversity) .



Date Posted

May 6, 2022



3925 8 Street, Nisku, AB, Canada

title: Construction Labourers
description:
Construction Labourers

In the position of an upcoming job for Construction Labourer, we would ask you to do the following:

  • Handle and distribute construction materials (e.g., load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials
  • Move tools, equipment and construction materials to and from work areas; remove rubble and other debris)
  • Assemble and dismantle scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades at construction sites
  • Prepare and clean up construction sites
  • Move materials and equipment
  • Perform demolition, excavation and compaction activities Work on a wide variety of buildings, structures and premises including municipal sewer and water mains, roads, dams and bridges, tunnels, railways and canals
  • Use shovels, rakes, or other tools
  • Be able to spot equipment
  • Act as a flagger when needed

Sounds challenging and exciting right? Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

  • You have one to two years of industrial or civil construction experience.
  • You have up-to-date safety tickets (CSTS, WHMIS 2015, and ground disturbance are required)
  • You have experience in using compactors, and trampers (jumping jack)
  • You are able to lift at least 30 lbs
  • You have a safety conscious attitude and able to work with others in a team
  • Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required

Jobs are located in Edmonton, Northern Alberta, and Saskatchewan.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status.

title: Labourer
description:
Labourer

Truro, NS

The members of the Inland Group of Companies (Inland Technologies, IDS and Quantem Aviation Services) are highly experienced in environmental management, aircraft de-icing, ground handling and pretty much any other aviation support service you can think of. We operate at over 50 airports in four countries. Inland Technologies core business is the delivery of airport environmental compliance programs. We are continuously innovating the technologies we use to provide our range of services including, spent aircraft de-icing fluid collection and recycling, wastewater management, and aircraft de-icing fluid manufacturing for reuse.

Our business is built on a foundation of excellence in customer service, innovation and continuous improvement and safety is at the forefront of everything we do.  We provide a workplace where respect, integrity and a high degree of ethical behaviour is a minimum expectation.  To learn more about our organization, please visit our website at:  www.inlandgroup.ca

 

We are currently providing an opportunity for a well-rounded safety focused individual to join our team in the position of Labourer at our Brookside Manufacturing Facility.

 

About You:

The ideal candidate will be someone who is passionate about safety, doesnâ€™t shy away from a challenge and is comfortable working in an environment where the noise level can be excessive at times.

 

About the Position:

Aside from the excitement of working in a busy manufacturing facility, the essential duties and responsibilities of this position include:

  • Promoting and adhering to our safety and respectful workplace culture and instilling this culture in the station while ensuring safety and regulatory compliance with all Government Labour, Health and Safety laws, regulations and policies.
  • Follow established Standard Operating Procedures (SOPâ€™s) and HAVE ZERO TOLERANCE FOR UNSAFE ACTS!;
  • Plan and carry out work assignments and handle problems in accordance with instructions, policies, previous training or accepted company practices and procedures;
  • Operate forklift equipment;  
  • As required, assisting in manufacturing functions such as assembly and fabrication;
  • Keep all Inland owned or managed equipment, tools and materials in good working condition, including keeping clean and returning to assigned storage areas when not in use;
  • Maintain facility cleanliness and appearance including garbage removal, washroom cleaning and restocking and other general cleaning requirements;
  • Promptly and accurately complete all associated paperwork as required;
  • Perform/complete other additional projects, duties, and assignments as required and/or by management request.

 

Qualifications:

  • Forklift Operator Certification;
  • High school diploma or equivalent;
  • Read, write, speak and communicate effectively;
  • Basic computer skills with working knowledge of Microsoft programs including Outlook, Word, and Excel;
  • Ability to interpret documents including safety rules, operating, maintenance and procedure manuals;
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills;
  • General mechanical competence and ability to effectively use hand tools;
  • Must possess a strong work ethic, positive attitude, with an ability to motivate and work in a team environment;
  • Willing to learn new skills and adapt to change in order to support the growth of the company and meet needs of customers.

 

About Inland: 

At Inland, we offer the following benefits, some of which are subject to eligibility:

  • A rewarding and safe work environment (company provided PPE);
  • On the job training, mentoring and coaching;
  • Growth and advancement opportunities for high potential employees;
  • Employee and family assistance program;
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package;
  • Pension plan with employer contribution;
  • Access to group rates and discounts.

 

If you are a self-starter who is committed to providing the highest level of customer satisfaction and your experience and ability meet with the above minimum requirements, please forward your cover letter and resume to the Inland HR Team, quoting posting number 22-25.  Full job description available upon request. 

 

Please apply online.

 

Inland is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

 

Please note:  All employees working in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 unless provided by Inland with an approved accommodation under Canada's Human Rights Act.

title: General Labour (Burlington)
description:
JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is looking for General Labourers in Burlington, ON!

Formerly Cogent Power Inc., JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is under new management.

While we appreciate all applicants, we will only be contacting those selected for an interview.

This position is located in Burlington, Ontario - 845 Laurentian Drive, L7N 3W7 (Conveniently located by bus route) 

This position will be on rotating continental shifts (12-hour shifts) and overtime available as required, there will be a shift premium (80 cents) on all regular hours.

Salary: $18-$23 an hour

 

Why you should join JFE: 

  • $500 signing bonus after your first 4 weeks
  • Travel Subsidy:
    • Starting April to September 2022 we will be providing a subsidy to all employees that incur the costs of travelling to work. These subsidies will be provided at the end of the month in the form of a gas card (i.e April subsidy will be provided by mid-May).
    • For those who take a city bus to work, we will be providing a transit pass.  
  • 100% Health & Benefit Plan 
  • RRSP RPP Pension Plan (Company matching!)
  • Perkopolis Account - get access to 5000 exclusive online discounts to stores & sports events (Hello Fresh, Apple, Indigo, Toronto Marlies, Toronto Raptors, etc.)
  • Boot & Prescription Safety Glasses Reimbursement
  • Employee & Family Assistance (free confidential counselling program)

What youâ€™ll do as General Labour:

  • Set-up machine according to work order and operating procedures
  • Ensure product meets quality requirements as per work order, operating procedures and customersâ€™ specifications
  • Read work orders and understand all measurements
  • Follow priority schedule

About you, simply stated:

  • Strong measuring skills (tape measure & micrometer experience preferred) 
  • Exceptional communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Organized
  • Manufacturing experience is a strong asset

    bout JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc:

    On September 20th, 2019, JFE Shoji Trade Corporation acquired 100% of the shares of Cogent Power Inc, from Tata Steel Europe. Grouped, the Cogent and JFE Shoji Steel America business make it possible for JFE Shoji to capture greater market share in the electrical steel market for both transformer and automotive products. The combination of Cogent and JFE Shoji has become one of the largest processors of electrical steel transformers in the world. JFE Shoji currently has many other production and processing facilities throughout Asia, as well as a facility in Tijuana, Mexico.

    Globally, JFE Shoji enhanced the businessâ€™ competitiveness by sharing and integrating technical skills with deep business experience, which can be strongly applied to the global and North American markets. With this investment, JFE Shoji has one of the worldâ€™s leading processing and distribution functions for core design and manufacturing for transformers.

    Based in Tokyo, JFE is one of the worldâ€™s largest steel producers with over 45,000 employees and operations globally. 

    If you would like to be considered, please apply in confidence. For more information about starting your career with JFE Shoji Power Canada, please visit https://www.jfeshojipower.com/

    Job Type: Full time, benefits, vacation, RRSP and Pension offered!

    Salary: $18 an hour

    #JFEHP

title: Labourer
description:
You enjoy working with your hands and take pride in hard work. You are motivated by seeing the end product that you helped create. We're looking for labourers to join our crew at our new commercial construction site in Winnipeg.
RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials
  • Move tools, equipment, and construction materials to and from work areas
  • Operate hand and power tools
  • Clean up rubble and debris on a regular basis to ensure a safe and well maintained construction site
  • Move and level earth using shovels and rakes
  • Clean, lubricate, and refill tanks as instructed
  • Practice work place safety at all time
  • Perform other duties as required

REQUIREMENTS

  • Previous experience in a related position
  • Positive can-do attitude
  • Willing and able to easily follow direction
  • Able to lift 50lbs
  • Willing and able to work long hours in a fast-pace, physical environment

 

WHY SEYMOUR PACIFIC?

Seymour Pacific Developments is an industry leader in building multi-family homes with unparalleled speed and efficiency. We develop and build over 1,500 units a year by leveraging effective teamwork and industry expertise. We offer excellent wages and benefits, as well as a variety of training for employees who are motivated to succeed and want to expand their horizons. Seymour Pacific Developments is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to following safe and inclusive hiring practices.

title: General Labourer
description:
CenterLine (Windsor) Limited is a recognized industry leader in manufacturing standard and custom designed resistance welding, spot welding, arc welding and metal working equipment. We apply state of the art technology to the design and manufacture of robotic weld lines, configurable fastener welders, welding electrodes, welding guns, welding cylinders, and other welding accessories. CenterLineâ€™s vertical integration provides resistance weld gun manufacturing, electrode / weld cap manufacturing, equipment manufacturing, all integrated into our custom machinery. Our people are our key competitive advantage in todayâ€™s global market. Celebrating our 60th Anniversary, CenterLine (Windsor) Limited continues to evolve and diversify to remain a valued partner to its customers and a respected member of industry. Our success is built on the foundation of innovation, efficient design management, excellence and the guarantee of quality service.

 

CenterLine is looking for a self-motivated, reliable individual to fill the position of General Labourer.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Organizing and prioritizing work
  • Clean/lubricate equipment
  • Keep manufacturing areas free of debris and dirt
  • Follow instructions to operate machines, hold or supply materials and tools and load and unload items from machines and assembly lines.
  • Locate parts as required
  • Other miscellaneous duties as required

 

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • Secondary School diploma
  • Manufacturing experience an asset
  • Mechanical aptitude preferred 
  • Time management
  • Manual dexterity to use tools and machines
  • Blue print reading an asset

 

EMPLOYEE BENEFITS

  • Air-conditioned manufacturing facility
  • Health, dental, vision care
  • Life insurance
  • Company pension plan
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Employee Assistance Plan
  • Retirement benefits
  • Wellness committee

 

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Centerline Windsor Limited will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, Selection, and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform the Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

title: Labourers
description:
Overview:

Labourers

 

SurewayConstruction is one of Albertaâ€™s largest heavy construction contractors, with 49 yearsâ€™ experience, involved in; civil earthworks and grading, utilities and offsite, mine operation and aggregate extraction.

 

Work for Sureway and enjoy being home with your family/friends every night!

 

We offer: Benefits, RRSP and TFSA Matching

 

Job Type: Full Time, Seasonal

Schedule: 10+ Hours/day, Saturdays and Sundays as required, Schedule as per Operational Requirements, OT after 8hr/day or 44hr/week

Location: Edmonton and Surrounding Areaâ€™s (non-camp position, required to live in the area)

Essential: Hard-working, reliable, flexible with schedule, ability to work in physically demanding conditions

 

Requirements:    

  • Personal Reliable Vehicle
  • CSA approved steel toed boots with 6â€ ankle support

Pre-employment:

  • Drug and alcohol testing (swab-based test)
  • Successful completion of Company Orientation and site-specific orientation

 Labourer Responsibilities:

  • Clean and prepare construction sites as needed, removing and properly disposing of debris and waste materials, and digging trenches.
  • Maintain a safe and clean job site by handling materials and storing them properly, picking up and removing all tools and equipment when not in use.
  • Load and unload construction supplies from trucks manually and at times may be asked to use equipment.
  • Promote, execute and adhere to the companyâ€™s safety program, and encourage all employees, subcontractors and consultants to adopt safety as a culture.
  • This is a general responsibilities list and does not include all responsibilities required of the position.

Sureway Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer. We would like to thank all applicants for submitting their resume; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Construction Laborer
description:
We are seeking landscape construction laborer's and experienced individuals for the installation of paving stone and retaining walls. Skid steer and excavator experience is an asset. Wages start at 20hr to 26hr depending on experience. 

We offer a great working environment, Monday to Friday and some weekend work, benefits after 3 months and lots of hours, with overtime.

We require good work ethic, reliability, and you must have your own transportation to sites across Calgary and surrounding areas. Please send resume.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

title: Carpenter
description:
Kitchen Tune-Up is seeking a Carpenter to work on home remodeling projects in the Burlington and West Oakville area.
Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Arrive to jobsite on time in logoed shirt and appropriate work clothing.
  • Follow instructions given by project manager.
  • Follow the Kitchen Tune-Up Trustpoints on every job.
  • Keep work area clean and orderly and clean up daily.
  • Communicate with project manager daily about progress.
  • Work quickly and efficiently.
Skills:
  • Stellar work ethic.
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to follow directions without deviating.
  • Able to drill for hinges.
  • Able to install doors and drawer fronts.
  • Able to install roll-out trays in cabinets.
  • Ability to safely operate power hand tools including; a table saw, band saw, power hand saw, router, planer, and powered nail gun.
  • Ability to work in Kitchen Tune-Up Burlington West Oakville and surrounding communities.
  • Must be able to interact with our customers on a professional & friendly level.
  • Must take personal pride in a job well done the first time.
  • Must have a valid driver's license with a verifiable good driving record and no physical limitations to perform the tasks required.
  • Must be able to pass a criminal background check.
Additional Skills. Training is provided.
  • Prior experience in cabinet refacing is preferred.
  • Prior experience in cutting moldings is preferred.
  • Able to install crown molding is preferred.
Why Work for Kitchen Tune-Up
  • Rapid growth in the market.
  • Growth opportunities available.
  • Established pathway to promotion.
  • We are a high quality company with an excellent reputation. You will be selling custom projects in some of the nicest areas of our community.
  • Ongoing training and coaching provided.

The positions on this website, unless otherwise indicated, are posted by Kitchen Tune-Up® franchisees.  Kitchen Tune-Up® franchises are independently owned and operated businesses and if you accept a position with an Kitchen Tune-Up® franchisee, you are employed by that franchisee, and not by franchisor HFC KTU LLC, nor any of its parents or affiliates. The hiring franchisee is solely responsible for all employment decisions including hiring, termination, discipline, compensation and benefits and HFC KTU LLC and its parents and affiliates have no input or involvement in such matters. HFC KTU LLC does not receive, review or store any applications for employment. Any questions about posted positions or the hiring process must be directed to the Kitchen Tune-Up® franchisee posting the position.

title: General Labourer
description:
Our General Labourers earn a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!


Position Summary:

The General Labourer is in good physical condition and provides construction work and support required to ensure timely project completion. The Labourer follows good work practices and procedures and sets a good example for new crew members and co-workers. The Labourer may: operate a variety of equipment and instruments, including hand and power tools of all types; clean and prepare sites; clean up rubble and debris; remove mold, asbestos lead, and other hazardous materials.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads by example and follows all health and safety policies and procedures.
  • Strives to continually improve through specific development plans.
  • Accepts direction from the Lead Hand, Lead Water Technician and/or Lead Carpenter and more experienced co-workers.
  • Participates in good housekeeping discipline on the job to ensure a safe non-cluttered workplace and to minimize cross-contamination.
  • Learns and practices correct procedures, especially when environmental work is required.
  • Adheres to company policy regarding acceptable standards to follow at a customer site i.e. smoking policy etc.
  • Displays good manners and attitude toward the property owner, occupants of the property, co-workers, and sub-contractors.
  • Is willing and able to be on-call 24/7 for after hour's emergency work.
  • Directs customer questions or concerns to the most senior company person at the job site.
  • Looks out for and assists co-workers.

Qualifications:

  • Previous construction or cleaning work preferred.
  • Experience with hand tools & power tools preferred.
  • High School graduate or equivalent.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Carpenter
description:
First Onsite is seeking to hire a full-time Carpenter to help rebuild homes and businesses for our residential and commercial customers after fire or flood emergencies. Do you have previous experience in restoration or construction? Are you looking to build a successful career while rebuilding lives? If so, keep reading!

Our experienced Carpenter earns a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A CARPENTER

You are focused on bringing back homes and businesses to their former beauty. Your attention to detail and passion for construction assists you in delivering superior quality work to your customers. Whether repairing a roof, or installing a cabinet you consistently demonstrate skill in the safe operation of tools. Your ability to oversee laborers ensuring that the quality standards of the company are being met and as well as your knowledge of materials, methods and the tools involved in the construction or repair of residential & commercial buildings, and other structures will set you up for success in this role

Your excellent communication skills assist you as you work collaboratively with construction crews. Health and safety are important to you which is why you respect all policies and procedures and ensure that they are followed by other employees and subcontractors. You are a get-it-done person who likes to be active and isn't afraid to jump right in and make things happen. You take pride in your work and feel good about being able to restore order for people in our community while helping us build a loyal customer base!

QUALIFICATIONS

  • At least 3 years of experience in the carpenter in the construction or restoration industry
  • Ability to pass a background check
  • Valid drivers' license
  • Availability for scheduled on-call and after-hour shifts

Are you able to work independently? Do you have excellent communication and interpersonal skills? Can you work collaboratively with construction crews? Are you service-oriented? Is safety important to you? Do you project a professional appearance and attitude? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!
