title: Night Labourer - Temporary
description:
$20/hour - General Labourer - Temporary Project

We are actively recruiting 2 temporary labourer(s) for an overnight store renovation project in SK - Saskatoon .This job is very physically demanding. You would be assisting in moving product and shelving units,discarding of construction material and assisting with other general labourer tasks.
  • Rate: $20/hour + vacation pay
  • Location: SK - Saskatoon
  • Project Dates: May 22nd - September 29th, 2022
  • Availability: Sunday night – Friday morning shift, 1030pm-7am – times may change
  • Hours/week: Hourly - Up to 40 hours/week hours a week

Job Responsibilities: 
  • Moving product and fixtures in a big box retailer
  • Disposing of construction material
  • Cleaning store sections
  • Other general labour tasks as required
  • Physical requirements: Lifting up to 50lbs, on feet for entire shift. 

Successful Candidate Qualifications: 

  • Retail experience considered an asset 
  • Positive attitude, reliable, good communicator and fluent in English
  • PPE required: CSA Approved Safety footwear, Work Gloves, Hard Hat, Safety Vest
  • Reliable way to get to the location (transit will be limited due to nights)
  • Physically able to lift up to 50lbs, remain on feet for entire shift and work in a physically demanding position.
How to apply:
If this job sounds like the perfect fit for you, please apply online and be prepared to provide:
  • a relevant resume
We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Night Builder/Installer - Temporary
description:
Night Builder- $24/hour- Temporary Project 

M30 Retail Services is hiring NIGHTFixture Installer/Display Builder(s) in SK - Regina to join a night crew, working on section renovations in a big box retailer. We are looking for 3 mature individual(s) with building experience. Must be 18 years to apply.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Renovation and building of new fixtures/features in retail location
  • Installation of displays and/or fixtures
  • General labour as required

Qualifications

  • Retail experience considered an asset / comfortable reading building prints or planograms
  • Carpentry experience is required
  • Fixture installer and building experience required
  • Own tools to use during project (hammer, screwdrivers, knife, level, tape measure, cordless drill etc.)
  • Handy person with common sense and excellent problem solving and communication skills
  • Experience with pallet jack an asset
  • Physically fit and strong. Capable of standing, bending, reaching, kneeling, twisting and lifting continuously for the duration of the shift

Rate: $24/hour + vacation pay

Location: SK - Regina

Project Dates: May 22nd, 2022 - October 13th, 2022

Availability: Sunday - Thursday night, ending Friday morning; 1030pm - 7am

Hours/week: Hourly - Up to 40 hours/week hours a week


M30 provides a safe, fun work environment. If this temporary position sounds like something you would like to do, please submit your application with a current resume now!

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, American Iron & Metal (AIM) is a family-owned company, recognized as a world leader in the metal recycling industry. Over the years, AIM has evolved into a multi-faceted company with successful lines of business including metals recycling, dry materials recycling, manufacturing of solder assembly, environmental services, retail auto parts, and highway transportation. With multiple facilities throughout Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe, and Asia and over 2000 employees located throughout the world, AIM is uniquely positioned to provide best-in-class service and value to its customers. 

Job Description

  • Sorting, picking, and processing scrap metals 
  • Clean and inspect recycling yard by sweeping and raking materials and debris  
  • Assist with performing routine maintenance 
  • Perform other general labourer duties as assigned 

 

Qualifications

  • A Minimum of 1 year of experience is required in a similar role  
  • Experience in the metal scrap industry will be considered as an asset 
  • Experience in using machines like Lift Truck / Forklift, Skid steer will be considered as an asset 
  • Must be able to lift 50 lbs. and stand for extended periods of time 
  • Successful candidates must be highly motivated and work with little supervision 
  • Always strive for excellence and constant improvement 


Additional Information

WE OFFER 

  • Competitive salaries commensurate with experience and qualifications 
  • Group benefits like insurance and RRSP 
  • Additional training and uniform 
  • Great working environment 
  • Overtime opportunities 

HOURS OF WORK 

  • Permanent and full-time position 
  • 44 hours per week, able to work extended hours/weekends when deemed necessary 

HEALTH AND SAFETY 

  • Must work in compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Regulation and follow in accordance with AIM’s Health and Safety policies and procedures 
  • Responsible for reporting all accidents, illnesses, or ‘near miss’ incidents to management

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR KENNY U-PULL?

Get ready to immerse yourself in a professional playground of cars.

Become our clients’ ally to provide the best customer service. At Kenny U-Pull, we adhere to high operational standards to maintain an organized and efficient workspace where we repurpose cars and their parts to give them a second life. Join our team in one of North America’s leading companies in the self-service auto part industry.

It’s simple: we do it right. We aim for excellence.

This position is eligible for an annual retention bonus of up to $1150

Job Description

  • Clean up vehicles by removing liquid chemicals and certain parts, such as the battery, to prepare the vehicle to be displayed in the yard to customers.
  • Remove tires from rims and sort them, fill retail shelves.
  • Clean, test and sort batteries to be displayed for purchase.
    • Fill cans with certain liquids and affix labels.
  • Set vehicles in our yard on rim stands in an orderly manner.
  • Prepare, organize and clean the yard.
  • Keep the work space clean and orderly.
  • Any other tasks required by the business
Qualifications

  • Excellent physical condition
  • Reliability, diligence and punctuality
  • Health and safety awareness
  • Attention to detail
  • Versatility
  • Good manual dexterity
  • Drive to achieve results


Additional Information

  • Typical work schedule: Monday to Friday
  • Occasional additional Saturday shifts
  • Permanent, full-time position
  • Possibility of working indoors and outdoors daily

What we offer:

  • Group insurance after 3 months
  • Group RRSP after 6 months
  • Overtime at time-and-a-half after 44 hours
  • Bonus plan
  • Employee discounts
  • Uniform/Coveralls
  • Tools Provided

American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to everyone. The masculine form is used solely to make the text easier to read. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: General Labour - Full-Time
description:
Company Description

Welcome to EagleCraft Boats! 

At our plant in beautiful Campbell River, British Columbia, our talented team of 25 full-time staff specializes in designing and building custom aluminum boats. Well represented across the globe, our company is proud to have built over 800 aluminum quality vessels ranging from pleasure crafts to commercial work boats.

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Ensure that company property, building, vehicles and tools are safe, secure, operational, organized and clean;
  • Safely operate equipment and vehicles related to the job's needs;
  • Perform scheduled and as-needed maintenance/inspection/calibration/repairs according to machinery specifications ;
  • Ensure work area is kept clean and organized to reduce or remove hazards;
  • Follow all applicable Eaglecraft Boats and WorkSafeBC Occupational Health & Safety regulations.
  • Complete general shop duties as assigned (deburr aluminum, move material, unload/organize deliveries, clean boats, etc)
  • Assist production or other departments, as needed.

 

Qualifications

What do you need to succeed?

  • Relevant experience in a manufacturing/shop/construction environment preferred;
  • Technical certificates and/or professional certifications preferred (crane, forklift, Worksafe training, welding, painting, carpentry);
  • Valid driver’s license required;
  • Continuous physical effort is required (standing, walking, stooping, climbing, grasping/reaching. Lifting/moving items up to 75 pounds.

At EagleCraft, we recognize and embrace the importance of values in our ever-changing workplace. To be successful, all applicants must demonstrate behaviours that are reflective of our values:



Additional Information

What's in it for you?

  • Year-round, full-time permanent work;
  • Year-round indoor working conditions;
  • Working alongside a great team of talented individuals;
  • Building a world-class product;
  • Opportunity for advancement;
  • Family owned company;
  • Fun work events (Christmas Party, BBQ, Golf , etc.);
  • Competitive Salary based on  experience;
    • Wage reviews are conducted after successful completion of the probationary period and annually after the first year of employment.
  • Every other Friday is a day off based on a 9hr day/ 9 day pay period
  • Extended Benefits Coverage;
  • Employee Assistant Programs;
  • Employee Purchase Discount on Marine materials;
  • Education and Apprenticeship Opportunities;

 WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Regular periods during which there is continuous physical effort is required, e.g., walking, standing, stooping, climbing, lifting material or equipment, some of which may be heavy or awkward;
  • Exposure to factors such as temperature variations, fumes, moving machinery, humidity, toxic materials which may cause periods of discomfort, high noise levels;
  • Frequent need to give concentrated attention, either hearing or seeing to work being performed;
  • Noticeable pressure from deadlines, production quotas, accuracy or similar demands exists.

title: Carpenter/Apprentice/Framer (FT)
description:
PCR Construction is seeking Red Seal Carpenters and Carpenter Apprentices to join our team in Whitehorse, YT.

We offer an exciting opportunity to develop and grow within our Yukon business. These positions will utilize your experience and technical skills as we embark on the construction of a new 54-unit condominium building in downtown Whitehorse.

Job Duties:
  • Collaborating with management and vendors in the delivery of quality product and customer service.
  • Project planning components including material takeoffs, equipment and staff allocation.
  • Assisting with the training of new crew members, monitoring job progress and scope, participating in and leading the company health and safety program.
  • Building foundations, installing floor beams, laying sub-flooring and installing walls and roofing systems.
  • Fitting and installing trim, doors, stairs, moulding and hardware.
  • Measuring, cutting and joining materials made of wood or wood substitutes.
  • Repairing and renovating wooden structures.
  • Framing carpentry experience is an asset.
  • Preparing cost estimates for clients.
  • Reading and interpreting blueprints, drawings and sketches.
  • Backing & blocking, formwork and parapet framing.
  • Building panels, footings, retaining walls and stairs.
  • Planning timelines and meeting deadlines.
  • Collaborates with management and vendors in the delivery of quality product and customer service.
  • Ensuring all work meets safety codes and applicable permits, inspections and reports are in place.
  • Other related duties.
Qualifications:
  • Registered Carpentry Apprentice or Red Seal Carpentry certification.
  • Commercial, industrial, and residential experience.
  • Experience with framing, formwork and finishing.
  • Strong knowledge of general construction duties - pump set up, use of tools, PPE, weather protection, etc.
  • Demonstrated ability to adjust to work-related demands.
  • Demonstrated ability to work safely.
  • Strong work ethic and reliability.
  • Valid Driver's License and reliable transportation.
  • Available for work in Whitehorse, Yukon (please note these are not a rotational, fly-in/fly-out positions. The incumbent is expected to relocate if out of territory.).
To assist with evaluation, please provide a resume including description of prior work experience, skills acquired, education and references.

Salary: DOE (Dependent on Experience).
Category: Regular, full-time.
Pay: $20.00-$40.00 per hour.

title: Skilled Carpenter
description:
Since 2009, M-Squared Contracting has supplied the GTA with high-end, residential renovations. Our primary focus is ensuring that we leave our clients with a high-quality home and a positive experience.

Do you have experience in high-quality residential renovations, and can you perform high-end finish work? We’re a dynamic, well-established company and we're looking to expand our team of skilled and passionate carpenters. Having a great team that cooperates, is always looking to improve their craft, and stays with us for a long time is important to us. We’re looking for skilled carpenters with experience in high-quality residential renovations from start to finish. Our ideal candidate will be motivated and ambitious—a team player with a good work ethic. 

We offer full-time, permanent year-round employment (40 hr week guaranteed), competitive wages, benefits, and perks like tool allowances, flexible vacation time, summer hours, and other generous company bonuses.

Work hours are from 7:00 am to 4:30 pm, Monday to Friday.

Qualifications: 
  • 5 or more years of experience in residential renovation.
  • Ability to lift 50+ pounds.
  • Own basic hand tools.
  • Ability to work in Canada.

Responsibilities:
  • Ability to produce high-end finish carpentry.
  • Competent in all aspects of framing.
  • Window and door framing.
  • Layout floor.
  • Working knowledge of various sub-trades, with the ability to manage/oversee their work.
  • Ability to read/interpret drawings and architectural details.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Capable of working directly with clients, inspectors and designers in a professional manner.
  • Ability to multitask, work under pressure, and complete jobs with demanding deadlines while keeping great attention to detail.
  • Highly motivated and high level of initiative; confidence to work independently and with a team, in support of project goals and objectives.
Adheres to company safety guidelines with a working knowledge of relevant Ministry of Labour requirements.
  • Flexibility to work weekends and overtime during hectic, busy times.

Job Type: Permanent full-time with benefits.
Salary: 28 - 38 / hourly.
Work Location: All projects within the GTA.

title: Playground Carpenter
description:
At Earthscape, we create beautiful, innovative custom playground sculptures and structures that inspire children and adults to creatively play.  By partnering with some of the most prestigious Landscape Architecture firms in North America, we bring brilliant playground concepts to life. Our award-winning design-build firm is located just outside of Elmira, Ontario in Waterloo Region.

Together, our ambitious team designs, engineers, builds and installs state-of-the-art timber playgrounds that become iconic and well-loved destination spaces. The work environment we've created is positive, productive, fun and rewarding. To see our one-of-a-kind projects, visit www.earthscapeplay.com.

Currently, we are looking for a Playground Carpenter to join our growing team.  The role of this team member is best suited to someone who is interested in custom manufacturing and design, but also someone who is comfortable working outside the box; our playgrounds don't fit within regular building code categories. 

Who are we looking for?

As a Playground Carpenter, you:

  • will work with an experienced team of engineers and wood craftspeople and carpenters and will bring your keen eye for construction design to help us figure out how to best build our playground structures and sculptures;
  • enjoy physical work with large timbers to build custom designed playable-wood sculptures;
  • must know how to read construction drawings from our Engineering department;
  • be competent in operating all types of standard wood shop machinery;
  • have excellent problem solving skills - our designers and Engineers are constantly looking for feedback on how best to construct our unique playground pieces;
  • will be a critical part of conversations to discuss what worked and what didn't work for each project;
  • will work with a team of engineers and wood craftspeople and carpenters to build our playground structures and sculptures;
  • have great attention to detail;

What's in it for you?

This job offers the opportunity to work on some of North America's most interesting playground projects. The pace, challenges and problem-solving opportunities mean you will never be bored. You will have the opportunity to develop and refine a wide variety of skills in our rapidly growing business. When we asked our current Playground Carpenters what keeps them here, they responded "a warm workshop with heated floors, a fully equipped workshop that you may also use for personal projects, great co-workers who have mutual respect for each other, food truck on site, outside training opportunities, voluntary travel as a site supervisor, and seasonal activities like pond hockey, and run clubs/walking trails on site."

Compensation: We believe in great compensation for great employees, and we reward our staff with a combination of:

  • profit sharing and performance bonuses
  • overtime pay
  • award-winning projects and designs
  • up to date equipment
  • no management hassles and great colleagues
  • benefits for full-time employees

Job Type: Full-time, Permanent

Compensation: $20.00-$30.00 per hour based on experience

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Employee stock purchase plan
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Profit sharing
  • Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends
  • Overtime

COVID-19 considerations: Earthscape is operating under a detailed COVID-19 Safety Plan. More details can be provided if you are selected for an interview.

See us in action!

title: General Labourer
description:
Merchandising Specialist – Flowers and Plants 

About the Position

Brand Momentum is looking for two General Labourers to work together at local sites in Prince George. 

6 hours/week

Key Responsibilities:

- Take off shelves by unhooking from slots
- The shelves to be stacked flat on base with hooks fitting into pole openings;
- Make sure the triangular tow bar of the base is not stacked underneath the shelves, so that it can still be used to make a train and be pulled with;
- Stack the shelves not higher than 50 per base;
- All carts with no shelves left are to be further dismantled by taking the poles off and stacking these on a cart with shelves and place 40 poles per shelf.
- Stack the ‘bare' bases not higher than 12 per stack.

;t=436s

Specific Requirements:

· Must be able to lift 50 pounds alone

· Must have access to a vehicle

· Must wear steel toe footwear

· Must be able to work outside in all elements

· Must be able to work independently and as a team member

· Must observe store safety protocols

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary

About Brand Momentum

We are a national integrated Sales, Marketing, and Retail solutions agency with two headquarters, one in Toronto and one in Montreal. We deliver authentic and enduring human connections, and we are led by a talented team and supported by a network of trusted partners. Rooted in Goodness, Brand Momentum is a three-time winner of Canada's top 100 Best Workplace® and one of Canada's top 500 fastest growing companies.

About Our Culture

Goodness is at the heart of everything we do. Brand Momentum (BMI) is an enduring market leader in quality and innovation. We deliver on our promises to our clients and each other, and we do it with passion, innovation and a commitment to excellence. Every single day we live our values of integrity, respect, empowerment, commitment, fun, flexibility and fiscal responsibility while putting our valued clients at the center of every decision we make.

title: Labourer I, Edmonton Waste Management Centre - (Job Number: 43671)
description:
Description43671
Qualifications

The Edmonton Waste Management Centre (EWMC) is a unique collection of waste processing and research facilities. Owned and operated by the City of Edmonton, the EWMC is an integral part of Edmonton's sustainable approach to waste management. Join the EWMC’s family as a Labourer I, where you will provide general labouring support around the site. Your success in this role will be measured by your ability to perform all work tasks in a respectful and inclusive way.


With a focus on the City of Edmonton’s Cultural Commitments to Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, you will:

  • General cleaning of the site, including snow removal, litter picking and sweeping
  • Lawn maintenance using grass trimmers and push/ride-on mowers
  • Vegetation management, including weed control operations using mechanical and cultural methods; hand pulling; and applying pesticides in accordance with provincial legislation and City standards
  • Site maintenance, including pruning, edging, fence and repair, pressure washing and watering
  • Maintenance and minor repairs on powered equipment, including push mowers and riding tractors
  • Use tools such as shovels, rakes, stake pounders and various small hand/electric tools
  • Other related duties as required

title: Carpenter Red Seal
description:
Minimum Clearance Required to Start:


Not Applicable/None


Job Description:


Parsons has been successful in winning environmental and mining projects in Northern Canada and will be aggressively pursuing additional northern projects. We are a world-class leader in providing in-depth engineering, construction, technical, and management services. Our employees deliver landmark commercial, industrial, environmental, energy, power, and renewable infrastructure — and provide innovative solutions to complex environmental, water quality, supply, treatment, watershed, and wastewater projects. We hire colleagues with an entrepreneurial spirit who thrive on solving project challenges in a high-energy environment. Parsons is helping to build a healthier and more sustainable world.


Parsons is now hiring a Carpenter for our Faro Mine Site.


Responsibilities:


The Carpenter performs carpentry duties necessary to maintain building structures and finishes in good repair including repairing or installing new walls, partitions, floor tiles, ceiling tiles, and systems furniture. Also included are drywall patching, painting, and adjusting and installing door hardware. Work involves most of the following: planning and laying out of work from blueprints, drawings, models, or verbal instructions, using a variety of carpenter's hand tools, portable power tools and standard measuring instruments, and making standard shop computations relating to dimensions of work; and selecting materials necessary for the work. Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.


EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE

• High School diploma or equivalent.

• Formal or informal education or training which ensures the ability to read and write at a level necessary for successful job performance.

• Minimum of ten years of carpentry experience required.

• Ability to lift up to 45 lbs

• Computer Skills: Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, etc.) preferred.


The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by federal, state, provincial or local mandates or customer requirements.


About Us
Parsons is a digitally enabled solutions provider focused on the defense, security, and infrastructure markets. With nearly 75 years of experience, Parsons is uniquely qualified to deliver cyber/converged security, technology-based intellectual property, and other innovative services to federal, regional, and local government agencies, as well as to private industrial customers worldwide.
Parsons is an equal opportunity, drug-free employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Minority/Female/Disabled/Protected Veteran/LGBTQ+.
For more about Parsons, visit parsons.com and follow us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and YouTube.

title: General Labour
description:
Are you searching for a fun, fast-paced opportunity? Want to work full time or part time? PeopleReady is looking for general labourers in your area to work with one of our premier clients. At PeopleReady we value and respect our employees. When you work for PeopleReady you're not just joining a company but joining a family. If you're the type of person who gives 100% to what you do, we want to talk to you. We're not looking for someone who can just get the job done. We are looking for someone who can also be our goodwill ambassador.

Work Locations: Oshawa, Whitby, Bowmanville, Pickering, Ajax, Courtice, Uxbridge and Stouffville.

Shift timing - 1st shift (Day)

Responsibilities Include:

*

General site cleanup

* Working outside

* Loading and unloading materials

* Repackaging skids

* Inventory control

* Delivery assistant

Qualifications:

* There is no minimal educational requirement, but specialized training can help Labourers advance

* Experience on commercial construction sites but not mandatory.

* Strong work ethic

PeopleReady is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religious affiliation, color, national origin, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by law. We will get to know you and connect you with jobs that match your skills, experience and preferences. We work hard every single day to find jobs so each employee has opportunity and variety in their work.

title: Skilled Ground Worker in Fort McMurray, Alberta | Careers at North American Construction Group
description:
Position Scope

NACG is looking for a labourer to work on a remote mining site in the Fort McMurray area. You must be well-organized and favor safety above everything else.

 

Site: Fort Hills

Schedule: 14x7- 12 hours (paid for 11.5 hours) (Days and nights)

Accommodations: Camp provided

Transportation: Flights are provided to and from Edmonton or Calgary. All individuals utilizing provided flights must be fully vaccinated as per federal transportation regulations. Bussing provided from Fort McMurray to site (before and after shifts)

Overtime: Provided after 8 hours a day or 44 hours a week

 

The successful candidate will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955. 

 

Qualifications

  • Successful applicants must to be willing to help out in all tasks for general labourer duties.
  • Must be physically fit and be able to lift 50 pounds
  • Must have a valid driver's license.
  • High school diploma, GED, and/or post-secondary education is considered an asset.

Summary

All successful candidates must:

  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  • Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  • Disclose COVID-19 vaccination status:
    • Fully immunized individuals must provide government issued proof of vaccination to be exempt from site testing requirements
    • Individuals not fully immunized may be subject to site COVID-19 testing requirements and associated costs
  • Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

    Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

    All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  • CSO or BSO Certification
  • Copy of Valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Copy of recent Driver’s Abstract
  • VOID cheque/direct deposit form
  • Silica Awareness
  • Hydrogen Sulphide Awareness

  • Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  • Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  • An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  • After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

  • Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

     

    NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

    Overview

    North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.  In that time, we’ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. We’ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers. 

    In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

    • Significant Growth – As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
    • Long Term Contracts – With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
    • Commitment To Safety – With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
    • Competitive Compensation – NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.

    North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

     

    Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Labourer Summer Student
description:
Benefits/Perks
  • Competitive wages and a flexible working schedule (including opportunities to travel)
  • A challenging, fun atmosphere with a great team
  • Training opportunities and advancement within the company
  • Benefits available after a probationary period
  • Company purpose statement is “to provide our employees with a workplace that is considered a vehicle for personal and professional growth”. We hire based on our company values - The DRIVEN Principles.  You will be with like-minded individuals. 
 We are seeking a Labourer (Summer Student) for our crew.  As the Labourer, you will perform a wide variety of projects for various clients across the city. Company OverviewEverLine Coatings and Services is a premier line painting and maintenance company that proudly has a location in Your City.  We provide high-quality line painting and pavement maintenance services for parking lots, roadways, parkades, and warehouses. In addition to painting services, we offer power sweeping, power washing, asphalt seal coating, crack filling, and more.  Our success is a direct result of our dedicated team. Every employee at EverLine is committed to providing complete customer satisfaction in the delivery of our services. We work hard, have fun, and have an amazing corporate culture. Our teams are DRIVEN. Dedicated, Resourceful, Integrity-Focused, Value-Based, Excelling, and Nourishing. Are you ready to make an impact?  Job SummaryOur Labourer utilize our specialized equipment and apply materials on pavement surfaces in order to provide maximum value for our clients' pavement assets.  Responsibilities WHAT YOU’LL DO
  • Use equipment to perform line painting, asphalt crack filling and seal coating, power washing, epoxy flooring, and more
  • Plan and facilitate the production of a high-quality project
  • Communicate job status daily with the Operations Manager
  • Maintain a safe, hazard-free job site 
  • Additional tasks as required 
 QualificationsWHAT YOU BRING
  • A Ontario driver’s license with a clean driving record (Driver’s Abstract is required) and a reliable mode of transportation
  • You are a self-motivated, critical thinker that likes to problem solve 
  • You understand the importance of punctuality, organization, and attention to detail 
  • Ability to work night shift
  • Ability to work in a physically demanding role with lots of walking, bending, and lifting (up to 75lbs)
  • Ability to work well independently unsupervised
  • Past experience with small engines (like lawnmowers) and/or paint sprayers is an asset
  • Desire to learn and exceed expectations
  • An Engineering educational background is an asset

title: General Labourer
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a General Labourer at our 591 Arvin facility.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the General Labourer is responsible for performing a variety of production tasks, including but not limited to, loading and packing customer product. Employees will be responsible for adhering to the policies and procedures outlined in the TS16949 Quality System and practice continuous improvement wherever possible.

Wages starting at $17.15

Shift premium and shift incentive available for 4am, 1:00pm and 4:00pm shifts.

Shifts Available:

  • 4:00am - 1:00pm
  • 7:15am - 4:15pm
  • 1:00pm - 10:00pm
  • 4:00pm - 1:00am

Responsibilities:

  • Package product according to customer specifications, ensuring that all product is handled in a proper, safe manner at all times, no partial boxes are shipped, similar parts are packaged together and boxes are properly labeled.
  • Load product on production racks and visually inspect ongoing product for defects, ensuring non-conforming product is segregated from production line.
  • Sand product off line when required.
  • Remove product from production racks upon processing and place empty racks into designated buggies.
  • Maintain clean and orderly work area both throughout and after the shift.
  • Notify supervisor immediately of any equipment or production problems.
  • Comply with company work and safety rules at all times and report all accidents, incidents and hazards immediately.
  • Participate in corrective/preventative action when required.
  • Practice continuous improvement; identify processes or procedures that will result in production of non-conforming product, or identifying any processes or procedures that can be improved and result in better company performance.
  • Adhere to all procedures and policies as outlined in the TS 16949 quality system.
  • Perform other duties assigned from time to time by supervisor.

Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 or equivalent work experience
  • Manufacturing experience preferred
  • Demonstrated communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to follow work instructions
  • Demonstrated organizational skills


Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources at

hr@tiercon.com

.

title: General Labourer
description:
Job description

General Labourer

Shift: Day Shift

Competitive start rate based on experience!

Location: Downviews

Here’s what we do at our Ashwarren Yard…

Ferrous Scrap Metal Recycling

RAM’s highly trained and experienced staff, utilize the latest in specialized equipment to collect, sort and process all varieties of Ferrous metals. Our streamlined recycling techniques maximize the recovery of iron to increase value to various mills and foundries in Canada and abroad.

Here’s where you come in!

Are you a motivated self starter that works well contributing to high performing teams and enjoys a dynamic work environment? RAM needs you to help build a sustainable future in recycling management, while doing your part to protect the environment and our neighborhoods.

We are growing and need one (1) General Labourer to join our Ashwarren Yard.

Now that you know about us, we want to know more about you! We are looking for someone who can:

  • Ensure clear roadways,
  • Spot, direct traffic
  • Garage duty
  • Other duties as assigned
  • General labour duties not limited to the above

Make a Positive Change

RAM Iron & Metal Inc. offers great career opportunities with competitive compensation packages; inclusive of comprehensive health care benefits, RRSP contributions, profit sharing, and other incentives to attract and retain great talent like you.

Discover How!

Send us your resume and let us know how you would you make an impact at RAM.

Please note Ram Iron & Metal Inc. is committed to accommodating people with disabilities as part of our hiring process. If you have special requirements, please advise Human Resources during the recruitment process.

title: General Laborer (Construction)
description:
Job Description: All-purpose Renovation Contractor
Go Industries is looking for an ambitiousAll-purpose Renovation Contractor. You will be responsible for all renovation work including layout, installation, and repairs for our client’s commercial, industrial, and residential customers. 

The Opportunity:
We are looking for an experienced full-time All-purpose Renovation Contractor to join our prestigious heating and cooling client’s team. This is a full-time opportunity with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow. 
 
Key Responsibilities:
  • Must have expertise in multiple types of repairs, maintenance, and remodeling.
  • Must possess basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate.
  • General Carpentry - Rough and Finish.
  • Ability to Upgrades / Remodel / Refresh / Remodel all types of commercial, residential, and industrial spaces. 
  • Painting Interior and Exterior.
  • Drywall Repair/Patching / Caulking.
  • Electrical knowledge.
  • Minor Plumbing and Minor Electrical Knowledge.
  • Flooring Repair and Installation.
  • Ceramic Tile Installation.
  • Handyman, General Home Repairs and Maintenance Work.

Qualifications:
  • 2-5 years of renovation experience. 
  • Valid Driver’s license with clean abstract.
  • Able to work at multiple sites in Ontario Primarily in the Hamilton area.
  • Experience working in other trades is a bonus. (HVAC/Plumbing/Electrical)
  • Ceramic tile installation is a bonus.

Pay rate: 
  • Up to $40.00 per hour for the right candidate. 
 




    About Go Heating/Natural Direct Canada:

    GO Heating & Cooling has been proudly serving the communities Simcoe County, Bruce, Grey, Kawartha Lakes, Muskoka, Dufferin, Peel, York, Durham Region and surrounding areas since 1977. Our reputation has been built on Quality Service, Honesty and Integrity and this has made us the service provider of choice. Over the years, the GO company has grown but our commitment to our core values and to our community remains the same today as it did when we first opened our doors. Today we’re more than just furnaces and air conditioners – we’re home comfort experts. We know what it takes to keep your home healthy and comfortable, each and every day.

title: Labourer (Casual)
description:
Job Description:

Part-Time; Event-Based
Wage: $24.61/hour plus 10% in lieu of benefits and vacation

Date Posted: March 3, 2022

 

Who We Are

 

The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This 112-year-old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of approximately $58 million dollars and generates revenue through four activity streams:   the 15-day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights, year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events.   The fourth activity stream is park care and facility maintenance.   The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best, we can be.

At the PNE, we strive to create an environment that reflects our organizationâ€™s core values: Enthusiasm, Excellence and Evolution.   With a focus on these core values, we are committed to achieving our mission which is to â€œDeliver Memorable Experiencesâ€ for all who interact with the PNE whether it is our guests, our employees, or the community.

We are seeking diligent and hard-working individuals that have a passion for the Events industry and the Pacific National Exhibition (PNE). Our Labourer team works work under the direction of the Director, PNE Maintenance & Facility Operations and are responsible for site maintenance, and setup/teardown of events. They will operate vehicles and tools/equipment in compliance with all health and safety requirements as determined by WorkSafeBC, and all other applicable legislation and company policies.

 

Why join our Team?

 

  • Exhilarating and fun-loving culture
  • Flexible work environment
  • Opportunity for free or discounted tickets to shows, events, sports games, and much more
  • Staff discounts for Playland, The Fair, and Fright Nights, as well as all PNE Food Stands
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to create lasting memories and friendships!

 

What will you do this year?

 

In your role as a Labourer, your primary accountabilities will be to:

  • Help in the set-up of events by moving equipment, furniture, assembling barricades, setting up seating etc.
  • Perform maintenance and janitorial tasks including cleaning washrooms, mopping, sweeping, vacuuming, and stocking supplies as needed.
  • Service and maintain equipment operated by site maintenance.
  • Effectively use heavy and light equipment, depending on the jobsite/assignment.
  • Assemble and dismantle special event facilities.
  • Maintain a safe and clean work environment.
  • Perform other related work as required.

 

What else?

  • Previous general labour and janitorial experience is required.
  • Must be capable of lifting 50lb objects; be highly motivated and able to work alone.
  • A valid class 5 BC driverâ€™s license is required.
  • Previous experience operating a forklift is preferred.
  • A valid forklift operating license is an asset.
  • A valid aerial lift or fall arrest ceritifcation is an asset.  
  • Knowledge of materials, methods and equipment used in janitorial work.
  • Knowledge of methods and practices used in servicing and maintaining equipment operated.
  • Knowledge of methods, materials, tools, and equipment used in assembling and dismantling special event facilities and in performing maintenance and janitorial tasks.
  • Successful completion of grade 12 preferred.
  • OFA Level I (or higher) is considered an asset.
  • Skill in the operation of construction and maintenance equipment and the use of tools used in servicing, minor maintenance tasks are desirable.
  • Ability to carry out work orders and prepare and maintain work records.
  • Must have CSA approved steel toe boots.
  • Must be available to work a variety of shifts including weekends, week days, and overnight shifts.
  • Must be comfortable working an event based schedule, as hours of work will vary.
  • The PNE has implemented a Proof of Vaccination policy and due to requirements of this position the successful candidate must provide proof of vaccination.
  • Candidates must undergo a Criminal Record Check.

 

Who are you?

 

  • Team Player
  • Passionate
  • Skillful communicator
  • Proactive
  • Committed

 

Where and when to APPLY?

 

Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the role is filled.

We look forward to hearing from you!

 

The PNE is proud to be an  equal  opportunity  employer, committed to creating an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse community we proudly serve. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or age. If you require any support or accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the People & Culture Department at  

hr@pne.ca

.

title: Carpenter and Handyman
description:
We consistently hire reliable, customer service-focused employees who are both knowledgeable and skilled. They are experienced in many areas of handyman repair and they know the value of building relationships with our clients. Our team of qualified experts live our code of values of Respect, Integrity, and Customer Focus while having fun in the process!As Handyman/Carpenter, you are a key member of our team responsible for quality repairs, remodeling, and home improvement projects. You will build customer relationships and uphold our standard for excellent customer service. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.You have a strong background of skilled tradesman experience and have proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.  You are self-motivated, thrive in fast moving environments, and able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines.Specific Responsibilities:
  • Complete small to medium repairs, remodeling, and home improvement projects
  • Communicate with customers about scope of work and cost estimates
  • Insure the efficient use of materials and maintain adequate stock of necessary equipment
  • Collect payment and/or payment information from customers for work performed
  • Keep company vehicle and equipment properly serviced, clean, and in good working order and condition
  • Complete invoices, daily route sheets, and weekly reports as required
  • Perform other duties as needed which may include cross-training in related positions
Job Requirements:
  • Skilled tradesman with 10 years of experience in home maintenance/repair and remodeling
  • Strong carpentry background
  • Must have own tools fit for many job types
  • Proficiency to navigate tablet based technology
  • Team player who can work independently
Benefits: New work van, fuel, uniforms, paid holidays and vacations, bonus opportunities available.We are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow-up!Proudly serving: West Calgary, Bearspaw, Springbank, Strathmore, Cochrane, Airdrie and surrounding areas.

Notice

Mr. Handyman International LLC is the franchisor of the Mr. Handyman® franchised system. Each Mr. Handyman® franchised location is independently-owned and operated by an independent franchisee performing services. As a service to its independent franchisees, Mr. Handyman International LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. Mr. Handyman International LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent Mr. Handyman® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither Mr. Handyman International LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. Mr. Handyman International LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: General Labourer
description:
Overview:

If you  have experience in a shop, warehouse, or general labour position, come start a career with  Fountain Tire Sudbury (Elisabella) as a General Labourer! We are willing to train interested applicants who are looking for a career in the Automotive Industry  and love to work with their hands.

 

What do we offer?

  • $16 an hour
  • On the job training
  • The opportunity to work with an excellent team and great customers in a clean, safe and respectful environment
  • Regular day shifts, with opportunity for overtime during our busy seasons (spring and fall)
  • Competitive wage, benefit programs for you and your family, including a RRSP program with company matching
  • Discounts for you and your family on tires, parts and services at all Fountain Tire locations
  • The opportunity for growth into apprenticeships and  leadership positions - own your own Fountain Tire location!

You will be responsible for:

  • Installing, balancing, rotating, and repairing passenger and light truck tires and wheels  
  • Resetting and repairing tire pressure monitoring systems (TPMS)
  • Maintaining tire service equipment on a regularly scheduled basis
  • Completing specialty tire work
  • Operating company and customer vehicles in a clean and safe manner

What does it take to get on track?

  • A valid driver's license
  • Some experience in an automotive shop would be great, but mostly we are looking for reliable candidates with a willingness to learn!
  • A customer-service focus with the ability to develop and maintain effective relationships with team members and customers
  • A keen attention to detail
  • Basic computer skills
  • Ability to consistently lift 25 kilograms

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply online or in store today!!

title: Labourer
description:
The Labourer is key member of our team, responsible over our property for cleanliness and organization, and assisting plumbers & apprentices to complete large scale jobs. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.  

Ideally you have prior experience in the plumbing industry and have proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.  You are self-motivated, thrive in fast moving environments, and able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines.  

Mr. Rooter Plumbing of Ottawa is interested in hiring people looking to be introduced into the plumbing trade, or those looking to gain experience in the trade. We are confident that the variety of jobs that are performed at our company will be helpful in education and skill development.

 

Specific Responsibilities:

  • Supporting plumbers and apprentices to complete large scale jobs which may involve digging, chipping concrete, and other labour-intensive tasks.
  • Perform minor to non-complex service work on plumbing systems in commercial and residential environments

  • Communicate problems, propose solutions, and explain billing to customers

  • Organizing tools, materials, and coordinating job activities with team members.
 

Job Requirements:

  • Prior industry experienced preferred

  • Valid Driver's License

  • Ability to operate basic hand tools necessary for the craft

  • Attention to detail

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Professional appearance and personality

 

Benefits: Benefits package varies by location

 

We are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow up!

Notice

As a service to its independent franchisees, Mr. Rooter LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. Mr. Rooter LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent Mr. Rooter® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither Mr. Rooter LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. title: Part-time General Labour
description:
Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?
Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in Toronto, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. Our Company employs approximately 11,500 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.

Our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. As we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.

Maple Leaf Foods Bradford Plant is Hiring for multiple General Labour positions within our Production team!
The General Labour position is responsible for performing packaging, clean-up and other general activities related to food processing.
We are offering part-time work opportunities for people who are interested in working afternoonshift, 2-3 days per week.

Job Title: General Labour
Department: Production
Reports To: Production Supervisor

We have numerous positions available for the following shifts:
  • Tray Pack Department: Monday - Friday, 5:30 pm - 1:30 am (or end of shift)
  • Cut-Up Department: Monday - Friday, 6:30 pm - 3:00 am (or end of shift)
Details regarding wages and shift premium will be discussed when contacted.

Responsibilities:
  • Manually pack product into bags, trays and other packaging formats as per customer specification
  • Check products and packaging for basic quality defects
  • Cut-up product and hang poultry
  • Operate single-function machines
  • Load product onto packaging line for processing
  • Ensure work area is clean and tidy
  • Follow all GMP and food safety principles
Experience:
  • Able to work in a fast-paced work environment
  • Able to stand and walk throughout the shift
  • Able to perform repetitive lifting
  • Can work well in a team environment and support fellow team members
  • Good communication skills

Why Maple Leaf Foods?

  • Training provided where needed, specifically in Human Resources, Health & Safety, Food Safety and on-the-job training
  • Reputable company and well-known brands
  • Competitive Wages
  • Great team environment
  • Strong focus on internal advancement and promotion
  • Employee Assistance Program and Mental Health support


If interested, please send resume by email to:

Jessica.madia@mapleleaf.com

or apply to our job posting onlinewith an updated resume and phone number atCareers and Jobs – Maple Leaf Foods, or through our other job boards.

These positions will remain open until filled.


We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. We ensure that our recruitment practices are supportive of this commitment.

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Come build with a BC Top Employer 2022 winner!

Jacob Bros Construction is immediately hiringSkilled & GeneralLabourers (Civil Construction)for projects throughout the lower mainland.

Your ​Rewards:

  • Full-time, permanentemployment
  • Work 10-12/h days, 5-6 days per week
  • Earn overtime after8 hours per day, and double time after 12 hours per day
  • Group Medical, Extended Health and Dental Plan
  • Group RRSP contribution
  • Vacation pay
  • 5 Year Service Award (Trip for twoanywhere in North America)
  • Eligibility for up to $2000.00 Referral Bonus Program
Responsibilities:
  • Manual labour, cleaning and preparing sites
  • Raking, shoveling, unloading trucks and maintenance tasks
  • Digging trenches, raking and shoveling
  • Cleaningdebris and removing waste materials from sites
  • Operate hand tools as directed
  • Worksafelyaround heavy construction equipment
  • Other labour duties as assigned
Requirements:

  • One (1) year proven civil constructionexperience for a privately held or family-owned general contracting business is preferred
  • Must be legally eligible to work for any employer in Canada

About Jacob Bros:

At Jacob Bros, our team of talented construction professionals is taking on some the most challenging projects in British Columbia's construction industry.

We are one of BC’s largest and most respected construction organizations, offering construction services in a variety of markets including heavy civil construction, major public infrastructure, and industrial, commercial, institutional and residential projects.

Jacob Bros has proudly served every major sector of Western Canada’s construction industry since 2008, and has been consistently recognized as a BC Top Employer.

Jacob Bros employs over 300 construction professionals, including staff and craft employees.

title: General Labourer (Dufferin Aggregates) - $24 - $29/hr
description:
Job ID:  402839 

Work Type:  Full Time Permanent 

 

It is a great time to join the Dufferin Aggregates team! Dufferin Aggregates is going through an exciting business transformation which demands first-class Talent Management support to drive results.


We are building a world- class team. Make your mark!


You will be a successful addition to our team if you look at change as an opportunity to develop and contribute to the business. You will be successful in your role if you like partnering with the business, presenting new ideas and providing excellent customer service.

Dufferin Aggregates, a divison of CRH Canada is looking to hire!

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Work in a team environment with other co-workers, supervisors and managers.
  • Complete cleanup assignments using shovels and/or small, heavy equipment.
  • Assist in maintenance inspections and activities using appropriate procedures.
  • Operate crushing and screening plant as trained and directed.
  • Report any malfunctions or safety risks to supervisor immediately.
  • Specific job duties will often vary from day to day depending on business needs.

Qualifications:

  • Experience in construction, mining or operating heavy machinery is preferred but not required.
  • Minimum Ontario high school diploma (OSSD) or equivalent.
  • Reliability – Showing up to work on time.
  • Be willing to work rotating shifts, overtime and weekends when required.
  • Physical ability to walk around the plant.
  • Basic maintenance/mechanical aptitude, welding and fitting is preferred but not required.
  • Dependability – follow instructions and respond to direction. Good communication skills are required.  
  • Working outdoors/indoors under varied temperatures and weather conditions.

Health and Safety:

  • Comply with OHSA and all of its applicable regulations.
  • Strict compliance with Dufferin Aggregates safety rules, PPE, policies and procedures.
  • Be aware of environmentally sensitive areas and be alert to correct environmental problems that may develop in the assigned work area.
     

What Dufferin Aggregates Offers You:

  • Pension and benefits included after probationary period.
  • Shift premium applies to night shifts.
  • Bonus pay based on safety and performance.
  • High competitive starting wage with multi-tier wage structure based on skill and ability.
  • Overtime opportunities are available as required.
  • PPE and tools allowance are provided by company for some positions.
  • Company provides training and appreciation events.
  • A culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

Visit our website for more information: http://www.crhcanada.com

CRH Canada Group Inc. recognizes Canada’s diverse landscape. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The Labourer is required to perform tasks involving physical labour at commercial construction projects, and to operate a variety of hand and power tools.

Qualifications

  • Knowledge of safe operation of basic hand and power tools
  • Minimum of 1 year previous construction labour experience preferred
  • Knowledge of workplace safety, and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Knowledge of First Aid and CPR preferred
  • Valid Drivers License and clean abstract preferred
  • Out of town work may be required. Work in all weather conditions.

 



Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. The carpenter is responsible for constructing and maintaining buildings.

Required knowledge includes: construction and remodeling trades, practices, procedures, techniques, tools and equipment, materials, specifications, quality control, cost control and safety.

The carpenter must be proficient at the following tasks: hanging doors, drilling and setting door hardware, setting windows, layout for stairs and common rafters, formwork, and reading blueprints. The carpenter must also possess the mathematical and analytical skills necessary to do materials estimates.

  • Ticketed Journeyperson Carpenter
  • Experienced with a large general contractor
  • Valid drivers license and clean drivers abstract preferred
  • Must be able to successfully pass criminal record check

title: Laborer
company: On The Greener Side Lawn & Tree Service
description:
Looking for a seasonal laborer.
The hours will be 40 hours per week and some Saturdays may be required.

Requirements:
  • Must have a driver's license and a vehicle to get to work.
  • Stamina and strength to perform manual labor.
  • Excellent hand-eye-coordination skills.

The job is to:
  • Assist with the installation of underground sprinklers, so there are physical demands and will be working outdoors.
  • There is digging, backfilling raking.
  • Some lifting is involved in this job, so you must be physically fit.

title: Carpenter
description:
Description:

The Engineering Department at Hamilton Health Sciences is an integral part of the support services, providing facilities maintenance services to all buildings, wards and departments at General, JHCC, JCC, St. Peters, WLMH and McMaster Children's Hospital sites. The Engineering staff is comprised of numerous and varied trades, including Stationary Engineers in the power plant, Electricians, Plumbers, Millwrights, Carpenters, Painters, etc. all contributing to the safe and efficient operation of the facilities. The department's goals can best be summarized as "SERVICE EXCELLENCE".



Qualifications:

The Engineering Department at Hamilton Health Sciences is an integral part of the support services, providing facilities maintenance services to all buildings, wards and departments at General, JHCC, JCC, St. Peters, WLMH and McMaster Children's Hospital sites. The Engineering staff is comprised of numerous and varied trades, including Stationary Engineers in the power plant, Electricians, Plumbers, Millwrights, Carpenters, Painters, etc. all contributing to the safe and efficient operation of the facilities. The department's goals can best be summarized as "SERVICE EXCELLENCE".


Under general supervision, the Carpenter is responsible for the construction, installation, repairs and maintenance of cabinet work, drywall partitions, doors and frames, windows, concrete floors, furniture, framework, locks, hardware, hinges, closures, weather stripping, blinds, curtain track and ceiling tile, exterior building repairs including soffits, minor glazing, caulking and minor roof repairs. Functions in accordance with duties defined in the job description of a Carpenter. May be assigned to work at any HHS site.


Under general supervision, the Carpenter is responsible for the construction, installation, repairs and maintenance of cabinet work, drywall partitions, doors and frames, windows, concrete floors, furniture, framework, locks, hardware, hinges, closures, weather stripping, blinds, curtain track and ceiling tile, exterior building repairs including soffits, minor glazing, caulking and minor roof repairs. Functions in accordance with duties defined in the job description of a Carpenter. May be assigned to work at any HHS site.


Monday to Friday; days


Monday to Friday; days


1. Current Province of Ontario General Carpenter Trade Certificate
2. Minimum five years experience as a qualified Tradesperson
3. Demonstrated ability to follow verbal and written instructions in English
4. Demonstrated ability to use tools and equipment of the trade
5. Demonstrated ability and willingness to work in areas that are cold, hot, dusty, dirty, noisy amongst machinery, at elevated levels and cramped quarters
6. Must be willing to provide own hand tools of the trade
7. Demonstrated ability to bend, crawl, lift heavy items, climb, work from ladders and scaffolding, and as required, wear a respirator to work in mechanical spaces containing sprayed asbestos fire-proofing


As a condition of employment, you are required to submit proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to Employee Health Services.


1. Current Province of Ontario General Carpenter Trade Certificate
2. Minimum five years experience as a qualified Tradesperson
3. Demonstrated ability to follow verbal and written instructions in English
4. Demonstrated ability to use tools and equipment of the trade
5. Demonstrated ability and willingness to work in areas that are cold, hot, dusty, dirty, noisy amongst machinery, at elevated levels and cramped quarters
6. Must be willing to provide own hand tools of the trade
7. Demonstrated ability to bend, crawl, lift heavy items, climb, work from ladders and scaffolding, and as required, wear a respirator to work in mechanical spaces containing sprayed asbestos fire-proofing


As a condition of employment, you are required to submit proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to Employee Health Services.


Guidelines for submitting an Application ~ UNION staff, who choose to submit their application through hard-copy mail, fax or email will need to have their application (ONA & OPSEU: with accompanying skills profile) available to the Recruitment Staff before 4 p.m. on the day the posting closes (day-7). ALL JOB SEEKERS, including UNION staff, who use the Career's Website to apply for job postings will have until 11 p.m. on the day the posting closes (day-7). ***INTERNAL JOB SEEKERS - Please ensure that both your ID# and last name are entered exactly as you see it on your most recent pay stub, otherwise you will be treated as an external candidate.***

Hamilton Health Sciences fosters a culture of patient and staff safety, whereby all employees are guided by our Mission, Vision, Values, and Values Based Code of Conduct. Hamilton Health Sciences is a teaching hospital and all staff and physicians are expected to support students and other learners.

To be considered for this opportunity applicants must apply during the posting period. All internal and external applicants may ONLY apply via the Careers website.

Hamilton Health Sciences is an equal opportunity employer and we will accommodate any needs under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedom, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact HR Operations at 905-521-2100, Ext. 46947 for assistance. If the applicant requires a specific accommodation because of a disability during an interview, the applicant will need to advise the hiring manager when scheduling the interview and the appropriate accommodations can be made.

This competition is open to all qualified applicants, however, qualified internal applicants will be considered first. Past performance will be considered as part of the selection process. If you are a previous employee of Hamilton Health Sciences, please note: the circumstances around an employee's exit will be considered prior to an offer of employment

Proficiency in both Official Languages, French and English, is considered an asset

If this position is temporary, selection for this position will be as per the outlined Collective Agreements:

Article 30 (k), CUPE Collective Agreement

Article 10.7 (d), ONA Collective Agreement

Article 13.01 (b) (ii), OPSEU 273 Collective Agreement

Article 14.04, OPSEU 209 Collective Agreement

Article 2.07 and Article 13, PIPSC RT Collective Agreement

title: Maintenance
company: Northview Canadian High Yield Residential Fund
description:
At Northview, we are a passionate, community-focused team dedicated to making our properties the best they can be. We are proud to live, work, and play in the neighborhoods we serve, next to our residents, hotel guests and commercial tenants across Canada.

We are looking for a Maintenance team member to join our Hotel team in Yellowknife, NT. Reporting to the Operations Manager, Hotel you will play a key role in ensuring that Northview’s Hotels show pride of ownership and respect for our Customers, by making sure they are kept in good repair, and that maintenance issues are resolved in a timely and cost efficient manner.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensuring the safety of common areas, and complying with Northview’s Health and Safety requirements
  • With a  focus on customer service, troubleshoot and prioritize work orders and handle emergency situations
  • Drywall repairs, painting prep and painting
  • Minor electrical repairs
  • Minor plumbing repairs, including boiler checks and hot water tank replacements where applicable
  • Perform water and sewer line repairs where applicable
  • Dealing with subcontract labour
  • Maintain company vehicle where applicable
  • Assisting with and or performing suite renovations and other upgrades
  • Moving furniture, equipment, materials and supplies, including clearing of vacant units
  • Maintain clean vacant lots, removal of garbage and debris from building and grounds
  • Maintain tools and equipment
  • Snow removal and ice control from all entrances/exits and walkways as required
  • Completion of suite inspections
  • Assisting with the development and implementation of preventive maintenance programs
  • Other related duties as assigned by the manager

Qualifications:

  • Able to work independently, is a self-starter an takes pride in a job well done
  • Three years previous experience in building maintenance
  • Proven ability to work productively and safely while under pressure
  • Good customer service skills and pleasant demeanor
  • An ability to speak and write English fluently
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs
  • Able to provide a criminal record check free of relevant convictions
  • Hold a valid driver’s licence  with a clean drivers abstract
  • Flexible schedule, able to work on call and weekends as needed

Benefits

    • Competitive pay
    • Extended health care including medical, dental and vision coverage
    • Life insurance, drug coverage and wellness programs
    • Discounts on rent at Northview properties
    • Vacation travel subsidization for northern employees

    About Northview

    Northview is a leading property management company operating in six provinces and two territories. We manage over 11,000 multi-residential units, 1.1 million sq. ft. of commercial space, three hotels and 200 executive suites. We are proud to live, work, and play in the neighborhoods we serve.

    As a condition of employment, all Northview employees are expected to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or can provide reason for exemption based on a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation. The successful candidate will be required to demonstrate their vaccinated status or reason for exemption before they start work with Northview. Northview will review and consider requests for exemption and will accommodate where required. Personal preference is not sufficient grounds for an exemption.

    If your background matches the qualifications listed above and you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference in the communities we serve, please submit your resume in confidence to www.rentnorthview.com/about/careers. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue through the selection process will be contacted. Northview welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you require a specific accommodation, please contact

    hr@northviewfund.com

    .
