title: Carpenter
description:
Why Fraser Health?:

We invite you to apply today and find out why more than 95% of new employees recommend Fraser Health to their friends as an exceptional place to work. A 2022 BC Top Employer, we value diversity in the work force and seek to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring & Trust.

 

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Full Time Carpenter to join the Facilities Maintenance and Operations team at Royal Columbian Hospital located in New Westminster, B.C.

 

Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlakaâ€™pamux Nations. Our team of 43,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.  

 

Effective October 26th 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization â€œWHOâ€ approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines).   Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.

 

Curious to learn what itâ€™s like to work here? Like us on  Facebook  (@fraserhealthcareers), follow us on  Twitter  &  Instagram  (@FHCareer), or connect with us on  LinkedIn  (fraserhealthcareers) for first-hand employee insights.

 

Detailed Overview:

In accordance with established vision and values of the organization, this position performs skilled carpentry work at the journeyman level in the installation, construction, alteration, troubleshooting, maintenance, repair, and/or service of structural elements, fittings and furniture in compliance with applicable codes and regulations.

Responsibilities:
  1. Reviews work requests and consults with user departments regarding specifications and other project requirements; interprets blueprints, drawings and specifications to determine the required materials and equipment; calculates materials and labour in estimating cost of projects and makes recommendations as required.
  2. Prepares for work projects by performing operational and safety risk assessments, arranging work schedules with user departments and assembling supplies, tools and equipment.
  3. Designs, constructs, and maintains woodwork, furniture, fittings and hardware by selecting, laying out, joining, assembling, erecting and/or dismantling materials; constructs, erects, installs and repairs structural elements in conformance with applicable Building Codes and By-Laws
  4. Assigns work tasks to designated staff and provides related training and orientation; checks work performed to ensure that the work was done properly.
  5. Maintains storage and work areas in clean, tidy and safe condition and maintains an inventory of supplies, equipment and tools; completes related reports and records including daily work summary sheets; recommends purchase of related supplies and equipment. Evaluates equipment/supplies for technical acceptance and safety prior to selection as required.
  6. Performs other general maintenance and repair duties related to building, grounds and equipment in a variety of areas as required/assigned.
  7. Performs all work in adherence to all applicable codes, regulations, and safety requirements, including regulations of the WCB.
  8. Performs other related duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Education and Experience

Certificate of Apprenticeship or Trades Qualification Certificate as a journeyman Carpenter recognized by the Province of British Columbia. Two (2) yearsï¿½ recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Skills and Abilities

  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints, drawings and specifications.  
  • Ability to organize work.  
  • Ability to operate related equipment.

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Who We Are:
Nestled in the southwestern corner of Alberta, in the rugged and legendary Canadian Rockies, Castle is as authentic as it gets. Hard-working, hospitable, and here for the powder is what we’re all about. With less than 200 employees we’re a small, passionate team of winter enthusiasts. Here, we’re all family and you will quickly find you are right at home. If this sounds like you, then we want you to join us.

Our resort is not owned or operated by a large ski conglomerate; rather by a bunch of local skiers and riders who are passionate about steep terrain and great snow. Operational decisions are made here (head office = the basement of the day lodge) and our long-term direction is plotted by a group of passionate, volunteer directors who represent more than 200, predominately local shareholders.

More Info including staff perks can be found at: https://www.skicastle.ca/employment/

 Position Overview:
Work at Beautiful Castle Mountain Resort in southwest Alberta. There are plenty of opportunities to explore the area after work and on days off. Castle Mountain Resort is seeking a Skilled Labourer to join our close-knit Maintenance Team for the Summer season (May to October).

What we offer you:
  • Opportunity to work in the beautiful Southern Alberta Rocky Mountains
  • Small team environment
  • Varied work tasks
  • $16.39/hr starting wage
  • 40hr/ week. Schedule is a 4-on (10hr), 3-off schedule. Overtime may be required, based on operational need
  • Workdays are Mon-Thurs during summer (May-Oct) with occasional weekend or holiday work
  • Opportunity for winter employment for the right candidate
  • Discounted Castle Mountain Resort Season Pass for the 22-23 Ski Season
  • On resort Staff Accommodation may be available

What you will be doing:
  • Assist lift mechanics with yearly maintenance on ski lifts
  • Operate chair lifts and apply safety lockouts (training will be provided)
  • Cleaning and rebuilding of lift parts including sheaves and grips
  • Assist with other building or maintenance tasks on-hill as required
  • Assist with on-site events at the resort as required

Job Requirements:
  • Basic knowledge of hand tools
  • Class 5 driver’s license for parts pick up from the nearest town
  • Ability to lift 50lbs
  • Ability to work outside in all weather conditions performing physical labour

What you offer us:
  • Passion for the ski industry and culture
  • A sense of teamwork and community
  • Experience with general maintenance work
  • Ability to work independently while meeting job tasks
  • Solid judgment
  • Critical thinking skills

Hiring Process:
We are looking to fill the position right away. Candidates will be emailed if they are selected for an interview.
 
Where we are:
Castle Mountain Resort is located at the end of Highway 774, near Pincher Creek, AB. This is a remote work location with no mobile coverage or public transit. There is a communal living Staff Accommodation building on-site for new and returning staff. More information on our location and our resort can be found at skicastle.ca

title: General Labour
description:
Job Description

General Labour

Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world.  From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global pioneer in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

SNC Lavalin's Operations and Maintenance is recognized as one of Canada’s leading outsourced operations and maintenance solutions experts, a division of SNC-Lavalin Group Inc.

Our team members across the country and the globe deliver unrivalled service to every one of our clients. Our people are vital to our success, and we build teams that are second to none. Our team embraces challenges and is engaged in working together to contribute to our business objectives.

We are currently hiring General Labour for Summer work to start in May 2022 and end in August 2022. This position is located in North Battleford, SK.

How will you contribute to the team?

Reporting to the Maintenance Team Lead, General Labour monitors and landscape the grounds surrounding buildings and businesses.

  • Planting, mowing, and ground maintenance as necessary.
  • Prune and care for plants, shrubs, trees, and lawns within the gardens.
  • Landscaping, mowing, weeds, watering, landscaping repairs, etc.
  • Garbage and debris pickup and ensuring the site appearance is well maintained.
  • Operate the necessary equipment to maintain landscaped areas, such as lawn mowers, trimmers, and leaf blowers.
  • This is an outdoor job that takes place in all weather.
  • A Criminal Record check and Vulnerability Check will be required.

What will you contribute?

  • High School Diploma.
  • Ability to carry out physically demanding tasks.
  • Ability to work unsupervised.
  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Class 5 Driver's License is required.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment.


You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

**************************

The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds, and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion, or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology, and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available atsnclavalin.comor follow us onLinkedInandTwitter.

Worker Type

Employee

Job Type

Student (Fixed Term)

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers siteto know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

title: General Labourer
description:
Company Description

For more than 170 years, Harsco has played a fundamental role in industrial progress, expanding across the globe and the world to deliver critical products and technologies to our customers and the markets they serve. We take pride in our value system and employee-friendly work culture. Find out more about Harsco Environmental on https://www.harsco-environmental.com.

We take pride in our work culture and an exciting work environment. Harsco has been operating in Hamilton since 75 years which in itself is a testimony of our customer service and innovation.

Job Description

The Labourer’s job is to clean plant and to clean where and when necessary. The responsibilities encompass the entire plant.

  • Operate under direction of plant supervision
  • To obtain directives from Shift Supervisor
  • Assist with non-mechanical duties such as screen installation
  • Follow lockout procedures
  • Obtain, use and maintain PPE
  • Obtain, use and maintain assigned Tool Kit
  • Make sure work area is safe and free of debris
  • Ensure that all guards are in place in the immediate work area
  • Work will be performed as per supervisor’s instructions
  • Assist plant personnel when needed (i.e. short staffed on production)
  • You are responsible for ensuring all tools that you use get put away
  • You are responsible for reporting any dust emissions as well as all fluid spills or leaks
  • Know, Understand and follow Plant Lockout procedures
  • Immediately report any unsafe conditions, practices or accident, injury, near miss disputes or concerns and/or other circumstances
Qualifications

  • Must have a high school diploma or equivalent
  • Should have a minimum of 6 months of experience as a Labourer
  • Experience handling mini equipment like a telehandler, backhoe
  • Experience with Heavy Equipment is an asset
  • Previous experience of working on a steel mill is an asset
  • Must have a valid Driver's License


Additional Information

Benefits:

Competitive wages, extensive benefits including health, dental, life insurance and RRSP match.

We pride ourselves on our company culture and safe working environment.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $23.07 /hour

title: General Labourer
description:
S3 Manufacturing's hard working team has earned the respect of customers for their ability to respond quickly to changing market demand, and for the consistent quality of the product. Every team member is ready to do what it takes to get the job done.

Why Work at S3 Group?

For all your hard work, we offer:

  • Competitive wages
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • RRSP matching and bonus programs
  • On-the-job training and continued education options
  • Safety and wellness allowances
  • Advancement and cross-training opportunities
  • Fast-paced, respectful and teamwork environment

  • Clean up worksite from hazardous or obsolete material
  • Assist welders, assemblers, fabricators, painters, warehouse and other employees and departments with functions as defined by Production Supervisor or his designate
  • Handle and transport materials and manufactured internally
  • Use hand tools, power tools and machinery (e.g. forklifts) when needed
  • Follow instructions from Production Supervisor or their designate to perform manual labour tasks

title: Labourer (FT)
description:
Labourer

Kieswetter Excavating Inc. is a leader in excavating, site grading and site servicing activities; Working on many of the areas highest-profile projects. We are a fourth-generation, family-owned company which works primarily in Waterloo Region and surrounding area. Our operation is built around the latest in GPS technologies; from estimating to machine control; and is seen as a North American leader at technology adaptation in the industry. We take pride in the reputation we have built for providing excellent well maintained heavy civil equipment to run, pride in workmanship and on the job safety. Our skilled workforce is dedicated to quality and excellence.  We look forward to hearing from motivated individuals who take interest in these tasks.

What sets us apart:
  • Family owned and operated.
  • Best equipment and technology.
  • Growth within the company.
  • Continuous year round work.
Benefits of joining our team:
  • Knowledge and experience on variety of applications.
  • Winter/Spring work for the right operators.
  • Working outdoors.
  • Benefits and company perks.
  • We promote from within.
Requirements:
  • Must be able to travel to Waterloo Region. 
  • Regular, consistent attendance and regular overtime at all assigned job sites.
  • Valid Driver's License.
  • Ability to communicate and take direction.
  • Previous experience in construction, manufacturing or outdoor environment.
  • High level of awareness.
  • Ability to work cooperatively with others.
  • Physical strength and endurance to perform all principal duties and responsibilities.
  • Ability to recognize, communicate and eliminate hazards.
Responsibilities:
  • Work with hand tools, dig holes, expose utilities.
  • Handle materials, assist in preparing crew, use equipment.
  • Preform traffic control dutes.
  • Inspects and maintains the equipment.
  • Performs other tasks as needed.
  • Complies with Company Safety Program.
  • Organization of project details, locates, performance objectives.
  • Communication of any discrepancy.
  • Ability to plan ahead.
  • Report issues with equipment or unsafe conditions.
Schedule:
  • Monday to Friday.
  • Overtime.
  • Weekend availability.
  • Ability to work 10-14hours a day.
Work Location: Mostly Waterloo Region some travel in Southern Ontario.

title: Skilled Construction Labourer
description:
Morgan Construction and Environmental Ltd. is an earthworks and environmental group who continues to grow in projects, scope, and in our people. With four main offices in Edmonton, Acheson, Calgary and Fort McMurray; projects throughout Western Canada; nearly 500 workers; and hundreds of pieces of heavy equipment; Morgan continuously seeks to add top talent to their team.

SUMMARY: Under the direction of the site supervisor or direct supervisor, this Skilled Construction Labourer position is to perform manual work to support construction activities and oilfield maintenance services.

Positions available in Fort McMurray. Camp is provided for positions located in Fort McMurray.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Tasks may include shooting grade, carrying construction materials, shoveling, or racking soils, flagging, equipment watch, hand excavation around facilities and erosion control installation.
  • Understand the issues with lives sites and ground disturbance.
  • Demonstrates good judgment and problem-solving skills.
  • Knowing job procedures and if in doubt know where to locate written work procedures.
  • Knowing the location of MSDS information, and reporting procedures.
  • Notifying the Supervisor or Supervisor of any equipment deficiencies.
  • Performing work with co-workers in a safe, responsible, and cooperative manner.
  • Performing any other duty or task as may be assigned from time to time by the Supervisor and/or Supervisor.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

  • Proven experience with road building, oilfield leases and pads.
  • Able to identify hazards on sites and complete JSA’s and hazard assessments.
  • Able to interpret Survey layout would be an asset.
  • Proven experience with installing underground utilities and culverts would be considered an asset.
  • Must have at least 2 years of experience as a labourer in the civil earthworks, construction, or oilfield maintenance services industry.
  • Must have (or be willing and able to obtain) CSTS-09 / OSSA Regional Orientation or BSO or CSO, Standard First Aid Level C, H2S Alive, Bear Awareness (in class).
  • Required to work outside under all weather conditions and handle noise and vibrations.
  • Must have own Safety boots -Requirement is 8" lace up steel toed (CSA Approved).
  • Must have valid class 5 drivers license
  • Must be able to repetitively lift up to 50lbs.
  • Must be able to work up to 12 hours a day.
  • Must be able to work day or night shifts.

WHY JOIN US?!

  • Camp provided
  • Vacation and holiday pay
  • Benefits
  • Year-round work

Potential to earn:

  • Finish Operator Bonus *Ask us for details
  • Paid Training
  • Referral Bonuses
  • Retention Programs
  • Labour Market Adjustment Program for all sites, in all regions * program to be revaluated Oct. 2022

Salary: $21.00-$23.50 per hour, dependant on experience

title: Labourer
description:
Title: Labourer

Location: Nisku, AB

-

About Us
Force is a rapidly growing leader in tubular inspection and repair whose success is founded on its uncompromising personal commitment to customer satisfaction in the delivery of quality solutions.

About the Position
Reporting to the Operations Manager, this role is responsible for ensuring material is properly handled, and assisting machining operations. This role requires knowledge of using tools, be physically capable of moving parts around the shop, and housekeeping.

Your Duties

  • Assists Operators with any dressing or movement of parts.
  • Knowledge and ability to use various hand tools and power tools.
  • General housekeeping to ensure safe and clean work area.
  • Handling weight up to 50 lbs
  • Complies with Force Inspection’s Health & Safety program and Occupational Health & Safety Regulations.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

Your Qualifications

  • 6 months experience in a Labourer environment an asset.
  • Forklift ticket is an asset.
  • Functional English reading and writing skills.
  • Strong detail orientation; values accuracy and has high standards around quality of work.
  • Process thinker, with high degree of initiative and ability to work independently.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment in a timely and effective fashion.
  • Strong team player with a positive attitude.
  • Willing to work indoors and outdoors to meet company needs.
  • Jib crane, Band Saw or equivalent experience is an asset.

The Great Things We Offer

- Competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits plan including, health, dental, life insurance, vision care, disability coverage, and more.
- Health Spending Account
- Relaxed commute for those living in Edmonton, Nisku, Leduc, Beaumont and Surrounding Area.
- Paid time off programs.
- Career growth and mentoring opportunities allow you to take your career to the next level.
- Outstanding safety culture with a track record to prove it.
- Some of the best people you will ever work with.

Only persons who are legally allowed to work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, do not apply as we will not consider your job application.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration and will not be discriminated against based on their race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected classification. If you are an applicant that requires a specific accommodation due to a disability or medical need during the recruitment process, please include this information in the body of emailed application.

title: General Labourer
description:
Company Description

Canada Goose isn't like anything else. We’ve built something great, something special – an iconic lifestyle brand with an inspirational and authentic story. Our purpose-based platform HUMANATURE and philosophy that humans are a part of nature and nature is a part of us informs everything we do. From the materials we use to the products we make, everything is meticulously crafted and built to last. At Canada Goose we endure any condition, observe every detail, and take the long view in order to keep the planet cold and the people on it warm.

Here, opportunities are everywhere – to try something new, to learn, to do meaningful and impactful work, and they’re yours for the taking.

Job Description

Canada Goose is hiring General Labourers for it's manufacturing operations in Scarborough. This is a permanent full time position with benefits.

Responsibilities:
• Spread and cut layers of material according to markers provided
• Cut fabric by hand, with electric hand-held cutting machines
• Remove cut pieces from the conveyor and place them on the rack
• Maintains daily records Notify supervisor of mechanical malfunctions
• Inspect machinery to determine whether repairs are needed
• Confer with the supervisor to obtain information about orders, processes, or problems
• Keep work space and equipment clean and well organized
• Perform proper preventive maintenance as required on any equipment being used
• Follow all safety guidelines and uses required Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)


Qualifications:
• Keen attention to detail will be
• Strong initiative to consistently meet deadlines
• Ability to work in a noisy, fast paced factory environment
• Ability to comprehend and follow job safety guidelines
• Able to perform preventative maintenance to machine, tools/equipment
• Ability to do repetitive tasks for long periods of time, while standing
• Excellent eyesight and the ability to detect subtle differences among rolls of fabric (shading), and detect fabric flaws
• A good understanding of numbers and measurements
• A command of English is necessary
• Training will be supplied as required

Working Conditions:
• Manufacturing environment
• Standing for extended periods of time

Canada Goose Inc. is committed to delivering and improving accessibility in employment for all persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available, upon request, in the application and interview process and in the course of all other methods of selection of employees. Successful candidates for employment will be introduced to and trained in respect of all of Canada Goose Inc.’s human rights, accommodation and accessibility polices.

title: General Labour - Full time
description:
Production Operators

Wonderbrands (formerly Weston Foods)

Kitchener Fresh Bakery

560 Victoria Street North, Kitchener, ON 

 

GENERAL LABOUR - PART-TIME  (Weekends, Mornings/Afternoons/Nights)

Shift Schedule: Day AND Night Shifts available  (Sunday - Thursday, 8 hour shifts to start). After one month must be available Sunday-Friday, 3 day (12hr) schedule 

Wage: $18/hr, $1.00/hr shift premium (6 pm - 6 am), and wage increases after 6 months by $0.50/hr.

*Availability required (flexibility with working overtime, and on weekends, as necessary).* 

 

We are a premier North American bakery company and we’ve been in business for 135 years. Our team is passionate about baking the foods your family and friends love to eat, including breads and rolls, donuts, pies, cakes, cookies and more!  

Weston Foods proudly serves communities through our ~35 bakeries across North America, and every day, our team strives to elevate moments for our customers and your loved ones by producing high quality baked goods. 

Our bakery team is the heart of our company and plays an important role in keeping North America’s food supply going. Our General labourers are an integral part of the baking process, ensuring our delicious baked goods are packaged, and safely end up on grocery store shelves and at your favorite restaurants across North America. 

We are not just a job, we are an extended family, committed to elevating everyday moments and feeding communities and families across the country. Join us and find fulfillment and purpose in your work. 

In a typical day, you will: 

  • Support Production line by placing baking pans on and off the line,  
  • Work in production/packaging area to place wrapped product onto trays.
  • Inspect filled packages to ensure product is packaged according to specifications. 
  • Work closely with production team members to ensure product quality  
  • Assist machine operators/mixers/oven captains and crew with other duties as assigned.  
  • May assist sanitation crew in the cleanliness of production equipment and area   
  • Ensure all Food Safety and Health & Safety policies and procedures are followed   

About You: 

  • A lover of bread and baked goods! 
  • You have strong people skills—you’re approachable, a good listener, and empathetic  
  • You have previously worked in a manufacturing environment (even better if it was food manufacturing!) 
  • You’re dedicated to the health and safety of yourself and your colleagues  
  • You digest constructive feedback as an opportunity to listen, and improve your skills, abilities, and performance 
  • You are someone who listens to comprehend a situation first, asking questions to clarify your own understanding, instead of listening to be able to reply quickly  

 

If you’re excited about this opportunity and love baked goods, we invite you to apply! 

Weston is committed to fostering a work environment with strong core values that support diversity through various policies, programs and activities that encourage sensitivity and accommodations. Weston offers employment regardless of race, colour, gender, national origin, religion, age, disability, or sexual orientation. Diversity is integral to our success as an organization and we will use diversity as a model to help identify and develop the best talent, create effective teams, and achieve overall excellence. 

Weston Foods is an equal opportunity employer. M/F, Disabled and Vet EEO/AA Employer

description:

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR AIM? 

Come work for Honeycomb, a division of American Iron and Metal Company Inc., specializing in the recovery, processing and sale of precious metals.

Be part of a growing division! 

Job Description

Do you like working in an industrial environment? Do you want to progress within a large company? The following position is for you! 

Reporting to the supervisor, the incumbent will work several shifts in rotation with his colleagues. More specifically, the incumbent will: 

  • Operate machinery, forklift and power/pneumatic tools; 
  • Handle catalyst boxes and their contents; 
  • Analyze, count and evaluate the material in the boxes received; 
  • Sort different metals according to their characteristics; 
  • Use tools to cut metals; 
  • Produce written reports on the evaluated material; 
  • Ensure the cleanliness of the premises; 
  • Perform all other related tasks. 
Qualifications

  • Ability to work on your feet all day;  
  • Comfortable with physical labor, machinery and power/pneumatic tools; 
  • Enjoy the industrial work environment;
  • Enjoy working in a team environment; 
  • Resourcefulness; 
  • Minutia; 
  • Versatility; 
  • Sensitivity to Occupational Health and Safety. 


Additional Information

What we offer

  • Starting salary of $18.50/hr;
  • Work schedule from Monday to Friday, 7am to 3:30pm;
  • Full time, permanent position; 40 hours per week;
  • Advantageous group insurance program;
  • Group RRSP;
  • Bonus plan;
  • Opportunities for advancement within the division and the company.

American Iron & Steel Company and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to all. Only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Labourer
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview:

The Labourer is an unskilled position which involves extensive physical labour at the Mamquam River Pit aggregate processing plant. Candidate for this position must be physically fit and have an interest and willingness to learn new skills in an active mining setting.

Responsibilities:
  • This position required candidate to possess a valid driverâ€™s license, Level 1 Occupational First Aid or equivalent, WHIMIS and/or any other certifications deemed necessary for operations under the C.Mines Act and the Mine Health, Safety and Reclamation Code for Mines in British Columbia.
  • Responsible for assisting in the daily checks required for operation of crushing/washing conveyance gallery.
  • Responsible for keeping grounds maintained and free of waste material, garbage and scrap metal and crushing and washing spread during daily operations.
Qualifications:
  • Must be able to read, write, verbally communicate and understand verbal and written instructions in English.  
  • Must be able to verbally communicate directly with supervisors, co-workers and customers; using radio and/or telephone equipment.
  • Must be able to take direction, follow instructions, have the ability to work with others, and have an acute attention to details.
  • Must possess a valid driver`s license
  • Possess a willingness to learn new skills and a positive attitude in their execution.
  • Must maintain an on-time attendance work record and safe completion of scheduling shifts.

Education and Experience

  • Experience an asset but not essential
  • Completion of company training programs (incl. OFA Level 1 and WHIMIS) and any other ticketing/certifications required under the Mines Code.

Physical Demands

While performing the duties of this job the employee will be exposed to extensive moderate to heavy manual labour for prolonged periods of time. This will include ongoing maintenance and cleaning of working area. Labourer will be required to stand, walk, crawl, kneel, bend, and reach with hands and arms above their shoulders. Ability to climb ladders is necessary. Specific vision abilities required by this job include acute central and peripheral vision as well as depth and color perception.

 

Work Environment

While performing the duties of this job, the employer will be exposed to moving mechanical parts; outside weather conditions; and extreme cold and/or heat. The noise level in the work environment is moderate to high. Dusty working conditions could also necessitate the need for a respirator to be worn. Employee can expect a variety of tasks in a high paced working environment for the duration of shift.

 

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim:

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: General Labourer
description:
*CURRENTLY HIRING FOR THE SPRING/SUMMER OF 2022*

ACT NOW TO SECURE YOUR POSITION IN ONE OF BC'S TOP  PAINTING COMPANY!

Our painting team is looking for highly-motivated individuals to join us!

We are looking for the absolute hardest-working, most efficient people in Trail/Castlegar, BC, who want to join a team of awesome staff and culture, who are also looking to earn what they are worth and optimize their cash flow!

This year we plan to paint 100+ homes in the Trail/Castlegar area, with one strategy in mind: satisfied clients, which create a happy work atmosphere and rewards employees. 
For the Spring/Summer of 2022 we are hoping to provide an even better service than last year and employ, train and optimize an even stronger team!
We are looking to hire our team, starting in the early spring of 2022!

About this job:
*Fast paced, fun environment with incentivized pay scale.
*Hands on experience in customer service and communication
*Working outdoors with a crew of other like-minded people
*Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together and note this in your application, we love hiring teams of Rockstar’s!
*Training is provided! We teach everyone how to paint!
*We are currently hiring Painters and Site Supervisors for 2022. Both positions are full-time jobs and can lead to future promotion opportunities within the company for those with the right attitude!
*Act quickly, our summer positions will fill up fast!

What will be expected of you: 
-Positive Attitude (My team hires for attitude and trains for skill)
-Reliable Transportation (As we will be working at many different job sites you must 100% be capable of getting around town. The team may be required to move job sites mid-day and you must be able to accommodate this, no exceptions!) 
-Motivation for $$$ (With this company you truly get out what you put in)
-Ability to work from ladders (if you are afraid of heights, this job is not for you)
-Ability to work with clients and always represent our company respectably
-Ability to complete and provide certifications for required training provided
-Ability to ensure proper time management and punctuality (lateness is not tolerated)
-Referring our services to friends and family (this is not required but always appreciated)
-A strong mindset dedicated to learning and self improvement

 

What benefits will you get? 
-Full training on how to paint the interior and exterior of homes/commercial buildings as well as top notch safety training.
-Lots of opportunity to earn more with greater efficiency, as well as company offered prizes and incentives.
-Pay exceeding $20/hr for exemplary painters (Starting rate dependent on experience. Raises based on proven skill after start date. (Bonuses will depend on performance and the criteria established by the business Owner/Operator.)
-Working with other like-minded and fun individuals. 
-Excellent training and strong mentorship provided during P.A.D (performance, availability and discussion) meetings.
-Working outside in the fresh air! 
-A glowing reference to help really beef up your resume!


Position Descriptions

Painter: This role is a fun but incredibly challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience and make money reflective of their efforts. The ideal individual is hard working, coachable and has effective communication skills. You will be sometimes required to work at heights or for long hours in warm weather so needless to say endurance is also an asset.
 

Site Supervisor: In addition to painting, in this role you would gain experience in leadership and management skills. You would take on additional responsibilities for additional pay. This would include moving ladders, making trips to the paint store, motivating your team, solving client issues, training additional painters, and managing other tasks on job sites.
Ask to be considered for this if you feel you may be a good fit.
Bonuses and Incentives as well as pay increases provided for people in this position. 
 

If this job sounds like the right fit for you then please get in contact with us!
We would love to hear from you and set up an interview.

title: General Laborer (Brampton Auto Mall)
description:
Drive for Excellence

Performance Collision Brampton (Formerly known as the Brampton Auto Mall) is home to 10 full-service dealerships and a state-of-the-art collision and glass repair centre. We represent 14 different automotive brands, and have been a proud community partner of Brampton and the GTA since 1991.

Performance Collision Brampton is looking for a full time General Labourer to join their exceptional team.


Part of the Performance Auto Group, a leading automotive group, we are committed to integrity, believe in employee empowerment, passionate about innovating, care about a great guest experience and giving back

About you.

You are a team player, results oriented and committed to guest service. Performance Collision Brampton fosters a team environment that is focused on guest satisfaction. You are driven and team oriented with a strong willingness to learn and succeed. We look forward to having you on our team!

Essential Duties:

  • Park vehicles slotted for repair in the back lot or at designated Service department
  • Shoveling snow from path and entrance ways of dealership
  • Cleaning the shop and emptying garbage receptacles
  • Any other duties required by service department

Qualifications and Requirements:

  • Must be reliable and able to work productively with minimal supervision
  • Positive attitude 
  • Ability to lift 50-60lbs
  • Ability to work in adherence to company safety standards at all times
  • Automotive detailing or driver experience an asset but not required
  • Must have a valid Ontario Class ‘G2’ driver’s license (clean record)
  • Must have non-skid/safety shoes

What’s in it for you?

  • Excellent management support and guidance
  • Opportunities through our Internal career mobility program
  • Access to health, dental and vision insurance
  • Disability, critical illness and life insurance for the unexpected
  • Our Employee Assistance Plan (EAP) for you and your family's wellness
  • Discount on vehicles, service and parts for you and your family
  • Discounts to retailers and service providers across the country
  • Free and engaging employee events 
  • Did we mention we love giving back to our communities?!

Performance Auto Group is a leading automotive company in Southern Ontario with over 1800 employees, 22 brands and 30 locations in Brampton, Brantford, Bolton, Grimsby, Mississauga, Oakville, Orangeville, St. Catharines and Toronto. Performance Auto Group also includes AutoPlanet Direct, Ontario's largest indoor used car showroom.

 

Performance Auto Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. In keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, accommodations are available for all parts of the recruitment and selection process. Applicants may request any accommodation needs required.

 

No Phone Calls please. We thank all applicants, however only those contacted for an interview will be considered.

title: Labourer / Carpenter's Helper - Afternoon Shift
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

WHAT’S THE JOB?
Join our NRB Modular Solutions team, where our people are driven by a desire to innovate, do social good, and move construction forward.

As a Carpenter’s Helper, reporting to the Lead Hand, you will assist tradespersons in the construction of structures made of wood, wood substitutes, steel and other materials. Based in our Calgary manufacturing plant, this is a full time position working Monday to Friday, 3:00 PM - 11:30 PM. 

This position is safety sensitive and requires drug and alcohol testing as a condition of employment.

Your work will include:

  • Assembly of basic carpentry elements with supervision.
  • Assisting tradesmen and production workers on site to carry out work on new manufactured and renovated buildings.
  • Interior renovation work that includes removing paneling, removing walls, pounding staples, and removing studs. You will install sheets of drywall to interior and insulate; measuring, cutting, shaping, assembling and joining moldings, wood materials, drywall and plastic materials.
  • Exterior renovation work that includes the following: Removing sheeting and nails, pounding staples/nails and re-nailing sheeting. Use of scaffolding is often necessary.
  • Roof work that includes the following: Inspecting and wear of fall protection gear. You will remove sheets, remove joists and remove insulation. Under sheathing work
  • includes ensuring the building is properly positioned on cribbing, removing sheets/joists, insulations. You must wear a particle mask.
  • Framing work includes the general layout and construction of walls and building.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Full Benefits Package
  • On the job training - experience an asset
  • Opportunity to learn under Carpenters and Journeyperson.
  • Award winning safety culture.
  • Work indoors year-round.
  • Be #1 on day 1 by joining an industry leader.

Follow NRB Modular Solutions on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Individuals that are excited to learn new skills and are looking for full time work.
  • Carpentry experience and/or experience working on construction sites considered an asset.
  • Comfortable in learning to operate all hand and power tools required to perform tasks specific trade.


Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.

title: Labourer (Industrial Sand Plant)
description:
Overview:

Labourers (Industrial Sand Plant)

 

Sil Industrial Minerals is a company of good, hard-working people dedicated to providing excellent service and top-quality products for its customers through leading edge technology. That's why Sil Industrial Minerals is Western Canada's leader in industrial sands, blasting abrasives and equipment.

 

Work for Sil and enjoy being home with your family/friends every night!

 

Rate: $23.00-$28.00

We offer: Benefits, Pension

 

Job Type: Full Time

Schedule: 10+ Hours/day, Day and Night Shift, Varying Shift Rotations, Schedule as per Operational Requirements

Location: Bruderheim, AB â€“ 570079 Range Rd 204, non-camp position, required to live in the area, approximately 12 km north of Bruderheim on Range Road 204

Essential: Hard-working, reliable, flexible with schedule, ability to work in physically demanding conditions

 

Requirements:      

  • Personal reliable vehicle and valid driverâ€™s license
  • CSA approved steel toed boots with 6â€ ankle support

Pre-employment:

  • Drug and alcohol testing (swab-based test)

title: General Labourer (1 Year Contract)
description:
#BeExtraordinary

At Andrew Peller Limited (APL), we deliver the perfect brand experience for every lifestyle, occasion, and generation. Through collaboration, open communication, honesty, drive to win, and accountability, we inspire teammates to be extraordinary every day.

Who We Are

We are one of Canada's largest and oldest wine companies with a rich heritage in quality winemaking.

We produce some of Canada's most recognized brands and offer our teammates a challenging and rewarding employment experience.

We are seeking twoGeneral Labourersto join our Operations Team!

Reporting into the Packaging Manager, The Bottling Line Operator will be responsible for providing support to the Lead Line Operator while working with the Bottle shop team to ensure the efficient production of finished goods which meets both Company and Government quality and work safe practices.

We are looking for a teammate with:

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Five years' work experience or training in a similar manufacturing operation.
  • Packaging quality experience
  • HACCP and ISO training
  • Forklift training
  • Oral and Written communication skills

This teammate will be accountable for:

  • Participates in training program and qualification process for a Line Operator Level 3.
  • Trouble shoots and make minor adjustments, fully change over All Lines
  • PS and Cold glue Labeler sets-up and adjustments to meet optimum efficiency
  • Maintains inputs on the PLC and mechanical adjustments on the filers, labelers, packers, and check-Scales.
  • Inspect and make machine set-up adjustments to ensure the product is free of defects and meets final product specifications i.e.; PS and Cold Glue labelers
  • Assists maintenance and lead operators during scheduled shut downs
  • Assist when required to perform hot water and chemical sanitization of fillers, filter housings, rinsers. Perform filter integrity Test.
  • Reprocessing as required i.e., re-labeling, dumping, inspection.
  • Ensures safe work practices are followed. Reports work related injuries and hazards immediately to the Production Supervisor.
  • Maintains quality standards by following Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's) and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP's). Reports any and all quality concerns to the Production Supervisor.
  • Participates in the Maintenance of all areas in the Bottle Shop through collaboration with all Team members.
  • Training of other team members upon request
  • Demonstrates continuous improvement in the competencies of a Level 1 and Level 2 line operator.
  • Follows safe work procedures and practices and reports all unsafe working conditions / hazards to their reporting Manager.
  • Will be required to work afternoon shifts and third shift occasionally

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest; only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. In addition, per our "Internal Job Posting Policy"; internal candidates should be in their current position for one (1) year and their performance must be in good standing.

Andrew Peller Limited is committed to meeting the needs of persons with temporary and/or permanent disabilities in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We are happy to discuss any need for accommodation in the workplace and will make an effort to meet those needs in a timely manner by preventing and removing barriers to accessibility in the areas of information, communications, and employment.

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

Become a part of AIM’s history.

We have continued to prosper for the last eight decades through our employees’ strength and our clients’ trust, thus establishing our international presence and diversifying our expertise. Take your place at AIM Global, an integrated chain comprised of five divisions who work in collaboration to revalorize resources such as metals, construction waste, end-of-life vehicles and urban areas. We invest in our installations and employees to ensure a better future for all.

Are you a self-starter with the ability to learn new processes and concepts quickly? The successful candidate posses the ability to provide excellent customer while working in a fast-paced environment.

It’s simple: we do it right. We aim for excellence.

Job Description

We are currently recruiting for a Labourer with experience for our Kitchener location. Under the supervision of the Yard Manager, the incumbent will be responsible for the general maintenance of the premises. 

  • Working inside our warehouse and in our outdoor yard
  • Sorting, picking, and processing metal pieces 
  • Operating a tow motor and or forklift on occasion to tip or dump bins
  • Cleaning your work area at the end of your shift 
  • Other general labour/manual duties will apply
  • Being able to operate a crane (an asset)
Qualifications

  • Experience in operating a Forklift
  • Experience in metal recycling
  • Ability to work indoors/outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Ability to work in a loud, dusty environment 
  • Previous recycling experience is considered an asset 
  • Must be able to stand and walk for long periods of time 
  • Good physical fitness
  • Ability to work independently and as a team
  • Excellent attendance and safety record.


Additional Information

  • Full time and permanent position; Monday to Friday and alternating Saturday shift is required

What we offer :

  • On-site Training
  • Group insurance after three months
  • Group RRSP after six months

American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to everyone. The masculine form is used solely to make the text easier to read. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: General Labourer - Summer Student (Acheson)
description:
Position Scope:

This position is located at our Acheson shop.

 

This is a SUMMER position only.

Responsibilities:
  • Help with disposal of surplus material in Acheson
  • Help clean up outside yard and sea-cans
Qualifications:

 

  • Must have valid class 5 driver's license
  • Demonstrate safety at all times
  • Standard first aid course
  • Experience around heavy equipment is an asset
Summary:

All successful candidates must:

  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  2. Have a valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Have experience as requested in the job description above
  4. Undergo and successfully pass the following pre-employment testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  1. Copy of Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  2. Copy of recent Driverâ€™s Abstract
  3. VOID cheque/direct deposit form

To explore this opportunity, please submit a resume of your experience and accomplishments in confidence.

Overview:

North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.   In that time, weâ€™ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. Weâ€™ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers.  

In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

  • Significant Growth â€“As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
  • Long Term Contracts â€“ With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
  • Commitment To Safety â€“ With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.

North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

 

Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Construction Labourer - $19 Per Hour
description:
Primus Workforceprovides safety- minded, experienced personnel support throughout the oil & gas, construction and technical trades sectors to our clients long and short-term contingency needs. We are a growing and dynamic company to work with providing the key to your future success.

This is a temporary position that could lead to full-time employment.

We are currently seeking: Construction laborers

The laborers will be accountable for such duties but not limited to the following:

  • Operate and care for construction equipment and machines.
  • Cribbing and shoring up a new building.
  • Obtaining and/or maintaining a clean work site.
  • Loading and unloading materials.
  • Ensure all work is conducted in a safe and responsible manner.
  • Be aware of changes to materials and techniques. Adapt easily to those changes.
  • Removing hazards.
  • Ready to learn from on-the-job training when necessary.
  • Repetitive labor tasks.

Physical requirements:

  • Stand for long periods of time and being outside.
  • Lifting, climbing, bending, digging, and operating hand and power tools.
  • Hand-eye coordination as well as multi-limb coordination.
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs.

Previous Labor experience an asset and you will be required to have your own  PPE ( safety boots, hard hat, gloves and glasses).

Thank you to all those that apply. Only those that meet the specific job requirements for this position will be contacted. You are encouraged to apply for various future positions we may have.

Primus Workforce is committed to equity employment for women, aboriginal people, visible minorities, veterans and persons with disabilities. Interested candidates from these groups are encouraged to apply.

A Scaffolders’ duties may vary from site to site, however the main responsibilities of a Scaffolder are to erect temporary work platforms using steel pipes, support braces and clamps with a high standard of workmanship using a variety of tools. Scaffolders work both indoors and outdoors, year-round in commercial and industrial settings.

title: General Labourer
description:
At Samuel, Son & Co., your success is our business. As a leading metals and industrial products manufacturer, processor and distributor, we leverage our industry expertise, breadth of experience and the passion of our people to help drive success for North American business—one customer at a time. We go beyond quality, price competitiveness, reliability and service. As a strategic supplier, we work collaboratively with our customers to understand their challenges and opportunities, and to develop innovative solutions that create value and meet real business needs. Our people are the source of our strength, vitality and reputation. We are a team—always moving, improving and getting things done. We focus on doing the right thing for our customers and employees— and we never compromise our integrity. We safeguard our employees’ health and well-being, give back to our communities and demonstrate respect for the environment. Samuel, Son & Co. Because it’s not just business. It’s family. 

Here is some of what we have to offer:

  • Competitive wage: $20.61- $24.48 per hour
  • Rotating Shift: Days, Afternoons, Evenings
  • Company Paid Benefits
  • Paid Vacation 
  • Defined Contribution Pension Plan with company match 

RESPONSIBILITIES: 

  • Secure lifts with banding and packaging. 
  •  Prepare packaging materials 
  • Package material to customer specification. 
  • Replenish packaging materials. 
  • Assist in the set-up of the stacker/carousel. 
  • Help maintain safety and good housekeeping in work areas. 
  • Assist with various other duties as assigned by Operator/Foreman and train new employees as required. 
  • Wear all applicable PPE (i.e. Gloves, safety glasses, and wristlets). 

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Steel processing experience is an asset 
  • High School Diploma 
  • Forklift certification and at least 2 years experience operating a forklift 
  • Previous experience in an industrial environment 
  • Commitment to continuous improvement, and health & safety
  • Computer skills, including Microsoft Dynamics system is an asset

title: Temporary Summer Student Labourer
description:
Temporary Summer Student Labourer - (22000052)

Description

 

Compass Minerals is a leading provider of essential minerals that solve nature's challenges, including salt for winter roadway safety and other consumer, industrial and agricultural uses, and specialty plant nutrition minerals that improve the quality and yield of crops. The company produces its minerals at locations throughout the U.S. and Canada and in the U.K. Though the company’s history stretches back as far as 1844, Compass Minerals became a public company in December 2003. The company is part of the S&P MidCap 400 Index, the Russell 1000 Index and was included in Fortune magazine’s 2010 listing of the “100 Fastest-Growing Companies.” Named one of Forbes’ 100 Most Trustworthy Companies in America in 2015 and 2016, Compass Minerals’ mission is to be the best essential minerals company by delivering where and when it matters.

 

Summary:  We are currently seeking to fill a General Labourer Position which is described below. This is a Temporary Summer Student full-time position located in Amherst, NS.

Essential Job Functions:Include but are not limited to the following:  

(Management reserves the right to add or modify the duties and responsibilities at any time.)

  • General labour i.e. cleaning, painting and janitorial duties
  • Operate packaging equipment
  • Forklift and other heavy equipment operation
  • Loading bulk trucks
  • Dust collection duties
  • Sanitation related inspections and cleaning
  • Must be able to work at heights and confined spaces.
  • Shifts may vary
 

Qualifications

 

Qualifications:

  • Minimum High School Diploma, post-secondary education in a related field preferred.
  • The ideal candidate will have experience in a process-related industry, be knowledgeable about process equipment and control systems, and be flexible to different task assignments.

Education and/or Experience:

  • Minimum High School Diploma, post-secondary education in a related field preferred
  • 3 – 5 years’ experience in a warehouse environment. Preferably in a manufacturing setting
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Previous experience driving a forklift would be an asset
  • Previous experience working shift work would be an asset
  • Able to work in a warm and dusty area at times
  • Must be able to pass criminal background check and drug testing

 

Compass Minerals is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Compass Minerals is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, contact 519 524 8338 orcareers@compassminerals.com.

title: Carpenter/drywall
description:
Reports To: Operations Manager

"A mind built for excellence. A spirit built for service."
 What does a Carpenter / Drywaller with Paul Davis do?
  • Serve others within your community in their time of need
  • Make a difference for others that have had a disaster strike their property
  • Work hard and take pride in completing projects 
  • Be empathetic and show a sense of urgency. 
Why Join The Team? Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and commercial properties throughout the United States and Canada. We are growing locally and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We love creating an opportunity for our team members, providing industry training, and giving technicians the opportunity to become experts in the field of restoration.

Values: Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.Vision: To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.Mission: To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results.
 
 Why The Team Needs You? Serving others after a disaster has struck their property is not easy. Everyone within Paul Davis needs to have a world-class work ethic, serious attention to detail and love to help people. It is challenging to make customers happy when faced with a traumatic event but you enjoy helping them get back to their lives through your skill. Team Compensation and Benefits:
  • Leadership Development - our company grows from the inside. If you are determined and motivated enough, ask about participation in our leadership development initiative to grow your career and explore new opportunities
  • Cross-training opportunities to advance your career
  • Flex schedule - at Paul Davis we are committed to our team and their well-being. We have instituted the ability for flex hours that ensures team members get the time they need for personal matters while still being able to work full time.
  • Paid training
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Great culture and team dynamic
  • Most of our files allow for piece work.  If you can do multiple trades and you are efficient, this position is for you.
 Team Qualifications (Requirements):
  • Desire to join a world-class team and contribute a positive attitude
  • Dedication to customer service
  • Valid driver's license with a clean record
  • Have the ability to work on rotation with an on-call schedule for emergencies
  • Ability to lift 75 LBS frequently
  • Desire to continually learn new things
 Role on the Team (Job Responsibilities):
  • High-level performance of drywall, texture, and paint repairs
  • Carpentry - framing, cabinetry, roof construction, decks, and fences.
  • Focus and dedication to providing excellent customer service.
  • Maintain a clean, properly stocked, and organized truck and maintain all company equipment.
  • Be accessible by phone and participate, as necessary, in the on-call schedule as emergencies occur
  • Assist in warehousing and facility-related tasks when necessary.
  • You will assist other team members as you see opportunities arise and be a leader for the team when needed.
 Please apply if you think you have what it takes to serve others and deliver a world-class service when others need it the most. We are looking forward to discussing this opportunity with you.We support and hire Veterans and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!

title: Laborer
description:
With locations across Western Canada, Canada Cartage System is a recognized leader in transportation logistics delivering customized solutions for the transportation, distribution and warehousing marketplace.

Canada Cartage is seeking a hardworking Swamper to be based out a number of our lower mainland stores.

What we offer:

  • 40+ hours per week
  • Full Benefits (Health, Dental, Vision, MSP, Pension)

Responsibilities:

  • Load, unload and move products and materials by hand or with material handling equipment

General Requirements/Qualifications:

Work Conditions

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups and women

title: General Labourer
description:
Responsibilities:

  • Perform routine maintenance jobs and repairs – inside and outside
  • Move furniture, equipment and supplies
  • Empty waste containers
  • Snow clearing/salting
  • Shipping duties if required
  • Driving duties as required
  • Running Cable (Voice/Data/Video)

Qualifications:

  • Able to work without supervision in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Valid driver’s license with own transportation
  • Able to work overtime when required
  • Basic knowledge of Computers
  • High school diploma

What we Offer:

  • Employer funded benefit program
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Work-life Balance
  • Employee Assistance plan
  • Employee Discount Platform
  • Career Progression
  • Casual work environment
  • Social Events and Sport Teams

Location: Burlington, ON (Only candidates located in Ontario will be considered)

About:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery. Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertz’ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers. With over 1500 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

 

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz

title: Maintenance
description:
Ã‚  :

 

Our Maintenance People,

 

As Canadaâ€™s largest residential landlord, CAPREIT prides itself on the smooth operation and safety of our properties. Our Maintenance Crew is responsible for the coordination of all major repairs and improvements necessary for a portfolio of properties. They key goal of the team is to maintain a properly functioning and inviting environment throughout the building for our staff and residents.

 

An ideal candidate for this position should have excellent communication skills, a background in building mechanics, good knowledge of painting and accessories, general HVAC/plumbing knowledge, and the ability to handle multiple jobs in an organized fashion. In order to be considered for this position, candidates must possess a means of travelling between properties throughout the day.

 

Please note that applications from all interested individuals are appreciated; however, we will only contact candidates that are selected for an interview.

 

CAPREIT values diversity in the workforce and is an equal opportunity employer.  

CAPREIT welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Labourer
description:
Looking to Start Your Driving Career? Looking to Learn New Skills? Austin Powder is seeking to add a career-minded entry-level team member! This is a full-time opportunity to handle site maintenance, manage inventory, be responsible for customer deliveries, as well as, customer support and assist the at job sites.

This position offers a competitive wage and generous benefits. Our benefits include extended health, dental, voluntary RPP, AD&D, weekly income (STD), long term disability, group life and dependent life. If this sounds like the opportunity that you've been searching for, apply for this blasting worker position today!

ABOUT AUSTIN POWDER

Austin Powder manufactures a full line of industrial explosives and provides blasting services to customers in the quarrying, mining, construction, and oil and gas industries -- all for the purpose of providing aggregate, energy, and mineral products to consumers.

Our values of commitment to safety, attention to detail, and the power of family are the very bedrock upon which our company's culture is built. We truly value our team which is why we offer competitive opportunities for career growth and advancement.

A DAY IN THE LIFE

As a Labourer, you will handle packaged explosive products, operate manufacturing vehicles on the job site (if licensed), and load and drive box trucks (if licensed). All activity is done in strict compliance with safety and company procedures. You will assist blasters load and stem blast holes prior to initiating the blast. This position involves being outside in all weather conditions, lifting and carrying 50+ pounds of product and other materials, and frequently squatting and bending as you prepare for the shot.

Safety is always a priority whether you are driving or assisting the Blaster in charge with site preparation and equipment setup. Under the direction of the Blaster in charge or Location Manager, you will inspect product bins, inventory of product, and complete required paperwork. To keep your truck and equipment running properly, you will perform both general and preventative maintenance. You will enjoy keeping busy and being on the move throughout the day.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must submit drivers abstract with resume
  • Valid Class 5 - no restrictions and desire to obtain Class 3
  • Preferred Class 3 license
  • Ability to work outside in all weather conditions
  • Physical ability to lift 23 kg.
  • Must meet requirements of all Provincial and Federal explosive laws and qualify as an ERD explosive possessor

Are you a self-starter that is hardworking and passionate? Do you enjoy being outdoors? Are you a dependable team player? Are you willing to learn and expand your skills? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this Labourer position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 60-300.5(a) and 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, and for inquiring about, discussing or disclosing compensation. Moreover, these regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

title: Nutrien Carseland: Scaffolder Apprentices
description:
SCAFFOLDER - APPRENTICES : Calgary Local Drive-in position

NEW LOA $125 Daily Tax Free

SUMMARY:
A Scaffolders’ duties may vary from site to site, however the main responsibilities of a Scaffolder are to erect temporary work platforms using steel pipes, support braces and clamps with a high standard of workmanship using a variety of tools. Scaffolders work both indoors and outdoors, year-round in commercial and industrial settings.
On going work in 2023 and turn around for 2024.Large project and turnaround.
4-10 hour shifts (Monday-Thursday) with Overtime after 10 hours. 

Journeyman rate: $38.46 and there is room to advance those with the right skill sets for the upcoming turn around as we will be looking to fill supervisor positions. This is also a very diversified site where can also look to pursue getting involved in other roles such equipment operating, fitting and HVAC, scaffold and insulation.

MINIMUM SAFETY TICKET REQUIREMENTS:
  • CSTS-09 
  • Fall Protection
  • Ability to pass an A&D test
If you feel you would be a good fit, please apply with your resume and safety tickets!
