title: Journeyman Ironworkers for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!
description:
Currently we are looking for Journeyman Ironworkers for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Employee Benefit Program
  • Employee Assistance Program

Requirements:

  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Valid Alberta Ironworker Journeyman or Red Seal Certification
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20 / WHMIS 2015
  • Valid Fall Protection Certificate
  • Valid Aerial Work Platform
  • Physically capable of performing all tasks required of field Ironworkers
  • Invested in a safety-oriented work environment

**At this time, our client’s may request contractors, vendors and suppliers to be fully vaccinated while providing service to their sites and therefore may require candidates to attest their vaccination disclosure status**
At Phoenix Industrial, we believe we are stronger together. That’s why we believe that investing in our people and the communities in which we work and live returns to us ten-fold. We invest in your growth because we believe it is essential for our continued success. 
We are proud of our company, our projects, our sustainable growth and most importantly our people. And we’d be proud to welcome you to the Phoenix family.
Come Grow With Us!
 

See Job Description

title: Carpenter
description:
Carpenter


  • Are you interested in joining the largest and fastest growing premium custom builder & renovator in North America?
  • Are you looking for career growth and an opportunity to move from hands-on carpentry to site supervisor, project management or to owning or managing your own custom remodeling and or home building company?
  • Do you love building something you are proud of, rather than the same project again and again?


The carpenter is responsible for performing carpentry work in the form of repair, renovation or new construction on a residential building project.


Learn more at: https://www.alairhomes.ca/delta/custom-home-builders/


Requirements:

  • Has a demonstrated track-record of success, experience and skills with residential and commercial carpentry projects.
  • Proven experience with site preparation (demolition), rough carpentry and finishing carpentry.
  • Able to read and interpret construction plans and specifications.
  • Proactive in recognizing project and material requirements.
  • Uses logic and smarts to effectively and efficiently solve problems and work with trade partners.
  • Possesses strong interpersonal skills and enjoys working with people.
  • Uses creativity and detail-orientation to envision a final product and ensure spot-on execution.
  • Has an excellent customer-service mindset that is responsible, respectable and personable.
  • Is reliable and punctual.
  • Able to work autonomously and is a self-starter.
  • Has proficiency with computers and technology with an ability to touch type.
  • Supplies and takes pride in personal set of tools and safety equipment.
  • Has a valid driver’s license and vehicle to travel around the Lower Mainland and beyond.


Job Responsibilities:

  • Takes responsibility for daily management of site coordination and site organization.
  • Ensures daily site clean-up occurs.
  • Takes responsibility for site safety as per WorkSafe BC standards, including running safety meetings and completing necessary documentation.
  • Project dependent, performs the following carpentry duties:
  • Form-work – slab-work, some retaining walls and architectural concrete (smaller scope)
  • Framing – renovations and larger project backframing
  • Siding – vinyl, cedar, hardi plank and trimwork
  • Building envelope
  • Window and door installation
  • Finishing carpentry
  • Hardware and accessory installation
  • Minor drywall patching
  • Painting, painting touch-ups and caulking
  • Project dependent, performs the following site preparation duties:
  • Demolition
  • Jack-hammering
  • Digging
  • Slab preparation and rebar
  • Mobilization and demobilization/clean-up
  • Operating Alair equipment
  • Sets up and maintains project signage.
  • Follows project schedule and provides feedback to project manager on achievements.
  • Communicates with project manager to attain Alair equipment as needed.
  • Liaises with sub-trades to enable their work on site.
  • Interfaces with building and municipal officials on site.
  • Manages, organizes and resolves warranty items.
  • Some site supervision.
  • Other duties as required.

title: General Labourer
description:
We specialize in all things glass. Established in 1962 with one shop in Seattle, Wash., today Glass Doctor offers quick and affordable glass services to business, home, and auto owners at more than 270 locations across the United States and Canada. Our team of qualified experts lives our code of values of Respect, Integrity, and Customer Focus while having fun in the process! We hire reliable, friendly, and customer service-focused glass professionals and office staff who are dedicated to creating a delightful customer experience. 
As a general labour, you would be a key member of our team responsible for assisting in the quality and efficient installation of residential and commercial flat glass and related glass products such as windows, storefronts, mirrors, display cases, shower doors, etc. You will also develop new customers by identifying opportunities to sell additional work. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.
Ideally you have prior experience in the flat glass industry and have proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.  You are self-motivated, thrive in fast moving environments, and able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines.  

Specific Responsibilities: 
  • Assisting with installation for interior glass and mirror products, shelving, and interior sliding doors
  • Insure the efficient use of materials and maintain adequate stock of vehicle
  • Conduct accurate field measuring
  • Keep company vehicle and equipment properly serviced, clean, and in good working order and condition
  • Perform other duties as needed which may include cross-training in related positions
Job Requirements:
  • Prior experience in construction is a plus
  • Ability to measure accurately and use tape measures and levels
  • Quality workmanship is a must
  • Physical ability to lift heavy objects such as shower panels and door
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Professional appearance and personality
Benefits: Benefits package available
Wages: Competitive wages

Excellent growth potential!
We are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow-up!

title: Handyman / Carpenter
description:
Being a handyman takes a lot of skill, and yet so often customers appreciate the small things: being on time, meeting deadlines, listening to needs and honesty. If you can do those and more, you might make a great fit for Handyman Connection of Victoria.

We’re on the lookout for a qualified Handyman/Carpenter who can surprise customers with a can-do, above-and-beyond attitude that puts their desires first. Anyone can be a handyman – our “connection” is filled with go-getters aren’t afraid of an honest day’s work.

Benefits:
  • Average $30-$40 per hour with regular appointments every month of the year
  • Work as an independent contractor – on your own schedule
  • Enjoy backing from an office staff that is here to assist you
  • Benefit from a company mobile app that helps you stay organized
  • Marketing to draw customers, which includes branded signage and merchandise

Want to improve others’ lives using your gifts and talents? Apply to become a Handyman/Carpenter

Job Summary:
  • Share your expertise of home repair, maintenance and remodeling on job sites.
  • Bid work on a regular basis and produce it effortlessly.
  • Finalize appropriate job materials and quantities for all projects.
  • Evaluate requests, price out all jobs, troubleshoot and effectively communicate with clients.

Job Requirements
  • Basic handiwork in at least three (3) of these capacities:
    • Home remodels, including bathroom and kitchen
    • Painting, both inside and out
    • General carpentry
    • Drywall work
    • Basic plumbing and electrical
    • Floor installations and repairs
    • Residential maintenance
    • Understand building codes and materials management
    • Driver's license & insurance
    • Tools, vehicle & references
    • Pass personal screening & background check
    • Smart phone and Internet access

Please, no project managers or primarily new construction. Handyman Connection is strongly considering candidates with experience as a Handyman/Carpenter or similar positions.

Handyman Connection of Victoria would love to talk with you. Apply today and start the process!

title: General Labour
description:
Looking for a challenge this summer? Join our hard working team in transforming the homes of our
community! We are looking for team players who are driven, results oriented, and eager to make their
mark this summer. We provide high quality home services such as lawn care & painting/staining services
for both Interior and Exterior projects!
 
We are committed to transforming the homes of our local residential communities and leaving our
homeowners in AWE of the transformation. We are offering both full time and part time general labour
positions to the most motivated, coachable individuals to join our business. Looking to hire skilled
labourers who like working outside and motivated to do an incredible job.
 
Requirements:
Preferably some experience with hands-on work (no professional experience necessary),
you will be trained on how to take care of lawns & paint/stain projects and will be a pro in
no time!
Must have own car or reliable transportation
Positive attitude
Reliable and hardworking
Strong communication skills
Coachable
 
Responsibilities:
·        Responsible for the overall completion of projects. Start to finish completion at a high
standard of quality, and in a timely manner
·        Maintain a clean and organized site and project
·        Delivering quality and satisfaction through constant communication with homeowners, crew
chiefs and business owner

·        Drop off flyers and market door-to-door in neighbourhood around work site
 
Compensation: 
·        - $15-$18/hr depending on experience and responsibility
·        - Opportunities for increased responsibilities and leadership positions
 
Benefits: 
·        Bonus incentives/opportunities for advancement
·        Improve communication skills
·        Get to work outside
·        Opportunities to learn the ins and outs of the business from a management level directly
from the business owner
·        Meet and work with amazing people!
 
Resumes should be sent ASAP as positions are filling up quickly.

title: General Labourer
description:
Appliance Repair & Cleaning Technician $19-$22

Company Summary 

Canadian BBQ Boys mission is to improve barbecue health, safety and performance by providing a professional barbecue cleaning service that helps residential grillers get the most out of the grilling season.

In just 5 years, the company has grown exponentially across Ontario, making Canadian BBQ Boys the brand name in barbecue cleaning and service. Since our appearance on Dragons Den, we have continued to grow the business and are in the process of Canada wide expansion. 

As we continue to implement our growth plans, we have a number of opportunities with massive growth potential. Our goal is to provide amazing job experiences focused on learning and growth. Each member of our team will have the opportunity to move up in the business, all it takes is a strong work ethic and willingness to learn!

Job Description 

The Appliance Repair & Cleaning Technician position is typically best suited for hard workers who enjoy working with customers, working outdoors in the summer and indoors in the winter and are looking to improve on sales/service skills in a labour intensive environment. 

This role is a very essential role for our operations at Canadian BBQ Boys. As an Appliance Repair & Cleaning Technician, you will be learning the ins and outs of the barbecue industry by conducting the oven and barbecue cleaning services that we offer according to company processes and procedures, facilitating the customer experience, and managing your own set of supplies and equipment.  

Appliance Repair & Cleaning Technicians have the opportunity to work their way into the Territory Manager, and Regional Manager as well as Office positions, which can come with pay increases along with increased responsibilities. 

Job Duties and Responsibilities

  • Cleaning barbecues and ovens at both Commercial and Residential properties
  • Conducting repairs and maintenance to appliances we service
  • Maintaining and organizing company supplies and equipment
  • Interacting with customers
  • Upselling products and add-ons
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

  • Experience working in-home services industry is an asset
  • Able to perform physical labour and operate light equipment
  • Able to work outdoors in various weather conditions
  • Able to understand and carry out verbal and written instructions
  • Able to use technical skills to assess issues with appliances 
  • Able to meet deadlines, problem solve and work well under pressure
  • High attention to details

Compensation

  • Starting at $18/hr + Tips + Commission + Incentives (Most make $19- $22/hr)

Job Type

  • Full-time Position (Year Round)
  • Over-time hours available during May + June 

Requirements

  • G-Licence

title: General Construction Worker
description:
We’re looking for an experienced construction worker with a good work ethic, a history of consistent attendance, and great physical strength and stamina to join our team. You’ll work under our construction manager’s direction, alongside a close-knit team of other skilled laborers and tradesmen, no prior experience is necessary however prior experience in spray painting would be the ideal candidate. will have previous construction experience, have knowledge of construction methods, tools, and equipment. If you’re ready to work hard every day under various conditions, start your application today.

Compensation:

$40,000 - $55,000 yearly

Responsibilities:
  • Follow all directions of the construction manager, and work with other team members to complete construction projects accurately
  • Remove debris and hazardous materials to keep the job site safe and clean to meet safety regulations and OSHA requirements
  • Operate power tools, hand tools, and heavy equipment such as jackhammers, survey equipment, and forklifts as required
  • Dismantle old structures, and build temporary structures such as signs, cones, barricades, ramps, and other devices to control traffic around the construction site
  • Load, unload, and transfer tools and building materials such as lumber, tile, saws, sheetrock, grout, etc.

  • Make sure task is completed in a timely manner

Qualifications:

  • Comfortable working in inclement weather, like extreme temperatures, rain, etc.
  • High school diploma or equivalent is required - Associate’s degree, trade certification, and/or completed apprenticeship program is highly preferred
  • Both physical stamina and physical strength are essential
  • Solid mechanical skills are needed, as are good eye-hand coordination and depth perception
About Company

Canadian Elite Renovation has been in business for the past decade. We are one of the biggest reglazing groups in Ontario, while we have amazing spray painters we are always open to expanding and bringing on new talent on board.

title: General Labourer
description:
Job Description

Our client is seeking GENERAL LABOURERS to work at their sawmills in GOGAMA, Ontario. While you might see a lot of job offers for General Labourer, but being one at the sawmill in Gogamameans getting to work right in the heart ofnature. You'll be aroundwood,woodand morewood. Your eagle eyes will help keep theyardandsawmilllooking their best. To keep things running smoothly, you’ll make sure that there’s a place for everything and that everything is in its place. You'll make a living working at oursawmillswith deep roots in thenorthernregions ofOntario. You'll discover that they do more than just transformwood; they also transform our communities!

Are you hard-working, resourceful and a go-getter? Our team is waiting for you!

What you’ll be doing specifically:

  • Tie up bundles of rough lumber for drying outside.
  • Redo and stack bundles of rough and planed wood in the yard.
  • Perform clean-ups of the yard and sawmill.
  • Perform clean-ups after interior and exterior sawing operations.
  • During work downtime, clean areas that are inaccessible during operations.
  • Do any other related tasks (don’t worry; you'll learn tons of things that will help you in your career!).

What do you need to succeed with us?

  • Be able to work well on a team.
  • Be independent and full of initiative.
  • Show vigilance and a concern for health and safety.

Qualifications

Experience that will help you in this position:

  • DCS, DEC, or equivalent.
  • Prior experience at a sawmill is an asset.
  • Be available to work day and/or night shifts.

WAGE & HOURS:

  • $26per hour, + night shift premium, 40- 44 hours per week
  • Overtimeafter 44 hours per week, Sundays or Statutory Holidays
  • Shift rotation (as applicable): rotating shifts days, afternoons, night

BENEFITS:

  • Disability Insurance
  • Dental Insurance
  • Pension
  • Extended medical insurance (e.g. prescription drugs, paramedical services, medical services and equipment)
  • Paid vacation

title: General Labourer
description:
Looking for a challenge this summer? Join our hard working team in transforming the homes of our community! We are looking for team players who are driven, results oriented, and eager to make their mark this summer. We provide high quality home services such as lawn care & painting/staining services for both Interior and Exterior projects!

 

We are committed to transforming the homes of our local residential communities and leaving our homeowners in AWE of the transformation. We are offering both full time and part time general labour positions to the most motivated, coachable individuals to join our business. Looking to hire skilled labourers who like working outside and motivated to do an incredible job.

 

Requirements:

  • Preferably some experience with hands-on work (no professional experience necessary), you will be trained on how to take care of lawns & paint/stain projects and will be a pro in no time!

  • Must have own car or reliable transportation

  • Positive attitude

  • Reliable and hardworking

  • Strong communication skills

  • Coachable

 

Responsibilities:

·        Responsible for the overall completion of projects. Start to finish completion at a high standard of quality, and in a timely manner

·        Maintain a clean and organized site and project

·        Delivering quality and satisfaction through constant communication with homeowners, crew chiefs and business owner

·        Drop off flyers and market door-to-door in neighbourhood around work site

 

Compensation: 

·        - $15-$18/hr depending on experience and responsibility

·        - Opportunities for increased responsibilities and leadership positions

 

Benefits: 

·        Bonus incentives/opportunities for advancement

·        Improve communication skills

·        Get to work outside

·        Opportunities to learn the ins and outs of the business from a management level directly from the business owner

·        Meet and work with amazing people!

 

Resumes should be sent ASAP as positions are filling up quickly.

title: labourer
description:

Responsibilities:Knowledge and use of various types of electric and gas powered tools such as chippers, Concrete drills, quick-cut saws, circular saws and reciprocating saws.





Skills Required:Knowledge of various structures such as residential, commercial and industrial buildings. • Knowledge and use of various types of electric and gas powered tools such as chippers, Concrete drills, quick-cut saws, circular saws and reciprocating saws. • Knowledge of safety documentation such as Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS), Workplace • Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) and symbols. • Knowledge and use of various types of materials such as lumber, earth, piping, concrete and masonry units. • Knowledge of types of ladders such as extension, platform and stepladders with placement, 3-point contact, overhang and kick plates. • Concrete types, strengths, aggregates and properties, plasticizers and accelerators, ratios, mixing times and compatibilities as required. • 1-2 years of experience in a similar role. • General construction knowledge and experience required. • Experience in and understanding of the retail and commercial construction space. • Excellent accuracy and mathematical competency skills. • Strong verbal and written communication skills. • Must be organized, efficient and productive. • Able to work effectively with others in a team environment. • Valid License is mandatory

title: Carpenters- FTM
description:
Come use your drive, energy, and diligence to make your mark on our community!

The Casman Group of Companies, one of the largest general contractors in the region of Wood Buffalo, has been based in Fort McMurray since 1981.

Casman Building Solutions, a part of the Casman Group, is seeking experienced Carpenters for construction on projects in the Wood Buffalo region.

Applicants must be safety conscious, physically fit, able to lift up to 25 kg (50 lb), and able to work in a variety of indoor and outdoor settings.

Candidates with necessary construction industry certifications, experience and a proven track record are preferred. A valid driver's license with 6 or fewer demerits and no major infractions is required.

WORKING CONDITIONS

  • No Camp accommodations provided
  • No Flights
  • No Living Out Allowance
  • Working 10-hour shifts Monday to Friday
  • Some weekend work may be required

CASMAN'S COMPENSATION INCLUDES:

Wage range dependent on skills and experience ($25.55-$36.50)

Pension matching plan

Comprehensive Benefits, 50% premium paid

Compulsory life & disability insurance

Health, Dental & Vision coverage

Retnetion bonuses are offered to long term employees 

Company truck and gas card are provided!

Casman welcomes all applications, and we thank you for your interest in our group. Only applicants of interest will be contacted.

title: Residential Carpenter
description:
Residential Carpenter

 

  • Looking to work in the city of Toronto on exciting projects?
  • Ready to take your carpentry skills to the next level?
  • Wanting to find a fun and professional place to learn and grow your skills?

 

If so, we're looking for you!

 

 

Must Haves:

  1. Own vehicle and valid Ontario driver’s license
  2. Own tools and PPE
  3. Must own a smart phone with a data plan (Time Clock and Daily Logs will all be input from your phone through the Buildertrend App)
  4. Ability to read, understand, and explain Architectural Drawings and relay details accordingly

 

 

Qualifications:

  • 3+ Year Framing Experience in High-End Residential Renovation/Custom Home Building field
  • 3+ years Trim/Finish Carpentry experience
  • Proven ability to work within deadlines and budgets
  • Strong Time Management and Self-Management skills
  • Strong working knowledge of job site safety and building codes
  • High standard of integrity, satisfaction, and professionalism
  • Excellent People skills; sub-trades, suppliers, clients, neighbors and SevernWoods staff
  • Ability to lift 50 pounds, climb ladders and scaffolding
  • Pay rate dependent on Experience & Skill Level

 

 

Responsibilities:

  • Work with the Lead Carpenter on all carpentry; including framing, trim carpentry, window & door installation and steel/wood beam installation
  • Complete all work with a high level of productivity
  • Understand time allocations and work within the Project Schedule
  • Anticipate problems/issues and work with Lead Carpenter to come up with solutions
  • Use Buildertrend to create PO’s, keep an eye on the Budget and Schedule
  • Use Buildertrend to upload pictures and daily logs when necessary
  • Daily communication with the Lead Carpenter or PM to schedule work accordingly
  • Learn/Maintain a thoughtful approach to sustainability and energy efficiency
  • Maintain a safe work environment for yourself and others, organizing tools and materials and keep site clean
  • Aid the Lead Carpenter with quality control of sub-trades and suppliers on site

 

 

Company Highlights:

  • Join our amazing team of talented people and work as a team on interesting projects!
  • Profit Sharing Program!
  • 2 weeks paid Vacation per year!
  • Yearly Company Retreat!
  • Employee of the Quarter awards & lunch!
  • Paid Training/Learning/Skill Development opportunities!
  • Opportunity to grow into Lead Carpenter & Site Supervisor Roles!
  • Great Work/Life balance (no evenings or weekend work)!

title: General Labourer
description:
General Labourer (Vacuum Truck Services)
WESSUC INC.

Wessuc is one of Ontario's leading resources for municipal, industrial and agricultural wastewater infrastructure and processes, with a focus on turning waste into value.

As a result of our continued growth in our dewatering, vacuum and clean-out services, we are looking for motivated General Labourers to join our team. An essential part of our vacuum operations crews, our attendants and confined spaces technicians keep the job running smoothly from start to finish by maintaining equipment on site, operating high pressure water systems and assisting the operator with the vacuum truck. 


Job Responsibilities

As a General Labourer with our Vac Services team, you will:
  • Assist the operator in setting up sites efficiently and safely, including vacuum hoses, safety equipment and associated equipment;
  • Service equipment on site and carry out preventative maintenance procedures to ensure that pumps, vehicles and equipment are fuelled, greased, and in proper working order;
  • Clean out and working in confined spaces including waste water holding tanks, pump stations, and various other tanks at sewage treatment plants, water plants and processing facilities;
  • Support and assist the foreperson in paperwork including CSE permits and all other required paperwork as part of daily operations;
  • Assist in all divisions at Wessuc, may be required to help out in other divisions as operational needs arise.

Qualifications

  • High school education;
  • Mechanically inclined; 
  • Experience in the construction or wastewater industry an asset;
  • Valid G or G2 drivers license with good driving record; 
  • Safety certifications of Confined Space Entry and Working at Heights are an asset;
  • Ability to work in confined spaces; walk, bend, and lift 75 lbs.;
  • Flexibility to work a varied schedule, work may include out of town work.

Benefits

  • Competitive wages with overtime paid after 44 hours;
  • Comprehensive benefits plan including health, dental, life and vision;
  • Company matching RRSP-DPSP program;
  • Boot allowance of $150 after one year of service;
  • Supportive team work environment in a family owned and operated company;
  • Opportunity for advancement.

About Us

Established in 2000, Wessuc is a family owned and operated business driven by its values. As leaders in our industry, we take pride in our commitment to safety and our use of innovative waste solution technologies. Our teams contribute to cleaner, greener, and sustainable communities every day. 

Wessuc encourages all qualified candidates to apply. Should you require accommodation in the recruitment process, please let us know by using the “Help” function in the application, or contacting our Human Resources team.

title: Carpenter
description:
Job Description:

 

Voice Construction is a privately owned civil construction firm providing services for high profile clients and projects across Alberta and British Columbia. We specialize in petrochemical site preparation and related earthwork construction projects. Since our founding in 1939 Voice has grown considerably yet still maintains a family culture. At Voice you will find challenging work and opportunities for career growth through mentorship and career development!

 

Voice Construction is currently hiring experienced Carpenter for work on a project site near Richmond, BC.

 

Project Shift Schedule: 5/2; Monday - Friday

 

This is a local position; no camp or living allowance provided.

 

Essential Job Funstions:

  • Must have industrial experience with concrete form-work
  • Experience with Doka formwork is preferred
  • Physically fit to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Operate heavy equipment if required including Zoom Boom, Skid Steer
  • Operate company trucks, including flat deck & site vehicle
  • Comprehends blueprint readings to prepare layouts including selecting materials, planning sequences and methods of work, and measuring and marking materials to avoid costly mistakes or omissions
  • Understands industrial concrete forming and engineered forming systems to accurately build concrete forms, scaffolding, bridges, trestles, tunnels, shelters, towers, and other structure
  • Checks completed units to be sure they are level, square, plumb, and the right size, shape, and location
  • May perform other related duties as assigned

The following certificates are required for site access; training can be provided as needed:

  • CSTS 09
  • WHMIS 2015
  • Pre-Access D&A test
  • Journeyman ticket an asset

Please apply here or through our website, www.voiceconst.com.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals.

title: General Labourer
description:
Job Description:

GENERAL LABOUR

 

Shift: AM: 5.30am to 2pm / 5.45am to 2.15pm

                   PM: 2.45pm to 11.15pm / 3pm to 11.30pm

Hours of work: 40hrs/week

Rate: $19.44 per hour

Days of work: Mon to Fri

Working Conditions: Plant environment (cold: 0 to 4 Degrees)

Job Description:

  • Take an active role in changeover procedures and achieve line speed efficiencies
  • Visual quality checks of product against customer and internal specifications (including foreign materials and weight checks).
  • Ability to maintain cleanliness of areas of responsibility.
  • Adhere to individual Product Standard Operating Procedures for components and packaging material.
  • Must wear proper Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and comply with Health and Safety requirements. including ensuring power is shut down on equipment prior to specified tasks.
  • Packaging cooked or semi product on various meat production equipment.
  • Verification of Best Before Date and labels.
  • Supply packaging lines with boxes, films and labels.
  • Inventory control of label room and staging area.
  • Pack various meat products into trays/boxes.
  • Operate slicing machine and weight scale when necessary.
  • Palletizing.
  • Other duties as required/assigned.
  •  

Required Skills:

  • Ability to read, write and communicate in English.
  • Must be able to work with all types of meat products including pork.
  • Must be able to work in a cold environment.
  • Ability to stand and reach for extended periods of time.
  • Must be able to lift up to 25kgs.

 

Next Steps for qualified candidates:

  • Submit your resume for consideration.
  • A member of HR Team will contact qualified candidates to schedule a telephone interview.
  • For selected candidates, we will undergo a criminal background check prior to joining.
  • After which the selected candidates, will require to undergo a COVID-19 test prior to joining.

title: Labourer
description:
Come use your drive, energy, and diligence to make your mark!

The Casman Group of Companies, one of the largest general contractors in the region of Wood Buffalo, has been based in Fort McMurray since 1981.

Casman Building Solutions, a part of the Casman Group, is seeking local, experienced Labourers. Duties to include general labour, clean up and related tasks on construction projects. Applicants must be safety conscious, physically fit, able to lift up to 25 kg (50 lb), and able to work in a variety of indoor and outdoor settings.

Candidates with experience are preferred.

CASMAN'S COMPENSATION INCLUDES: 

   Competitive wages ($21.00-$23.50 starting)

   Pension matching plan 

   Comprehensive Benefits, 50% premium paid 

        Compulsory life & disability insurance 

        Health, Dental & Vision coverage 

Casman welcomes all applications, and we thank you for your interest in our group. Only applicants of interest will be contacted.

title: Construction Worker (FT)
description:
Looking to join a fun construction crew? We are looking for individuals with knowledge of framing and foundations or those willing to learn. 

A positive attitude and good work ethic are a must. Lots of opportunities to learn, with lots of hours and good pay.

Benefits are available after successfully completing a 3-month period.

Apply Today.

Requirements: 
  • Similar work experience is beneficial.
  • Be mild-tempered and a team player.
  • Be healthy, strong, and fit.
  • Must have reliable transportation.

Hours: Mon-Fri 40+ hrs/week.

Wage is based on experience. The entry-level wage is $20/hr. Benefits offered after 3 months of work.

title: General Laborer
description:
Mirage Renovations Inc. is a company that specializes in the renovation and maintenance of high-rise rental apartment buildings.

We are a rapidly growing company looking for a reliable, hard-working, and dedicated General Laborer to join our team.

You will be responsible for duties such as:
  • Jobsite cleanup.
  • Moving various materials (tiles, kitchen cabinets, drywall, etc.).
  • Assisting skilled contractors with their work.
  • Demolitions.

A Successful Candidate Requires:
  • 2-3 years of experience.
  • Must have reliable transportation to commute between multiple sites in a workday.
  • An ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
  • Must be currently located in or willing to relocate to Toronto.

Why You Should Join Our Team:
  • Travel during work hours paid.
  • No weekends!
  • Room for growth!
  • Paid as a sub-contractor for maximum earning potential.

Other Information:
  • This is a full-time position (not for general contractors). Serious applicants only.
  • Salary based on experience and will be fair and negotiable.
  • $20 - $22/hr.
  • Mon - Friday.
  • 8-10 hour shifts.

Our service area encompasses the whole GTA.




    About Mirage Renovations:

    Mirage renovations Inc. is an interior renovations company that specializes in residential apartment building rental units. We pride ourselves on a quick job, done well and at a reasonable price. Years of experience in the rental apartment sector has allowed us to build a highly dedicated and efficient team that is able to tackle jobs of any size. Capital Projects: - Drop Ceiling installation - Corridor painting - Metal door and frame replacements - Finish work after large scale building updates - Garage Painting - Balcony Repairs - Fences Suite turnovers: We can handle all the components of a complete turnover: - Demolition - Plaster & paint - Electrical - Plumbing - Cabinetry - Tub Surrounds - Flooring - Baseboards - Tiles - Tub surrounds - Doors & Frames - Cleaning In-suite/ Odd jobs: We are well- equipped to provide solutions to all your maintenance needs. - Repairing flood damage - Plaster repairs - Door replacement - Painting - Finish work after plumbing repairs - Leaky faucets - Hardware replacement - Boiler room repairs - Fire- rating updates

title: General Laborer (Timmins)
description:
At Golder, we thrive on challenges.

Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture.

Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?

We are currently seeking a General Labourer to join our Victor Mine project Team.

Position: General Labourer (Contract Position).

Work Schedule: Rotation consisting of 14 days on and 14 days off - 10-12 Hour Shift daily

Accommodations:

The project site is a dormitory style accommodations complex with all services. Meals are provided, lunches are bagged style and sit-down meal setting for breakfast and supper. Site room and board is supplied by the employer. Fly in / Fly out from Timmins.

An overview of your role will include:

  • Service work, renovations, new construction
  • Skilled manual labour in construction
  • Clean and perform preparation of worksite
  • Operate various hand and power tools to complete projects
  • Fueling machinery and dewatering site
  • Material Handling
  • Additional tasks such as assisting technicians on site

Your benefits at Golder will include:

  • Competitive benefits and remuneration packages
  • Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment
  • Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects
  • On the job training, mentoring, and coaching
  • Global projects and travel opportunities

One of Canada's Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 15 consecutive years

Renowned for technical excellence, Golder, now a member of WSP, is a leading, global consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 30 countries, Golder's 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.

Golder Associates Ltd. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of persons with disabilities in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), and all other applicable legislation. Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities upon request.

To learn more about our company and culture click here to view The Promise of Golder video.

title: General Labourer (FT)
description:
A very busy and award winning Home Renovations company, servicing the GTA, is looking to fill General Labour Positions.

Who we are looking for: 
We are looking for good people to join our team. Ideally we want students of construction or individual to have some construction experience. You must be able to start immediately and are willing to commit to steady work with one company. We need people who are willing to except an entry level position willing to work their way up. 
  • Are you reliable and responsible? 
  • Do you have some construction experience? 
  • Are you presentable and professional? 
  • Are you in good physical and mental shape? 
  • Do you want to work with a company that puts quality first? 
  • Do you want to work for an established and in demand growing company? 
  • Do you have a vehicle? 
  • Do you have some required tools? 
  • Do you take direction clearly?
  • Are you a team player?
  • Do you have a valid WHMIS and Fall Arrest Certificate?
 Responsibilities:
  • Operate construction vehicles.
  • Use power tools.
  • Haul goods from the receiving area.
  • Maintain a clean work environment.
If you feel you meet all or most of the requirements, please send us your resume or a detailed email listing your experience and qualifications to info@obornecontracting.com.  
 
Wage range for this position is approximately $30,000.00 - $44,000.00+ per year depending on skill, experience, qualifications and certifications (paid our hourly).
 
********************* Serious Applicants Only**********************
 
While we appreciate the time and effort taken to respond to this ad, only those applicants we feel worthy of an interview will receive a reply. 
 
You can learn about us at www.obornecontracting.com 
 
We look forward to hearing from you!

title: General Labour
description:
We are looking for physically fit individuals to work in a warehouse and on deliveries. You must be able to lift up to 75lbs repetitively for the duration of your shift. Steel-toed boots and a vest are mandatory. Location is on a bus route but the shift starts at 7:00am. Pay rate is $17/hour.

We thank all interested applicants, however, only those who are currently residing in Alberta and are legal to work in Canada will be considered. Please do not apply if you do not reside in Canada, we are not seeking international applicants at this time.

title: CARPENTERS & LABOURERS, HIGH RISE CONCRETE FORMWORK **up to $40+/hr CASH
description:
**CARPENTERS & LABOURERS, HIGH RISE CONCRETE FORMWORK **up to $40+/hr CASH **

Opportunities are available in London, ON and surrounding areas

Seeking experienced Carpenters & Labourers who have 3+ years of formwork carpentry experience in high rise construction.

Responsibilities include:
  • Build and install formwork for multi-story concrete structures
  • Prepare forms based on sketches and verbal instructions
  • Suspended slab formwork
  • Form concrete stairs
  • Construct elevator cores
  • Build retaining walls
  • Formwork used in concrete construction
  • Construct temporary wooden structures and supports
  • Build foundations and install shoring
  • Build and install platforms, scaffolding, ramps and ladders
  • Determine specifications and calculate requirements
  • Prepare layouts in accordance with building codes
  • Measure, cut, shape, assemble and join wood materials
  • Operate power tools

Minimum Requirements:
  • Minimum 3 years Concrete Formwork experience
  • Minimum 3-5 years high-rise form carpentry experience
  • Valid safety certificates are required: WHMIS, Worker Health and Safety Awareness in 4 Steps and Working at Heights
  • Suspended slab formwork experience
  • Physically capable of lifting 50+ lbs
  • Work as a team alongside other carpenters, labourers and trades
  • Available to work overtime and weekends, as required
  • Work in all weather conditions
  • Must be reliable, committed and punctual
  • Must be able to understand and follow safety procedures
  • Doka, Peri or other taper tie gang formwork experience preferred

title: Skilled Laborer (FT)
description:
Canadian Erosion and Containment is currently hiring full-time skilled laborers for the upcoming construction season. These positions will be based out of the Calgary with opportunity for travel to sites in Western Canada.

Responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to:
  • Assisting with the deployment of geosynthetic materials in the installation of Erosion Control Systems.
  • Installation of erosion control measures, GCL Liners, Silt fence, Erosion Matting, Gabion Walls and mattresses, MSE walls, Wrap Slopes, Barb Wire fence, Radon Barriers, Drill seeding, and Hydroseeding.

Requirements:
  • Must have a valid Driver’s License and reliable vehicle.
  • Must have valid safety tickets: CSTS 09 WHMIS 2015. First aid and H2S Alive would be an asset.
  • Must have PPE (steel toe boots, reflective vest, hard hat, safety glasses, gloves).
  • Must have a cell phone.
  • Previous industrial or construction experience.
  • Be able and willing to travel to remote locations and be away for extended periods of up to 24 days.
  • Availability to work up to 12 hours per day seven days a week.
  • Be adaptable to changing schedules.
  • Be comfortable working outdoors in various weather conditions.
  • Be comfortable working around heavy equipment.
  • Ability to lift to 50 pounds throughout the day.
  • Be a safety-focused individual.
  • Be able to successfully pass 8-panel pre-employment test as required for site-specific access.

Other details:
  • Rate of Pay: General Labourer position with opportunities for advancement within the company.
  • Paid Travel Time & Per Diems (daily food allowance) and hotels or camps provided for out-of-town work.
  • Accommodations, transportation, and travel time paid while on remote job sites.
  • Job Type: Full-time, Temporary, Permanent.

description:
Verity Construction is hiring! Are you looking for a great opportunity with a well-established construction team? We are an industry leader and are looking for the right candidate to join our team of professionals. We are currently looking for a full-time General Labourers.

Verity is dedicated to obtaining a supportive and positive work environment, as well as continuous training, skill development and more. We offer competitive wages and benefits to successful applicants. Wages will be based upon skill set, work ethic, and attitude. If you are looking for long term employment this is the opportunity for you!

title: Labourer
description:
Primoris Canada is an infrastructure contractor serving major firms in the oil, gas, power, petrochemical, and heavy oil industries and include services covering tailings and hydro-transport pipeline construction and maintenance, storage tank construction and maintenance, industrial facilities multi-discipline construction and maintenance, piping fabrication, and pipeline integrity services.

 

Summary: 

A Labourer is involved in a variety of job scopes assisting ticketed tradesmen. This work may exist indoors or outdoors and may be physically demanding.

 

Shift: Day/Night

Location: CNRL Horizon

Accomodation: Camp available


  • Comply with PSC and Client Safety rules, as well as OH&S standards
  • Assisting tradesmen in completing daily duties
  • Sorting and selecting tools, as requested by journeymen
  • Acting as fire/spark watch for welders
  • General Clean-Up
  • Load and unload materials as required
  • Attend required safety and tailgate/toolbox meetings
  • May perform other duties as assigned

  • Previous experience working on an industrial site is considered an asset, but not required
  • CSTS-09 (or CSO if not already in possession of CSTS-09)
  • OSSA Fire Watch is considered an asset
  • Valid Class 5 Drivers License
  • Must be physically able to lift 50lbs
  • Able to work well in a team environment

Pre-employment alcohol and drug testing is a condition of employment.

title: Summer Student - General Laborer - Tsiigehtchic
description:
Under the general supervision of the Manager Generation Support, you contribute to the safe and efficient operation of the NTPC Plant. Duties would include heavy lifting, weed whacking, painting, mopping, cleaning and assisting the Mechanics, Electrical Technicians, Electricians and Power Linepersons



Qualifications:

  • Are enrolling/enrolled to attend full time post-secondary studies at the start of the Fall 2021 semester.
  • Related experience in a labourer position an asset.

 How to Apply:

  • Submit your cover letter, and a current copy of your resume including two references from your most recent supervisor or instructors.
  • You will be required to provide proof of registration in a post-secondary institution.

This position pays $26.97 per hour plus 6% vacation pay.  No housing or relocation assistance provided.

 

This job opening is limited to student residents living in Tsiigehtchic.

 

Affirmative Action Employer - Candidates must clearly identify eligibility status via our online portal in order to receive priority consideration.

 

We thank all those who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Landscape Construction Labourer
description:
Job Summary:
The Landscape Construction Laborer is responsible for working as a team member under the direct
supervision of the Landscape Construction Foreman. This role is responsible for completing construction landscape installation jobs in an efficient manner, promoting job worksite safety, providing excellent customer service, and exhibits pride and quality workmanship.

Job Responsibilities:
  • Work closely with Foreman and Crew Leader in the installation of landscape construction projects.
  • Always represent the company’s best interest, maintain the highest level of professionalism.
  • Maintain a clean and safe job site
  • Maintain and care for company equipment, tools, and vehicles.
  • Perform highly physical installation work on a consistent basis.
  • Work as part of a team and take direction.
  • Keep accurate timesheet records
  • Attend training classes and seminars as requested by management.
  • Perform other tasks or projects as assigned/instructed by Foreman and/or Crew Leader.
  • Frequently operates machinery such as a powered auger, compactor, sprayer, cutoff saw, and masonry saw.
Qualifications/Requirements:
  • Knowledge and experience in installing a variety of hardscape applications and assets.
  • Highly motivated, self-driven, and detailed oriented.
  • Must be professional in appearance and actions.
  • Great time management skills; available for seasonal long hours, weekends, and although rare potential holidays.
  • Punctual and dependable with a can-do attitude.
  • Ability to work effectively with individuals of differing backgrounds, knowledge, and skill levels.
  • Physical demands require constantly moving, walking, stooping, kneeling, crouching, or crawling.
  •  Frequently required to stand and walk, lift and/or move up to 50 to over 100 lbs. with assistance. 
  • Constantly required to communicate with the ability to talk and hear. 
  • Requires to constantly work outdoors in all types of weather conditions and exposure to elements. This can include heavy to moderate noise, extreme proximity to moving equipment or machinery, proximity to electrical energy, exposure to tools and machines used in construction industries.
  • Be flexible and ready to learn new job skills on a weekly basis.
  • A first-aid certificate is a bonus.
  • Must have steel-toed boots.
Examples of duties:
  • Construct cement block retaining walls.
  • Install paving stones.
  • Level and prepare grades for playgrounds, yards, commercial properties.
  • Install natural sod or artificial turf.
  • Plant landscaping trees or bushes.
  •  Work as a heavy equipment assistant.
  • Install and paint panel fencing.
  • New duties all of the time based on the customer's needs.




    About House 2 Home Landscaping:

    At House2Home Landscaping, our strong appreciation for the landscaping trade and our love for precise, functional, creative landscape design helps us shape every single project we work on.Our first priority is producing custom-made, quality landscaping designs that are executed with the highest attention to detail and are perfectly suited to meet the needs of each unique client. No matter how small or complex a project we are working on, the challenge of creating practical, functional, and aesthetically beautiful pieces is the most rewarding thing we can do.

title: General Labor - General Packer - Hamilton, ON 12 Hour Continental Shift Rotation
description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.

You independently operate and maintain at least one process, equipment or systems following autonomous maintenance (AM) standards and use your technical skills to improve line and/or system performance to meet business needs.

How you will contribute

You are a key ingredient in changing how the world snacks. With coaching, you will operate and maintain equipment to deliver on our safety, quality, cost, delivery, sustainability and morale targets. You will use execute all standard work processes on your equipment using AM (autonomous maintenance) and PM (progressive maintenance) standards and ensure that safety processes are observed, and that quality assurance activities are performed. You will understand the losses in their area and equipment and report them.

What you will bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:

  • Operating machines with coaching
  • Safety and quality standards for operating machines
  • Reading and writing, and fluently conversant in the language of communication as appropriate to the site
  • Collaborating well in a diverse work environment

Education

  • High School Diploma (required)

Experience / Skills

  • Experience in warehouse environment strongly preferred.
  • Previous experience using production line type machinery or food processing machinery would be an asset.

Business Unit Summary

We are the second-largest snacking company in Canada and in the top 10 food companies in North America. We make and distribute delicious household favorites including Cadbury, Oreo, Mr. Christie and Maynards. We are an ambitious business—in the past few years alone, we have invested $250 million in our Ontario-based factories. Our community of over 2,600 employees is based across Canada, with our head office on Bloor Street West in Toronto. Canada plays a strategic role for Mondelēz North America and globally. We are proud of our “local-first” commercial focus that enables us to take ownership of our own market and make more, faster decisions closer to our consumers. We are also proud of our top 100 position on Forbes magazine’s 2019 Canada’s Best Employers list.

If you are applying to a position in Canada, accommodations for applicants with disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process please contact 847-943-5460 for assistance/support.

Job Type

Regular

Manufacturing core

Manufacturing

You will understand the losses in their area and equipment and report them.', 'You independently operate and maintain at least one process, equipment or systems following autonomous maintenance (AM) standards and use your technical skills to improve line and/or system performance to meet business needs.', 'Manufacturing', 'High School Diploma (required)', 'Regular']

title: Construction Lead (Subway Projects)
description:
Company Description

We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60 offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

IBI Group’s Toronto office is seeking an experienced Construction Lead to work on major transit/subway projects in Toronto.  Reporting to the Project Director, the Construction Lead will be responsible for leading and managing a multidisciplinary construction team in the execution of the Yonge-North Subway Extension (YNSE) project under various procurement delivery models (i.e. Alliance, CMAR, Progressive DB, etc.). The successful candidate will also be responsible for building a collaborative team to work initially to deliver the project through to commissioning of the project. This individual should be highly organized and a project driver exhibiting extremely strong project management skills with the ability to work with individuals across multiple disciplines.

Most Of The Things You’ll Work On:

  • Reporting to the Project Lead, oversee the entire construction effort between the Construction Team and CA Construction Team to ensure project is constructed in accordance with design, budget and schedule
  • Collaborate with Contracting Authority and applicable Contracting Authority Consultants to understand and document Project scope and identify any risks (including gaps in scope, site readiness, and in-market schedule) and develop mitigation strategies for such identified risks
  • Plan, coordinate and/or supervise activities of all company personnel working in accordance with the overall program objectives
  • Oversee the review of  work plans, construction submissions, commissioning and operations submissions and any other submissions by the Construction Team; ensuring that the project is conducted with the highest standards of quality and integrity
  • Oversee the overall coordination between Construction and Quality Team to ensure implementation of the quality program and audits for Construction activities
  • Provide oversight on the monthly report to Contracting Authority outlining findings of any incomplete work, discrepancy or inconsistency with intended dimensions, materials or finishes, substandard performance or failures, or other noncompliance/ non-conformance
  • Review, monitor, and report on Project Co's construction schedules and activities on site; Provide opinions on the validity of the construction schedule as presented by Project Co in coordination with the Owner’s Engineer
  • Monthly reporting to the CA on general project status, milestone activities, NCRs, Risks, and any additional commentary
  • Seeks innovation and cost effectiveness during the project lifecycle.
  • Ensure all company, client, and project policies, procedures, standards, etc., are adhered to
  • Provide oversight to support Contracting Authority, if requested, in liaising with municipalities, utility companies government agencies, Indigenous communities and Early Works Contractors to assess and determine requirements that need to be incorporated into the Project and advise on potential impacts to the schedule
  • Mentor and lead team members in their development and growth
Qualifications

You’ll Need To Have:

  • Ideally a minimum 20 years experience with a University or College degree/diploma; 10 years of construction management experience
  • Must have very strong experience in transit stations (specifically subways).  Experience with other complex P3 level projects are an asset
  • Must have expert knowledge on Construction Safety Standards with ability to drive safety culture
  • Have an integrated team approach to construction; IPD experience an asset.
  • Must be a proven people and project leader with solid experience managing and developing multidisciplinary teams
  • Results-oriented with an extremely high work ethic, excellent communication, planning skills stringent quality standards, and a can-do attitude
  • Thorough knowledge of all aspects of modern construction techniques including incorporation of digital modeling and tools for efficiency in construction and for the benefit of client life cycle


Additional Information

We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19, but when we do return to the office we're located at 55 St. Clair Ave West, this office is steps away from St. Clair station and is easily accessible by bike, TTC and car. Occupying 7 floors, with over 700 employees, it is the largest office at IBI Group. The floors are open concept and represent our collaborative approach to projects.

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada. 

We request applicants submit RESUME AND PORTFOLIO highlighting relevant work experience. Please limit PDF files to 10MB or provide a WebLink.

title: Senior Carpenter - Custom Home Builds and Renovations
description:
Senior Carpenter About Us We are an industry-leading custom builder and contracting company and we take pride in our work, providing our client with excellent quality and customer service
We are a custom home builder and renovator in the Midland-Penetanguishene area and we are looking for Senior/Skilled Carpenters to join our team to help realize homeowners' custom home and renovation dreams
We are a great place to work, and take care to make sure employee's needs and safety are our top priority
We value dedicated and hard working team members and do everything we can to make sure that they are happy, and are in an enjoyable work environment
Duties Measure, cut, shape, assemble and join materials Read blueprints and drawings Framework Crown Moulding Millwork Installation of windows, doors, cabinets, and flooring Work safely and in an organized manner Lay out a house Build foundations and footings Qualifications Minimum of 5 to 10 years of experience in custom home building and renovations, or a proven record of senior level skill Must be physically able to perform all delegated duties Strong interpersonal and leadership skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Must have knowledge of workplace safety requirements, policies and procedures Our Offer: Starting at $35-$40 per hour with quick raises based on performance and duties Health, Dental, and Vison, etc
Benefits are available Opportunity for growth into a leadership role Monday – Friday Day shift Opportunity for overtime hours Additional perks! All work is within 45 minutes of Midland, ONFuel Compensation is provided based on distance Apply Now!

title: Senior Carpenter
description:
Eventscape has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Senior Carpenter (Custom Millwork Fabricator) to join our woodshop. The ideal candidate will be an elite craftsperson and natural leader, with experience with all aspects of architectural millwork fabrication and familiarity with a variety of materials.

 

ABOUT THE ROLE

The custom millwork fabricator position will:

  • manufacture and assemble high-quality custom architectural elements and structures
  • read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and sketches and to understand project specifications
  • determine tolerances and test project elements
  • operate all woodworking machinery, finishing equipment, power tools, and hand tools
  • work with different materials, including solid surfaces, epoxy, metals, melamine, solid wood, wood products
  • perform exact measurements, ensure precise installation of hardware and other elements
  • perform wood finishing, sanding, staining, and applying finishes
  • monitor quality across the team and ensure each piece is fabricated to a high standard
  • plan and execute fabrication strategies; oversee and manage junior fabricators and assistants
  • manage schedules to meet deadlines and provide consistent, regular project updates to management
  • maintain awareness of inventory and requirements for upcoming projects
  • ensure safe work practices are adhered to and follow all safety policies and procedures
  • maintain a clean and tidy work area and facilitate required repairs and maintenance to all equipment 

 

ABOUT YOU

To succeed in this role, you will have:

  • training from a relevant program such as woodworking, millwork, carpentry or cabinetmaking OR  an acceptable combination of education, training, and experience
  • experience as a lead-hand or senior fabricator
  • a passion for challenging fabrication and tight tolerances
  • the ability to self-motivate and be schedule conscious
  • a strong attention to detail and amazing problem-solving skills
  • competency in reading and interpreting blueprints/drawings
  • a thorough understanding of health and safety principles and practices
  • a willingness to collaborate with a team and work independently when needed
  • an in-depth understanding of fabrication processes and manufacturing/building materials
  • experience with materials like wood, solid surfaces, fabric, acrylic, glass, leather
  • flexibility to work occasional evenings and weekends 

 

WHY JOIN EVENTSCAPE?

  • claim your place in our collaborative and supportive network of multi-disciplinary architectural fabrication experts
  • join in on frequent contests, celebrations, and unique social activities
  • be inspired and challenged by our team of the most creative, talented, and passionate individuals
  • a regular Monday to Friday work schedule
  • a fast-growing company with opportunities for advancement
  • enjoy being at the forefront of technological innovation with our state-of-the-art machinery
  • the opportunity to work on unique and challenging projects andâ€¦
  • the reward of seeing those projects come to life through fabrication and installation
  • extended health and dental benefits
  • be part of a socially conscious and family-owned company

 

APPLY NOW

Apply now with your resume and 1-2 lines about your how your experience relates to advanced custom architectural fabrication.

For more information or if you need disability accommodation, contact human resources at (416) 231-8855. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest in Eventscape, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Eventscape is committed to fostering a workplace in which individual differences are recognized, appreciated, and respected. Eventscape will consider all qualified candidates and welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available for all stages of the selection process.

title: Junior Rigger - Dead by Daylight
description:
The rigger is the person whose work allows animator to leverage their skills. They use their strong knowledge of rigging and skinning principles to create the structure that animators need to bring characters to life according to design requirements. 
The rigger also has the necessary knowledge to create well-thought-of and optimized structures depending on production constraints. They share their experience working with polygonal structures of models to get the best possible deformation and follows up with animators to validate the quality and relevance of their work. 

In this role, you will:

  • Understand the technical development vision in animation; 
  • Work withing the technical restraints; 
  • Create rigs and skinning for models with various degrees of complexity; 
  • Suggest new tools and best practices; 
  • Reuse resources wherever possible; 
  • Maintain strong communication with animators and designers; 
  • Assess the impact of methods used during production; 
  • Support animators to optimize the integration and use of animations in engine. 

What we’re looking for:

  • Experience in rigging; 
  • In-depth knowledge of 3D animation; 
  • Willingness to explore new software and technical art advances with curiosity; 
  • Proficiency with Maya animation software; 
  • Production experience with Unreal or Unity is considered an asset; 
  • Understanding of AnimGraph systems; 
  • Experience with motion capture is considered an asset; 
  • Ability to manage priorities; 
  • Proficiency in French and English. 

Dans ce rôle, vous devrez :

  • Comprendre la vision du développement technique en animation ; 
  • Respecter les contraintes techniques ; 
  • Créer des rigs et effectuer le skinning de modèles de diverses complexités ; 
  • Proposer de meilleures pratiques et suggérer de nouveaux outils ; 
  • Réutiliser les ressources lorsque possible ; 
  • Établir une solide communication avec les animateurs et les designers ; 
  • Évaluer l’impact des méthodes utilisées en production ; 
  • Assister les animateurs afin d’optimiser l’intégration et l’utilisation des animations dans le moteur. 

Ce que nous recherchons :

  • Expérience en rigging ; 
  • Connaissances approfondies en animation 3D 
  • Curiosité pour les nouveaux logiciels et les avancées en art technologique ; 
  • Maitrise du module d’animation du logiciel Maya ; 
  • Expérience de production avec Unreal ou Unity un atout ; 
  • Compréhension des systèmes d’Anim Graph (atout) ; 
  • Capacité à gérer les priorités ; 
  • Maîtrise du français et de l'anglais. 
En tant que Rigger, vous permettez aux animateurs de pouvoir faire rayonner leur talent. Armé.e d’une bonne connaissance des principes de rigging et de skinning, vous créez la structure qui permet à l’animateur de déformer le personnage ou l’objet selon les exigences du design. 
Vos connaissances vous permettent de créer des structures réfléchies et optimisées selon les contraintes de production. Vous partagez votre expérience en orientant la structure polygonale des modèles pour obtenir la meilleure déformation possible et vous assurez le suivi auprès des animateurs pour valider la qualité et la pertinence de votre travail.

title: Rigging Lead
description:
Company Description

As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.

Job Description

The Rigging Lead will create 3D rigs for different types of objects, vehicles, characters and creatures, ensuring to meet the high quality standards of Rodeo FX, while supporting the Rigging Artists within their project team. This includes answering questions, offering guidance and helping to resolve issues in a positive and constructive manner.  They will work closely with production to assign tasks to artists, communicate the status of work, propose solutions to problems 

Main responsibilities:

  • Create 3D rigs for different types of objects, vehicles, characters and creatures;
  • Create and rig the internal anatomy of a creature, in order to drive the final deformation of the skin;
  • Create feature-quality, scripted rigs and refine them based on the needs of animators and downstream departments;
  • Implement and refine character, body/face, cloth/deformer and hard-surface rigs;
  • Work closely with modelers and animators to ensure an asset is efficiently rigged and capable of believable movements.
  • Work closely with the CG and Animation Supervisors and Production to find creative and technical solutions and approaches that meet project requirements and deadlines;
  • Participate in the creation of tools for their speciality. Test the tools before their integration, and ensure clear and accessible documentation;
  • Oversee the work of a team of artists on a show, demonstrating an expert standard of skills in the specialty and a positive, solution-driven attitude;
  • In collaboration with production, plan and assign appropriate tasks to team members, taking into consideration their abilities, level and the project workflow and timing;
  • Provide feedback on artist’s work to ensure it meets quality standards and corresponds with client’s artistic vision;
  • Communicate promptly with the Production Team and Department Manager regarding any artist who may not have enough work. May assist in finding alternative tasks (training, R&D pipeline tools, etc);
  • Mentor members of their team by providing training and sharing knowledge. Communicate any training needs for their team to the Head of Department. May participate in preparing training materials or giving group training sessions;
  • Participate in mid & post mortem reviews, and annual reviews of artists by providing feedback to the Head of Department;
  • Keep Production and the project team informed of the status of work, issues to be resolved, ramifications of problems encountered and recommend potential solutions;
  • Ensure deadlines are met, advising the project team promptly if delays could be expected, whether by themselves or a member of their team;
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of their specialty and be on the lookout for the latest technological advances in methods and approaches.
Qualifications

  • Minimum of 3 years experience as an Rigging Artist, within the VFX industry;
  • Knowledge of English and French - should be fluent in one of these languages, functional in the other;
  • Excellent knowledge of Maya software;
  • Experience in programming using Python and PySide;
  • Good knowledge of of the principles of anatomy (bipeds, quadrupeds, skeletons and muscles) and facial expression;
  • Knowledge of modeling tools for blend shapes;
  • Knowledge of animation tools for the creation of animation test deformation;
  • Excellent sense of prioritization and respect of deadlines;
  • Ability to stay calm under pressure and act as a positive role model and mentor.


Additional Information

  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Telecommunications Tower Rigger
description: We currently have immediate openings for Experienced Telecommunication Tower Riggers for our Calgary location.  Telecommunication Tower Riggers perform all required duties associated with the installation of communication towers, accessories, antenna systems on towers or rooftops and any other telecommunications related activities that may be required. Tower Technicians work outdoors in all weather conditions.

title: Offshore Ironworker - Rigger
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood is actively recruiting Riggers to support upcoming Q3 2022 Maintenance Turnaround activities.

 

This position will require you to travel to offshore Newfoundland and Labrador via helicopter or supply vessel. Individuals must be comfortable working in remote locations, confined spaces, and heights.

 

Responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to:                     

  • Safe execution of work in accordance to agreed guidance documents (i.e. work packs, work instructions, procedures) and governing specifications.
  • Ensure that safe rigging practices are used during the movement of loads including risk assessment, proper lift planning and equipment selection.
  • Monitor rigging materials and highlight any overages/shortages to Offshore Maintenance Supervisor.
  • Ensure all rigging equipment is in fit-for-purpose condition (i.e. pre and post use) and quarantine any defective materials.
  • Must be conversant with relevant rigging standards, specifications, rules, regulations etc. including Permit to Work (PTW).

 

 

Skills / Qualifications

Candidates should possess the following qualifications:

  • Interprovincial Boilermaker / Iron Worker or Journeyperson’s certificate. Any equivalent combination of experience and / or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved may also be considered.
  • Must have successfully completed Rigging Training as outlined in CAPP from a recognized training institution.
  • Must have a basic understanding of the construction (i.e. wire rope, nylon, chain), inspection, maintenance and selection of lifting equipment, including limitations and safety issues associated with the material.
  • Must be familiar with the safe use of mechanical handling equipment (i.e. chain hoists, tirfors, hydraulic jacks, etc.) used in an offshore construction environment.
  • Strong working knowledge of industrial rigging practices and equipment.                             

For this position, the following training/certifications would be considered an asset:

  • Basic Survival Training (BST) including HUET and HUEBA.
  • Advanced Offshore Rigging: Stage 1 or 2
  • Hydrogen Sulphide (H2S) Alive.
  • Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS 2015).
  • Offshore Safety Regulatory Awareness
  • Fall Protection
  • Confined Space Entry
  • Emergency First Aid

Successful Candidates must meet the following requirements

  • Pass a site-specific drug and alcohol test and meet COVID-19 vacination requirements
  • Be able to safely lift and carry up to 50lbs
  • Possess enough strength and stamina to perform the technical duties and essential functions as identified above
  • Able to move and work in confined spaces, following proper protocol
  • May be required consistently to work 10-12 hour shifts performing physical labour in varying temperatures and weather conditions.
  • Be able to climb and maintain balance on stairs, ladders, scaffolds and steel framework, utilizing proper fall arrest procedures when required.
  • Able to safely and comfortably work at heights without posing a danger to oneself or others
  • Able to meet physical requirements of frequent walking, climbing, standing, bending, twisting and crawling for the duration of the shift

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.
