title: Apprentice Formwork Carpenter
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview:

Lafarge is hiring an Apprentice Formwork Carpenter for our Vancouver infrastructure operations.

To apply, please email resumes directly to:
gord.bird@lafargeholcim.com

blaine.fisher@lafargeholcim.com

Responsibilities:
  • Construction, specializing in Heavy Civil Vertical Formwork
  • Infrastructure Projects within the Greater Vancouver Regional District
  • Determine specifications and calculate formwork material requirements
  • Prepare layouts / assist in Field Surveying
  • Measure, cut, shape, assemble  wood materials
  • Operate power tools (cutting/grinding, etc.)
Qualifications:

Education:

  • None required, grade 12 preferred

Credentials (certificates, licences, memberships, courses, etc.):

  • Apprentice Carpenter
  • Consideration for Application to become a Red Seal Certified Formwork Carpenter an asset, but not required

Other:

  • Basic English is required.
  • Must have ability to travel to multiple worksite locations, own vehicle is preferred due to the location of some of the worksites

 

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim:

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Hardscape Laborer
description:
Why CSL? 

CSL Group is a dynamic family-based company committed to its employees. We are a growing company with a fantastic reputation and are searching for new team members to grow and develop. If you are looking for a career, not just a job, we offer exciting growth and advancement opportunities. All employees at CSL are committed to our company values (SHARING - Safety, Humility, Accountability, Respect, Integrity, Nurturing, Growth). If working for a company that is committed to upholding its SHARING values excites you, please apply today! 

Job Duties:

  • 2 years of experience in the landscape enhancements industry 
  • Demonstrates initiative: ability to think, work and make decisions based on sound judgment
  • Able to operate basic construction equipment (excavator, skid steer, earth movers, etc)
  • Experience in working in repairing fences, tree planting/cutting, hardscaping, laying mulch, patio stones etc. 
  • Superior strengths including lifting, climbing, bending, digging
  • Examples of duties include excavation, grading, layout and basic construction labour tasks
  • Perform preventative maintenance on tools and equipment by conducting inspections, lubricating, and cleaning on a daily basis
  • Comply with all company policies and regulations
  • Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with extreme weather fluctuation
  • This is a full time position throughout the spring, summer, and fall seasons. This position transitions into winter duties.  

Work Perks:

  • Competitive wages
  • Company paid benefits package
  • Employee appreciation events
  • Company paid uniforms & safety boot allowance
  • RRSP and DPSP

Other companies may call this job: Full Time, Full-Time, Landscape, Landscaper, Enhancement, Construction

title: Maintenance
description:
Company Description

We are more than just your local restaurant. We are a collection of hardworking small-business owners.

Did you know that from coast to coast, we serve delicious choices to more than 2.5 million people in over 1,400 locations every day, or that we have proudly helped more than 387,000 Canadian families with sick children through Ronald McDonald House Charities?

 

Job Description

Our offer

Working with us means that you will have the opportunity to earn and learn, flexibility, and a safe and inclusive work environment. What this means in practice is:

·       Access to education and skills development opportunities that take you further

·       A total rewards package that includes discounts, incentives, and recognition perks

·       Flexible hours/shifts that suit your needs

·       A safe, respectful and inclusive workplace

·       Bring your authentic self to work – welcoming people of every age, background, and culture – just like the guests who visit our restaurants every day

The job

We are sure that you have an idea about what working with us is like, but just in case here are some of the highlights on what your job will entail:

·       Maintaining a clean, safe, and secure work environment for guests, coworkers, and yourself, leveraging your knowledge of safety regulations and equipment.

·       Multi-tasking in between troubleshooting, tending to store areas and appliances during your shift, and repairing décor and equipment, whether it’s during the day or throughout the night.

·       Managing priorities, staying organized, and keeping on top of the various tasks with limited supervision.

Your vibe and experience

You are trustworthy and have trust in others. You’re a curious mind. You love to see how things work and are fascinated by the intricacies of objects. You’re good with your hands and mechanically adept. You’re always willing to learn and grow. You remain cool, calm and collected in a fast-paced environment. You’d rather do a job right the first time, than do it twice.

Additional Information

About us

In 1954, an enterprising salesman named Ray Kroc discovered a small burger restaurant in California, and wrote the first page of McDonald’s history. In 1967, the first McDonald’s Canada opened in Richmond, B.C. and we’ve been growing with our communities and serving quality food at great a value ever since. Today, McDonald’s Canada is proud to be one of the world’s leading foodservice retailers, offering job opportunities at corporate-owned restaurants or restaurants owned by independent franchisees.

McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: General Labourer
description:
Description:
Looking for a career, instead of just a job?
Agilus is recruiting for multiple General Labourers in the construction industry in Woodstock, Ontario.

A day in the life:
  • Assembling, preparing, and dismantling concrete forms
  • Placing and tying of reinforced steel
  • General labour duties within a concrete facility

Requirements:
  • Ability to handle physically demanding work
  • Previous labour experience in the concrete and/or construction industry considered an asset
  • Willingness to rapid test for Covid19, as required
  • Willingness to complete a pre employment drug screening for illegal substances

What's in it for you:
  • Full time, permanent employment
  • Becoming a member of the union
  • Employer paid medical and dental benefits
  • $23.97 per hour, starting wage. Increases up to $26/hour
  • Daytime hours - no evenings or weekends!

Let's connect!
Please apply directly online by phone 902.491.4494 or by email lreynolds@agilus.ca or by text 902.491.4494
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Skatepark Construction Builders / Finishers
description:
Are you a passionate, creative team player with a desire to travel and work and make a difference in communities across Canada? We have openings for experienced Carpenters and Concrete Finishers who take pride in their workmanship. Successful candidates will possess a positive attitude, be community driven, adaptable, responsible and have the ability to work and travel out of town for extended periods of time. We provide very comfortable homes away from home, travel provided to and from locations and a healthy compensation allowance for living away from home.

We are looking for individuals with experience in carpentry and formwork, welding and concrete placing/finishing. Experience with shaping and finishing vertical shotcrete and experience with concrete line pumps an asset. With safety as our top priority, we are interested in individuals with Health and Safety certifications and relative training certifications.

Preference may be given to those with a journeyman carpentry ticket, previous concrete finishing work experience, ACI certification. We are seeking interested candidates with experience in: framing and excavation, ability to read architectural drawings, rebar and form installation, measure/calculate concrete volumes, handling and troweling concrete.

New Line Skateparks offers a productive fast paced work environment in an exciting industry. Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. We offer a complete benefits plan including, medical, dental, and insurance as well as a performance bonus program.

title: Labourer - Casual
description:
Labourers with Cando are responsible for performing the safe and efficient securement of truck frames to railcars, and sorting spacers to assist plant production. Working in a fast-paced, customer oriented environment, the Labourers must work well in teams to maximize efficiency while demonstrating a strong initiative and safety focus.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Conduct and participate in clear and concise job briefings.
  • Operate equipment such as lift truck, genie lift, spacer machine, etc. according to the safety rules and regulations of Cando and its customer
  • Prepare railcars for loading by unchaining harnesses and pallets on returning unloaded railcars.
  • Prepare stock for shipment by setting up tie rods and chains, lubricating turnbuckles as needed, and securing product on railcars.
  • Lift 25 lb rods into caps above head height and secure by pulling a chain through the rod; ratchet turnbuckles on chains until chain is tight and load is secure, lift and sort 20 lb spacers to support production
  • Adhere to all Health and Safety Programs; conduct job hazard analysis, report unsafe working conditions, and ensure they are repaired immediately
  • Contribute to team effort by assisting other team members in all functions of the job; take direction from Shift Supervisor
  • Work and operate equipment according to customer and Cando's safety rules and regulations
  • Ensure the site is clean, tidy, organized, and a safe work place at all times

Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities

  • Prioritize and perform multiple tasks with the ability to meet daily demands and function in busy situations
  • Ability to operate and perform daily maintenance checks on required machinery, including the ability to change clamps and exchange propane cylinders
  • Medically fit to work in a safety sensitive environment; physically fit including the ability to pull self up and down from forklift, genie lift, and rail car
  • Ability to work outside in all weather conditions in a plant that operates 24 hours a day, seven (7) days a week
  • Demonstrate initiative to work with others to foster a respectful workplace
  • Able to accept new challenges and responsibilities as they arise

Education & Experience

  • Training will be provided; Must be able to hold and maintain required certification

Note: This description is not intended to limit the assignment of work or be construed as a complete list of the many duties to be performed by the incumbent. The qualifications are provided so interested candidates understand of the level of expertise required in this position.

title: General Labourer - Fittings
description:
Here at KP Building Products, our employees are at the forefront of everything we do. We are the leading Canadian manufacturer and distributor of vinyl siding and strive to be the best in customer experience. We are a company rich in history and proud to be Canadian owned and operated.

KP Building Products has an immediate employment opportunity in the Brampton area for General labourers for the fitting department. The Special Fittings Operator workers manually produce specially formed fittings by heating and molding, bending, joining and cutting PVC plastics using tools such as molds, mold presses, and a press cutter.

Shifts: 8 hour shifts
Salary: $15.50 per hour

We offer:

  • Health and Dental benefits
  • RRSP
  • Ongoing training initiatives
  • Yearly Safety Boot Allowance
  • Prescription Safety Glasses Allowance
  • Vacation & paid time off

Responsabilities:

  • Determines parts to be made as per customer order
  • Cut long PVC flat sheets using cutter
  • Cut plastic sheets using band saw
  • Cut pipe using table saw
  • Welding and assembling of pieces
  • Heat plastic for forming into molds and bending
  • Set-up and replace molds and cutters
  • Cut holes into parts using a hole cutter
  • Application of labels to parts; packing of parts
  • Participate in training as required by the company
  • Adhere to all applicable company policies and procedures, including quality and health and safety
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Requirements:

  • Completed high school diploma, GED, or equivalent.
  • Two (2) years experience as a special fittings operator within a manufacturing environment, preferably working with PVC plastics is an asset
  • Ability to follow instructions from team lead and plant manager
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those candidates who fit the requirements of the role will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Labourer
description:
Steel River Solutions is seeking Labourers for a potential upcoming pipeline integrity project in Kamloops, BC.  

The Labourer is responsible for a wide range of general construction activities.

Key Job Duties:

  • Perform demanding physical work activities and operate hand tools and trucks in a safe manner
  • Assist operators and perform a wide range of tasks at construction sites
  • Active participation in all safety and planning meetings, identification of hazards
  • Load, unload, identify and utilize tools and materials required to perform the various tasks to be executed by the crew
  • Assist with assembling and dismantling of equipment
  • Act as a spotter for trucks and other heavy equipment entering the work area
  • Clean and prepare construction work areas where needed
  • Ensure the appropriate use of Personal Protective Equipment while performing tasks
  • Adhere to all Company policies, plans, standards, and procedures
  • Identify safety risks and hazards, and comply with relevant safety procedures and regulations
  • Other tasks as assigned as deemed appropriate by management

Job Requirements:

Qualifications & Experience:

  • Various safety tickets, certificates and Personal Protective Equipment are required depending on the project and position
  • Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License or government issued photo identification
  • Must successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing
  • High school diploma or equivalent; and/or a combination of education and relevant work experience is an asset
  • Previous construction experience in a labourer position is an asset

Skills & Knowledge:

  • Excellent hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity
  • Knowledge of handling hazardous materials and waste
  • Physically able to perform manual labour for long hours outdoors and in all weather conditions
  • Physically able to handle and lift heavy objects up to 50 pounds
  • Knowledge of workplace safety requirements and procedures
  • Knowledge of the pipeline construction industry
  • Ability to receive instructions and carry out instructions in a safe manner
  • Excellent time management and organization abilities
  • Manual dexterity with the ability to use various hand tools
  • Ability to be reliable and have a strong work ethic
  • Strong communication skills: written and verbal skills, listening skills, proven attention to detail, and ability to develop positive working relationships
  • Ability to work in a growing, dynamic and changing environment
  • Optimistic/collaborative approach and attitude towards work

Working Conditions:

  • Field based.  Applicants must be willing to work long hours outdoors
  • Schedule: 6 days on, 1 day off with 12-hour shifts
  • Anticipated Project Start/End: May 2022 â€“ October 2022

Why Steel River Solutions?

Steel River Solutions offers a diverse range of pipeline and civil construction, maintenance, and management support services to meet the ever-growing demands of the oil and gas construction industry. Services include all the disciplines required to plan, build, execute, and maintain a project from beginning to end. Our focused dedication to completely understand a project allows us to deliver efficient, cost-effective services that also create value for our Indigenous partners.

Our objective is to provide our clients with outstanding service and to be first in class in construction, maintenance, and facilities. Through our alliances, we can provide turnkey project solutions including design, engineering support, and world-class design and construction expertise.

The Steel River team is equipped with substantial experience and has worked on small to large diameter pipeline and related pipeline projects across Canada. Steel River strives to find innovative solutions that promote health, safety, and environmental sustainability.

Our commitment is to look beyond any one single project, to cultivate opportunities, create long-lasting relationships, and to seek sustainable initiatives that enhance the communities in which we operate.

Follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook for the latest job postings and news.

Steel River Solutions is an equal opportunity employer.  Only selected candidates will be contacted.  Thank you in advance for including us in your career search!

title: Skilled Carpenter
description:
You are a skilled Carpenter with experience to support us on industrial oil & gas projects. You will be an integral part of the team working on the CBR Cogen project. This is a long term construction project that includes replacement of three coke fired boilers with two 400 MegaWatt cogen units. The project is conveniently located right outside of Fort McMurray at Suncor Baseplant.

Essential Responsibilities:
  • Comprehend drawings to prepare layouts including selecting materials, planning sequences and methods of work, and measuring and marking materials to avoid costly mistakes or omissions
  • Understand industrial concrete forming and engineered forming systems to accurately build concrete forms
  • Check completed units to be sure they are level, square, plumb, and the right size, shape, and location
Qualifications:
  • Have a Journeyperson Carpenter Ticket from a recognized provincial training authority
  • Non-ticketed carpenters must provide proof of hours relevant to the industrial carpentry trade.
  • Must successfully complete pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Successful candidates will require CSTS 2020, CSO or BSO
Work Conditions:
  • Project is located in the Fort McMurray AB.
  • Project commenced in July 2021; this is a role with long term potential
  • 14 days on /7 days off schedule, working 10 hours per day
  • Site based camp provided
  • Charter Flights from either Edmonton or Calgary
  • Must be fully vaccinated and provide valid COVID-19 vaccination record for air travel (unless you have a legitimate recognized medical or religious reason for not getting vaccinated), or agree to submit to testing requirements
  • Travel allowance for candidates who qualify
  • Driving to Fort McMurray is an option as there is camp parking available
  • Benefits provided by CLAC

title: Scaffolder - Journeymen and Apprentices
description:
Soogadin Industrial Inc. is hiring Scaffolders - All Levels at CNRL Horizon for a turnaround.

SUMMARY:
A Scaffolders’ duties may vary from site to site, however, the main responsibilities of a Scaffolder are to erect temporary work platforms using steel pipes, support braces and clamps with a high standard of workmanship using a variety of tools. Scaffolders work both indoors and outdoors, year-round in commercial and industrial settings.

This is a fly in/fly out from Edmonton or Calgary, camp position. Shift schedule is 7&7 , turnaround schedule will be 6&1. We are offering attractive Travel Allowance

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • Must have a minimum of one year's previous Scaffolding experience.
  • Valid certification or proof of hours for skill level. 
  • Fall Protection 
  • H2S Alive or Awareness
  • Confined Space
  • OSSA BSO, CSTS-09 or PST
If you  or someone you know might be a god fit, apply within with you resume.

title: Journeyman Carpenter
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

WHAT’S THE JOB?
This is a fulltime, permanent, opportunity at our Cambridge, Ontario facility.  

Join our NRB Modular Solutions team, where our people are driven by a desire to innovate, do social good, and move construction forward. 

As a Journeyman Carpenter, you will be responsible for the construction, erection, installation and repair of structures and components of portable buildings that are made of wood, wood-substitutes, steel and other materials. In this role, you will work Monday through Friday, 40 hours per week.

Wage range is $32 - 40/hour. 

Your work will include:

  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings and specifications.
  • Determine specifications and calculate requirements.
  • Start and complete job according to drawings and within the allotted time frame.
  • Measure, cut, shape, assemble and join moldings, wood materials, drywall and plastic materials.
  • Fit and install windows, doors, stairs, moldings and hardware.
  • Instruct apprentices and carpenter’s helpers/labourers as required.
  • These tasks require work with the following tools: sawzall, skill saw, chop saw, table saw, radial arm saw, drills, drill press and air tools.
  • Complete daily Job Hazards Assessments and Pre-Job Task Hazard Analysis forms.
  • Abide by all safety rules & procedures.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Extended health and dental benefits, HCSA, RRSP matching plan, Wellness program, EAP 
  • Award winning safety culture.
  • Work indoors year-round.
  • Whereas other companies are downsizing, we are growing!
  • Be #1 on day 1 by joining an industry leader.

Follow NRB Modular Solutions on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Education background equivalent to high school is required.
  • Knowledge of the construction/manufacturing industry is required.
  • Must have complete the C of Q for Carpentry.
  • 5 years of related knowledge and experience in the carpentry trade.
  • Able to operate all hand and power tools required to perform tasks specific to trade.
  • Perform heavy manual labor, including bending, stooping, reaching, carrying and lifting heavy objects weighing up to 45 lbs.
  • Requires manual dexterity of both hands and feet to perform activities such as lifting overhead, twisting and bending while lifting, climbing ladders and stairs while wearing protective equipment.
  • Able to manage fluctuating workload and set priorities to meeti deadlines.
  • Able to work independantly and as part of a team.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

NOTE:  all candidates must be fully vaccinated against Covid-19.



Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.

title: Carpenter Apprentices - Belle River, ON
description:
We are helping North America Construction (1993) Ltd., - NAC Constructors Ltd. (NAC) find caprenter apprenctices in the Belle River area! 

NAC is Canada’s leading multi-trade builder and provides true Master Builder services to the civil, municipal and energy biofuel marketplaces. The depth of our resources is evident in the variety of projects we construct. From water filtration to wastewater treatment; dams to ethanol; we build it all…and more! The contagious energy and excitement within NAC creates a variety of rewarding and challenging opportunities for individuals to achieve their goals.

NAC is currently seeking Carpenter Apprentices (level 3 & 4) to join our Denis St. Pierre Water Pollution Control Plant Expansion Project located in Belle River, ON.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

 

Position Description

 

  • Assist Carpenters with daily tasks and duties contributing to on-site day-to-day operations
  • Assist in the assembly and erection of forms for concrete, wood and metal frame construction and use plans and instruments to prepare for excavating and shoring
  • Participate in Tool Box Talks daily and communicate any safety concerns
  • Maintain a clean, safe work environment, and comply with all Health & Safety regulations
  • Operate and maintain carpentry tools and equipment
  • Keep a daily log of tasks
  • Respect and respond to direction given
  • Handle and transport job materials to the work area as needed
  • Advise Journeypersons/Forepersons of any variances to schedule and/or material issues
  • Perform other related duties, including minor duties of other trades where certification is not required and the work does not exceed own limitations
  • Understand and comply with all company policies and procedures

 

Qualifications and Requirements

  • 1-3 years’ experience working in the construction industry
  • Experience using advanced formwork systems (LOGO or Peri preferred)
  • Knowledge of concrete pouring experience
  • Flat concrete finishing experience is an asset
  • Experience on 7 meter high walls is an asset
  • Experience working with circular formwork tanks is an asset
  • Knowledge of workplace safety and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Ability to operate carpentry tools and required equipment in a safe and responsible manner
  • Ability to read building specifications, prints and as-builds
  • Proactive in ensuring job knowledge is current
  • Respect diversity - treat others with respect
  • Valid WHMIS, Health and Safety Awareness Training for Workers and Working at Heights/Fall Arrest certificates are required.

BENEFITS:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Opportunities for career growth, development and advancement, including financial assistance
  • Comprehensive benefit plan (dental, vision, health, etc.)
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program
  • Excellent company matched pension plan
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plans
  • Additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day
  • Community involvement opportunities
  • Friendly working environment
  • Numerous team activities and various company events

How to apply:

Click on the link to complete an online application AND assessment: http://www.supportontarioyouth.ca/apprenticeships/

  1. Attach a detailed cover letter and resume.

We will ONLY be in touch with candidates who qualify for the positions.  We wish all applicants success.

title: Carpenter's Helper
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

Job Description

WHAT’S THE JOB?
Join our NRB Modular Solutions team, where our people are driven by a desire to innovate, do social good, and move construction forward.

As a Carpenter’s Helper, reporting to the Production Supervisor, you will assist tradespersons in the construction of modular structures made of wood, wood substitutes, steel and other materials. Standard hours for work are Monday through Friday, 8 hours per day.

Your work will include:

  • Assembly of basic carpentry elements, with supervision.
  • Assisting tradesmen and in the construction of modular buildings.
  • Interior and exterior finishes.
  • Framing in both wood and steel construction.
  • Installation of windows, doors and fitments.
  • Working at heights where required.
  • Adherance to all HSE policies and procedures.

  Starting Rate for this position is $21.00/hour.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Extended health and dental benefits that are fully covered.
  • Opportunity to learn under experienced carpenters.
  • Opportunities of carpentry apprenticeships.
  • Award winning safety culture.
  • Work indoors year-round.
  • Whereas other companies are downsizing, we are growing!
  • Be #1 on day 1 by joining an industry leader.

Follow NRB Modular Solutions on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Work requires some knowledge of the construction/ manufacturing industry.
  • Minimum of 1 year of basic carpentry experience and/or experience working on construction sites.
  • Able to operate all hand and power tools required to perform tasks specific to the carpentry trade.
  • Need to be familiar with building materials.

 

  • All candidates must be fully vaccinated against Covid-19, 


Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors.

title: Scaffolder
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is actively recruiting Scaffolder - Adhoc for offshore Newfoundland and Labrador  

 

This position will require you to travel to offshore Newfoundland and Labrador via helicopter or supply vessel. Individuals

must be comfortable working in remote locations, confined spaces, and at heights.

 

Responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to:                                        

  • Erect and dismantle scaffolds in accordance with Scaffold Operating Procedure.
  • Monitor scaffold materials and highlight any overages / shortages to Offshore Scaffold Lead.
  • Ensure that all equipment is fit for purpose condition prior to use and quarantine any defective materials.
  • Execute scaffold inspections as per Scaffold Operating Procedure.
  • Ensure that documentation is maintained in accordance to Scaffold Operating Procedure.
  • Must be conversant with all relevant standards, specifications, rules, regulations etc. including Permit to Work (PTW).

Ensure work is executed in accordance to agree guidance documents (i.e. work packs, work instructions, procedures and governing specifications).

 

Skills / Qualifications (Text Only):Candidates should possess the following qualifications:- Must have successfully completed a scaffolding training program from a recognized training institution and deemed to meet the requirements of â€œCompetent Scaffold Erectionâ€ and â€œAdvanced Scaffold Erectionâ€ as per CAPP guidelines.- Must have a thorough understanding of the applicable construction procedures and regulations related to the erection of scaffolds (i.e. CSA Z797 â€œCode of Practice for Access Scaffoldingâ€). - Must maintain scaffold certification in accordance to CAPP Guidelines. - Experience in an industrial maintenance environment (preferably in the offshore or petro-chemical / refinery industry). - Familiar with various types of scaffold materials (i.e. system scaffold, tubeâ€“andâ€“clamp). - Any equivalent combination of experience and / or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved may also be considered.                                                              For this position, the following training/certifications would be considered and asset: - Basic Survival Training (BST) including HUET and HUEBA. - Hydrogen Sulphide (H2S) Alive. - Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS 2015). - Offshore Safety Regulatory Awareness.- Fall Protection.- Confined Space Entry.- Emergency First Aid.Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Labourer
description:
JOURNALIERS POSTES DISPONIBLES DÈS MAINTENANT!
Prim d'embauche $1000
 
Êtes-vous prêt à travailler avec une équipe dédiée à la sécurité et à la croissance de ces employés? Triumvirate Environmental ne fait pas que promettre des opportunités de croissance, nous les créons par la formation et le mentorat des employés. Joignez-vous à une équipe aussi dévouée à votre carrière que vous l'êtes!  
Triumvirate Environmental est l'une des plus grandes entreprises de services environnementaux en Amérique du Nord. Triumvirate offre des services et des conseils diversifiés pour aider à gérer la conformité des institutions de premier plan des secteurs de l'enseignement supérieur, des sciences de la vie, des soins de santé et des secteurs industriels. Chez Triumvirate, nous nous efforçons d'épater nos employés et nos clients. Notre culture unique favorise la croissance, le développement, l'éducation et la créativité.
 
 Responsabilités et les tâches essentielles:
  • Le déchargement et le chargement des camions.
  • Préparation des déchets et des documents; révision de la réglementation et de la sécurité.
  • Gestion de l'inventaire des déchets .
  • Apprendre et appliquer une connaissance de base des pratiques de travail quotidiennes.
  • Se familiariser avec les directives d'emballage et le choix des installations d'élimination.
  • Développer une compréhension des réglementations SIMDUT, des pratiques de santé et de sécurité de Triumvirate, et des réglementations TMD.
  • Communiquer efficacement avec les autres employés pour résoudre des problèmes complexes.
  • Développer le respect et les relations de travail avec ses collègues.
  • Démontrer sa capacité à être créatif et à résoudre des problèmes uniques.
  • Attitude positive!
  • Épater les clients internes et externes!
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe.
  • Suivre une formation sur les chariots élévateurs à fourche et être capable d'utiliser la machinerie en toute sécurité.
 
Qualifications requises:
  • Diplôme d'études secondaires.
  • Connaissance de base ou le désir d'aquérir des connaissances dans le domaine des déchets dangereux.
  • Passer un test d'ajustement pour un respirateur et être à l'aise pour porter un respirateur pendant plusieurs heures par semaine.
  • Permis de conduire valide.
 
Les exigences énumérées ci-dessus sont représentatives des connaissances, des compétences et/ou des aptitudes requises.  Une formation sera donnée sur place.

title: Carpenter
description:
The Carpenter is responsible for constructing and maintaining buildings. This includes building items such as furniture and stairs, making repairs to the internal and external structure and ensuring buildings are safe. This position is based out of the Bonnyville / Cold Lake area.

Knowledge of commercial construction and remodelling trades, practices, procedures, techniques, tools and equipment, materials, specifications, quality control, cost control, and safety. The Carpenter must be proficient at the following tasks: stain-grade trim work, hang doors, drill and set door hardware, set windows, layout for stairs and common rafters, read blueprints, utilize appropriate math skills, able to read blueprints, and must possess mathematical skills and analytical skills necessary to do material estimates. 

Job Duties:

-Lay building foundations
-Prepare for framing for cement
-Mix and pour cement
-Create cement form
-Pour cement for stairs
-Frame the building including doors and windows
-Put up siding
-Put up drywall
-Finish the building and ceiling
-Put in flooring
-Finish the roofing
-Put in porches and grounds
-Put up scaffolding
-Build required items including specialty furniture
-Build stairs and other items
-Build other items as required
-Operate and maintain carpentry tools and equipment
-Assist with the delivery of other related municipal services
-Respect and respond to direction given by lead-hand(s)
-Contribute and participate in the effective use of the Quality Control System
-Construct and maintain structural woodwork, shelving, flooring, tables, chairs etc.
-Perform drywall, boarding, taping and sanding
-Build and install cupboards, bookcases, tack boards etc.
-Repair furniture
-Ensure an adequate supply of material is available for preventative maintenance program
-Perform other related duties, including minor duties of other trades where certification is not required and the work does not exceed own limitations
-Understand and comply with all Policies and Procedures

GENMEC ACL offers a challenging and rewarding work environment that is built on mutual respect and our core values of quality, integrity, and community. We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits plan.

Thank you to all candidates that apply. We thank everyone for their interest; however, only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

title: Carpenter (FT)
description:
As a Carpenter, you will be responsible for reading blueprints and working with lumber, plywood, wallboard, and other materials to help within the scope of our Building Envelope projects. You may build and repair wooden structures and use a variety of tools such as hammers, power saws, tape measures, drills, etc. depending on the needs of our Building Envelope project.

With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team! 

Responsibilities:
  • Installing wooden structures such as roofing frames, rafters, partitions, joists, and stud work
  • Selecting lumber by size and strength to suit each job, sourcing wood to suit the customer’s budget and style
  • Calculating the number of fasteners required for each job
  • Reading blueprints and designs to work to specifications prepared by other construction professionals, architects, and building code recommendations
  • Liaising with clients, suppliers, and other construction professionals
  • Other duties assigned.

Requirements:
  • At least 2 to 3 years of experience as a Carpenter or equivalent.
  • A certificate in the relevant area is preferred.
  • Experience in using hand and power tools such as drills, chisels, sanders, saws, and nail guns.
  • Commitment to the job site safety and project quality
  • Understanding of construction procedures, equipment, and Safety Guidelines
  • Excellent organizational and execution skills
  • Experience using construction machinery is an asset

Benefits:   
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, stable work-life balance, positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more! 
 
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment. 




About New City Contracting Ltd.:

Over 20 years ago, Edward Buset — New City’s founder and president — saw that the Lower Mainland was missing something: a resource for property managers, homeowner associations (HOAs), engineers, and other professionals involved in the building renewal business. Edward envisioned this resource that will work on new builds or maintain existing buildings, one that will develop cost-effective plans for the renewal of all types of buildings in our area’s unique climate. From this vision rose today’s New City, one of Vancouver’s leading general contractors. With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. We know what needs to be done, when it needs to be done, and how to get it done — in the most beneficial way for the building. Whether its envelope renewal, deep renovation, concrete restoration, or other building envelope management concerns, New City has the expertise and resources to handle the largest and most complex work smoothly and efficiently. Today, New City Contracting is a trusted leader in envelope renewal for commercial and residential projects. New City is an expert in the investigation, analysis, and repair of building envelopes — for all material types and vintages. Our extensive building renewal services include: Building Envelope RenewalExterior and Interior PaintingRoof Renewal and ReplacementTenant ImprovementWaterproofingExterior and Industrial CleaningEnvironmental AbatementConcrete Restoration

title: Skilled Carpenters!
description:
We are in need of skilled carpenters!

Salary: Hourly: Min. $36.00 to $40.00 for 45.00 hours per week

Anticipated start date: March/April 2022

Terms of Employment: Permanent Full-Time

Number of positions: 2

Employment Conditions: Day

Employer: Landscapes By Lucin

Web site: www.lucin.net

Languages: English

Education: Completion of High School; some college/CGEP/vocational or technical training

Credentials (certificates, licenses, memberships, courses, etc.)

3rd period Apprentice, WHMIS Certificate

Experience: 2 years to less than 3 years

Major Work Area: Construction; Maintenance/Repair; Renovations

Type of Establishment/Work Setting Experience: Residential

Area of Specialization:

General carpentry, rough carpentry, finish carpentry, framing, form work, custom stairs, exterior siding, landscape carpentry, fences, decks, pergolas, arbours, custom screens, gazebos, belvederes, and other outdoor structures.

Specific Skills:

Determining specifications and calculating material needs, preparing site layouts, meausuring, cutting, shaping, assembling, joining mouldings, wood materials, fitting header boards, building porches, stringers, railings, stairs, and having full knowledge of all necessary power tools.

Additional skills:

Reading and interpreting blueprints, drawings and specifications, estimating labour and material costs, owning personal tools/equipment, safety gear, personal protective equipment.

Work Site Environment:

Outdoors, ladder work, noisy with possible dusty conditions, must have valid and clean "G" license with personal vehicle at all times.

title: General Labourer - Night shift ($24/h & $600 signing bonus)
description:
Company Description

The launch of our production season 2022 has several surprises in store for you!!

Hurry now is the time to initiate a new career!!  First hires will be eligible to receive $600 sign on bonuses and be eligible to participate in several draws with a value of up to $500, including tickets to the Montreal Canadiens and gift cards!

No experience required. We are searching for bright, hard-working and reliable individuals interested in a successful career in manufacturing. Take your chance and come join us!

Here is why you must join Techo-Bloc:

  • Competitive salary
  • Shift Premiums available
  • End of year Bonus 
  • Overtime opportunities 
  • Several shift options available (day, evening, weekend)
  • Refer a friend for a competitive referral bonus
  • Weekly pay
  • RRSP Program available in 2022
  • Group insurance plan after 3 months of service for permanent employees
  • Career path opportunities – move to production, distribution, maintenance, transportation or supervisory roles

Shift offered:

  • Monday - Friday 5h30PM to 3h30AM
Job Description

Snapshot of your day to day

Are you a diligent worker that loves to work with your hands and you are looking for a stimulating and well-paid job? This is the right place for you!

At Techo-Bloc, our general laborers are a crucial part to our day to day operations. This role is a perfect fit for those newer to the industry, or anyone looking for a career steppingstone in manufacturing. 

Speaking of stones, our laborers are true concrete connoisseurs!  Your day-to-day will entail handling and inspecting concrete blocks, while serving as the ‘right hand’ to our machine operator and maintenance team.

  • Complete examination of finished product by checking height, shape, color and consistency by applying knowledge of proper company standards as instructed and applicable for in process systems;
  • Complete block checks, remove any defective pieces from pallet or board and replace defective pieces with quality pieces. These tasks vary by line and by product and process that the General Labourer is assigned to;
  • Sort, pack, crate and package materials and products;
  • Performs other laboring and elemental activities;
  • Clean machines and immediate work areas.
Qualifications

  • No experience required, training will be provided;
  • You will be using your manual skills. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds (23kg). We won’t hide it from you, this is a physically demanding position;
  • Manual dexterity, hand-eye co-ordination and a combination of sitting, standing and walking required;
  • Punctuality, concentration and thoroughness;
  • Team spirit and collaboration.


Additional Information

Interested? Here is how you can apply:

  • Apply online right here
  • Apply by phone to this number: 1 877-832-4625 ext. 2
  • If you prefer, you can drop by with your resume at our Chambly Plant (7800 Rue Samuel-Hatt, Chambly, QC J3L 6W4)

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have. We look forward to meeting you!

Other benefits we offer:

  • Employee discounts on Techo-Bloc’s products
  • On-site training and additional courses available such as forklift certification (if it`s a work requirement)
  • Awesome uniforms and swag
  • Newly renovated plant kitchens and bathrooms in St-Hubert plants
  • Free Parking
  • Epic barbecues and Christmas parties
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP available 24/7)

Additional information

Headquartered on the South Shore of Montreal, Techo-Bloc is a leader in outdoor landscape products. We passionately create new products to allow all design enthusiasts to transform ordinary spaces into exceptional spaces.

Why work for Techo-Bloc, you may ask? We listen and respect our employees and encourage them to make an impact. We love talent and people who are ready to roll up their sleeves to get the job done. If you're looking to put your knowledge, experience and passion into play, this is the place for you. We celebrate change, welcome your bold initiatives, and support you in bringing them to life. Our company has grown rapidly and this is just the beginning. Come join one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies and make this your next big move. You will not be disappointed!

COVID-19 considerations

The health and safety of our employees is important to us. To keep our staff safe, we've implemented safety guidelines in line with prevalent Quebec laws and regulations.

 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: General Labour - Mixing Morning Shift-1307
description:
Are you a â€œfoodieâ€ and love cookies, muffins and pancakes?  Are you are looking for a company where we place high value on teamwork, collaboration, innovation?  Are you looking to gain experience and grow your career with a successful international company?

If you are looking to do the best work of your career, be a part of an extraordinary company and have a passion for what we do, we want to hear from you!

Cerelia Bakery Canada is currently looking to add some awesome new team members to our facility in Mississauga, ON. You will be a critical part of delivering our products to customers everywhere!

About Cerelia Bakery Canada:

We develop and produce exceptionally high-quality products including: Fresh & frozen cookie dough and muffin batter in pre-portion sizes and scoop and bake pails for the foodservice industry as well as in-store bakeries of North American grocery, mass and club stores.

Our baked gourmet cookies and muffins are produced for distribution through multiple channels, including quick service restaurants. Refrigerated products including cookie, pastry and biscuit dough sold to North American Grocery Stores in a variety of formats including canister, chub, break-and-bake and place-and-bake.

Our Research and Development is on-going, aimed at introducing new and exciting products to complement our delectable bakery lines. We are an aggressive, flexible company dedicated to providing quality products that satisfy customer needs and market place demands.

Most importantly, we are GROWING.  As we grow, our team members grow with us.  

About this Position:

The Mixer is responsible in ensuring seamless processing of product mixes/dough. The Mixer understands the impact of this position as it directly effects the whole process of our products being made as it is one the first and most important steps in the plant. The Mixer must ensure seamless processing of products. Responsible for the maintenance of prescribed quantity and quality of dough produced and operation of the mixer machine. The Mixer must be prepared to work as a team member and with minimal supervision, follow all safety and food safety procedures, and have a high threshold for heat in a manufacturing environment. 

Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

  • Follow the mixing schedule as required and laid out by the Production Supervisor.
  • Gather, measure, and mix dough ingredients per the quality guidelines using our dedicated mixing machine to be transferred into our dough cutter.
  • Transport dough buggies from one location to the other whenever required.
  • Float from one production station to another effortlessly to ensure product quality standards are maintained.
  • Manage product quality and recipes with other production team members.
  • Ensure our high-quality standards are being met with every batch we produce by checking each batch for quality and accuracy - delivering a world class finished product each time.
  • Support other departments and functions of production as required.
  • Assist sanitation with the cleanliness of production equipment and floor.
  • Adhering to all policies, procedures and programs of the company (GMP, Quality, Food Safety and Health & Safety etc) at all times.
  • Other related duties and assigned.

Working Conditions:

  • Weekend work required
  • Overtime as required
  • Ability to lift at least 50 lbs
  • Fast paced environment
  • Physical Demands: Bend, Carry, Lift, Push/Pull, Reach, Standing for long periods
  • Ability to work in a hot/cold environment. 
  • Shift 6:00 am to 2:30 pm 
  • Hourly Wage CAD 17/Guaranteed Overtime 

What you will receive in return:

  • Competitive Hourly Compensation.
  • Fully Employer Paid Medical Insurance includes Dental & Vision.
  • Life Insurance
  • 2 Weeks Paid Vacation.
  • RRSP
  • Comprehensive training program, tailored to each individual - regardless if you're a food manufacturing veteran or new to the industry, we will ensure you receive the training you need to succeed.
  • Clean and safe production facility.
  • Career advancement opportunities.

Cerelia Bakery welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

If you are eager and excited to work with a company driven by quality, commitment to excellence, and an awesome product, we want to hear from you!

title: Tunneling Labourer BC
description:
We are a growing tunneling contractor based in Calgary, AB that offers its employees exciting opportunities for career growth, a great working environment, and competitive compensation.

The Company: Bothar Inc. specializes in trenchless tunneling technologies, balancing cost-effective drilling solutions with environmental protection. Our trenchless tunneling technology, Direct Pipe, presents unique cost saving and scheduling opportunities for challenging pipeline and municipal projects.

Bothar is respected in the trenchless contracting industry by clients and employees alike, for our integrity, commitment to excellence, and customer orientated service.

Our great team of staff are the best in their field. They are committed to collaboration, quality, and safety. We invest in our people, and they deliver excellence! We believe in leading through innovation and providing superior value and service to our clients and partners by with safe, high quality, and environmentally conscious trenchless solutions.

The Position: As we are expanding our field of operations, we are in need of more motivated and hardworking crew members to join our team. The Labourer position is responsible for assisting in the timely and technical execution of installations, as a part of the operations team on project sites. 

Labourers will have the opportunity to work with equipment used in Micro Tunneling, Horizontal Direction Drilling (HDD), Auger Boring, and Direct Pipe trenchless installations. 

Opportunities are currently available at various project locations across BC and Alberta. 

Compensation includes:

  •    Equitable pay based on experience
  •    Applicable overtime
  •    Living out allowance or paid accommodations
  •    Travel expense coverage

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  •  Maintain cleanliness / organization / stock of parts container and tool container
  •  Remove/Install cables on spools during de mob / mob.
  •  Efficiently pull and install tunneling utility lines (electrical cables, slurry lines, hydraulics)
  •  Effectively connect / install victaulic clamps and hydraulic connections
  •  Rig, hoist, and direct lifting equipment
  •  Load and unload trucks
  •  Maintain, clean, and refurbish equipment
  •  Effectively pack and secure pallets / boxes / cages
  •  Connect internal and external brackets for utility lines
  •  Inspect, connect, and install airlines
  •  Apply condat grease on machine connections
  •  Fill out required paperwork, such as Field Level Hazard Assessments, HID cards.
  •  Knowledge & ability to operate air compressor, pumps, arial lift, generators etc.

Technical Skills and Knowledge

  •  Basic mechanical/electrical skills
  •  Operate power / hand tools safely and with skill
  •  The ability to determine the necessary tools for assigned tasks
  •  The ability to troubleshoot a problem based on experience and applicable trade knowledge
  •  Good work ethic, ability to work long hours (12-hour shift work)
  •  Able to work in confined spaces
  •  Clearly spot vehicles and equipment, and communicate using basic hand signals
  •  Understand use of and clearly communicate on two-way radios.
  •  Identify lifting points on equipment, able to safely rig equipment / pipe for lifting
  •  Previous experience in tunneling, general construction, or oil field work
  •  Contribute to a safe working environment
  • Travel may be required subject to project locations

Successful candidates will be required to have the following safety tickets ( training is available);

  • WHIMIS, First Aid, CSTS or PCST, Confined Space Entry and Rescue, Fall Arrest / Fall Protection
  • Drug and Alcohol clearance

Other Relevant Information        

    • Travel is required in this position. 
    • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and walk; use hands and fingers to handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; talk, and hear.
    • Frequently required to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
    • Distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus
    • Employee will be required to work in outdoor weather conditions, including extreme cold and heat
    • Required to work in confined spaces (42-inch or 46-inch pipe)
    • Covid 19 Vaccination Required


    Bothar is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to providing an equitable, diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees, whatever their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation or identity, education, and/or disability, feel valued and respected. 

    While we appreciate all applications, only those who are selected will be contacted.

title: General Labour
description:
Location : Hamilton ON 

City : Hamilton 

State : Ontario (CA-ON) 

Country : Canada (CA) 

Requisition Number : 20682 

Position Summary:

This position involves various shift arrangements and the incumbents must be flexible to accommodate the frequently changing shift arrangements.  Shifts can be day shift, Monday to Friday 0700 hours to 1530 hours. However the incumbents will frequently be required to fill in on twelve hour rotating shifts as a spare person on shift.  Shift schedules and job assignments for this position are arranged by the Material Handling Supervisor in accordance with the business requirements for the various plant areas.  The position requires a conscientious person in the areas of operational procedures, quality control, GMP, reporting, safety and housekeeping and customer service.  This area of responsibility requires a person whom can work flexible schedules, on relatively short notice, as directed by the needs of the business.

This position will start out doing general housekeeping type work in the plant.

 

 

Core Functions:

  • Totally responsible for any area of operations assigned to during all hours of work to which assigned on a particular shift or week.
  • Compliance with any Work Instruction – Operational Procedures
  • Maintaining the safe and efficient use of all equipment, ensuring only the equipment that needs to run is operating and in good order
  • Maintaining Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) at all times
  • Safely and efficiently operating the Locomotive Switch Engine and Trackmobile as required.
  • Safely and efficiently operating the plant Bob Cat and Case Skid Steer as required.
  • Safely and efficiently operating the plant forklift as required.
  • Safely and efficiently operating the rail car tugger as required.
  • Maintaining a stock of sufficient cleaning supplies and equipment in the stockroom.
  • Maintaining a stock of sufficient safety supplies in the stockroom, and distributing the same to various plant storage areas.
  • Cleaning up of plant grounds and perimeter areas as required and directed by Supervision.
  • Loading of meal and hulls products and unloading of incoming beans and seed rail cars, trucks and vessels (ships) as required.
  • Completing the proper paperwork for all loads received and loaded.  As these loads are shipped and received in bulk, the incumbents are responsible for the accurate operation of truck and rail bulk weighing scales and accurately recording of the weights received or shipped, as the case may be.
  • Basic computer and keyboard skills sufficient to accurately use the plant OneWeigh and System 2000 programs. 
  • Maintaining Safety Standards in all areas of the operation
  • Maintain and clean all areas of the operations at all times. Will also be responsible for cleaning in any other area of the plant as required by Supervision.
  • Maintaining personal hygiene, cleanliness and appearance including compliance with Bunge Hamilton dress code as, at times, this person will be dealing directly with our customers.
  • Must comply with Bunge Safety Policy E-3 Respiratory Equipment.  The incumbent must be and remain sufficiently free of facial hair so as to guarantee the necessary proper fitting of respirator equipment at all times while on site and be willing to undergo periodic fit testing as required by the policy.
  • The ability to wear and use proper fall restraint apparatus when working at heights.
  • Provide written reports of Operational/Equipment problems and discrepancies to the Supervisor, utilizing the “Employee Departmental Report” form, and following the “Operator Protocol for Calling the On-call Supervisor” and the Company Call-In Procedures when necessary.  Work orders to be processed through the direct report unless priority #1 during off hours.
  • Provide accurate written reports on any Incidents, Accidents, Fire or Spills as necessary, utilizing the “Employee Departmental Report” form.
  • Complying with all Bunge Corporate and Hamilton policies, including Safe Work Practices, Emergency Measures Plan, Hourly Employee’s Handbook, and the Health and Safety Act of Ontario.  Maintaining Safety Standards in all areas of work.
  • Reporting on small inventories needed for the area of operations
  • Call in to the Boiler Room Operator at 3:00 am for attendance check-in when on shift.
  • Must complete any other tasks required to run a safe and efficient operation or as requested by the Company

 

Skill/Experience Requirements:

  • Grade 12 education required, technical college diploma preferred.
  • Good mechanical aptitude.
  • Good computer / keyboard skills
  • Able to consistently lift up to 22.7 kg.
  • Must be able to work from heights and in confined spaces.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both oral and written

 

 

Bunge Canada – Hamilton is a tenant of the Hamilton-Oshawa Port Authority (federal property), Transport Canada requires us to require that all of our employees be vaccinated in order to be on-site.  As a condition of your employment, you must be fully vaccinated with a government-approved type of COVID-19 vaccine and provide proof of vaccination. 

 

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

 

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status.  Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

title: Drywaller / Carpenter
description:
Reports To: Operations Manager

"A mind built for excellence. A spirit built for service."
 What does a Carpenter / Drywaller with Paul Davis do?
  • Serve others within your community in their time of need
  • Make a difference for others that have had a disaster strike their property
  • Work hard and take pride in completing projects 
  • Be empathetic and show a sense of urgency. 
Why Join The Team? Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and commercial properties throughout the United States and Canada. We are growing locally and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We love creating an opportunity for our team members, providing industry training, and giving technicians the opportunity to become experts in the field of restoration.

Values: Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.Vision: To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.Mission: To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results.
 
 Why The Team Needs You? Serving others after a disaster has struck their property is not easy. Everyone within Paul Davis needs to have a world-class work ethic, serious attention to detail and love to help people. It is challenging to make customers happy when faced with a traumatic event but you enjoy helping them get back to their lives through your skill. Team Compensation and Benefits:
  • Leadership Development - our company grows from the inside. If you are determined and motivated enough, ask about participation in our leadership development initiative to grow your career and explore new opportunities
  • Cross-training opportunities to advance your career
  • Flex schedule - at Paul Davis we are committed to our team and their well-being. We have instituted the ability for flex hours that ensures team members get the time they need for personal matters while still being able to work full time.
  • Paid training
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Great culture and team dynamic
  • Hourly pay is based on experience and certifications
 Team Qualifications (Requirements):
  • Desire to join a world-class team and contribute a positive attitude
  • Dedication to customer service
  • Valid driver's license with a clean record
  • Have the ability to work on rotation with an on-call schedule for emergencies
  • Ability to lift 75 LBS frequently
  • Desire to continually learn new things
 Role on the Team (Job Responsibilities):
  • High-level performance of drywall, texture, and paint repairs
  • Carpentry - framing, cabinetry, roof construction, decks, and fences.
  • Focus and dedication to providing excellent customer service.
  • Maintain a clean, properly stocked, and organized truck and maintain all company equipment.
  • Be accessible by phone and participate, as necessary, in the on-call schedule as emergencies occur
  • Assist in warehousing and facility-related tasks when necessary.
  • You will assist other team members as you see opportunities arise and be a leader for the team when needed.
 Please apply if you think you have what it takes to serve others and deliver a world-class service when others need it the most. We are looking forward to discussing this opportunity with you.We support and hire Veterans and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!

title: Labourers - Ontario
description:
The Nuna Group of Companies is now accepting resumes for Labourers with large earthworks and construction projects experience.
 
Nuna is the largest Inuit-owned heavy civil construction, earthworks and mine construction contractor in Canada.  
 
We offer: 
  • 2 week on / 2 week off rotations; 12 hour days
  • Competitive hourly rate with Overtime pay (1.5x),
  • Employee recognition/ rewards program,
  • Commercial flights and accommodations are covered,
  • Long-term employment opportunities
This position is located on our project site located in the Northern Ontario, Timmins / Gogama

PLEASE NOTE: Only candidates from Ontario will be considered for this role.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Load and unload construction materials
  • Working around heavy equipment
  • Assist heavy equipment operators; spotting of trucks and other heavy equipment
  • Manual labor including shoveling, sweeping, raking
  • Working in remote locations in a camp setting
  • Previous Dewatering experience


QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs on a regular basis
  • Must hold a valid Driver's License
  • Must be 18+ years old
  • Must be willing to work outdoors and in various weather conditions
  • Willing and capable of committing to a 2x2 rotation,
  • Surface Miner CORE an asset. (Please submit copy with your resume).

Candidates will have to be Covid Vaccinated to gain site access and to fly. Covid-19 testing will be conducted on site.
 
How to Apply:
Applicants are asked to apply online at http://nunalogistics.com/jobs.html or by email: hr@nunalogistics.com
 
Nuna is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.   
We thank all who apply but only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
 
Nuna is a highly regarded civil construction company with hundreds of employees working across the Arctic and Northern Canada. Working often in remote locations, Nuna offers unique on-the-job experience and opportunity to build an exciting career. Our multi-disciplined teams provide a comprehensive array of services and innovative solutions to the most challenging and remote sites in northern Canada. Nuna's core values of: Safety - Integrity - Teamwork - Respect for Cultural Diversity and for Community & Environment; reflect our reputation as a safe, cost-effective and innovative operator in the north.

title: Landscape Construction Labourer
description:
BOFFO LANDSCAPING INC.

Boffo Landscaping Inc. is a family-owned and operated landscape maintenance, construction, and snow & ice control service operation.  Established in 1996, Boffo Landscaping is now a leader in the landscape industry throughout the GTA.  Boffo has been a proud and valued member of Landscape Ontario since inception and Boffo will continue to provide exceptional services for years to come.  Boffo is currently seeking high quality, highly motivated and experienced individuals who are willing to join our Landscape Maintenance Team as a full-time position.

 



LANDSCAPING & CONSTRUCTION PROFESSIONAL

 

DEPARTMENT:                      Landscaping & Construction

 

COMMENCEMENT:                        Spring 2022   

(** Immediate positions available **)

 

SUMMARY:  Boffo Landscaping Inc. is looking for hard working, punctual, dependable and motivated individuals with an excellent work ethic.  Candidates should have a minimum of 1 year landscaping/construction experience (with flexibility for increased training).  This position is "full-time" seasonal with the potential for year-round employment & an opportunity for future growth and advancement in this field.     

 



REQUIREMENTS, FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Perform all aspects of the company's "Landscaping & Construction" Operations including: tree and shrub planting, grading, sod work, interlocking, retaining walls, natural stone work, soil/mulch installation, etc.
  • Should have knowledge, experience and capability in using various tools, equipment, and machines required for landscape construction work (for example, skid steer, backhoe, mini excavator, plate tampers, concrete saw, etc.).
  • Knowledge and hands-on competence of various plant material, aggregates, and other landscape construction materials and supplies required for project work (is an asset).
  • Perform both small and large scale landscape construction enhancements/improvements as assigned to crew unit. Ensure efficient completion of work in the allotted timeframe for each project in conjunction with Crew Foreman. 
  • Continually deliver a high standard of work and productivity with field work operations. Demonstrate good interpersonal skills and respect for customers, suppliers, and co-workers.  Effectively and safely operate crew trucks & tandem trailers, crew equipment, and machines.  Ensure safe use and operation of all equipment and machines.   
  • Must be a "team player" dedicated to achieving both crew and company goals. Perform other related duties, as assigned, that are in accordance with job responsibilities or necessary department and corporate objectives.  Must arrive to work in a timely fashion and in uniform.
  • Learn, uphold, understand, and respect the rules and regulations as outlined in the company's "Corporate Policy Manual" and "Safety Manual". Manage and enforce all safety policies and procedures.
  • Must have a high school diploma and possess minimum 1 year experience in landscaping/construction. Candidates should have a valid "G" license and a clean driving record and reliable transportation to and from work.

 

**** Opportunity for full-time, year-round employment will be available for successful candidates ****

**** $25.00-$35.00/hr depending on qualifications****

 

 

SUBMIT RESUME & CONTACT:

Boffo Landscaping Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Please submit your resume:

 

* Office:  905-832-3850                                                  Address: 12000 Keele Street, Maple, ON

* Email: careers@boffolandscaping.com                                     L6A 1S1                    

 

Note:  We would like to thank (in advance) all applicants for their resume submittal and interest; however, we will only be contacting those candidates who are selected for an interview.
