title: Construction Labourer (FT)
description:
We are searching for a dependable Construction Laborer to join our excellent construction crew. The Skilled Laborer's responsibilities include ensuring worksites are clean and safe, a demo of windows, and torched on roofing, spreading gravel, using drills, saws, and other power tools, and providing assistance with heavy machinery. You should also be able to take instruction from superiors and complete on-the-job training. To be successful as a Skilled Laborer, you will have completed apprenticeships and acquired suitable skills. An outstanding Skilled Laborer should be hungry to expand their skill set and increase their level of expertise. You should also be willing to learn from other crew members and receive off-site training wherever possible.

With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team!
Responsibilities:
  • Moving materials to the worksite and ensuring all tools, machinery, and other equipment are safely set up.
  • Operating equipment like drills, saw, shovels, and other heavy machinery.
  • Assisting with various window removal and roofing demo procedures.
  • Obeying health and safety codes, as well as the company's principles.
  • Removing hazardous materials from sites.
  • Driving scissor and boom lifts
  • Performing site and equipment inspections.
  • Attending meetings and workshops.
  • Completing on-the-job training.
  • Ensuring tasks are completed to deadlines.

Requirements:
  • High school diploma or similar.
  • Completed apprenticeships recommended.
  • driver's license recommended.
  • Sound knowledge of construction and practical experience with tools.
  • Excellent time management, organizational, and communication skills.
  • A good understanding of safety procedures.
  • Great hand, eye, and foot coordination.
  • Willingness to learn and be flexible.
  • Positive attitude and great interpersonal skills

Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, stable work life balance, positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!

This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.

title: Scaffolder
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood is actively recruiting Scaffolder - Adhoc for offshore Newfoundland and Labrador 

 

This position will require you to travel to offshore Newfoundland and Labrador via helicopter or supply vessel. Individuals

must be comfortable working in remote locations, confined spaces, and at heights.

 

Responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to:                    

  • Erect and dismantle scaffolds in accordance with Scaffold Operating Procedure.
  • Monitor scaffold materials and highlight any overages / shortages to Offshore Scaffold Lead.
  • Ensure that all equipment is fit for purpose condition prior to use and quarantine any defective materials.
  • Execute scaffold inspections as per Scaffold Operating Procedure.
  • Ensure that documentation is maintained in accordance to Scaffold Operating Procedure.
  • Must be conversant with all relevant standards, specifications, rules, regulations etc. including Permit to Work (PTW).

Ensure work is executed in accordance to agree guidance documents (i.e. work packs, work instructions, procedures and governing specifications).

 

Skills / Qualifications

Candidates should possess the following qualifications:

  • Must have successfully completed a scaffolding training program from a recognized training institution and deemed to meet the requirements of “Competent Scaffold Erection” and “Advanced Scaffold Erection” as per CAPP guidelines.
  • Must have a thorough understanding of the applicable construction procedures and regulations related to the erection of scaffolds (i.e. CSA Z797 “Code of Practice for Access Scaffolding”).
  • Must maintain scaffold certification in accordance to CAPP Guidelines.
  • Experience in an industrial maintenance environment (preferably in the offshore or petro-chemical / refinery industry).
  • Familiar with various types of scaffold materials (i.e. system scaffold, tube–and–clamp).
  • Any equivalent combination of experience and / or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved may also be considered.                                

For this position, the following training/certifications would be considered and asset:

  • Basic Survival Training (BST) including HUET and HUEBA.
  • Hydrogen Sulphide (H2S) Alive.
  • Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS 2015).
  • Offshore Safety Regulatory Awareness.
  • Fall Protection.
  • Confined Space Entry.
  • Emergency First Aid.

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Maintenance
description:
Company Description

We are more than just your local restaurant. We are a collection of hardworking small-business owners.

Did you know that from coast to coast, we serve delicious choices to more than 2.5 million people in over 1,400 locations every day, or that we have proudly helped more than 387,000 Canadian families with sick children through Ronald McDonald House Charities?

 

Job Description

Our offer

Working with us means that you will have the opportunity to earn and learn, flexibility, and a safe and inclusive work environment. What this means in practice is:

·       Access to education and skills development opportunities that take you further

·       A total rewards package that includes discounts, incentives, and recognition perks

·       Flexible hours/shifts that suit your needs

·       A safe, respectful and inclusive workplace

·       Bring your authentic self to work – welcoming people of every age, background, and culture – just like the guests who visit our restaurants every day

The job

We are sure that you have an idea about what working with us is like, but just in case here are some of the highlights on what your job will entail:

·       Maintaining a clean, safe, and secure work environment for guests, coworkers, and yourself, leveraging your knowledge of safety regulations and equipment.

·       Multi-tasking in between troubleshooting, tending to store areas and appliances during your shift, and repairing décor and equipment, whether it’s during the day or throughout the night.

·       Managing priorities, staying organized, and keeping on top of the various tasks with limited supervision.

Your vibe and experience

You are trustworthy and have trust in others. You’re a curious mind. You love to see how things work and are fascinated by the intricacies of objects. You’re good with your hands and mechanically adept. You’re always willing to learn and grow. You remain cool, calm and collected in a fast-paced environment. You’d rather do a job right the first time, than do it twice.

Additional Information

About us

In 1954, an enterprising salesman named Ray Kroc discovered a small burger restaurant in California, and wrote the first page of McDonald’s history. In 1967, the first McDonald’s Canada opened in Richmond, B.C. and we’ve been growing with our communities and serving quality food at great a value ever since. Today, McDonald’s Canada is proud to be one of the world’s leading foodservice retailers, offering job opportunities at corporate-owned restaurants or restaurants owned by independent franchisees.

McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Finishing Carpenter
description:
As a Finishing Carpenter, add the final touch to a carpentry project by trimming, shaping, and installing ornaments and various other wood finishes that improve the appearance of a wooden structure.
With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team!
Location: 844 Fisgard St, Victoria, BC V8W 3M5
Responsibilities:
  • Interior suites wood working on windows frames and trims
  • Preparing wood or structural finishing by shaping and trimming fixtures with the aid of manual or power tools.
  • Take accurate measurement of structures in order to develop suitable plans for wood tailoring.
  • Trimming of moldings to match irregular surfaces.
  • Responsible for the measurement and installation of wooden flooring, and may also provide varnishing and staining services for woodwork.
  • Other duties that may be assigned.
Requirements:
  • At least 2 to 3 years of experience as a Finishing Carpenter or equivalent.
  • Prepare wood structures for finishing by shaping and trimming with hand or power tools
  • Take measurements to develop suitable layout for a fixture
  • Carry out measurement and installation of wooden floorings
  • Provide varnishing and staining service for woodwork
Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, a stable work-life balance, a positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.

title: Labourer (Acheson)
description:
Position Scope:

Reporting to the Brake North American (BNA) Remanufacturing Supervisor, you will ensure the proper deployment of job resources, operating part washer, and helping Bench Hands as directed. The Laborer is instrumental in enabling the department to achieve all established safety, quality, and productivity goals.

 

Schedule is 7x7

Responsibilities:
  • Cleaning parts as required.
  • Operating cranes to move parts and components around shop.
  • Operating fork trucks for moving parts and other items.
  • Keeping the shop and yard clean.
  • Snow removal around shop and front parking lot (seasonal).
  • Interacting with shop employees and becoming a part of a remanufacturing team.
  • Complete shop equipment inspections prior to use.
  • Perform basic preventative maintenance on support equipment as directed by supervisor.
  • Ensure compliance to all company, client and legislated safety policies and procedures.  
  • Using adequate and suitable safety equipment, including PPE.
  • Reviewing safe work plans/ hazard assessment with prior to job commencement.
Qualifications:
  • Warehouse materials handling experience in a distribution setting or similar environment considered an asset.  
  • 6 months experience with various fork-lift(s) battery standup,   propane or fuel type.
  • 6 months experience working in a safety sensitive work place.
  • Industrial construction and/or mining experience preferred.
  • High school diploma
  • Forklift operating certificate
  • Overhead crane operating certificate
  • Able to operate forklift, skid steers, small loaders
  • Must have valid class 5 driver's license
  • Always demonstrate safety
  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check
  • Basic computer literacy/skills.
  • Experience around heavy equipment is an asset
Summary:

All successful candidates must:

  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  2. Have a valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  4. Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  5. Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

 

All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  1. CSO or BSO Certification
  2. Copy of Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Copy of recent Driverâ€™s Abstract
  4. VOID cheque/direct deposit form

Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  1. Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  2. An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  3. After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

 

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

 

Overview:

BNA Remanufacturing is located in Acheson, Alberta, and is a joint venture between North American Construction Group and Brake Supply Heavy Equipment.

 

This dynamic new partnership is designed to provide a cost effective and flexible pricing model for the supply of mining and construction drive train components.

 

BNA Remanufacturing provides a secure, local supply of drive train components to meet equipment production and availability targets. As well as exchanging components, we also provide rebuild and return service options for customer-owned components. All components are rebuilt to the highest exchange specification using OEM reusability guidelines and procedures.

 

BNA Remanufacturing is a trusted partner that you can help you develop product improvements and processes to achieve the most economical cost per equipment operating hour.

 

Learn more today by contacting us at BNA Remanufacturing.

title: General Labourer
description:
Mazenga Building Group Ltd. is a Toronto-based construction management firm established to provide clients with an unmatched level of attention, care, and customized management style. Our team strives to streamline the construction management process to deliver exceptional client satisfaction.

Our office in Toronto, ON is looking for Full Time General Labourers to perform work at sites throughout the Greater Toronto Area

Responsibilities

  • Unload, move and lift materials and equipment throughout the job site
  • Assist in managing traffic in construction areas
  • Housekeeping: general cleaning, moving materials, sweeping to ensure the site is clean and organized
  •  Report to Site Supervisor at start and end of day to receive job tasks and related communications
  • Assist carpenters or other staff members
  •  Under the direction of the Site Supervisor, occasionally perform work using small hand tools
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

  • Ability to perform physically demanding tasks, lifting, bending, walking, standing for long periods of time
  • Excellent Communication skills both verbal and written
  • Time Management skills to adapt to changing requirements and schedules
  • Ability to safely use hand tools and other construction equipment
  • Able to perform tasks with a focus on safety
  • Able to clean and maintain a variety of equipment, including but not limited to small repairs and routine maintenance
  • Valid G Driverâ€™s license and own transportation preferred to travel to different job sites ranging from the West End (Oakville, Brampton, Caledon) as well as downtown Toronto

title: General Labourer
description:
Merchandising Specialist – Flowers and Plants

About the Position

Brand Momentum is looking for two General Labourers to work together at local sites in Squamish.

6 hours/week

Key Responsibilities:

- Take off shelves by unhooking from slots
- The shelves to be stacked flat on base with hooks fitting into pole openings;
- Make sure the triangular tow bar of the base is not stacked underneath the shelves, so that it can still be used to make a train and be pulled with;
- Stack the shelves not higher than 50 per base;
- All carts with no shelves left are to be further dismantled by taking the poles off and stacking these on a cart with shelves and place 40 poles per shelf.
- Stack the ‘bare’ bases not higher than 12 per stack.

;t=436s

Specific Requirements:

· Must be able to lift 50 pounds alone

· Must have access to a vehicle

· Must wear steel toe footwear

· Must be able to work outside in all elements

· Must be able to work independently and as a team member

· Must observe store safety protocols

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary

About Brand Momentum

We are a national integrated Sales, Marketing, and Retail solutions agency with two headquarters, one in Toronto and one in Montreal. We deliver authentic and enduring human connections, and we are led by a talented team and supported by a network of trusted partners. Rooted in Goodness, Brand Momentum is a three-time winner of Canada’s top 100 Best Workplace® and one of Canada’s top 500 fastest growing companies.

About Our Culture

Goodness is at the heart of everything we do. Brand Momentum (BMI) is an enduring market leader in quality and innovation. We deliver on our promises to our clients and each other, and we do it with passion, innovation and a commitment to excellence. Every single day we live our values of integrity, respect, empowerment, commitment, fun, flexibility and fiscal responsibility while putting our valued clients at the center of every decision we make.

title: Scaffolder - Journeymen and Apprentices
description:
Soogadin Industrial Inc. is hiring  Scaffolders at Suncor Firebag!!

A Scaffolders’ duties may vary from site to site, however, the main responsibilities of a Scaffolder are to erect temporary work platforms using steel pipes, support braces and clamps with a high standard of workmanship using a variety of tools. Scaffolders work both indoors and outdoors, year-round in commercial and industrial settings.

This is a fly in/fly out  position, with flights available from Edmonton or Calgary. It is a camp position with  14&14 schedule.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • Must have a minimum of one year's previous Scaffolding experience.
  • Valid certification or proof of hours for skill level. 
  • Fall Protection 
  • Confined Space
  • H2S Alive
  • OSSA BSO or Regional or CSO
  • CSTS-09 
  • Must be fully vaccinated to travel to site
If you think you'd be a good fit, apply now!

title: Labourer
description:
Skwlax Resource Management is seeking Labourers for an upcoming construction project.  Positions are field-based and are in the region of Chase, British Columbia. 

Key Job Duties:

  • Manual material handling and a wide range of general construction activities
  • Operate hand and power tools
  • Clean, construction works areas where needed
  • Load, unload, identify and distribute materials and equipment
  • General minor maintenance and checks on equipment
  • Operate light equipment and tools
  • Fluid hauling, handling and pumping

General Requirements:

  • Previous construction experience, an asset
  • Excellent hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity
  • Ensure the appropriate use of Personal Protective Equipment
  • Ability to identify safety risks and hazards, and complying with relevant safety procedures and regulations
  • Physically able to perform manual labour outdoors (8-12 hours per shift, 5-6 days on, adjusted as projects demand)
  • Physically able to handle and lift heavy objects up to 50 pounds
  • Other tasks, duties and requirements as assigned

Qualifications:

Various safety tickets and certificates as required including but not limited to:

  • Positions are safety-sensitive, pre-employment drug and alcohol testing may be required
  • WHMIS 2015
  • Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License or government-issued photo ID
  • Ground Disturbance 2 if participating in Ground Disturbance activities, an asset
  • Confined Space Entry/Monitor if entering confined spaces/trench boxes
  • Alberta Standard First Aid, an asset
  • Other safety certifications as projects may require

Working Conditions:

  • Positions are field-based
  • The typical work schedule is 5-6 days per week, and 8-12-hour shifts depending on the project

Why Skwlax Resource Management?

Skwlax Resource Management is committed to fostering excellence and creating sustainable opportunities within the British Columbia Interior.

As a Little Shuswap Lake Band majority-owned company, Skwlax Resource Management is a fast-growing organization with purpose and promise. We are engaged in numerous large-scale projects and economic opportunities throughout the Interior.

The core of our business is a collaborative, knowledgeable, and dedicated team that is connected through a strong workplace culture. We encourage every member of our team to achieve great things, whether thatâ€™s through personal, professional, or community development.

If you are a team player who is driven to explore greater opportunities, we want to hear from you.

Follow Skwlax Resource Management on LinkedIn and Facebook for the latest job postings and news.

Skwlax Resource Management is an equal opportunity employer.  Only selected candidates will be contacted.  Thank you in advance for including us in your career search!

title: General Laborer (Construction)
description:

title: Skilled Carpenters!
description:
We are in need of skilled carpenters!

Salary: Hourly: Min. $36.00 to $40.00 for 44.00 hours per week

Anticipated start date: March 2022

Terms of Employment: Permanent Full-Time

Number of positions: 2

Employment Conditions: Day

Employer: Landscapes By Lucin

Web site: www.lucin.net

Languages: English

Education: Completion of High School; some college/CGEP/vocational or technical training

Credentials (certificates, licenses, memberships, courses, etc.)

3rd period Apprentice, WHMIS Certificate

Experience: 2 years to less than 3 years

Major Work Area: Construction; Maintenance/Repair; Renovations

Type of Establishment/Work Setting Experience: Residential

Area of Specialization:

General carpentry, rough carpentry, finish carpentry, framing, form work, custom stairs, exterior siding, landscape carpentry, fences, decks, pergolas, arbours, custom screens, gazebos, belvederes, and other outdoor structures.

Specific Skills:

Determining specifications and calculating material needs, preparing site layouts, meausuring, cutting, shaping, assembling, joining mouldings, wood materials, fitting header boards, building porches, stringers, railings, stairs, and having full knowledge of all necessary power tools.

Additional skills:

Reading and interpreting blueprints, drawings and specifications, estimating labour and material costs, owning personal tools/equipment, safety gear, personal protective equipment.

Work Site Environment:

Outdoors, ladder work, noisy with possible dusty conditions, must have valid and clean "G" license.

title: Labourer - Bucks
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

Bucks Auto Parts is a self-serve auto parts and vehicle recycling facility. If you have an aptitude for automobiles and/or suitable experience, a solid work ethic, a record of success, and great communication skills, we want to talk to you! We are currently seeking a Labourer to work at the Buck Auto Parts - Regina location operated by EVRAZ North America. This is a physically demanding role that is performed in all weather conditions. The day-to-day work includes yard maintenance, vehicle processing, draining appropriate fluids from cars, and removing good sets of rims.

  • Yard maintenance including clean up and parts disposal

  • Vehicle inventory and record keeping

  • Assist with the processing of vehicles

  • Remove batteries and jacks from vehicles as needed

  • Remove catalytic converters from vehicles as needed

  • Remove tires and rims from vehicles

  • Notify appropriate personnel of any procedural abnormalities

  • Maintain clean work area

  • Observe and follows all safety rules and regulations

Requirements

  • No experience necessary but previous work experience in a manufacturing, production, or similar scrap yard/auto part environment will be considered an asset

  • Knowledge of automotive components is an asset

  • Able to meet the physical demands of the position including standing, walking, sitting, climbing, crawling, kneeling, bending, moderate to heavy lifting, and pushing and pulling

  • Willing and able to work in variable weather conditions including hot, dry summer conditions and cold, harsh winter conditions

  • Organized and able to prioritize competing priorities

  • Strong communication skills – communicates clearly and concisely, verbally, over mobile radio devices and in writing

  • Polite and friendly with a customer service orientation

  • Strong work ethic – uses time efficiently

  • Able to work with minimal supervision/general oversight

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Skatepark Construction Builders / Finishers
description:
Are you a passionate, creative team player with a desire to travel and work and make a difference in communities across Canada? We have openings for experienced Carpenters and Concrete Finishers who take pride in their workmanship. Successful candidates will possess a positive attitude, be community driven, adaptable, responsible and have the ability to work and travel out of town for extended periods of time. We provide very comfortable homes away from home, travel provided to and from locations and a healthy compensation allowance for living away from home.

We are looking for individuals with experience in carpentry and formwork, welding and concrete placing/finishing. Experience with shaping and finishing vertical shotcrete and experience with concrete line pumps an asset. With safety as our top priority, we are interested in individuals with Health and Safety certifications and relative training certifications.

Preference may be given to those with a journeyman carpentry ticket, previous concrete finishing work experience, ACI certification. We are seeking interested candidates with experience in: framing and excavation, ability to read architectural drawings, rebar and form installation, measure/calculate concrete volumes, handling and troweling concrete.

New Line Skateparks offers a productive fast paced work environment in an exciting industry. Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. We offer a complete benefits plan including, medical, dental, and insurance as well as a performance bonus program.

title: Civil Labourer
description:
Friday, June 25, 2021

The Civil labor position is an entry level position requiring the individual to perform predominantly manual tasks. Pulling, digging, landscaping, lifting, moving, transferring and other related duties. This individual is a team player with a strong work ethic.


Core Competencies

  • Safety & Quality Focused
  • Telecommunication Construction
  • Communication
  • Teamwork
  • Adaptability / Flexibility
  • Problem Solving
  • Accountability and Dependability
  • Attention to Detail

Job Duties
  • Participate in the build of direct buried facilities.
  • Responsible for completing tasks as identified.
  • Must identify all unsafe working conditions and not proceed with work if it endangers the technician, other workers, customers, and/or the public.
  • Maintains company equipment per service requirements and safety guidelines.
  • Meet the quality standards to satisfy customer needs.
  • Apply due diligence ensuring accuracy in preparing and promptly completing all necessary documentation, equipment log and FLHA.
  • Assists with construction clean-up as necessary.
  • And any other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
  • Perform additional assignments per supervisor's direction.

Requirements
  • Valid driver's license minimum Class 5, clean abstract, and own vehicle.
  • High school diploma or General Education Diploma (GED) preferred.
  • Physically fit and able to bend, kneel, climb, and lift (up to 75 lbs).
  • Prior experience in buried telecommunication construction.
  • Knowledge of utility depths and placements.
  • Possess general knowledge of construction practices.
  • Experience working with Telecommunication Fibre Optic and Coax installation.
  • Ability to drive trucks and trailers as required.
  • Mechanically inclined.
  • Strong work ethic.
  • Willing to work outdoors in all types of weather (i.e. snow, rain, wind, etc.) if required.

Work Conditions
  • Ability to work in various environments/settings with moderate to loud noise levels.
  • Equipped to work in excavations, manholes and tunnels
  • Prepared to sit, stand, stoop, crouch, reach and lift for long periods of time
  • Able to lift to 75 lbs.
  • Valid Canadian Driver's License
  • Over time, as required.
  • Able to work in various locations in western Canada

title: Labourer - Fort Macleod AB Area
description:
Phoenix Industrial requires 20 Labourers with previous industrial construction experience. This is a 2 month project in Fort Macleod, AB with LOA provided. The project starts on ASAP.

The Labourer is responsible for assisting all trades with various jobs and engaging in various physical tasks.

Responsibilities:

  • Load and unload construction materials, and move materials to work areas
  • Erect and dismantle concrete forms, scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades required at construction sites
  • Mix, pour and spread materials such as concrete and asphalt
  • Assist tradespersons such as carpenters, bricklayers, cement finishers, roofers and glaziers in construction activities
  • Assist heavy equipment operators to secure special attachments to equipment, signal operators to guide them in moving equipment and provide assistance in other activities
  • Assist in aligning pipes and perform related activities during oil and gas pipeline construction
  • Assist in drilling and blasting rock at construction sites
  • Level earth to fine grade specifications using rake and shovel
  • Assist in demolishing buildings using prying bars and other tools, and sort, clean and pile salvaged materials
  • Remove rubble and other debris at construction sites using rakes, shovels, wheelbarrows and other equipment
  • Operate pneumatic hammers, vibrators and tampers as directed
  • Clean up chemical spills and other contaminants, and remove hazardous materials
  • Perform duties such as shovelling, sweeping, stacking, moving, etc.
  • Maintain equipment and tools
  • Direct traffic at or near construction sites
  • Managing and performing general house keeping and daily clean-up of work area
  • Perform other duties as required
  • Lead by example by demonstrating the importance of fostering a safety culture

Requirements:

  • 2 - 3 years of previous labour experience in industrial construction or Oil & Gas
  • CSTS-09, OSSA certified Fall Arrest and Confined Space Entry are all required tickets for this project
  • Must be willing to submit to a pre-employment drug & alcohol test
  • Local to Fort Macleod, Lethbridge, Pincher Creek, Glenwood, Coalhurst, Coaldale, Nolan, Woodhouse, Ardenville, Pearce, Nobleford, Cardston environs.
See Job Description

description:
Under the general supervision of the Manager Generation Support, you contribute to the safe and efficient operation of the NTPC Plant. Duties would include heavy lifting, weed whacking, painting, mopping, cleaning and assisting the Mechanics, Electrical Technicians, Electricians and Power Linepersons



Qualifications:

  • Are enrolling/enrolled to attend full time post-secondary studies at the start of the Fall 2021 semester.
  • Related experience in a labourer position an asset.

 How to Apply:

  • Submit your cover letter, and a current copy of your resume including two references from your most recent supervisor or instructors.

This position pays $26.97 per hour plus 6% vacation pay.  No housing or relocation assistance provided.

 

This job opening is limited to student residents living in Paulatuk.

We thank all those who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Rigging Artist
description:
Company Description

As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.

Job Description

The Rigging Artist will create 3D rigs for different types of objects, vehicles, characters and creatures, ensuring to meet the high quality standards of Rodeo FX. 

Main responsibilities:

  • Create 3D rigs for different types of objects, vehicles, characters and creatures;
  • Create and rig the internal anatomy of a creature, in order to drive the final deformation of the skin;
  • Create feature-quality, scripted rigs and refine them based on the needs of animators and downstream departments;
  • Implement and refine character, body/face, cloth/deformer and hard-surface rigs;
  • Work closely with modelers and animators to ensure an asset is efficiently rigged and capable of believable movements.
  • Work closely with the CG Supervisor and Rigging Lead to find creative and technical solutions and approaches that enhance assets, while meeting project specifications and deadlines;
  • May participate in the development of tools and techniques for the department;
  • Perform quality control on shots before they are submitted for review/approval, ensuring all technical and creative standards are met, and promptly apply notes received;
  • Keep Production and the project team informed of the status of work, issues to be resolved, ramifications of problems encountered and recommend potential solutions;
  • Ensure deadlines are met, advising the project team promptly if delays could be expected. 
Qualifications

  • Experience in a similar position, within the VFX industry;
  • Excellent knowledge of Maya software;
  • Experience in programming using Python;
  • Good knowledge of of the principles of anatomy (bipeds, quadrupeds, skeletons and muscles) and facial expression;
  • Knowledge of modeling tools for blend shapes;
  • Knowledge of animation tools for the creation of animation test deformation;
  • Excellent sense of prioritization and respect of deadlines.


Additional Information

  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Driver Rigger
description:
Overview:

Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.

When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger â€“ a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each otherâ€™s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.

Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provide you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.

 

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Job Requirements:

Has responsibility for operating Wireline equipment and/or machinery. Duties may involve some technical elements but primarily focused on running equipment/machinery /systems. Role is hands-on and directly manipulates the equipment, machinery or system; requiring precise instrumentation/operation. Acts at field operations as an effective member of a field crew, supporting the delivery under supervision of a Field Engineer or Field Specialist.

 

Responsibilities and duties:  

  • Prepare accurate tickets, job reports, time sheets, and other administrative forms as required.  
  • Assist in job safety analysis, job coordination and job installation with WFT supervisor and customer on location.  
  • Verify all necessary equipment and supplies are on location and in proper working condition.  
  • Perform all duties of a SES Service Technician II.  
  • Learn the operation and routine maintenance requirements of all solid expandable services equipment.  
  • Learn the maintenance procedures as they relate to solid expandable service equipment.  
  • Independently operate and perform basic troubleshooting and minor repair of solid expandable service equipment.  
  • Assist in pre-job safety meeting.  
  • Available on a 24 hour basis to respond to customer needs.  
  • Know and understand Weatherford Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions.  
  • Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford.  
  • Work assignments carried out to the highest quality level.  
  • Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job.
Experience:

REQUIRED

  • Experience in OIL/GAS/WIRELINE    
  • High School diploma, skilled labour certificate or equivalent
  • Valid Driver License
  • Strong operational and maintenance knowledge of equipment
  • Must have a telephone and the ability to be on 24 hour call

PREFERRED

  • Valid Commercial Driver's License or the ability to obtain one
  • Valid Hazardous Materials endorsement or the ability to obtain one    
  • Comply with region specific driving regulations and Health Requirements.   Work flexible schedule, including long and/or irregular hours

title: Rigger / Monteur
description:
Wednesday, November 3, 2021

Are you ready to take your career to new heights? Join our growing team at WesTower Communications Ltd. as an Aerial Field Technician!

We are Canada's largest network service contractor offering Engineering, Design, Fabrication, Construction, Project Management, and Maintenance Services for telecommunication carriers, independent tower operators, broadcast, and utility.

We offer competitive wages with paid out living allowances, paid holidays, comprehensive benefits, RSP matching, stock options, a generous referral bonus program and opportunities to further develop your skillset and grow your career.

Job Description:

  • Tower and cell-site installation and routine maintenance
  • Antenna modifications / adds
  • Repair or replace defective equipment on tower
  • Perform tests equipment to locate transmission faults
  • Extensive travel throughout the province and or country

Qualifications:
  • 2 years of basic knowledge of construction and tool manipulation
  • Telecom troubleshooting experience preferred but not required
  • Ability to interpret engineered drawings and knowledge of fibre and DC drawings
  • Knowledge of OTDR test equipment and fibre fusion
  • Demonstrate strong adherence to safety procedures
  • Good physical condition and comfortable working at heights
  • Willing to work outdoors and be exposed to all types of weather
  • Valid Canadian driver's license is required
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada
  • Must be mechanically inclined
  • Strong written and verbal skills
  • Clean Criminal record
  • Maintain a professional working relationship with co-workers and clients
  • Must be reliable, trustworthy and have a positive attitude!

At WesTower Communications Ltd. you can expect to be treated fairly. We recognize that it is our people who drive the success of our business, so we make it our priority to foster inclusive work environments welcomed to diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to accommodating prospective employees. We proudly offer a drug-free workplace with a zero-tolerance safety program.

title: Apprentice Carpenter
description:
PME Inc. provides civil site work and common construction services to the oil and gas industry in Western Canada with primary focus on the Northern Alberta region. The key bases of work have most recently been to the oil refineries, oil sands development and oil and gas pipeline sectors.

At PME Inc, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values. Then we simply give them the freedom to take their career further.

Duties and Responsibilities :

  • Ability to read and understand technical guides, drawings and specifications
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs
  • Comfortable working at heights
  • Ability to work in adverse weather conditions
  • Manual dexterity and ability to use carpentry tools safely

Qualifications:

  • Apprenticeship
  • CSTS 09, WHMIS 2015
  • Fall Protection & Rescue, Aerial Platform, Confined Spaces, Rigging/Hoisting and Hand Signals, and First Aid/CPR certification would be an asset
  • Meet drug and alcohol policy requirements

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it! These positions are set to start in Spring 2022.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status.

title: Labourer
description:
Are you looking for long term employment with a proven employer? As a member of the FBL team you will enjoy many career advancement opportunities such as development training, career growth, and promotional opportunities from within.

Forbes Brothers Ltd, OA FB Bullet is looking for qualified individuals to join our growing team in SURREY BC. Specializing in underground utility construction FB Bullet offers a competitive compensation package, benefits and pension contribution.


Civil Labourer

The ideal candidate will either have previous experience as a Construction Labourer or seeks the opportunity to join our growing team and advance their knowledge and skill base. The role of Civil Labourer will be responsible to report to the Crew Leader and execute the day-to-day activities of their crew. As a valued member of our team, you will be able to support and take instructions from crew members with assigned duties to gain and improve efficiencies.

Responsibilities:

  • Receive duties, delegations from the Crew Leader, and assist crew members execute these tasks
  • Work closely with all crew members, and learn the construction industry standards
  • Complete installation of conduit and other utility infrastructure with crew members
  • Work on tight timeline power outage worksites
  • Assist in maintaining a clean and organized work site
  • Able to problem solve through coordination with Crew Leader
  • Ensure quality of work meets or exceeds expectations
  • Complete daily pre-trip inspections on company equipment/vehicles
  • Participate and engage in daily Tailboard meetings, identify hazards and assist in crew compliance to safety policies and regulations
  • Work with construction equipment such as compactors, shoring, core drills, various hand tools
  • Ensure all small tools assigned to crew are cleaned, stored and maintained properly
  • Work closely with Crew Leader/Lead Hand to install conduit per specifications to correct grades/elevations
  • Assist drivers and vehicles navigate through busy work sites via proper hand signals and guidance

Schedule:

  • Due to the demand of our workload, all crews are scheduled Monday-Friday with the opportunity for weekend work quite frequently. Nightshift work is also scheduled on a less frequent basis
  • All shifts are scheduled for 8-10 hours, and due to the type of work we perform can extend past that
  • Daily overtime/double time is offered in all FB positions

Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid Class 5 driver's licence, Class 1 or 3 preferred
  • Preferred experience in underground utility construction, hydro/telecommunications considered an asset
  • Physically fit and able to provide hands on assistance to crew members
  • Must be safety orientated
  • Ability to take and execute instructions and duties assigned to you
  • Lead by example attitude
  • Existing knowledge of WorkSafeBC standards and policies is an asset for this position

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: General Labour - 12 hours shift
description:
Are you looking for your next permanent job opportunity? Do you have warehouse or manufacturing and production experience?

Our client in Mississauga is looking for reliable and dedicated workers to join their dynamic team.

Come and work for a leader in the Solar Panel production industry and do your part for the environment!

This position will require candidates to work set 12 hour continental shifts, lift up to 50lbs, and have computer and technical skills.

Job title - General Labour

Location - Courtney Park and Kennedy Rd (Mississauga)

Shifts:
Days
Monday - Sunday (7:00 am – 7:00 pm) 5 days working, 2 days off, 2 days working, 5 days off
Pay rate: $17.50 /hr

Nights
Monday - Sunday (7:00 pm – 7:00 am) 5 days working, 2 days off, 2 days working, 5 days off
Pay rate - $18.50 /hr




Advantages
• PERMANENT OPPORTUNITY
• Immediate start
• Full medical and dental benefits after three months
• Entitled to annual vacation days
• The opportunity to grow and advance your career long term.
• Work for a company dedicated to environmentalism and sustainability

Responsibilities
- Operate automatic and semi-automatic machines
- Assemble and test components
- Perform simple electrical testing of components
- Check final assembly for packaging
- Perform preventive maintenance on soldering machines
- Ensure final product meets high quality standards
- Various other duties directed by management

Qualifications
- Clear criminal background check
- High school diploma or equivalent
- 1 year of production experience
- Ability to lift up to 50 lb.
- Basic computer skills
- Ability to stand/bend/walk/lift for long periods
- Possess good hand eye co-ordination/manual dexterity
-Ability to distinguish between colors
- Ability to work flexible shifts
- Problem solving skills
- Attention to detail
- Team player and great work ethic

Summary
We are conducting interviews as soon as possible! If you're interested qualified for this role, and are interested , apply today! You can apply directly to the posting or email us at alique.marsim@randstad.ca or cindy.renaud@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Carpenter
description:
First Onsite is seeking to hire a full-time Carpenter to help rebuild homes and businesses for our residential and commercial customers after fire or flood emergencies. Do you have previous experience in restoration or construction? Are you looking to build a successful career while rebuilding lives? If so, keep reading!

Our experienced Carpenter earns a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A CARPENTER

You are focused on bringing back homes and businesses to their former beauty. Your attention to detail and passion for construction assists you in delivering superior quality work to your customers. Whether repairing a roof, or installing a cabinet you consistently demonstrate skill in the safe operation of tools. Your ability to oversee laborers ensuring that the quality standards of the company are being met and as well as your knowledge of materials, methods and the tools involved in the construction or repair of residential & commercial buildings, and other structures will set you up for success in this role

Your excellent communication skills assist you as you work collaboratively with construction crews. Health and safety are important to you which is why you respect all policies and procedures and ensure that they are followed by other employees and subcontractors. You are a get-it-done person who likes to be active and isn't afraid to jump right in and make things happen. You take pride in your work and feel good about being able to restore order for people in our community while helping us build a loyal customer base!

QUALIFICATIONS

  • At least 3 years of experience in the carpenter in the construction or restoration industry
  • Ability to pass a background check
  • Valid drivers' license
  • Availability for scheduled on-call and after-hour shifts

Are you able to work independently? Do you have excellent communication and interpersonal skills? Can you work collaboratively with construction crews? Are you service-oriented? Is safety important to you? Do you project a professional appearance and attitude? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Our Skilled Labourers earn a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!

Position Summary:

The Skilled Labourer is in good physical condition and provides construction work and support required to ensure timely project completion. The Skilled Labourer follows good work practices and procedures and sets a good example for new crew members and co-workers. The Skilled Labourer may: operate a variety of equipment and instruments, including hand and power tools of all types; clean and prepare sites; clean up rubble and debris; remove mold, asbestos lead and other hazardous materials.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads by example and follows all health and safety policies and procedures.
  • Strives to continually improve through specific development plans.
  • Accepts direction from the Lead Hand, Lead Water Technician and/or Lead Carpenter and more experienced co-workers.
  • Participates in good housekeeping discipline on the job to ensure a safe non-cluttered workplace and to minimize cross contamination.
  • Learns and practices correct procedures, especially when environmental work is required.
  • Adheres to company policy regarding acceptable standards to follow at a customer site i.e. smoking policy etc.
  • Displays good manners and attitude toward the property owner, occupants of the property, co-workers and sub-contractors.
  • Is willing and able to be on-call 24/7 for after hour's emergency work.
  • Directs customer questions or concerns to the most senior company person at the job site.
  • Looks out for and assists co-workers.

Qualifications:

  • Previous construction or cleaning work preferred.
  • Experience with hand tools & power tools preferred.
  • High School graduate or equivalent.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The Labourer is required to perform tasks involving physical labour at commercial construction projects, and to operate a variety of hand and power tools.

Qualifications

  • Knowledge of safe operation of basic hand and power tools
  • Minimum of 1 year previous construction labour experience preferred
  • Knowledge of workplace safety, and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Knowledge of First Aid and CPR preferred
  • Valid Drivers License and clean abstract preferred
  • Out of town work may be required. Work in all weather conditions.

 



Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

Job Description

The carpenter is responsible for constructing and maintaining buildings.

Required knowledge includes: construction and remodeling trades, practices, procedures, techniques, tools and equipment, materials, specifications, quality control, cost control and safety.

The carpenter must be proficient at the following tasks: hanging doors, drilling and setting door hardware, setting windows, layout for stairs and common rafters, formwork, and reading blueprints. The carpenter must also possess the mathematical and analytical skills necessary to do materials estimates.

Qualifications

  • Ticketed Journeyperson Carpenter
  • Experienced with a large general contractor
  • Valid drivers license and clean drivers abstract preferred

title: Summer Student - General Labour (Burlington)
description:
JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is looking for Summer Students to join our teams in Burlington, ON!

Formerly Cogent Power Inc., JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is under new management.

While we appreciate all applicants, we will only be contacting those selected for an interview.

This position is located in Burlington, Ontario.

We have two facilities located on 801 & 845 Laurentian Drive, L7N 3W7 (Conveniently located by bus route) 

Salary: $18.12 an hour 

Hours: This position will be on a straight day shift from 7 am to 3 pm Monday to Friday. 

Position Type: Summer Contract, 4-month period (flexible). 

The Perks:

  • Travel Subsidy:
    • Starting April to September 2022 we will be providing a subsidy to all employees that incur the costs of travelling to work. These subsidies will be provided at the end of the month in the form of a gas card (i.e April subsidy will be provided by mid-May).
    • For those who take a city bus to work, we will be providing a transit pass.  
  • Perkopolis Account - get access to 5000 exclusive online discounts to stores & sports events (Hello Fresh, Apple, Indigo, Toronto Marlies, Toronto Raptors, etc.)
  • $100 Coverage on CSA-Approved Safety Boots
  • Summer Gatorade Program (Free Gatorades over the summer term)

As a Summer Student, you will be working in one of these Departments:

Wound Core Department: 

  • Receiving and inspecting incoming slit steels, assuring that they are correct for the intended order
  • Issue materials to work orders accurately and correctly on both paperwork order, and through the visual software system
  • Set up machine according to work order and operating procedures.
  • Produce distributed gap cores
  • Ensure product meets quality requirements as per work order, operating procedures and customers specifications
  • Follow priority schedule

Stacked Core Department:

  • Set up machine according to work order and operating procedures.
  • Material stacking into a repeating specific pattern
  • Ability to follow detailed prints & procedures to create the finished product
  • Work in a team environment ensuring group success
  • Issue materials to work orders accurately and correctly

About you, simply stated:

  • Ability to follow health & safety policies
  • Strong measuring skills 
  • Exceptional communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • An eagerness to learn and dedication to improvement 
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Organized

Requirements: 

  • Must be 18 years of age or older
  • Must be able to show proof of enrolment at a post-secondary college or university
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada with a valid Social Insurance Number
  • Students on Visa's welcome to apply 

(Must be 18 years of age or older - students from all levels are welcome to apply. Training for your first two weeks is paid).

About JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc:

On September 20th, 2019, JFE Shoji Trade Corporation acquired 100% of the shares of Cogent Power Inc, from Tata Steel Europe. Grouped, the Cogent and JFE Shoji Steel America business make it possible for JFE Shoji to capture greater market share in the electrical steel market for both transformer and automotive products. The combination of Cogent and JFE Shoji has become one of the largest processors of electrical steel transformers in the world. JFE Shoji currently has many other production and processing facilities throughout Asia, as well as a facility in Tijuana, Mexico.

Globally, JFE Shoji enhanced the businessâ€™ competitiveness by sharing and integrating technical skills with deep business experience, which can be strongly applied to the global and North American markets. With this investment, JFE Shoji has one of the worldâ€™s leading processing and distribution functions for core design and manufacturing for transformers.

Based in Tokyo, JFE is one of the worldâ€™s largest steel producers with over 45,000 employees and operations globally. 

If you would like to be considered, please apply in confidence. For more information about starting your career with JFE Shoji Power Canada, please visit https://www.jfeshojipower.com/

Job Type: Summer, Contract, Students

Salary: $18.12 an hour

#JFEHP

title: GENERAL LABOURER
description:
Job Description

Job description

You’ve probably seen quite a few positions as labourer, but being one at EACOM Val d’Or, a subsidiary of INTERFOR, means having both hands in something bigger than life. You’re going to be handling wood and more wood. Keeping a close eye on everything that’s going on will help you keep the yard and the mill clean and tidy. We’ll be relying on you to keep everything in its place and running smoothly. You’ll be making a living in a job with us, in our sawmills rooted in northern regions of Ontario and Québec. You’ll discover that they transform much more than wood – they enhance our communities!

Are you hard-working and resourceful? Are you effective at moving into action? Come and see EACOM. We’ll bend over backwards to make things work. The team awaits you.

What you’ll actually be doing:

  • Fastening bundles of raw wood for drying outside;
  • Redoing and stacking bundles of raw or planed wood in the yard;
  • Cleaning up the yard and the mill;
  • Managing sawdust indoors and outdoors;
  • During halts in work, cleaning in places that are inaccessible during operations;
  • Handling related tasks (this may make you nervous, but you’ll learn plenty of new things that will serve you well).

What do you need to succeed with us?

  • Working well on a team;
  • Demonstrating self-reliance and initiative;
  • Showing vigilance and a concern for health and safety.
Qualifications

Your background will help you:

  • High school diploma, vocational diploma or equivalent;
  • Previous work at a mill is an asset;
  • Availability for day and/or night shifts.


Additional Information

At EACOM, we’re there for you.

EACOM supports employment equity, and diversity is welcome – in fact, we encourage it! We’ll contact you if you’re selected for an interview. If you need any special accommodation, let us know. Any information you send us will be handled respectfully and in complete confidence.

We’ll bend over backwards to make things work. title: Labourer
description:
You enjoy working with your hands and take pride in hard work. You are motivated by seeing the end product that you helped create. We're looking for labourers to join our crew in Edmonton.
RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials
  • Move tools, equipment, and construction materials to and from work areas
  • Operate hand and power tools
  • Clean up rubble and debris on a regular basis to ensure a safe and well maintained construction site
  • Move and level earth using shovels and rakes
  • Clean, lubricate, and refill tanks as instructed
  • Practice work place safety at all time
  • Perform other duties as required

REQUIREMENTS

  • Previous experience in a related position
  • Positive can-do attitude
  • Willing and able to easily follow direction
  • Able to lift 50lbs
  • Willing and able to work long hours in a fast-pace, physical environment

 

WHY SEYMOUR PACIFIC?

Seymour Pacific Developments is an industry leader in building multi-family homes with unparalleled speed and efficiency. We develop and build over 1,500 units a year by leveraging effective teamwork and industry expertise. We offer excellent wages and benefits, as well as a variety of training for employees who are motivated to succeed and want to expand their horizons. Seymour Pacific Developments is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to following safe and inclusive hiring practices.

title: Construction Labourers (Redwater, AB)
description:
At Golderado, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values. 

In the position of an upcoming job for Construction Labourer, we would ask you to do the following: Handle and distribute construction materials (e.g., load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials; move tools, equipment and construction materials to and from work areas; remove rubble and other debris) Assemble and dismantle scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades at construction sites Prepare and clean up construction sites, move materials and equipment, and perform demolition, excavation and compaction activities Work on a wide variety of buildings, structures and premises including municipal sewer and water mains, roads, dams and bridges, tunnels, railways and canals

Sounds challenging and exciting right? Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

  • You have one to two years of industrial construction experience and must have Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS 09) Certificate, WHMIS 2015, Standard First Aid considered an asset.
  • You have experience in using compactors, and trampers (jumping jack) You are able to lift up to 13.5 kg (30 lbs) 9-23 Kg You have a safety conscious attitude and able to work with others in a team
  • Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required
  • Drug and Alcohol Screening required. 

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!  Apply today at resumes@pmeinc.ca We are an equal opportunity employer. While only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview, be sure to continually 

 Please note, there is NO TRAVEL or LIVING ALLOWANCE for this project.

title: Labourer - Part Time
description:
Company Description

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, American Iron & Metal (AIM) is a family-owned company, recognized as a world leader in the metal recycling industry. Over the years, AIM has evolved into a multi-faceted company with successful lines of business including metals recycling, dry materials recycling, manufacturing of solder assembly, environmental services, retail auto parts, and highway transportation. With multiple facilities throughout Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe, and Asia and over 2000 employees located throughout the world, AIM is uniquely positioned to provide best-in-class service and value to its customers. 

We are currently looking for an enthusiastic individual to fill part-time labourer position at our Ajax Location. The individual will ensure that their yard is clean and organized and occasionally assist with other areas as requested by their supervisor. 

Job Description

  • Sorting, picking, and processing scrap metals 
  • Clean and inspect recycling yard by sweeping and raking materials and debris  
  • Assist with performing routine maintenance 
  • Perform other general labourer duties as assigned 
Qualifications

  • A Minimum of 1 year of experience is required in a similar role  
  • Experience in the metal scrap industry will be considered as an asset 
  • Experience in using machines like Lift Truck / Forklift, Skid steer will be considered as an asset 
  • Must be able to lift 50 lbs. and stand for extended periods of time 
  • Successful candidates must be highly motivated and work with little supervision 
  • Always strive for excellence and constant improvement 


Additional Information

  • Competitive salaries commensurate with experience and qualifications
  • Additional training and uniform
  • Great working environment

HEALTH AND SAFETY

  • Must work in compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Regulation and follow in accordance with AIM’s Health and Safety policies and procedures
  • Responsible for reporting all accidents, illnesses, or ‘near miss’ incidents to management

title: Labourer
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Labourer for our Grande Prairie location.The successful applicant for this position will be responsible for assisting in the dismantling of construction, forestry and mining based heavy equipment and components.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Cleaning parts and components
  • Cleaning and organizing the yard
  • Some inventory maintenance.
  • Assisting the other shop personnel fulfill their duties and increase overall shop productivity
  • Demonstrate safe and efficient workplace practices
  • Highly motivated, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Able to carry out and understand verbal and written instructions
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Capable of meeting the physical demands of the heavy duty equipment environment (ie: lifting up to 75 pounds)
  • Must be capable of working under minimal supervision
  • Previous mechanical aptitude and willingness to learn required
  • Forklift experience and heavy duty parts handling considered an asset

title: General Labour (6:15AM - 2:45PM)
description:
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Contributes to a healthy work environment, while maintaining high food safety standards
  • Works on the line directly handling raw poultry products
  • Takes action to correct any issues and to make improvements
  • Other responsibilities as required
WHAT DOING A GOOD JOB LOOKS LIKE:
  • Directly helps to meet targets and goals while maintaining a safe & healthy work environment
  • Maintains productivity that meets/exceeds standards
  • Dedicated to creating a high quality product that consistently meets product specifications
  • Contributes to the team and the whole facility in a positive way

REQUIRED SKILLS, ABILITY & EXPERIENCE:
  • Able to work in a fast-paced work environment with repetitive tasks on a moving line
  • Able to stand and walk throughout the shift
  • Able to rotate through all positions in the department as required
  • Must be comfortable with handling raw poultry products
  • Good communication skills, able to speak and read English
Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022). We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

description:
Job Description:

We are looking for Labourers in the Fort McMurray area for a turnaround starting immediatel. n work day-in and day-out to provide the best solutions for our customers. Join our team with a legacy of excellence and experience stretching back more than 50 years.    

 

You will be responsible to assist in the installation, maintenance, and repair of industrial facilities during Shutdown.  

 

What youâ€™ll be doing:

  • Can read and understand complex instructions
