title: General Labour
description:
General Labour

Colonial Cookies - Weston Foods

135 Otonabee Drive, Kitchener, ON

Full time permanent position.

Hourly Rate: $18.87/hour + $1.25/hour afternoon shift premium & $2.00/hour night shift premium.

*** Candidates must be able to work ALL shifts (days, afternoons and nights) to apply. ***

Shift Schedule runs from Monday-Friday + a mandatory Saturday Overtime, if needed.

We are a premier North American bakery company and we’ve been in business for 135 years. Our team is passionate about baking the foods your family and friends love to eat, including breads and rolls, donuts, pies, cakes, cookies and more!

Weston Foods proudly serves communities through our ~35 bakeries across North America, and every day, our team strives to elevate moments for our customers and your loved ones by producing high quality baked goods.

Our bakery team is the heart of our company and plays an important role in keeping North America’s food supply going. Our General Labour employees are essential to our success, and ensure our production equipment is operating smoothly to produce delicious, premier baked goods for our customers.

We are not just a job, we are an extended family, committed to elevating everyday moments and feeding communities and families across the country. Join us and find fulfillment and purpose in your work.

We are currently hiring for General Labour employees who are flexible to work in any shift and on weekends whenever required.

In a typical day, you’ll:

· Must have/maintain regular & consistent attendance.

· Must adhere to all safety, sanitation and good manufacturing practices.

· Ability to perform repetitive work.

· Make decisions regarding the product quality, packaging material and movement of the crew.

· Must adhere to all safety, sanitation and good housekeeping practices.

· Duties include package cookies, case packing and general duties.

· Duties shall be assigned by the employer, including other duties outside the work area.

 

 

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

· Ability to follow procedures according to company standards.

· Ability to work independently and as a team

· Ability to multi-task

· Attention to detail

title: Temporary Labourer
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview

 

  • Full time hourly position paying $19.73 per hour 
  • Working Monday to Friday from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm, 40 hours per week with some overtime, Lafarge seeks individuals to perform manual and physical labour tasks at our cement terminal
  • Location: Toronto (54 Polson St)
  • Reports to: Site Manager

Responsibilities

 

  • Understand and comply with Environmental Health & Safety (EHS policies to ensure that environmental health and safety are the priority of the business.
  • Actively support key safety initiatives at the facility and assist the department in improving EHS performance and results.
  • Understands and performs safety responsibilities such as hazard identification, equipment lock-out, emergency response, etc.
  • Maintain proper documentation, including operator log, maintenance records, safety & environment reports, etc.
  • Ensure the cleanliness of the production equipment, conveyors and the plant by using brooms, shovels, hand tools, and electric and pneumatic tools.
  • Operation of various motorized equipment such as screw conveyors and bucket elevators
  • Operate an automated truck loading system and a cement transfer system.
  • Use a computer operating system for truck loading (SAP).

Qualifications

 

  • Minimum High school diploma or equivalency
  • Minimum of one-year minimum experience working in an industrial environment.
  • Knowledge of the use of various tools
  • Ability to work shifts (days, nights, weekends)

 

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Aptitude for manual and physical labour
  • Must be willing to learn the operating parameters of equipment.
  • Demonstrated communication skills and the ability to function in a team environment. 
  • Must be able to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment. 
  • Demonstrated ability to work safely and follow all safety and housekeeping guidelines and policies. 

LafargeHolcim

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs. 

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. 

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Carpenter - Residential / Light Commercial
company: Handyman Connection of Metro Vancouver, BC
description:
To meet the demands of our rapidly growing base of satisfied customers, Handyman Connection of Metro Vancouver, BC is seeking an experienced carpenter.  This skilled craftsman would ideally have a variety of home improvement skills to support the growth of our business.  Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company dedicated to excellent customer service and quality work.  Our customers love us!  We have over 50% repeat/referral customer base and our business is growing!

 What You Will Receive

  • Receiving constant leads that can be scheduled based on your availability
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking
  • Free access to custom mobile application for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaign that brings us well qualified customers

Responsibilities


The Carpenter performs and coordinates the cutting, shaping and installation of building materials during the construction, remodeling or repair in a residential and light commercial setting. You must have experience as a residential carpenter, and you must have a positive attitude.


·        Constructing, installing, and repairing structures and fixtures of various types of wood, plywood and wallboard.

·        Ability to determine and clearly identify proper materials and material quantities for new and existing projects.

·        Evaluate customer requests, price projects, troubleshoot customer issues, and present a description of a work order to a customer.


Requirements


·        Must have current Driver's License and submit to a background check

·        Must have tools, vehicle and good references

·        Must have experience in the remodeling or home repair trades

·        Must pass screening process

·        Independent Contractors must carry liability insurance and workers comp

·        Must have a smart phone and access to the internet

 Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.

Check out our website at: www.handymanconnection.com

title: Layout Carpenter
description:
CHANGING SKYLINES, BUILDING FUTURES

Do you want to be a part of a close-knit, family-run organization where management appreciates and recognizes your hard work and values your input? If you are ready for a financially rewarding yet challenging position that promotes personal and professional growth, keep reading!

Pagnotta Inc. is a mid-sized, full-service provider of structural concrete, general contracting, and tower crane and hoist services with job sites located throughout Western Canada.  We provide value-added construction services to our customers by creating a successful partnership with them throughout the construction process. To learn more, visit www.pagnotta.ca or click here to view a short video about our company culture and values.

We are currently recruiting a Journeyman Carpenter with Layout experience for construction projects in Winnipeg. Reporting to the Superintendent and/or Foreman.

Wage

  •  $34 - $40/hr depending on experience, negotiable

Benefits

  • Employer-paid health, dental and vision benefits for you and your family
  • Life insurance 
  • Travel insurance
  • RRSP matching up to 4% of regular earnings
  • Year-round, full-time work
  • Opportunities for advancement - wage increases and promotions are regularly extended to those who take initiative, work hard and take pride in producing quality work

Culture

  • Our employees would describe the work environment as fast-paced and entrepreneurial-focused. We believe in hiring "A" Players who are self-motivated and intrinsically driven to succeed. These types of people thrive because they are resourceful and can seek out information on their own to make informed decisions

Duties/Responsibilities

Planning:

  • Review blueprints and construction drawings with Project Coordinator /Site Superintendents 
  • Review scope of work with Superintendents and determine layout requirements
  • Ensure layout equipment and tools are always maintained and available

Operations:

  • Responsible for all elements of layout and elevation requirements and ongoing monitoring checks
  • Document and maintain "as-builts" for submission as required
  • Arrange for survey checks and updates at various stages of projects
  • Ensure work site and tools are organized and cleaned at the end of each day

Tracking:

  • Record and maintain all calculations and equipment; maintain and troubleshoot technical equipment
  • Completion of daily work records, daily diary, and equipment reports as required
  • Review site for accuracy and keep current documentation on hand while working on the project.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  • Excellent communication/interpersonal skills (verbal and written)
  • Ability to work in a team or alone
  • Detail orientated
  • Able to prioritize quickly
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Able to set and maintain your own schedule to meet project requirements
  • Works well under pressure with strict deadlines
  • Punctual and reliable
  • Self-motivated

Qualifications/Education:

  • Certified Journeyman Carpenter or equivalent non-ticketed experience
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role
  • Experience working on high-rise, mixed-use, commercial and institutional projects preferred
  • Experience reading blueprints and construction drawings
  • Experience with Trimble Robotic Total Station and other survey equipment and tools
  • Experience with layout work preparation in AutoCAD  
  • WHMIS2015 (can provide if needed)
  • Fall Protection (can provide if needed)

Working Conditions:

  • 40 hours a week plus overtime and work on the weekends as required 
  • Two paid 15 minutes breaks and one Â½ hour unpaid lunch break per day
  • Working at heights
  • Must be able to stand, crouch, kneel, walk and climb for long periods of time
  • Exposure to hot and cold extremes. Must have appropriate gear for the weather.
  • Exposure to noise, dust and pollution.

title: General Labourer (Dufferin Aggregates) - $24 - $29/hr
description:
Job ID:  392419 

Work Type:  Full Time Permanent 

 

It is a great time to join the Dufferin Aggregates team! Dufferin Aggregates is going through an exciting business transformation which demands first-class Talent Management support to drive results.


We are building a world- class team. Make your mark!


You will be a successful addition to our team if you look at change as an opportunity to develop and contribute to the business. You will be successful in your role if you like partnering with the business, presenting new ideas and providing excellent customer service.

Dufferin Aggregates, a divison of CRH Canada is looking to hire!

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Work in a team environment with other co-workers, supervisors and managers.
  • Complete cleanup assignments using shovels and/or small, heavy equipment.
  • Assist in maintenance inspections and activities using appropriate procedures.
  • Operate crushing and screening plant as trained and directed.
  • Report any malfunctions or safety risks to supervisor immediately.
  • Specific job duties will often vary from day to day depending on business needs.

Qualifications:

  • Experience in construction, mining or operating heavy machinery is preferred but not required.
  • Minimum Ontario high school diploma (OSSD) or equivalent.
  • Reliability – Showing up to work on time.
  • Be willing to work rotating shifts, overtime and weekends when required.
  • Physical ability to walk around the plant.
  • Basic maintenance/mechanical aptitude, welding and fitting is preferred but not required.
  • Dependability – follow instructions and respond to direction. Good communication skills are required.  
  • Working outdoors/indoors under varied temperatures and weather conditions.

Health and Safety:

  • Comply with OHSA and all of its applicable regulations.
  • Strict compliance with Dufferin Aggregates safety rules, PPE, policies and procedures.
  • Be aware of environmentally sensitive areas and be alert to correct environmental problems that may develop in the assigned work area.
     

What Dufferin Aggregates Offers You:

  • Pension and benefits included after probationary period.
  • Shift premium applies to night shifts.
  • Bonus pay based on safety and performance.
  • High competitive starting wage with multi-tier wage structure based on skill and ability.
  • Overtime opportunities are available as required.
  • PPE and tools allowance are provided by company for some positions.
  • Company provides training and appreciation events.
  • A culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

Visit our website for more information: http://www.crhcanada.com

CRH Canada Group Inc. recognizes Canada’s diverse landscape. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Construction Trades Helper
description:
Our client is looking for Construction Helper in Kelowna, British Columbia

Area of Specialization:
  • Painting
Specific Skills:

  • Remove rubble and other debris at construction sites

title: Labourer
description:
Cindercrete ProductsLtd is currently looking for responsible, safe, and dependable Labourers to join our local team. As a Labourer you will support plant needs by ensuring a safe and productive work environment. In this position, you will have the opportunity to use different skills every day as you learn the aggregate industry and fill in for vacancies in various areas of our plant.

Who We Are:

Cindercrete Products Ltd is part of the Lehigh Hanson group of companies. Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.
With our diverse product lines and locations across North America, there are opportunities to explore different roles and work on a variety of exciting and interesting projects. At Lehigh Hanson, we believe our employees play a key role in the company’s success and future growth.

We offer:
  • Secure, long-term employment
  • Competitive wage and benefits package
  • Training and development
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • OT available
What You Will Get to Do:
  • Operate mobile equipment on plant property (loader, haul truck, water truck, etc.)
  • Maintain cleanliness of plant work areas
  • Assist with plant tasks including lubrication, maintenance, repairs
  • Transport materials to and from storage and shop areas
  • Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and environmental regulations, as well as company policies and procedures; assist with physical inspections of plant property/departments.
Who We Are Looking For:
  • High school diploma or GED required
  • Previous experience in an open pit mine is an asset
  • Experience using (or ability to learn) plant mobile equipment
  • Desire to work cooperatively as part of a productive team
  • Ability to work safely, and independently without constant supervision
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Capable of learning through on the job training
  • Able to work inside and outside in year-round weather conditions
  • In good physical condition, able to lift and carry up to50 lbs., sit and stand for extended periods of time, kneel, climb ladders, and walk on varied terrain
  • Ability to work different extended hours, holidays and/or overtime required

title: Apprentice Formwork Carpenter
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview

Lafarge is hiring an Apprentice Formwork Carpenter for our Vancouver infrastructure operations.To apply, please email resumes directly to:gord.bird@lafargeholcim.com

blaine.fisher@lafargeholcim.com

Responsibilities

  • Construction, specializing in Heavy Civil Vertical Formwork
  • Infrastructure Projects within the Greater Vancouver Regional District
  • Determine specifications and calculate formwork material requirements
  • Prepare layouts / assist in Field Surveying
  • Measure, cut, shape, assemble wood materials
  • Operate power tools (cutting/grinding, etc.)

Qualifications

Education:

  • None required, grade 12 preferred

Credentials (certificates, licences, memberships, courses, etc.):

  • Apprentice Carpenter
  • Consideration for Application to become a Red Seal Certified Formwork Carpenter an asset, but not required

Other:

  • Basic English is required.
  • Must have ability to travel to multiple worksite locations, own vehicle is preferred due to the location of some of the worksites

 

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Labourers
description:
Overview:

Labourers

 

SurewayConstruction is one of Albertaâ€™s largest heavy construction contractors, with 49 yearsâ€™ experience, involved in; civil earthworks and grading, utilities and offsite, mine operation and aggregate extraction.

 

Work for Sureway and enjoy being home with your family/friends every night!

 

We offer: Benefits, RRSP and TFSA Matching

 

Job Type: Full Time, Seasonal

Schedule: 12+ Hours/day, Saturdays and Sundays as required, Schedule as per Operational Requirements, OT after 8hr/day or 44hr/week

Location: Edmonton and Surrounding Areaâ€™s (non-camp position, required to live in the area)

Essential: Hard-working, reliable, flexible with schedule, ability to work in physically demanding conditions

 

Requirements:    

  • Personal Reliable Vehicle
  • CSA approved steel toed boots with 6â€ ankle support

Pre-employment:

  • Drug and alcohol testing (swab-based test)
  • Successful completion of Company Orientation and site-specific orientation

 Labourer Responsibilities:

  • Clean and prepare construction sites as needed, removing and properly disposing of debris and waste materials, and digging trenches.
  • Maintain a safe and clean job site by handling materials and storing them properly, picking up and removing all tools and equipment when not in use.
  • Load and unload construction supplies from trucks manually and at times may be asked to use equipment.
  • Promote, execute and adhere to the companyâ€™s safety program, and encourage all employees, subcontractors and consultants to adopt safety as a culture.
  • This is a general responsibilities list and does not include all responsibilities required of the position.

Sureway Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer. We would like to thank all applicants for submitting their resume; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Carpenters and Skilled Labour
description:
Our client is looking for Carpenter and Skilled Labour in Whitehorse, YT for a construction company.

Construction of a super green, high-end custom house.
High wall framing with vaulted ceilings, in-floor heating within concrete skim coat, polished concrete and tile work, hardwood flooring, custom cabinetry with quartz countertops, fine millwork, and custom steel stairs.

This is for those who want more than just a job.

To be determined based on skills, accreditation and experience.

Duration: Permanent
Compensation: $20 to $40 Hourly

If you're a skilled carpenter who shares these values and you would like to join our team, please send your resume.

Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.

title: Nutrien Redwater: Scaffolder Journeyman and Apprentice (Redwater, AB)
description:
SCAFFOLDER - APPRENTICES AND JOURNEYPERSON: Local Drive-in position

SUMMARY:
A Scaffolders’ duties may vary from site to site, however the main responsibilities of a Scaffolder are to erect temporary work platforms using steel pipes, support braces and clamps with a high standard of workmanship using a variety of tools. Scaffolders work both indoors and outdoors, year-round in commercial and industrial settings.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • Must have a previous Scaffolding experience.
  • Valid certification from an accredited apprenticeship board.
  • Must be able to work for 8 hours at a time in an environment where temperatures may reach from 0 to 60° C, both indoors and outdoors in the sun.
  • Work in an environment in which vibrations and noise are moderate to severe and noise level may require the wearing of hearing protection devices.
  • Must be able to work in confined spaces for 4-7 hours per day; stand or walk for long periods.
  • Able to wear a full-face respirator for extended periods.
  • Climb and maintain balance on ladders and scaffolding at extreme heights.
  • Stoop, kneel, crouch and crawl.
  • Lift and carry objects weighing up to 50 pounds often and occasionally up to 100 pounds.
  • Maintain footing on surfaces which are sometimes slippery.
  • See well (naturally or with correction) and distinguish colors.
  • Hear well (naturally or with hearing aid).
  • Must be able to effectively communicate with other employees and supervision.
  • Use arms and hands to reach for, handle, and feel objects; and coordinate well the use of hands or fingers and eyes.
  • Must have reliable transportation to and from the work location.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
  • Must comply with all safety regulations of Brock Canada.
  • Ensures that work is performed in accordance with Contractor Specifications and/or as directed by the Contractor’s Representative.
  • Ensures they are following the applicable Contractor’s Safety Procedures, OH&S, Provincial and/or Contractor’s safety requirements.
  • Assures that the proper materials, tools and equipment is being used for the specified tasks.
  • Reads specifications, such as blueprints and data, to determine requirements.
  • Able to install steel pipes, support braces and clamps to form bases for scaffolds.
  • Able to dismantle scaffold upon job completion.
  • Can identify the type of scaffolding material to be used for the job (frame, tube & clamp, system).
  • Able to thoroughly describe scaffolding materials.
  • Sort and organize material
  • Able to count and place orders for material
  • Required to complete safety paperwork such as FLRA’s, Start Cards, etc.
  • Other duties as assigned

Department: Operations
This is a non-management position
This is a contract position

title: Construction Labourer (FT)
description:
We are searching for a dependable Construction Laborer to join our excellent construction crew. The Skilled Laborer's responsibilities include ensuring worksites are clean and safe, a demo of windows, and torched on roofing, spreading gravel, using drills, saws, and other power tools, and providing assistance with heavy machinery. You should also be able to take instruction from superiors and complete on-the-job training. To be successful as a Skilled Laborer, you will have completed apprenticeships and acquired suitable skills. An outstanding Skilled Laborer should be hungry to expand their skill set and increase their level of expertise. You should also be willing to learn from other crew members and receive off-site training wherever possible.  

With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team!
 
Responsibilities:
  • Moving materials to the worksite and ensuring all tools, machinery, and other equipment are safely set up.
  • Operating equipment like drills, saw, shovels, and other heavy machinery.
  • Assisting with various window removal and roofing demo procedures.
  • Obeying health and safety codes, as well as the company's principles.
  • Removing hazardous materials from sites.
  • Driving scissor and boom lifts
  • Performing site and equipment inspections.
  • Attending meetings and workshops.
  • Completing on-the-job training.
  • Ensuring tasks are completed to deadlines.

Requirements:
  • High school diploma or similar.
  • Completed apprenticeships recommended.
  • driver's license recommended.
  • Sound knowledge of construction and practical experience with tools.
  • Excellent time management, organizational, and communication skills.
  • A good understanding of safety procedures.
  • Great hand, eye, and foot coordination.
  • Willingness to learn and be flexible.
  • Positive attitude and great interpersonal skills

Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, stable work life balance, positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!
 
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.




About New City Contracting Ltd.:

Over 20 years ago, Edward Buset — New City’s founder and president — saw that the Lower Mainland was missing something: a resource for property managers, homeowner associations (HOAs), engineers, and other professionals involved in the building renewal business. Edward envisioned this resource that will work on new builds or maintain existing buildings, one that will develop cost-effective plans for the renewal of all types of buildings in our area’s unique climate. From this vision rose today’s New City, one of Vancouver’s leading general contractors. With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. We know what needs to be done, when it needs to be done, and how to get it done — in the most beneficial way for the building. Whether its envelope renewal, deep renovation, concrete restoration, or other building envelope management concerns, New City has the expertise and resources to handle the largest and most complex work smoothly and efficiently. Today, New City Contracting is a trusted leader in envelope renewal for commercial and residential projects. New City is an expert in the investigation, analysis, and repair of building envelopes — for all material types and vintages. Our extensive building renewal services include: Building Envelope RenewalExterior and Interior PaintingRoof Renewal and ReplacementTenant ImprovementWaterproofingExterior and Industrial CleaningEnvironmental AbatementConcrete Restoration

title: Foreperson Carpenter
description:
Job Description:

Foreperson

 

Maple Reinders Constructors Ltd. is currently looking for a Foreperson Carpenter to work on a project in Camrose, AB. This is your chance to work with one of Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Companies!

 

Up to $37.03 /hr, plus premiums and benefits

  • Able to provide leadership at the foreman level

No agency calls please.

 

 

People, Passion, Performance

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR KENNY U-PULL?

Get ready to immerse yourself in a professional playground of cars.

Become our clients’ ally to provide the best customer service. At Kenny U-Pull, we adhere to high operational standards to maintain an organized and efficient workspace where we repurpose cars and their parts to give them a second life. Join our team in one of North America’s leading companies in the self-service auto part industry.

It’s simple: we do it right. We aim for excellence.

This position is eligible for an annual retention bonus of up to $1050

Job Description

  • Depollute vehicles: this means removing chemical fluids and certain parts such as the battery in order to prepare the vehicle for display in the customer's yard;
  • Dismantle wheels and classify tires;
  • Clean, test and classify batteries in order to install them in the sales displays;
  • Filling cans with certain liquids and affixing cards;
  • Prepare, organize and clean the yard;
  • Maintain a clean and orderly work area.
Qualifications

  • Excellent physical condition
  • Reliability, diligence and punctuality
  • Health and safety awareness
  • Versatility
  • Good manual dexterity


Additional Information

  • Work schedule: Monday to Friday from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM
  • Permanent, full-time position (40 hours / week) 
  • Possibility of working indoors and outdoors

What we offer:

  • Group insurance (after 3 months);
  • Group RRSP with employer contribution (after 6 months);
  • Overtime at time and a half after 44 hours;
  • Bonus plan up to $1050/ year
  • Employee discount;
  • Free parking;
  • Paid steel toe boot from day 1;
  • Uniform provided from day 1

American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to everyone. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted

title: Carpenter's Helper
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

HAT’S THE JOB?
Join our NRB Modular Solutions team, where our people are driven by a desire to innovate, do social good, and move construction forward.

As a Carpenter’s Helper, reporting to the Production Supervisor, you will assist tradespersons in the construction of modular structures made of wood, wood substitutes, steel and other materials. Based in our Grimsby manufacturing plant, hours of work for this position are Monday to Friday, 7:00 AM - 3:30 PM. Hours may change based on production schedules.

Aprenticeships are available to those with construction experience, interested in pursuing the carpentry trade.

Your work will include:

  • Assembly of basic carpentry elements with supervision.
  • You will install sheets of drywall to interior and insulate; measuring, cutting, shaping, assembling and joining moldings, wood materials, drywall and plastic materials.
  • Working with both steel and wood construction.
  • Framing work includes the general layout and construction of walls and building.
  • Working safely, abiding by all legislativie and company HSE policies.

  Starting Rate for this position is $21.00/hour.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Opportunity to learn under a Journeyperson.
  • Award winning safety culture.
  • Work indoors year-round.
  • Whereas other companies are downsizing, we are growing!
  • Be #1 on day 1 by joining an industry leader.

Follow NRB Modular Solutions on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

 

Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Work requires some knowledge of the construction/ manufacturing industry.
  • Minimum of 6 months basic carpentry experience and/or experience working on construction sites.
  • Able to operate all hand and power tools required to perform tasks specific to the trade.
  • Experience working on construcion sites is an asset.


Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors.

title: Finishing Carpenter
description:
As a Finishing Carpenter, add the final touch to a carpentry project by trimming, shaping, and installing ornaments and various other wood finishes that improve the appearance of a wooden structure.
With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team! 
 
Location: 844 Fisgard St, Victoria, BC V8W 3M5 
 
Responsibilities:
  • Interior suites wood working on windows frames and trims
  • Preparing wood or structural finishing by shaping and trimming fixtures with the aid of manual or power tools.
  • Take accurate measurement of structures in order to develop suitable plans for wood tailoring.
  • Trimming of moldings to match irregular surfaces.
  • Responsible for the measurement and installation of wooden flooring, and may also provide varnishing and staining services for woodwork.
  • Other duties that may be assigned.
 
Requirements:
  • At least 2 to 3 years of experience as a Finishing Carpenter or equivalent.
  • Prepare wood structures for finishing by shaping and trimming with hand or power tools
  • Take measurements to develop suitable layout for a fixture
  • Carry out measurement and installation of wooden floorings
  • Provide varnishing and staining service for woodwork
 
Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, a stable work-life balance, a positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!
 
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.


About New City Contracting Ltd.:

Over 20 years ago, Edward Buset — New City’s founder and president — saw that the Lower Mainland was missing something: a resource for property managers, homeowner associations (HOAs), engineers, and other professionals involved in the building renewal business. Edward envisioned this resource that will work on new builds or maintain existing buildings, one that will develop cost-effective plans for the renewal of all types of buildings in our area’s unique climate. From this vision rose today’s New City, one of Vancouver’s leading general contractors. With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. We know what needs to be done, when it needs to be done, and how to get it done — in the most beneficial way for the building. Whether its envelope renewal, deep renovation, concrete restoration, or other building envelope management concerns, New City has the expertise and resources to handle the largest and most complex work smoothly and efficiently. Today, New City Contracting is a trusted leader in envelope renewal for commercial and residential projects. New City is an expert in the investigation, analysis, and repair of building envelopes — for all material types and vintages. Our extensive building renewal services include: Building Envelope RenewalExterior and Interior PaintingRoof Renewal and ReplacementTenant ImprovementWaterproofingExterior and Industrial CleaningEnvironmental AbatementConcrete Restoration

Our office in Toronto, ON is looking for Full Time General Labourers to perform work at sites throughout the Greater Toronto Area

title: General Labour
description:
Merchandising Specialist – Flowers and Plants

About the Position

Brand Momentum is looking for two detail oriented General Labour to work together at local sites in Kelowna, West Bank and Penticton.

30 hours/week

Key Responsibilities:

- Take off shelves by unhooking from slots
- The shelves to be stacked flat on base with hooks fitting into pole openings;
- Make sure the triangular tow bar of the base is not stacked underneath the shelves, so that it can still be used to make a train and be pulled with;
- Stack the shelves not higher than 50 per base;
- All carts with no shelves left are to be further dismantled by taking the poles off and stacking these on a cart with shelves and place 40 poles per shelf.
- Stack the ‘bare’ bases not higher than 12 per stack.

;t=436s

Specific Requirements:

· Must be able to lift 50 pounds alone

· Must have access to a vehicle

· Must wear steel toe footwear

· Must be able to work outside in all elements

· Must be able to work independently and as a team member

· Must observe store safety protocols

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary

About Brand Momentum

We are a national integrated Sales, Marketing, and Retail solutions agency with two headquarters, one in Toronto and one in Montreal. We deliver authentic and enduring human connections, and we are led by a talented team and supported by a network of trusted partners. Rooted in Goodness, Brand Momentum is a three-time winner of Canada’s top 100 Best Workplace® and one of Canada’s top 500 fastest growing companies.

About Our Culture

Goodness is at the heart of everything we do. Brand Momentum (BMI) is an enduring market leader in quality and innovation. We deliver on our promises to our clients and each other, and we do it with passion, innovation and a commitment to excellence. Every single day we live our values of integrity, respect, empowerment, commitment, fun, flexibility and fiscal responsibility while putting our valued clients at the center of every decision we make.

title: Labourer
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

Our General Scrap facility in Winnipeg has multiple openings for Labourers for immediate hire. This is a physically demanding role that is performed in all weather conditions.

  • Working in conveyor picking stations removing unwanted material from product stream

  • Cleaning production areas, including shoveling, scraping and sweeping

  • Assist with shop and yard cleanliness by removing debris and picking-up metal from various places throughout the facility

  • Clearing snow as required.

  • Loading and unloading material and equipment

  • Assisting operators with maintenance and repairs of equipment

  • Pressure washing yard equipment

  • Assist in organizing and cleaning warehousing and part storage areas

Requirements

  • No experience necessary but previous work experience in a manufacturing, production, or similar scrapyard/auto part environment will be considered an asset

  • Able to meet the physical demands of the position including standing, walking, sitting, climbing, crawling, kneeling, bending, moderate to heavy lifting and pushing and pulling up to 50 pounds throughout the day

  • Willing and able to work in variable weather conditions including hot, dry summer conditions and cold, harsh winter conditions

  • Knowledge and understanding of metallic materials purchased, ferrous and non-ferrous classifications, an asset

  • Able to work with minimal supervision/general oversight

  • Able to communicate clearly as including using a handheld radio

  • Able to work evenings and weekends

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Skatepark Construction Builders / Finishers
description:
Are you a passionate, creative team player with a desire to travel and work and make a difference in communities across Canada? We have openings for experienced Carpenters and Concrete Finishers who take pride in their workmanship. Successful candidates will possess a positive attitude, be community driven, adaptable, responsible and have the ability to work and travel out of town for extended periods of time. We provide very comfortable homes away from home, travel provided to and from locations and a healthy compensation allowance for living away from home.

We are looking for individuals with experience in carpentry and formwork, welding and concrete placing/finishing. Experience with shaping and finishing vertical shotcrete and experience with concrete line pumps an asset. With safety as our top priority, we are interested in individuals with Health and Safety certifications and relative training certifications.

Preference may be given to those with a journeyman carpentry ticket, previous concrete finishing work experience, ACI certification. We are seeking interested candidates with experience in: framing and excavation, ability to read architectural drawings, rebar and form installation, measure/calculate concrete volumes, handling and troweling concrete.

New Line Skateparks offers a productive fast paced work environment in an exciting industry. Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. We offer a complete benefits plan including, medical, dental, and insurance as well as a performance bonus program.

title: Rigging Artist
description:
Company Description

As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.

Job Description

The Rigging Artist will create 3D rigs for different types of objects, vehicles, characters and creatures, ensuring to meet the high quality standards of Rodeo FX. 

Main responsibilities:

  • Create 3D rigs for different types of objects, vehicles, characters and creatures;
  • Create and rig the internal anatomy of a creature, in order to drive the final deformation of the skin;
  • Create feature-quality, scripted rigs and refine them based on the needs of animators and downstream departments;
  • Implement and refine character, body/face, cloth/deformer and hard-surface rigs;
  • Work closely with modelers and animators to ensure an asset is efficiently rigged and capable of believable movements.
  • Work closely with the CG Supervisor and Rigging Lead to find creative and technical solutions and approaches that enhance assets, while meeting project specifications and deadlines;
  • May participate in the development of tools and techniques for the department;
  • Perform quality control on shots before they are submitted for review/approval, ensuring all technical and creative standards are met, and promptly apply notes received;
  • Keep Production and the project team informed of the status of work, issues to be resolved, ramifications of problems encountered and recommend potential solutions;
  • Ensure deadlines are met, advising the project team promptly if delays could be expected. 
Qualifications

  • Experience in a similar position, within the VFX industry;
  • Excellent knowledge of Maya software;
  • Experience in programming using Python;
  • Good knowledge of of the principles of anatomy (bipeds, quadrupeds, skeletons and muscles) and facial expression;
  • Knowledge of modeling tools for blend shapes;
  • Knowledge of animation tools for the creation of animation test deformation;
  • Excellent sense of prioritization and respect of deadlines.


Additional Information

  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

Are you ready to take your career to new heights? Join our growing team at WesTower Communications Ltd. as an Aerial Field Technician!

title: Labourer
description:
Forbes Bros is currently recruiting full-time Laborer's for projects within Wynyard & Wadena, Saskatchewan.


Responsibilities:

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

  • Digging and backfilling trenches
  • Pulling and placing underground and overhead cable
  • Carry and move materials as needed
  • Operating small equipment and hand tools
  • Spotting for vehicles and equipment
  • Site setup and cleanup, ensuring trash, debris and potential dangerous materials from the construction site are removed
  • Assisting craft/crew members with work
  • Development of skills on varied and challenging tasks
  • Perform additional labourer duties as assigned

Preferred Qualifications:

As the successful candidate, you will have:

  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Must be in good physical condition and able to lift up to 23 kg (50 lbs)
  • Must have general knowledge of the principals involved in the operation of construction and maintenance methods and procedures
  • Able to work well with others as well as independently
  • Able to follow instruction and adhere to safe work practices
  • Attention to detail
  • Motivated
  • Punctual

Additional Details:

This position requires candidates to:

  • Have and maintain a valid driver's license and acceptable driver's abstract.
  • Successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing
  • Travel and work overtime as required

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: Carpenter
description:
First Onsite is seeking to hire a full-time Carpenter to help rebuild homes and businesses for our residential and commercial customers after fire or flood emergencies. Do you have previous experience in restoration or construction? Are you looking to build a successful career while rebuilding lives? If so, keep reading!

Our experienced Carpenter earns a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A CARPENTER

You are focused on bringing back homes and businesses to their former beauty. Your attention to detail and passion for construction assists you in delivering superior quality work to your customers. Whether repairing a roof, or installing a cabinet you consistently demonstrate skill in the safe operation of tools. Your ability to oversee laborers ensuring that the quality standards of the company are being met and as well as your knowledge of materials, methods and the tools involved in the construction or repair of residential & commercial buildings, and other structures will set you up for success in this role

Your excellent communication skills assist you as you work collaboratively with construction crews. Health and safety are important to you which is why you respect all policies and procedures and ensure that they are followed by other employees and subcontractors. You are a get-it-done person who likes to be active and isn't afraid to jump right in and make things happen. You take pride in your work and feel good about being able to restore order for people in our community while helping us build a loyal customer base!

QUALIFICATIONS

  • At least 3 years of experience in the carpenter in the construction or restoration industry
  • Ability to pass a background check
  • Valid drivers' license
  • Availability for scheduled on-call and after-hour shifts

Are you able to work independently? Do you have excellent communication and interpersonal skills? Can you work collaboratively with construction crews? Are you service-oriented? Is safety important to you? Do you project a professional appearance and attitude? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Carpenter
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The carpenter is responsible for constructing and maintaining buildings.

Required knowledge includes: construction and remodeling trades, practices, procedures, techniques, tools and equipment, materials, specifications, quality control, cost control and safety.

The carpenter must be proficient at the following tasks: hanging doors, drilling and setting door hardware, setting windows, layout for stairs and common rafters, formwork, and reading blueprints. The carpenter must also possess the mathematical and analytical skills necessary to do materials estimates.

Qualifications

  • Ticketed Journeyperson Carpenter
  • Experienced with a large general contractor
  • Valid drivers license and clean drivers abstract preferred


Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

The Labourer is required to perform tasks involving physical labour at commercial construction projects, and to operate a variety of hand and power tools.

Qualifications

  • Knowledge of safe operation of basic hand and power tools

title: GENERAL LABOURER
description:
Job Description

While you might see a lot of job offers for general labourers, being one at EACOM Matagami, a subsidiary of INTERFOR, means getting to work right in the heart of nature. You'll be around wood, wood and more wood. Your eagle eyes will help keep the yard and sawmill looking their best. To keep things running smoothly, you’ll make sure that there’s a place for everything and that everything is in its place. You'll make a living working at our sawmills with deep roots in the northern regions of Ontario and Quebec. You'll discover that they do more than just transform wood; they also transform our communities!

Are you hard-working, resourceful and a go-getter? Come work at EACOM, where we pull out all the stops for your success. Our team is waiting for you!

What you’ll be doing specifically:

  • Tie up bundles of rough lumber for drying outside.
  • Redo and stack bundles of rough and planed wood in the yard.
  • Perform clean-ups of the yard and sawmill.
  • Perform clean-ups after interior and exterior sawing operations.
  • During work downtime, clean areas that are inaccessible during operations.
  • Do any other related tasks (don’t worry; you'll learn tons of things that will help you in your career!).

What do you need to succeed with us?

  • Be able to work well on a team.
  • Be independent and full of initiative.
  • Show vigilance and a concern for health and safety.
Qualifications

Experience that will help you in this position:

  • DCS, DEC, or equivalent.
  • Prior experience at a sawmill is an asset.
  • Be available to work day and/or night shifts.


Additional Information

At EACOM, we're here for you.

EACOM supports employment equity. Diversity is not only welcome, it’s encouraged! We’ll contact you if you are selected for an interview. If you need special accommodations, let us know. Any information you send us will be treated with respect and confidentiality. Gender diversity is also important. Know that women are definitely welcome!

title: Summer Student - General Labour (Burlington)
description:
JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is looking for Summer Students to join our teams in Burlington, ON!

Formerly Cogent Power Inc., JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is under new management.

While we appreciate all applicants, we will only be contacting those selected for an interview.

This position is located in Burlington, Ontario.

We have two facilities located on 801 & 845 Laurentian Drive, L7N 3W7 (Conveniently located by bus route) 

Salary: $18.12 an hour 

Hours: This position will be on a straight day shift from 7 am to 3 pm Monday to Friday. 

Position Type: Summer Contract, 4-month period (flexible). 

The Perks:

  • Travel Subsidy:
    • Starting April to September 2022 we will be providing a subsidy to all employees that incur the costs of travelling to work. These subsidies will be provided at the end of the month in the form of a gas card (i.e April subsidy will be provided by mid-May).
    • For those who take a city bus to work, we will be providing a transit pass.  
  • Perkopolis Account - get access to 5000 exclusive online discounts to stores & sports events (Hello Fresh, Apple, Indigo, Toronto Marlies, Toronto Raptors, etc.)
  • $100 Coverage on CSA-Approved Safety Boots
  • Summer Gatorade Program (Free Gatorades over the summer term)

As a Summer Student, you will be working in one of these Departments:

Wound Core Department: 

  • Receiving and inspecting incoming slit steels, assuring that they are correct for the intended order
  • Issue materials to work orders accurately and correctly on both paperwork order, and through the visual software system
  • Set up machine according to work order and operating procedures.
  • Produce distributed gap cores
  • Ensure product meets quality requirements as per work order, operating procedures and customers specifications
  • Follow priority schedule

Stacked Core Department:

  • Set up machine according to work order and operating procedures.
  • Material stacking into a repeating specific pattern
  • Ability to follow detailed prints & procedures to create the finished product
  • Work in a team environment ensuring group success
  • Issue materials to work orders accurately and correctly

About you, simply stated:

  • Ability to follow health & safety policies
  • Strong measuring skills 
  • Exceptional communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • An eagerness to learn and dedication to improvement 
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Organized

Requirements: 

  • Must be 18 years of age or older
  • Must be able to show proof of enrolment at a post-secondary college or university
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada with a valid Social Insurance Number
  • Students on Visa's welcome to apply 

(Must be 18 years of age or older - students from all levels are welcome to apply. Training for your first two weeks is paid).

About JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc:

On September 20th, 2019, JFE Shoji Trade Corporation acquired 100% of the shares of Cogent Power Inc, from Tata Steel Europe. Grouped, the Cogent and JFE Shoji Steel America business make it possible for JFE Shoji to capture greater market share in the electrical steel market for both transformer and automotive products. The combination of Cogent and JFE Shoji has become one of the largest processors of electrical steel transformers in the world. JFE Shoji currently has many other production and processing facilities throughout Asia, as well as a facility in Tijuana, Mexico.

Globally, JFE Shoji enhanced the businessâ€™ competitiveness by sharing and integrating technical skills with deep business experience, which can be strongly applied to the global and North American markets. With this investment, JFE Shoji has one of the worldâ€™s leading processing and distribution functions for core design and manufacturing for transformers.

Based in Tokyo, JFE is one of the worldâ€™s largest steel producers with over 45,000 employees and operations globally. 

If you would like to be considered, please apply in confidence. For more information about starting your career with JFE Shoji Power Canada, please visit https://www.jfeshojipower.com/

Job Type: Summer, Contract, Students

Salary: $18.12 an hour

#JFEHP

title: Construction Labourers
description:
Flaggers/Construction Labourers

At PME Inc, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values.

In the position of an upcoming job for Construction Labourer, we would ask you to do the following: Handle and distribute construction materials (e.g., load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials; move tools, equipment and construction materials to and from work areas; remove rubble and other debris) Assemble and dismantle scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades at construction sites Prepare and clean up construction sites, move materials and equipment, and perform demolition, excavation and compaction activities Work on a wide variety of buildings, structures and premises including municipal sewer and water mains, roads, dams and bridges, tunnels, railways and canals

Sounds challenging and exciting right? Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

  • You have one to two years of industrial or civil construction experience and must have Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS 09) Certificate, WHMIS 2015, Flagging considered an asset.
  • You have experience in using compactors, and trampers (jumping jack) You are able to lift up to 13.5 kg (30lbs) 9-23 Kg You have a safety conscious attitude and able to work with others in a team
  • Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required
  • Drug and Alcohol Screening required.
  • These positions are located in Boyle, AB.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!

Please note, there is NO TRAVEL or LIVING ALLOWANCE for this project.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status.

We'll pay you for it!"]

title: General Labourer
description:
Company Description

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, American Iron & Metal (AIM) is a family-owned company, recognized as a world leader in the metal recycling industry. Over the years, AIM has evolved into a multi-faceted company with successful lines of business including metals recycling, dry materials recycling, manufacturing of solder assembly, environmental services, retail auto parts, and highway transportation. With multiple facilities throughout Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe, and Asia and over 2000 employees located throughout the world, AIM is uniquely positioned to provide best-in-class service and value to its customers. 

Job Description

  • Sorting, picking, and processing scrap metals 
  • Clean and inspect recycling yard by sweeping and raking materials and debris  
  • Assist with performing routine maintenance 
  • Perform other general labourer duties as assigned 
Qualifications

  • A Minimum of 1 year of experience is required in a general labourer role  
  • Experience in the metal scrap industry will be considered as an asset 
  • Experience in using machines like Lift Truck / Forklift, Skid steer will be considered as an asset 
  • Must be able to lift 50 lbs. and stand for extended periods of time 
  • Successful candidates must be highly motivated and work with little supervision 
  • Always strive for excellence and constant improvement 


Additional Information

WE OFFER 

  • Competitive salaries commensurate with experience and qualifications 
  • Group benefits like insurance and RRSP 
  • Additional training and uniform 
  • Great working environment 
  • Overtime opportunities 

HOURS OF WORK 

  • Permanent and full-time position 
  • 40 hours per week, able to work extended hours/weekends when deemed necessary 

HEALTH AND SAFETY 

  • Must work in compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Regulation and follow in accordance with AIM’s Health and Safety policies and procedures 
  • Responsible for reporting all accidents, illnesses, or ‘near miss’ incidents to management 

ACCOMMODATION 

American Iron and Metal Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We ensure that all individuals are treated equally, respectfully and with integrity. We welcome resume submissions from all qualified applicants and thank you for your interest in American Iron and Metal Inc. If accommodations are required, please attach a request with your resume. All information received will be addressed confidentially. We thank all applicants for their interest but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Full-Time Night Shift General Labour $17.25/hour (Mon-Fri 12:45am-9:15am)
description:
FULL-TIME NIGHT SHIFT GENERAL LABOUR $17.25/hour (Mon-Fri 12:45am - 9:15am)


Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?

Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in Toronto, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. Our Company employs approximately 11,000 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.

Our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. As we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Contributes to a healthy work environment, while maintaining high food safety standards
  • Works on the production line to process chicken and turkey products
  • Moves and lifts skids, tanks, totes and combos
  • Trims and removes bones from product
  • Takes action to correct any issues and to make improvements
  • Other responsibilities as required

WHAT DOING A GOOD JOB LOOKS LIKE:

  • Directly helps the department to meet targets and goals while maintaining a healthy and safe work environment
  • Dedicated to ensuring food safety procedures are met
  • Maintains productivity that meets/exceeds standards
  • Dedicated to creating a high quality product that consistently meets product specifications
  • Contributes to the team and the whole facility in a positive way

REQUIRED SKILLS, ABILITIES & EXPERIENCE:

  • Able to work in a fast-paced work environment with repetitive heavy lifting tasks
  • Able to perform heavy lifting, pushing tanks, lifting totes, shoveling
  • Able to stand and walk throughout the shift
  • Able to perform repetitive lifting and shoveling
  • Can work well in a team environment and support fellow team members
  • Good communication skills, able to speak and read English

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022). We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Our Skilled Labourers earn a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!

Position Summary:

The Skilled Labourer is in good physical condition and provides construction work and support required to ensure timely project completion. The Skilled Labourer follows good work practices and procedures and sets a good example for new crew members and co-workers. The Skilled Labourer may: operate a variety of equipment and instruments, including hand and power tools of all types; clean and prepare sites; clean up rubble and debris; remove mold, asbestos lead and other hazardous materials.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads by example and follows all health and safety policies and procedures.
  • Strives to continually improve through specific development plans.
  • Accepts direction from the Lead Hand, Lead Water Technician and/or Lead Carpenter and more experienced co-workers.
  • Participates in good housekeeping discipline on the job to ensure a safe non-cluttered workplace and to minimize cross contamination.
  • Learns and practices correct procedures, especially when environmental work is required.
  • Adheres to company policy regarding acceptable standards to follow at a customer site i.e. smoking policy etc.
  • Displays good manners and attitude toward the property owner, occupants of the property, co-workers and sub-contractors.
  • Is willing and able to be on-call 24/7 for after hour's emergency work.
  • Directs customer questions or concerns to the most senior company person at the job site.
  • Looks out for and assists co-workers.

Qualifications:

  • Previous construction or cleaning work preferred.
  • Experience with hand tools & power tools preferred.
  • High School graduate or equivalent.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!']

title: General Labour - $17/hr
description:
HIRING FULL-TIME: GENERAL LABOUR 

WF Bakery Inc.-ACE, North York, ON 

WAGE: Starting from $17/hour, Shift premium: $2 for all hours worked between 10:00 pm – 6:00 am, OT available after 44 hours. 
SHIFT: 8-Hour straight shifts- All shifts, availability required (flexibility with working overtime, and on weekends, as necessary) 

What we offer?

  • Full-Time direct employment
  • Full Benefits (Health, Dental, Pension etc)
  • Progressive wage 
  • Growth path to line leader and supervisory roles.
  • Transit accessible location
  • Straight shifts- No rotation

In a typical day, you’ll: 

  • Pick, pack, sort, and package fresh products into bags and boxes 

  • Stack oven racks and move them into the designated area

  • Work on Production lines to monitor the shape of  the buns/breads prior to baking. 

  • Work in production/packaging area to make and stack boxes onto pallets 

  • Inspect filled packages to ensure product is packaged according to specifications. 

  • Work closely with production team members to ensure product quality  

  • Assist machine operators/mixers/oven captains and crew with other duties as assigned.  

  • May assist sanitation crew in the cleanliness of production equipment and area   

  • Ensure all Food Safety and Health & Safety policies and procedures are followed   

About You: 

  • A lover of bread and baked goods! 

  • You have strong people skills—you’re approachable, a good listener, and empathetic  

  • You should be comfortable lifting 30-50 pounds. 

  • You have previously worked in a manufacturing environment (even better if it was food manufacturing!) 

  • You’re dedicated to the health and safety of yourself and your colleagues  

  • You digest constructive feedback as an opportunity to listen, and improve your skills, abilities, and performance 

  • You are someone who listens to comprehend a situation first, asking questions to clarify your own understanding, instead of listening to be able to reply quickly 

 

If you’re excited about this opportunity and love baked goods, we invite you to apply! 

Weston is committed to fostering a work environment with strong core values that support diversity through various policies, programs and activities that encourage sensitivity and accommodations. Weston offers employment regardless of race, colour, gender, national origin, religion, age, disability, or sexual orientation. Diversity is integral to our success as an organization, and we will use diversity as a model to help identify and develop the best talent, create effective teams, and achieve overall excellence. Weston Foods will accommodate the needs of applicants with disabilities throughout all stages of the selection process. Please reach out to our team at the Bakery to begin a conversation  about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process. Information relating to the need of accommodation will be addressed confidentially

Lastly, we believe that compliance with the laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct- it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

  #IND1

title: Labourers
description:

Please note this outage starts April 24th to May 25th, 2022. The position is located in theâ€¯Lloydminster area and are looking for local candidates to fill these roles. â€¯â€¯  

â€¯  

What youâ€™ll be doing:â€¯

What we offer:â€¯â€¯
