This position has beenâ€¯identifiedâ€¯as a safety sensitive position and will require completion of a drug and alcohol testing.â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯  â€¯  

 

There is a Client Owner mandated COVID-19 Vaccination Protocol to obtain access to the Lloydminster site.   You will be required to show proof of double vaccination with two doses of the Health Canada approved COVID-19 vaccine, with no less than 14 days since the second vaccination.   Individuals who are not double vaccinated will be required to produce a negative COVID-19 test every 72 hours.

 

Any expenses and time associated with obtaining the COVID-19 rapid test would be the individual's responsibility.   Neither the Client Owner nor ClearStream will be providing reimbursement for these costs.

title: Labourer - South Calgary
description:
Seymour Pacific Developments Ltd. is a national leader in land development and residential construction, and we are currently looking for Construction Labourers to perform a variety of construction-related duties at our multifamily site.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials
  • Move tools, equipment, and construction materials to and from work areas
  • Operate hand and power tools
  • Clean up rubble and debris on a regular basis to ensure a safe and well maintained construction site
  • Move and level earth using shovels and rakes
  • Clean, lubricate, and refill tanks as instructed
  • Practice work place safety at all time
  • Perform other duties as required

REQUIREMENTS

  • Previous experience in a related position
  • Positive can-do attitude
  • Willing and able to easily follow direction
  • Able to lift 50lbs
  • Willing and able to work long hours in a fast-pace, physical environment

 

WHY SEYMOUR PACIFIC?

Seymour Pacific Developments is an industry leader in building multi-family homes with unparalleled speed and efficiency. We develop and build over 1,500 units a year by leveraging effective teamwork and industry expertise. We offer excellent wages and benefits, as well as a variety of training for employees who are motivated to succeed and want to expand their horizons. Seymour Pacific Developments is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to following safe and inclusive hiring practices.

title: Labourer - Bridge Construction
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview

We are currently looking for skilled Labourers to join our Bridge Construction team. Successful candidates should be hard working, adaptable, and enthusiastic team players, willing and ready to learn and work in all conditions.

Responsibilities

  • Receive oral instructions to determine work assignments.
  • Perform physical activities that require considerable use of your arms and legs and moving your whole body, such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping, and handling of materials

Qualifications

  • Experience will be considered an asset.
  • Class 5 license and own means of transportation is required as not all sites will have public transit access.
  • Safety Oriented
  • Able to lift 50 lbs
  • Able to work in a fast paced environment
  • Willing to work overtime and shifts when needed including Saturdays
  • Able to work unsupervised
  • Able to work well with others
  • Good communication skills

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Labourer
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Labourer for our Edmonton location.The successful applicant for this position will be responsible for assisting in the dismantling of construction, forestry and mining based heavy equipment and components.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Cleaning parts and components
  • Cleaning and organizing the yard
  • Some inventory maintenance.
  • Assisting the other shop personnel fulfill their duties and increase overall shop productivity
  • Demonstrate safe and efficient workplace practices
  • Highly motivated, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Able to carry out and understand verbal and written instructions
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Capable of meeting the physical demands of the heavy duty equipment environment (ie: lifting up to 75 pounds)
  • Must be capable of working under minimal supervision
  • Previous mechanical aptitude and willingness to learn required
  • Forklift experience and heavy duty parts handling considered an asset

title: Labourer
description:
Our client labourer's assist skilled trade persons and perform labour activities at various construction and project sites. Employees are expected to support and participate in a “culture of safety” and adhere to and be ambassadors of companies Code of Conduct and Values, and to treat others with dignity, respect and fairness.

Position and Location Details:
  • Daily Living Allowance Per diem-based position Prince George BC or Mackenzie BC
  • Shift schedule: 16 days on/ 5 days off (9 hours per day with 1 hour of travel time) Note: During plant outages, hours will be increased to 11-12 hours per day.
  • Project sites will be based out of Summit Lake BC (approx. 35 minutes from Prince George) & Mcleod Lake BC (approx. 30 minutes from Mackenzie BC)
  • Shift Per diem paid once per shift for non-local employees
Core Accountabilities:
  • Identify and report hazards or unsafe work practices
  • Fuel equipment when needed
  • Clean construction work areas
  • Work with equipment and crane operators
  • Assist pipefitters and welders with their work
  • Perform other activities in yard and shop, as directed
  • Participate in pre-job toolbox meetings to identify potential hazards and measures to eliminate or minimize them
  • Correct unsafe acts and bring unsafe conditions to the attention of the immediate supervisor
  • Return tools (clean) back to the proper area after the job is complete or at the end of the shift
  • Ensure the appropriate use of Personal Protective Equipment while performing tasks
Qualifications:
  • Grade 12 or GED
  • Standard First Aid, Ground Disturbance Level 2, fall protection, man lift training and confined space are considered an asset
  • Must successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
  • Previous pipeline or facility specific construction experience is an asset
  • Ability to lift 50 pounds
  • Capable of working with small tools
  • Capable of working as part of a team
  • Fluent in speaking and reading English
  • Must be able to follow directions
